title: Great hotel-first class service. Would highly recommend staying here
text:
We stayed here for an anniversary and were pleasantly surprised to be greeted with a lovely bottle of wine and a cheese/grapes platter in our room. We were wished Happy Anniversary by several members of staff too which was a really nice touch. 
This hotel is in a fabulous location-close enough to walk to everything but a nice distance away from the loudness, hustle and bustle of NY city.
Our room was spacious, clean & comfortable but was right next to the lift so a little noisy. We asked concierge if we could change rooms, all we had to do was pack up our stuff and when we returned later in the day our suitcases had been moved into a quieter room. Excellent service. 
The breakfast buffet is probably one of the best we’ve ever had. Plenty of choice, hot buffet, continental breakfast, fruits, cereals, pastries, fresh juice, tea, coffee etc.
We had drinks in the bar every night to use half of the daily tourism tax. This is another NY tax-nothing g to do with the hotel. The bar is on the main foyer and stocked with plenty of branded spirits. I would say they’re double shots as definitely much stronger than anything in the uk, 
Our only negative would be the breakdown of any additional extras is confusing. You can view it on your tv but it’s not broken down into specifics so you really need to keep an eye on it. Ours was incorrect but it’s was sorted out easily at the front desk and corrected. 
I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we return to NY.
Special thanks to Sofia and her excellent team for looking after us so well.

title: Kudos again to excellent staff including their New Hotel Manager and Sanela in Guest Relations
text:
I had to wait for 3 months before TP would let me review my most recent stay at the Barclay.

Travelling to the NJ/NY area for a Baby Shower, my wife and I were fortunate to find space (and an upgrade) at the Barclay in New York.  We last stayed September last year and found the Property and its employees excellent. This visit, I was at first surprised to find some of those employees no longer with the property but if anything the level of service , hospitality and attention to detail under GM Sofia (thanks for the upgrade and goodies) has increased with the addition of Hotel Manager Matthias Kaiser . Mr Kaiser was on top of everything and stated in constant touch with us and this was the first time all the benefits afforded an Ambassador with the facility fee were explained in great detail for us to fully utilize those benefits during our stay.

On checking in Sunday (early so I should not be complaining) my room wasn't ready and I later found out that it was an Ambassador guest who had on-lined checked out but continued to stay in his room for the late check-out accorded their status. I am also an Ambassador but know when I on-line check out or settle my bill earlier than check-out, I notify the front desk so they know not to notify housekeeping to start cleaning the room for the next guest. To my fellow guests, try and remember that in your visits so other guests aren't waiting around. And one more reminder to my fellow guests, I saw most guests at The Parlour leave nothing on the table when they left. These service employees work really hard to provide a great experience. Remember to leave a gratuity. I could tell by my Housekeeper's reaction to us every day that not many leave a gratuity every day. These are the same guests who gripe on social media about rates being added by Hotels and lack of service. Not in this Property.

Despite the room situation, Mr Kaiser sent me to guest relations and this is where I was fortunate to meet Sanela M who was amazing. First she explained the issue, then found me another room and then also arranged for our accompanying relative with 2 small daughters to have their luggage out of the room assigned to one on our floor. All of this on a Sunday when staff would not have been as heavy as a weekday. She was simply amazing and kept in touch with Mr Kaiser (who was off BTW) until we were all settled. Kudos Sanela

Our upgrade was awesome, Housekeeping was great and this visit made use of The Parlour restaurant and while it may look small at first glance, have tables all around so that guests did not have to wait very long for seating. The buffet is full of everything one would need, from fruit, to breads, cereals, a hot breakfast and with Easter coming up had special cookies for guests. The bar at night looks like a movie scene. Check it out before you leave (using your daily credit)

The Bellmen staff were also excellent with moving, storing and packing luggage.

BTW one of the vouchers provided is for Ole and Steen next door. You must try their pastries all day, lunch and evening items (all with a 10% off)

Another tip. Parking can be found 1 block from the hotel and using ParkWhiz (no in/out) found a rate under $35 a day, unheard off.

Located on the East side, it's easy to find an Uber and getting around is a breeze (as long as you don't have to go to the West side). Lots of restaurants around and easy to find shopping, it's an awesome location. 

While there try visiting the upgraded Grand Central with its amazing food hall

Kudos again to GM Sofia for running one of the best InterContinental's we have stayed at. I was glad to Meet Manager Kaiser on our last day to thank him personally and to send our regards to the GM for a wonderful experience.

title: Disappointing all around
text: Waited 15 minutes to check in.  Was given a tiny room on a floor under construction.  Very disappointing.  I don’t think the staff really cared.  No coffee available in the morning - they gave me a discount card to go to a cafe down the street.  I expected a lot more from an Intercontinental hotel.

title: Kudos to Housekeeping Staff
text: I stayed here for a weekend. I have always preferred to stay in the midtown east area of the city. One thing I noticed was that the room was very clean - kudos to the housekeeping team! The room has been renovated and well amenitized, and so is the bathroom. I had breakfast one morning at the hotel - the buffet is expansive, though it would have been nice if ala carte was also offered.  Front desk staff were polite, though not really warm and friendly. The only hiccup during my stay was upon checkout, they have not entered my breakfast charge from that morning. But when I received my folio by email, I realized that they did not credit the $20 daily resort fee to the breakfast. I had to call to get that corrected.

title: Great choice for NYC stay
text: Our room was large, the beds comfortable and the service was friendly and professional. The location was great and we walked everywhere. At the end of the night we enjoyed a drink at the bar and the general ambiance of the hotel. Perfect choice for our visit.

title: I do not recommend this hotel.
text:
I booked a Barclay king room with a view of the city and we got two category below deluxe room.The receptionist was liar.He said:"this room the same as we booked."
The next morning we recognize on the hotel homepage not this room was booked.I went to complain to the front desk and they told me this is true.The hotel overbooked.I asked them to changed the room for the original one. They told me not possible ,because they are fully booked.For the third night they changed for the bigger room, because in the room was technical issue with the AC system.During the night we heard the "hammer noise" and to sleep there was impossible.

title: Standard elevato. Ci tornerei.
text:
Posizione centrale senza avere il caos di Time Square.
Stanza spaziosa rispetto agli standard di N.Y.
Bagno pure spazioso e pulito.
Personale estremamente gentile con pulizie accurate effettuate ogni giorno.
Estrema rapidità nel raggiungere la stanza, ascensori rapidi e senza fila.
Unica pecca il fatto che all'arrivo non ci fosse nessuno a prendersi cura dei nostri bagagli ai quali abbiamo provveduto autonomamente. L'altra cosa un po' spiacevole è che ho pagato un supplemento per avere una stanza con vista città, in realtà la vista era sull'altra ala dell'Hotel. Quando ho fatto presente la cosa alla reception l'addetta si è scusata. E basta.

title: Great Location for Business Meeting.
text: Lovely hotel that is centrally located near Grand Central Station. Business stay and literally the closest hotel to my meeting. Room was large and comfortable. Quiet - for New York City - and very modern + new appearing. Good sized closet and bathroom. Appears to be a lobby bar - restaurant, but did not use. Front desk personnel personable, helpful, pleasant. For the value of the room, the actual room charge for a mid-town Manhattan hotel was very reasonable. However, the ridiculous New York City, State taxes are...ridiculous. Literally added over $100 to room charge. There is actually a charge for the Jacob Javits Center, which is nowhere near this hotel and which I certainly was not using. To be clear, these charges are NOT the fault of the hotel. They ARE the fault of the people of New York City and New York State who continually elect politicians who have no concept of a financial budget. Not sure how any tourists can afford to visit New York. Also not sure why they would want to in the current condition of the city. If traveling on business, and your meeting is in the Grand Central Terminal area, this is a great spot. If thinking about a tourist visit, try Yellowstone National Park instead.

title: Gem in Midtown East NY
text: Luxury and elegance define InterContinental Barclay NYC. Impeccable service, stunning rooms, and a central location make it ideal for discerning travelers. I'll be back in my next trip to NYC. 👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻

title: Week in New York
text: We spent a lot of time choosing this hotel; the things that decided us were the location in midtown & the fact that we could have breakfast included as an option. It was nice but not perhaps up to the standard of some of the 5* hotels in other cities we have stayed in. Positives - the concierge, reception & door staff couldn't have been more helpful & gave us helpful advice when we asked. Some of the bar & waiting staff were lovely while others were a bit lacklustre. I agree with other reviews that the rooms were small but the hotel is generally elegant & pretty. Negatives -  (i) the safes need to be re-designed - they hang so that things have to be piled up on top of each other rather than the usual position of pushing things to the back. This means that delicate items such as cameras might be on top of each other. (ii) more vegetarian/vegan options on the menu please. I might have been tempted to eat here more than once during our stay if there had been more suitable choices. (iii) please get rid of the barmy system of charging someone for a bottle of water each time they open the fridge door, which is apparently what happened with our bill. We didn't take anything from our mini-bar fridge but 3 bottles of water were added to our final bill! People use their fridge for all sorts of things - medications, toiletries, water etc, so they shouldn't do this.

title: Great location... service needs help
text:
Great location decent hotel. Only stayed two nights on business. Probably biggest issue I had was the lack of staff at reception. One person only. Not the most friendly but polite (NYC style) but also probably overworked as well. Rooms were clean with good amenities.

Would go back but not if I'm in a rush.

title: Great Stay
text: Great Hotel and great staff. The entire staff made our stay very enjoyable and pleasant. Everything went well for our stay and we look forward to staying at the Intercontinental Barclay again in the future. Great location too! We were able to walk to many places.

title: Amazing Hotel in Midtown
text: The hotel is amazing. Really enjoyed. The room is super comfortable, the hotel is very chic and the service was great! Breakfast is awsome too. I loved the bar downstairs. Will defintely go back! The location is also very good if you want to stay in midtown. Very close to the park and grand central station.

title: Fabulous place to stay in NYC
text:
The hotel was the perfect choice for our family vacation ***** 5 stars 
Throughout our stay, the hotel staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had everything we needed. Their attention to detail and commitment to customer service were evident at every turn.

title: My Favorite Place to Stay in NYC
text: This is my favorite hotel to stay in and I've been staying here for about 24 years.  This time, there was a white tent set up on the backside of the hotel and I thought, someone important is staying here.  When I got to the front entrance, I had to show my reservation to NYPD just to gain entrance and I asked myself, who is staying here?  Once inside, there was Secret Service everywhere and I learned that President Biden was staying here after a fundraiser in NYC.  Nice to know that me and the President of the U.S. have the same taste.  The staff is great:  Annmara, Leslie (both at Ambassador Desk), Gregory (Front Desk), David (doorman), Sharon (Front Desk), German (bar) and Mills (Bellman/lobby).  They always remember me and treat me like a valued guest.

title: Classy and Convenient
text:
We stayed here in late 2021 and now once again in early'ish 2024. Each time we enjoyed the property and the location. Fortunately, our IHG Platinum Elite status allowed us to get a slight room upgrade (for double beds), which was helpful as there were three in our party, and the originally reserved room configuration would have been quite tight for us. The rooms (and bathroom) are clean, comfortable and quiet. Beds and bedding are nice. Staff was competent and friendly - notably at check-in.

The Barclay is approaching a hundred years in heritage, so it is classy over modern. There is a nice lobby bar, which we patronized each night for to use our daily $25 allocation (carved out from the mandatory $40 resort fee), but be forewarned as the prices there are very expensive. EX: a simple charcuterie ended up costing $42 after all fees and gratuities were added in.

Bottom line, the Barclay will certainly be in our consideration mix the next time we plan a trip to Manhattan.

title: Excellent as always
text: We stay here once or twice a month.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet.  Beds and bedding are nice.  Staff is competent and very friendly.   A classic hotel with a nice lobby bar.  We consistently have a great experience here…………………………….

title: Wonderful experience and exceptional team!
text: This was my first stay at the NYC Intercontinental and it was AMAZING!  From the moment I arrived, I was greeted by Irene K., who was marvelously friendly and accommodating (I arrived early).  She was able to quickly situate me into my room which had a marvelous view of the city.  The accommodations and appointments in the space were PHENOMENAL....posh, sheek and tastefully done.  Every member of the staff that I encountered was professional and went above and beyond to be helpful.  I have already begun planning my next trip to NYC....which will undoubtedly include a stay at The NYC Intercontinental.

title: Perfetto
text: Hotel 5 stelle in ottima posizione, camere molto ampie e pulite. Ambiente hotel particolare visto che in precedenza era la sede centrale di una banca. Nulla di eccepire, direi ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo. Se si sceglie solo pernottamento, a pochi metri ottimi locali per colazione.

title: Just okay
text: I stayed here two years ago and I really loved the hotel. As it turns out, last time my room was upgraded and this time it was not. While my room last time was large, this one was tiny and had a weird layout (it was difficult to open and shut the front door as it hit a wall when opening). The room, while small is comfortable and pretty. Nice toiletries in the shower. The internet was free but difficult to log on. The hotel does not give you water bottles in the room or even offer free water in the lobby (which is insane for a “five star” hotel).  The resort fee is expensive and you get a $25 per day credit for food and beverages (2 beer in the lobby bar cost more than that). I do like the hotel location. It is very easy to get around. I don’t think I will be staying here again

title: Favorite Hotel
text: Excellent hotel stuff... I love staying here.. My favorite hotel when I stay in manhattan... the staff recognize me and When I come back... Like a familiar face.... Great ambassador guess relations desk... Great location in midtown Manhattan.

title: A good experience in a convenient location
text: I don’t usually stay in a hotel in NYC as my daughter lives in midtown.  But this was an exceptional weekend as I became a grandmother.  But I enjoyed the hotel. It was a lovely experience And I got an upgrade to a high floor with a king bed.  However why change 4.50 for a cup of coffee in the lobby when in most hotels it’s free.  That’s my only complaint.

title: Cold welcome , small room but great location & practical for seeing NY attractions.
text:
We checked into the hotel around mid night after a long days journey. Checkin was done quickly but the person didn’t seem friendly . We were knackered and weren’t offered a glass of water nor did the room have any drinking water. We have travelled so much but never had such experience. Mini bar water bottle is $10/-. 

We are staying 5 nights, In premium room high floor. Room is ok but small for a family of 3 who are on a long US holiday and have 3 suitcases . We live in London, UK and understand premium of real estate in big cities. but the closet space really is a joke. The toilet had some scruff marks which makes it look old but bathroom is clean otherwise. 

Location is very convenient and should help in seeing NYC.

title: Very nice hotel
text:
The hotel is perfectly located mid town. Grand central is just a block away and Rockefeller center is 3 blocks away. 
Historical building with nice design and very good services. 
All day dining with nice buffet breakfast. 
I definitely recommend it for those looking at a central location in manhattan.

title: Really enjoyed our stay
text:
Friendly welcome and efficient check-in at reception from Kevin after a long flight from UK we were delighted to return again to the IC Barclay for a city break.
Hotel and bedroom were immaculate and housekeeping did a great job everyday in making sure our room was clean and comfortable.
We enjoyed the breakfast each morning - wide variety of options and food quality was great. We ate a few times in the evening at The Parlour and always made feel welcome and looked after. We were also thanked for being an IHG One member - nice to get recognised for our loyalty.
Overall, would highly recommend and look forward to staying again when in town.

title: Comfortable midtown option with a bit of luxe
text: Only spent one night but appreciated the elegantly designed room, professional staff, and convenient location midtown. The lobby area is bustling but offers plenty of seating. Byredo bath amenities were a nice touch. Comfy bed. Will return!

title: Awesome Experience as Always
text: Excellent service and ambiance as always. And great food and drink too. The staff provide wonderful service and always try to please. The location is wonderful as well and very well situated in Mid-Town Manhattan. Highly recommended for both business as well as personal travel.

title: Good hotel, recommended.  Nicely located between Broadway and Central Park zones.
text:
Nicely located NYC establishment.  Walking distance to most everything that we needed to go to.  (Broadway, Times Sq, MoMA, MET, Central P, Columbia U - bit far, Grand Central St, etc).
The hotel seemed a bit stiff, with some exceptions.
Rooms adequate.
Lounge nice, with adequate selection of food in morning, and open or snacks or soft drinks/coffe most of the day.  (You may have to pay extra for lounge access unless you are correctly tiered).
Hotel is recommended.  (Biden showed up the day we left so getting out got interesting).
We will probably not return.

title: Elegant NYC experience
text: My to-go hotel in New York City is the Intercontinental Time Square, but I thought we would give the Barclay a try as well. It was pretty much as I expected it. The upgraded room was quite small, but - being a Diamond Elite Ambassador -  the Concierge (Ms. Leslie) made sure we got a bit of a larger room which made all the difference. I found the food and beverage prices quite high even for NYC, but the quality was good. The breakfast selection was better than in the other Intercontinental. For those arriving by car for one night but maximizing the stay (early check-in and late check-out), I suggest to use the valet which will end up being cheaper for <36 hours than the garage across the street....

title: A very memorable stay at Intercontinental Barclay
text: Easy lounge access where the food is well prepared and the service is warm .  Checking in and out is always hassle free and the staff are always courteous.  It was a rainy day when we checked out .  The front desk staff offered us a complimentary umbrella for the rest of our day in town knowing that we would not be able to come back to return the umbrella.  That was very thoughtful of her.   We are impressed by your excellent client service and would like to return at our earliest opportunity.

title: Lovely hotel. Disappointing lounge
text:
Classic and stylish hotel in excellent location. Stated in a suite which was finished to a high standard. Staff friendly. Food and drink excellent. IHG status acknowledged and perks provided. Ambassador check in helpful - but could have been signed better. The bar is small but offers great food and drink.
The club lounge is nice but strangely offers no 'service'. Staff at every other IC interact with customers and serve the odd drink etc - not here! Staff just check room numbers. Fully a self service lounge! Also the lounge offers no spirits in the evening - just wine and beer which again is strange and disappointing for the cost of it. Probably would not book the lounge again.

title: Highly recommend
text: Great stay. Beautiful rooms. Upgraded at check in from queen to king. Very clean. Personable staff. Would stay again. Front desk told me the breakfast buffet is $50 pp so skipped that and went to Little Collins around the way. I'm surprised by the other low reviews.

title: Another great stay
text:
All staff are superb: front desk, breakfast and housekeeping. 
Very comfortable beds and superb shower. It would be good if IHG went back to real soap and not the liquid gel. 
Wi-Fi is good. Wasn’t totally clear if the still water in the fridge is complimentary or not.

title: I love coming back to the Barclay!
text:
The Barclay is amazing!  Front desk staff always goes above and beyond to ensure my stay is perfect!  

Two suggestions…complimentary bottled water for rewards members and change the scent of the body products in bathrooms.

Other than that keep the rest the same amazing experience!

title: Convenient location with updated and clean rooms
text: Great service from the front desk! Per effect convenient mid-town location near Grand Central, shops and restaurants. Nice and clean updated rooms. The only downsides would be super thin walls so you can hear other guests and very 3xpensive mini-bar selections…I’d stay again when in the area.

title: Wonderful city stay - every time
text: The room was spacious, so comfortable and clean and luxurious and light. The service and welcome were, as always, excellent.Great cocktails at the bar and superb breakfast. I absolutely love staying at IHG Barclay when I am in NYC. Location is perfect- so close to 5th Avenue stores, Grand Central and Bryant Park and so easy to get anywhere I. The city easily. Thanks to Sofia, Eddie, Victoria and AnnMara especially this time for your welcome and help. Highly recommend as best hotel to stay in for both personal and business stays.

title: Cant wait to See you all tomorrow!
text:
From the moment I first stepped through the doors of the Intercontinental New York Barclay last year, I was enveloped in an ambiance of unparalleled hospitality and comfort, making it my all-time favorite hotel in New York. The exceptional service began right at the entrance, where the door manager greeted me with such warmth and professionalism, instantly making me feel welcome. This level of personalized service seamlessly continued at the reception, where the staff went above and beyond to ensure my check-in process was smooth and pleasant. 

But the hospitality didn't stop there; the room service was equally impressive. Every request was met with promptness and a smile, adding so much to my overall stay. The attention to detail, from the impeccably clean and well-appointed rooms to the thoughtful amenities, truly made my experience memorable.

As I find myself on the eve of my return to the Intercontinental New York Barclay, my excitement is palpable. I cannot wait to see all the wonderful staff again and to experience that exceptional service that left such a lasting impression on me. It feels like coming back to a place where I am valued and cared for, a rare find in the bustling city of New York.

To the entire team at the Intercontinental New York Barclay, thank you for making my previous visit so remarkable. I am looking forward to reliving those moments and creating new ones. See you all tomorrow!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: It was a great experience from start to finish.  From the amenities in the room, to the cleanliness of the room and the hotel, the friendliness of the staff.  It was the quintessential New York experience.  The hotel made me feel special.  I highly recommend it.

title: Great hotel, fantastic location
text:
Amazing hotel in a fantastic location. This is our first time at the Intercontinental Barclay but not to New York. The hotel is centrally located to most attractions and tourist areas, with Rockefeller only a five minute walk. Benefiting from this central location means there is no need for costly taxi’s. 

Our trip started in style with a pre arranged airport pick up via the hotel. Whilst it would have been nice for the driver to meet us in arrivals, this did not dampen our spirits. 

We arrived at the hotel, greeted by Kevin who was very helpful, knowledgeable and welcoming. I was welcomed back as a platinum member and thanked for my loyalty with a welcome drink (nice touch). 

Our family trip meant two rooms and Kevin helped to ensure rooms were on the same floor, this was a great help. 

Our King Classic (High Floor) offered everything we needed for a five night trip - coffee machine and the usual in room facilities. I liked that the hotel offered free filtered water on each floor, I would like to see a bottle offered in the room that could be filled up using the facility. It would also be nice to have cups for the coffee, offered take out cups only doesn’t scream 5*! 

Overall a great stay and will certainly be returning.

title: Value per service
text:
Check was amazing and Anthony helped me as usual. I was attending a business offsite and we are a frequent user of the chain. I needed to extend my trip by one day and Kit was amazing. When things went south was room service. I ordered the Barclay breakfast and the person taking the order at 6:40 seemed a little disoriented. Fast forward
The order came I signed off at say to eat… no eggs. $80 breakfast. I called and the person questioned me. He said they would bring the eggs. 1.5 hours later nothing.

title: What a spectacular stay at Barclay intercontinental Hotel!
text: What an amazing stay at the Barclay!! Please know that while we travel extensively for business, our travels have not taken us to New York City for sometime. We are Diamond Ambassadors who have stayed at IHG properties more than 1000 night over the last 9 years. It is in this context that our stay stands out! Though we haven’t been to the Barclay in over 10 years we have come back to experience the unparalleled warmth and hospitality of three members of the Ambassador team. Sanela, Ann Mara and Leslie. That they have been here for so many years speaks to their dedication to providing the finest service and also to the special nature of the Barclay hotel. It is clearly a hotel that values loyalty and impeccable service!  Sanela arranged a lovely upgrade for us. And they  each greeted us as if we had only seen each other last week! We also had a spectacular breakfast each morning. Drinks in the beautiful bar. Excellent recommendations by chief concierge Uri. And most kindly a dessert sent up for a birthday we were celebrating from the GM Sofia. This is a group who not only demonstrate loyalty but inspire it! What an asset they are to the Barclay and the IHG brand! We cannot wait to come back and visit the beautiful Barclay and its fabulous staff again! Highest recommendations!

title: Relaxing time in a beautiful hotel
text: Checkin was a breeze   Orin helped us upgrade to a bigger room    Room was clean and decorated beautifully. I am an IHG Reward member and was offered points upon checkin. Was also offered late checkout. We were able to enjoy the gorgeous lobby as well  We didnt get to eat there, but we will try that next time.

title: Items in need of repair
text: Toilet was broken, phone didn’t work. Crew came out to fix the toilet but we still continually had to try to fix it ourselves if anyone needed to go to the restroom. Not ideal. Talked to the front desk about the issues once again after checking out.

title: Personalized luxury and fine service combined with history and tradition
text:
Many thanks to InterContinental Barclay staff. Recently I stayed at The Barclay for my second visit, the first being almost 50 years ago. If memory serves, this stay became my 15th InterContinental visit. Charming blend of tradition and luxury. 

Special appreciation to Bianca and Paulette in InterContinental Club, both of whom went out of their way to make me feel welcome. My heart warmed as I watched them provide special touches to their various guests, such as the young couple with two adorable young children whose taste buds might not be satisfied with some of the impressive-at-least-for adult-palates offerings, and the gentleman who apparently spoke little or no English yet they managed to communicate with him and resolve whatever was concerning him.

The (upgraded) corner room, combined with IC Club, provided much of what I needed to be productive over the three days. Even the energetic enthusiasm of the guest next door was fairly though not totally quiet in my room. The only significant concern with the room was the HVAC. On the evening of my arrival, I went back to the reception desk to alert the hotel to how cold the room was, despite turning up the thermostat. At check-out three days later, I again reported the problem, as there was no apparently improvement during my stay. Fortunately, I packed a few sweaters, so there was an adequate work-around.

And Marioara, what an awesome ambassador for The Barclay. At check-in, the staffer politely asked me to wait a moment, and there came Marioara back to the desk with him. (Sorry, he did not have on a name-tag and I did not think to ask his name. He was quite friendly and professional.) We chatted for a few minutes. Obviously Marioara had paid attention to the pre-arrival messages exchange between Sofia (General Manager) and me. And to top it off, I've been to Europe and worked with some developer Clients on projects in Romania. Then we ran into each other over the course of my stay a few times at the IC Club. 

Thank you, also, Sofia, for the thoughtful welcome note and chocolates. You and your team sure know how to make your guest feel welcome and special.

Even watching the paint crew taking such good care of this beautiful, "old" building. For one of the younger guys in particular to keep focus on the job at hand while also establishing eye contact and a huge smile - clearly they had either fine training or well-honed instincts or some combination. Along with the servers behind the bar, so gracious and helpful.

To the staff - multumesc foarte mult, merci beaucoup; adieu, ramas bun.

title: Comfortable and Convenient Hotel
text: Comfortable room. We booked a room with 1 king size bed. Well appointed bathroom with walk-in shower. Very comfortable king size bed. Large closet. 2 comfortable chairs for relaxing. Large flat screen tv. Professional, friendly staff. Nice buffet breakfast in the restaurant.  Great location on the eastside. Easy walk to and from Grand Central Station.

title: geweldige ervaring
text: Wij verbleven in februari 5 nachten in dit hotel. Vanaf ontvangst tot en met het uitchecken een geweldige ervaring. De kamers zijn knap ingericht en voorzien van alle  comfort. Het personeel doet alles wat het kan om je als gast een thuis gevoel te geven en slaagt daar wonderwel in. Ook de ligging is perfect op wandelafstand van openbaar vervoer in Grand Central en vlakbij 5th Avenue, de Chrysler building, One Vanderbilt enz...NYC bezoeken is sowieso de moeite maar een verblijf in dit hotel maakte het voor ons af!

title: Beautiful hotel, fabulous stay
text: Beuatiful, well appointed hotel. Room was nicely decorated, cheerful, quiet, and  spacious (for NYC), and the bed was very comfortable. .Snacks at the "club" were surprisingly good, and made booking a "club level" room worth it. Staff was friendly and efficient. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Fabulous NYC Hotel
text:
I visited this hotel 25 years ago. I had  very pleasant but vague memories that prompted me to revisit.
On this occasion I travelled solo with the knowledge that I would be within easy reach of places of interest.
I was not disappointed.  This non pretentious 5 star hotel is wonderful. The upgraded room was comfortable, classic and spotless.  5 stars for housekeeping staff who deserve accolade of their own. Reception staff were courteous and welcoming . Concierge service booked a preferred restaurant when I found online booking difficult as a solo female traveller.
I felt safe secure and cared for in all aspects of my visit to intercontinental Barclay . I will return without hesitation.

title: Our Home Away from Home
text: Always a great stay.  We appreciate the Club Lounge Staff so much!  IHG Barclay has become our home away from home. Our status is always recognized, and the front desk always has a smile! This hotel has the best fragrance when you enter. The rooms are always clean.

title: Perfect base to explore all the sights.
text:
Fantastic base for us to explore the city. Rooms were warm, comfortable and a lot more spacious than we had anticipated. It was a lovely surprise that our two rooms were internally connected. Hadn't expected it with two adult children rather than little ones.

We had done our homework prior to our stay so knew about the resort fee. We also knew it included an amount of spending in the minibar each day so we made sure we used every cent! 

Cracking little bakery to the side of the the hotel - useful to get pastries before full days of sightseeing.

title: Best NYC hotel
text: It was so nice and the room service was great and super quick it was a little expensive though.The room was so nice although the shower was a bit complicated but besides that it was amazing there was like 200 channels on the tv and the beds were SOOO comfortable the pillows were also amazing and the staff was great too.

title: Sneaky Amenity Fee leaves a sour taste
text:
Now, I have rated this as terrible due to the "amenity fee" that you have no choice about and which is just a cheap way of extracting extra money from you.  When I mentioned that I wasn't best pleased about the fee the person who checked me in just shrugged his shoulders as he'd probably heard it all before....  That combo is why I have rated it this way.

If it hadn't been for that amenity fee, I'd have rated it highly.  The Club Lounge and in particular their staff in there are just wonderful.  It's a great selection of food in the evening and for breakfast and, as I said, just warm and helpful staff.  The two ladies that were there when I stayed (one of whom I recognised from a previous trip and she remembered me!) just above and beyond.

Room itself was lovely, clean and pretty big for NYC.  Their heated floor in the bathroom didn't seem to be working but the room itself was warm so not a huge issue.

Not too bad a gym either for those of you wanting to use that.....having said that I think both their cross-trainers need some maintenance as the resistance buttons on either machine made no difference whatever number you typed in.

The location is also superb.  It is a short walk up the street and you can easily access the new terminal to the LIRR at Grand Central.  Very convenient. 

All in all, you'll not go far wrong with the Barclay in terms of the room and/or the Club Lounge.   The amenity fee might not be something that bothers you but, sadly, I'll not be staying at the the Barclay next time I'm in NYC as I felt as if they were gouging.

title: Great Visit!
text:
Reception was very friendly, room was clean and updated, bathroom amenities were stocked and bar tenders made delicious
cocktails. The prices of the drinks were high. We stayed one night and are looking forward to staying again when we visit NYC.

title: Another 5 star visit to this wonderful hotel. Highly recommend every time for a NYC visit. Ideally located.
text:
We stayed for part business and partly for a Valentine’s date and it was the perfect stay for both. As always, the staff were, without exception, welcoming, friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The cocktails at the bar were the perfect start to the evening and then Yuri, at the concierge desk, worked magic to get us an 8pm reservation at our favorite restaurant nearby. The room was perfect, spacious and light. And always exceptionally clean and well stocked. 
Thanks again for another wonderful stay - we will be back.

title: Hmmmm not the usual Intercontinental Standard
text:
My family and I have bought into two big hotel brands, IHG and Marriot Bonvoy.  This time as my husband is staying on business we decided to stay here.  I am used to a big effusive welcome in an Intercontinental, to be treated like long lost family but you will not get that here.
Some examples - at breakfast being ignored by waiters even though they visited next door tables with coffee but ignored me, so had to chase them down for re-fills - our room being serviced but dirty coffee cups and wine glasses left in the room - having to move rooms at midnight because the sound proofing was so bad you could clearly hear a normal conversation in the room next door - beware room 1201.  What surprised us was that management at no time got in touch to apologise, or check our new room was ok.
During my husbands last stay in New York he also stayed at the InterContinental in Washington and got the usual good service we have come to know and love, so it seems this hotel is perhaps lacking effective management and the staff certainly do not seem happy, with the exception of housekeeping who were endlessly bright happy and chatty. 
I would not choose to stay here again either on holiday or for business, loyalty to the brand clearly means nothing at this hotel.

title: Considering switching from Bonvoy to IHG
text: My fiancée and I came to NYC to celebrate our recent engagement and we were BLOWN AWAY by the service and attention to detail. I have been a longtime Marriot/SPG/Bonvoy member with Titanium status, and I am yet to receive the kind of treatment I got from the InterContinental team. I called ahead to let them know that we were going to be celebrating this occasion and they went ABOVE & BEYOND our expectations. We got upgraded and were given so much attention, it really made our celebratory trip super special. Shoutout to Sofia, and all the amazing staff at the hotel, for creating such a memorable trip. I am now seriously considering leaving Bonvoy to become an IHG member after this experience. 10/10 would recommend

title: Not good, so bad
text: The front desk's check-in and check-out procedures were both rather impersonal, with no thorough explanation of the associated costs, leading to a potentially arbitrary charging situation. Furthermore, the strong and unpleasant scent in the room was quite off-putting.

title: Winter in the city
text: Another fantastic stay at the InterContinental Barclays.  Everyone was so nice.  Special thanks to housekeeping staff and club lounge who made it extra easy to be away.  Hotel staff all around were very polite; made being away during the winter months to be easier.

title: Excellent stay!
text: This is our 2nd stay and we wouldn’t choose anywhere else.  Staff are so lovely and make you feel so welcome and can’t help you enough.  As an IHG member you get additional perks such as money off vouchers, late check out etc which was great.  Rooms are lovely and spacious and the beds are so comfy.  Bathroom is a great size with shower gel, shampoo and conditioner.  It is in a great location and we will definitely be back.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Room very big and clean. Beautiful too!
I was a bit disappointed with check in. I wasn’t informed that being a member of the IHG group I would have some cash to spend at the hotel and also some discount vouchers (15% off Bloomingdale’s, etc). I just got this information at check out when I asked something about my bill.

title: Nothing was too much trouble
text:
Amazing experience from start to finish. Very friendly welcome when we arrived. 
We were last here 5 years ago and returned for our anniversary. Nothing was too much trouble.  The room was immaculate and spacious.  The executive lounge was well stocked and really made a positive difference to our visit.

title: Bad Service
text: The hotel is ok, however most of the personal is very rud and the service is very bad.  Although some staff member were polite,  It  dosen’t seem that cutomer service is not a policy.  They accually yell at guests.    Never seen something like that.!

title: Old Faithful
text:
I stay a few weekends each month at the Barclay and I have for several years. The property and the business model are always reliably in top form. The rooms are finished with details I always admire, especially the quality of bedding and linens, placement of outlets for charging devices, and excellent lighting in both the room's living area and bath. 
The food is delicious. They serve a Mushroom Flatbread that is piping hot and savory. If you order from in-room dining, your food will arrive quickly, on very durable and handsome china, and it will be of a quality as high or higher than most chain hotels, including Ritz Carlton.
The Lounge service and atmosphere are also worth the investment. They offer a delicious breakfast there each morning with Illy coffee and a buffet overseen by Chef Henry, and it's the type of morning meal you would expect in a top-tier European business hotel. In the evenings, the Lounge serves ample hot and savory snacks and charcouterie, and wines. They have also added a new machine called Solato, an instant premium gelato service that is fascinating and delicious.
The Barclay is a fine hotel, centrally located, refined and a great value among its peers.

title: Great hotel! Great Location! Quality Service.
text:
Great hotel! Great Location! Quality Service.

A classic hotel in a great part of NYC with walking distance and great metro access to get to all main parts of Manhattan Island.

Could use more restaurants, bars and facilities.  However, nearby there are many options and no shortage there of.  Nice bar with good cocktails in lobby.

Highly recommend and away from noisy Times Square but within walking distance to all theatres and music venues.

title: luxurious and well located hotel.
text:
Very nice hotel . Many thanks to Leslie Pagan. Very comfortable room and lounge. Excellent breakfast. Very welcoming bar and jazz afternoon on Wednesdays.                             
very friendly welcome. we come back every year.
The Intercontinental Barclay is very well located between Park Avenue and Lexington.

title: Above average hotel
text: I like this hotel because the room is very clean and new. No matter you compare this with other IC in US or other NYC hotels. The public area is dark and old but eventually you spend most of your time in room. The block is clean and it’s quiet during night. Breakfast is not good at all but free to member

title: Nice hotel & great locale
text: After staying at a less desirable property near Times Square to be close to a theater for a play, I made the move here and this hotel made up for every unpleasant experience! The hotel is lovely! The room was upscale as well as the amenities! I loved the breakfast buffet! And my room was plush! I was able to walk to Bryant Park on an unseasonably warm day in December. The staff was friendly and I would definitely stay again!

title: Great Rooms & Bar
text: Katrina on floor 15 made our stay so special! She is a wonderful team member. The rooms are beautiful and immaculately kept. The bar staff was kind and always had great service. Overall great experience at this hotel!

title: BUENA UBICACIÓN
text:
Me gusto la ubicación. Sin estar en el centro de Times square, estas cerca de todo y lejos del ruido.
Las camas son muy confortables y la habitación muy correcta.
El hotel es de estilo clasico y elegante.
Como nota negativa diria que las habitaciones no tienen grandes vistas por su situación y que encontré muy caro el precio del bar( por este motivo no pongo, la puntuación máxima). Pedi 3 botellas de agua para subir a la habitación y me constaron 55$. Lo encontré excesivo.

Así que recomiendo este hotel y volveria a visitarlo, pero sin comprar agua 😃😃😃

title: Intercontinental Standard
text:
I picked this hotel because of the name and the perfect location -- close to Central Park and close to our event at Carnegie Hall. 

Our NY Thanksgiving trip really became memorable in spite of the frigid cold temperature because of the vibrant ambiance of the hotel and the rest of the neighborhood. 

1. Location: Central! You can pretty much walk anywhere from here (Central Park, Theater District, Times Square, etc) or if you're supertired 10$> uber away. The surrounding area is more upscale and not in the middle of the loud shopping stores. 

2. Price & Amenities: Good amenities with thicker slippers, robes, iron and refillable toiletry and clean comfortable bed and sheets. Price is industry standard. 

3. Customer Service: Front desk staffs were helpful --in spite of the busy season (with lots of airline staffs tryinh to check in too during our stay there), they managed to assist us well with our needs.

I will not hesitate to go back and stay here again on our next NYC vacation. (Highly recommended)

title: Highly recommended for a comfortable stay.
text: This was our home away from home for two and a half weeks. The room was a great size and the bed was so comfortable. We loved the housekeeper who left lovely notes and a light on for our return each day. Probably the only issue we had for the time we were there were the cups being polystyrene and only green tea...but because of our length of stay it was an easy visit to a whole foods for supplies that we could just have when we wanted. Highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

title: Another great stay at the Barclay
text:
We always stay at the Barclay when in or around NYC.
This is a fine well established high end hotel - where customer service is exceptional.
The rooms are always very comfortable, and well appointed
Every member of staff you meet offer a very warm welcome and cannot do enough for you.

title: Old Luxury with very poor value for money
text:
Very good location in midtown Manhattan. Building with history. 
Room size ok and clean. 

Reception staff unfriendly without real interest in the customer. Seemed inexperienced. They also did not ask, if we enjoyed the stay and we could not provide feedback.

Resort fee applied. No pool!  The F&B credit for the lobby bar was not considered in the bill. Charged for water in the room that tasted like tab water. Only took it off the bill after asking to do so considering the high room rate.  No great  offers in the hotel, no live music or similar. 

Being a gold member of IHG I cannot recommend this hotel and would certainly not return.

title: Simply a great stay
text: It sure is great to stay at a hotel where everything is perfect. The room was just right with a very comfortable mattress and excellent shower. With the friendly and professional staff the answer to every question was “yes.”  I’ll definitely be back.

title: An Unfriendly Machine
text:
Check in took around 10 minutes and was conducted by a cold indifferent member of staff. 

The assigned suite was filthy, please see the photos. We first noticed several big holes in the top pillow, then stains on the pillow underneath. Food debris on carpet in several places, even a piece of jewellery, and crumbs on the coffee table. Stains up the wall near entrance to the bedroom, dried urine on toilet pedestal, no slippers or bottled water. 

A call to complain was met with really bad attitude, and no apology. A few minutes later a guy knocked on the door saying he was told to collect trash? After further explanation he returned with two clean pillowcases for us to change ourselves. A few minutes later a female member of staff arrived also to collect trash? Noise from the other side of the interconnecting door was the last straw, and resulted in me asking from the duty manager to visit the room.

He was quite shocked to see so many cleaning issues, and the lack of willing to rectify or apologise. He suggested we go out and he'd arrange to clean the room. After explaining we wanted showers and bed he offered to find another room, and 40 minutes later we had what we should have had....a clean room! Not a great start to a surprise anniversary trip. 

It was a battle, and it shouldn't have been. It's basic hospitality to provide a clean room, and service recovery if things go wrong.

Club Lounge staff, as part of their welcome show you where to place used plates and glasses. Yes, they encourage you to perform self service in a 5 star hotel. Probably because they're too busy socialising with each other, which I observed regularly around the hotel. Never before have I seen staff using a Club Lounge toilet, which they did regularly, never before have I seen management cut up a guest forcing the guest to stop in their tracks. I overheard a guest ask for ketchup one morning, 5 minutes before the breakfast area opened up, he was barked at and told to wait. Never have I been to a 5 star hotel and witnessed so many guests being treated like an inconvenience.  

This hotel has serious service issues. If you're used to InterContinental standards, you will not find them here. It's borderline brand damaging.

I emailed Sofia the General Manager at the start of my 6 night stay, and haven't (6 days later) had the courtesy of a reply. 

Returning here after a 3 night break at another NYC hotel, let's see if it is just as bad! 

Club Lounge food, is plentiful and very varied it must be said. The wine is also excellent. 

I don't review often, only if somewhere is exceptionally bad.

title: Great hotel, but beware hidden fees....
text:
Overall our family really liked this hotel. Myself and my wife travelled with our two teenage sons who had their own room just down the hall. 
The room itself was really nice and that bed.. ! It was huge and so comfortable. The lobby area was really nice, adorned with Christmas trees, etc. The room maids were really good and tidied the room to perfection. I hear all the previous comments re drink prices, etc but I sort of expected this as it's a five star hotel.
The only negative is the dreaded 'amenity fee'. Now, I don't know whether this is a New York thing but when I was checking in I was 'stung' for a $40/night plus taxes per room, per night amenity fee. This is charged whether you use any of the listed amenities or not. For me it came to just shy of $500. For me, that's quite a sizable chunk and it knocked me for six a bit as u wasn't expecting it. Why doesn't the hotel add it to their nightly rate so at least you know what the costs are up front..?
Anyway, we had a great time and would definitely return. I would just make sure a had a bit more fluid cash in my account....

title: Nicht ganz 5*
text:
Das alte Hotel ,entspricht dem was man Erwartet ! sehr schön Renovierte Zimmer, schöne Bettwäsche sehr weich . Cafemaschine defekt ,kein heisses Wasser !
Bar sehr Teuer auch für USA ,kleine Restaurant hinter der Bar !
kein Schuputz Service! der Gast muss alleine zum Zimmer gehen !
nach dem ein checken !

title: Family Christmas in New York
text:
Our room was too small for a family and it would have been helpful if this had been brought to our attention when we booked.  There were 4 of us, but were given 2 cups and so had to ask for more.
We were next to the elevator, which we could hear in our room.  The wardrobe was far to small even for a couple and there was nowhere to hang a full dress.  Room would have benefited from coat hooks.
However the breakfast was lovely.  The location was good too.

title: Not good!
text: Sign in was chaos.  Assigned to occupied room.  Then assigned to down-graded room.  Then expected prescription parcel that was announced as delivered and charged for, while delivery turned out to be lost in mail room and delivered day later.  Room service orders not as requested.  Thermostat in room did not function properly.  It was a very bad experience with little accommodation after registering complaints.  For an expensive hotel this was not as anticipated.

title: Interior of lobby and bar Furniture deteriorating
text:
Deteriorating furniture in the lobby and bar  ( especially bar stools: see image ) 
Unacceptable and shameful !
What is the manager doing ? Where have  the establishment standards gone  ?
The bar tender didn’t seem to care and that’s not ok for any guests staying there

title: Only interested in your money
text: Unfortunately, on my departure, having already paid the balance in full with my travel agent for my stay at the ICB Barclay in September, I was billed a further £1,400 for my stay. I was extremely confused when I saw this payment had been taken out, as the hotel had not communicated this charge with me whatsoever before billing my card. I questioned this with the hotel staff as I left and I was assured this was just a mix up and that I could expect a refund within 72 hours of my departure. It is now been well over a week and I have not received my refund. I have emailed the hotel twice since to chase this up and had nothing but radio silence. Overall, the hotel was very nice. Great location and they tried very hard with the Christmas decorations. Unfortunately, it appears that once you have given them your money, the good service stops there. This is a shame because up until this point, I would’ve recommended this hotel and commended their friendly staff and good service. Now I am left frustrated after being billed twice for my stay and frustrated that I have received no communication from their customer service team to update my on the whereabouts of my refund.

title: Great location - no sound proofing
text:
We stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay for over a week during Christmas. It’s a nice hotel in a great location: we walked to most places and really enjoyed taking in all-things New York. 

I was a little underwhelmed with some aspects of the hotel:
1) Checking out from one of ours rooms at 9am, which must be one of the most common times to check out, there was only one person at the Reception desk and she sounded quite inexperienced as I kept hearing her say to someone “of if I haven’t done this before” and she took a very long time dealing with the person. Eventually someone came to sort her out and they were then able to start processing other customers. When I checked out of our other room some hours later, the same person was still at the desk and again it took a very long time with everyone. I appreciate we all start somewhere but perhaps peak hours on their own is not the best. 

2) As has been mentioned by most reviewers: the soundproofing in the building is non existent. This is really not up to the standard one expects from a hotel that claims to be five star. 

3) Service at the bar was very slow at times. The worst was having to wait for 15 minutes to sign the bill for two gin & tonics on one occasion.

title: Very good hotel, but expect high prices for food and beverages
text:
We visited this year for Christmas and found the hotel to be in an excellent location. This is a good quality hotel in terms of its building, rooms and decoration. It feels like it combines a traditional New York hotel, with a modern feel. In general the service was good, although note the point below. 

The things that stop it being a 5 for me are a few things that could be improved:

1. We arrived quite late from a long flight and the time to serve us and check us in was simply too long. There was only 1 member of staff on the desk and he was spending an over the top amount of time giving elaborate information to the guest in front of us. Either, he should have got another team member to help, or respected that other people were waiting and he should have managed the situation with more emotional intelligence. It felt like he was trying so hard to give “great service” to one guest, he ignored that this would impact others. We were tired, with kids, it was late. 

2. The price for soft drinks is simply unreasonable. I don’t care if New York is expensive, $44 for 4 cans of coke is frankly obscene. You are ripping people off. We also had a room service breakfast, which was good quality (although there were a couple of mistakes), but again the cost felt excessive ($250+). 

3. The last point I’ll make probably can’t be helped, but the sound proofing in the rooms is not brilliant, so I’d recommend ear plugs. It’s a city hotel I guess, so a country quiet location is not to be expected. 

The above points are easily addressable, although I sincerely doubt they will review the prices.

title: Exorbitant Hidden Fees: A Cautionary Tale
text:
While the room itself was pleasant and well-maintained, the exorbitant fees for all additional services were astonishing. As someone who values convenience and doesn't hesitate to pay for it, whether it's valet parking or generous tipping, I was shocked by the prices at this hotel. Typically, I don't scrutinize price, but the costs here were impossible to ignore. 

For instance, a soda can was priced at $11, with an added 20% service charge. The mini-bar's weight-sensitive setup meant even a mere inspection led to potential charges, prompting an unnecessary call to the front desk to clarify we hadn't consumed anything.

The room service charges were equally absurd. A simple order of three eggs was priced at $22, excluding tax, and subjected to a $9 delivery fee plus a 23% service charge. It felt as though the hotel management was testing the limits of what they could charge for the most basic items. These observations aren't from someone who usually pays attention to prices, but the excessive rates here were hard to overlook.

My frequent visits to various 4-5 star hotels in NYC have acquainted me with the city's pricing standards, but the charges at this hotel were unlike anything I've experienced, not just in New York, but anywhere.

title: No responde a email
text: Todo estuvo bien, la habitación, room service m. Pero mi gorro lo dejé enganchado en la mochila que dejé en consigna del hotel y no aparece. He enviado email y no han respondido y mi familia de florida han llamado y nada. Alguien lo cogió de la sala de equipaje. Le tengo mucho cariño, son muchos viajes con él. Lo dejé el 10/12

title: Best location to experience Christmas Lights in the City
text:
Christmas Holidays no better place to stay than the Barclay Intercontinental. From the GM Sofia Vandaele, Annmara in customer relations who took care of so many things for us, breakfast which is one of the best and servers like Fysal and his colleagues, housekeeping with turn down service....and of course the Christmas Carols each day with a different choir served with hot chocolate and cookies...all made this a really special Christmas. GM Sofia has an awesome team and this trip was made really special. Location is on the East side but its only a 10 minute walk to 5th Avenue with all of the lights and Xmas Tree and a short cab ride to Bryant Park. Very close to Grand Central with trains, food and a Christmas Fair. Lots of Xmas Fairs and great restaurants on 2 and Avenue. Ole and Steen next door for great pastries.
 
Wonderful stay as always.

title: Amazing birthday suprise
text:
This hotel is so beautiful, from the lovely friendly staff to the beautiful food it is an amazing place to stay. Our room was spacious very clean and had everything we needed. The bed was so comfy we both had a great nights sleep.
It’s in a great walking location to Times Square and also tub stations. 
I recently spent a week here for my surprise birthday and did not want to leave the lovely Bianca and her college were so helpful and nothing was any trouble  . We are definitely going to be back.

title: Luxury hotel with very poor hospitality
text:
I stayed at InterContinental New York Barclay for 4 nights. Check-in was fast and no explanation at all about the property and benefits as Diamond Ambassador. 
Room was small but very clean.
Breakfast was not so good and with the staff that rude and never smile.

title: Nicht ganz 5*
text:
Altes gepflegtes Hotel , 
Schöne Zimmer sehr sauber ! 
Gute Betten groß und schön
Leider schließt Die Bar schon um 
11 PM ungewöhnlich 
Für 5 Sterne Hotel 
Es gibt leider keinen Aufdeck Service am Abend 
Kleines Restaurant ! 
Sehr zu Empfehlen!
Werde wiederkommen!

title: Ok not great
text: Overall fine but some funny things I would not expect from a hotel of this standard. One single person restroom in the entire lobby with “more restrooms on second floor”. Seriously?? This is a huge space, bar and all, and you have to go to the second floor to use the restroom?  Also, ice machines only on every other floor. Again, seriously? I asked the bell stand for help finding one and the poor kid who went with me couldn’t even find one. So I ask at the front desk to have ice brought to my room. “5 or 10 minutes”. Never showed up. I guess I expect more from an Intercontinental hotel.

title: Very good hotel
text: Thia hotel is worth recommending. Very nice rooms, everything very clean. The employees are also very friendly. The location couldn't be better, you can walk to many places. Breakfast is also highly recommended.

title: Very Average IHG Hotel
text: I stayed here for 9 nights in a Premium Club room. I have Diamond Elite Ambassador status with IHG.  There is only one good thing about the hotel service: the room cleaners were hard-working and first class!  I congratulate them.  However because the walls in this hotel are so thin, the cleaners arrive in hallways quite early and bang and crash and talk loudly--so much so that one should not expect to sleep well after 830 am.  The Club Lounge has limited food offerings and far, far too much fried food; healthy options are minimal. Unlike Club Lounges in more up market IHG hotels no cocktails are offered.  And be prepared to  be expected to take your plates back to the counter after eating/drinking. Does that sound like a canteen?  It certainly feels like one.  I tried to use my  Food and Beverage Rewards held on account with IHG. Warning: these rewards have to be applied by the Ambassador desk and cannot be dealt with by the front desk at checkout of before checkout day.  When you have to queue for extended periods of time  to get these rewards applied to your bill it becomes very frustrating.  The same goes for trying to re-boot your room key if it suddenly fails.  I waited more than 30mins in a long queue just to get the room key re-booted when it failed on two occasions.  No slippers in the room. Now that is just a symptom of "very average".  If you are a traveller who has experienced IHG hotels on Oceania/Asia then you will soon realize that this is a very average place. Avoid.  Realize that you are in New York where prices are high and hotel service is poor especially in "average" hotels like this one relative to excellent Intercontinental hotels in the IHG group Asia/Oceania, and parts of the EU.  As an IHG Ambassador I'll be looking for better IHG options in NYC on my next visit, regardless of the price.

title: Great Rooms and History - Others...not so good
text: Room was great and the history of this building is rich.  Front desk staff advised of Amenities fee and while I'm not a fan of these at least I knew about it.  Breakfast at the Parlour wasn't so good - cold and indifferent host sat us at a terrible location even though there were many available tables.  I was not advised of mandatory tip - something I'm NOT a fan of and when I modified the tip, they still imposed it.  Food and Beverage manager rectified the situation, but it didn't change my feeling on the matter.

title: Thanksgiving at the Barclay Intercontinental
text: The staff were great, the concierge Yuri was outstanding, great knowledge and very helpful, we had a twin double bedded room, the beds are not big double but were comfy, the staff in the The Parlour restaurant were also outstanding, I can’t wait to go back to this Hotel 5 Stars

title: Overall good as always!
text: Love the Barclay and I have visited several times!  Some feedback…please rethink the personal care products in room.  The scent and quality is not equal to the hotel.  Also members should receive complimentary bottled water during their stay.

title: vacanza a Ny con famiglia
text: hotel storico, camere ben arredate e confortevoli, posizione eccellente, ci si sente come a casa, nonostante sia un grande hotel con più di 700 camere, ottima organizzazione. pulizia perfetta, personale non molto espansivo ma professionale ed efficiente

title: Do not go there !!
text:
Mean staff and horrible service !! All that imagine i am a diamond ihg member !!! 
They give me the wrong key ! Water bottles are chargeable!   You can clearly hear your neighbors cough or sneeze !! 
All in all i do not recommend it  at all

title: Don't stay here if you want to sleep
text: The walls in this hotel are paper thin.  We had to move rooms at 1 in the morning given the noise.  The hotel was very unhelpful in resolving the problem.  Basically the hotel doesn't care.  Too many rooms that have not been properly insulated for noise-this is what hotel personnel told me.

title: My home away from home!
text: AnnMara & Team make everything possible to make your stay better! They take of every detail to maximize your stay more pleasant... Barclay's location, middletown, is another outstanding point. Walking distance for Broadway, shops, business meetings, restaurants etc

title: Excellent guest interactions
text: The service from all of the front of house staff are excellent at their jobs and make sure everyone is made feel welcome. The cleanliness in the bedrooms were exceptional. Overall one of the best hotel stays

title: Breakfast eggs are important ;-)
text: Like the many times before the service was impeccable and the hospitality sincere. The A.C. in our room could use an upgrade and for a few  nights we had a crying baby  in a neighboring room but it couldn't spoil our stay. What disappointed me was the weak water pressure for the shower and.. the breakfast eggs, I regret that like so many other (lower cost) hotels you opted for this powder like yellow egg paste.. We didn't come back after the first morning and spent our money at Perching and most of all at Eately Flatiron where the coffee and pastry are fenomenal. Yes we will be back as we love the location and the excellent service of the hotel manager and her team.

title: Unfortunate alignment of circumstances
text:
I’m sorry to write this.  While the staff for the most part tried to be helpful, it was one issue after another
Very little soundproofing. We could hear the tv in the room next door.  The first night we did not sleep because of an assortment of noises and clanging from some system. 
The staff promised to look into it and at 3 pm gave us another room. Upon entering the room, we heard water running and there was a broken toilet with plastic stuffed in the tank.  While the plumber did come up to fix it, we moved to another (smaller) room.
Wouldn’t expect this from a hotel with these rates. I’m currently working a billing issue… cc charged $300 more than the bill.  

The 2 rating is because the majority of staff were professional and understanding.

title: Disappointed
text:
Long check in lines.  They don’t care that you are tired and thirsty.  
Rooms are small and the walls are so thin I heard my neighbor sneeze!  I could hear everything!!!!
Staff just don’t seem to care.  Save your money and go somewhere else
Very disappointed

title: Great hotel
text: The hotel stay was great. Room was clean and nice, location was in a nice area and close to tourist attractions, stores and food places. People were friendly. Attended a conference at the hotel. The waiters were helpful, food was very good.

title: Superb hotel
text: We are so pleased we chose this hotel, we came to NYC for a 6 day family holiday from the UK and had the most wonderful time.  The hotel is well located for the Rockerfeller Centre and 5th Avenue.  The hotel was very clean, very comfortable (the bed and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever slept in), they gave us a suite as the children were teenagers and shared the sofa bed in the lounge area.  The bathroom was very luxurious.  The staff couldn't do enough for you.  We can't wait to   return.

title: When I visit NYC, this is my stay
text:
I stayed there for a long weekend and was very pleased with the service, the staff was very professional, and I would certainly stay there again when I visit New York City again.

I liked the hotel's location very much, as it is very centric and people can easily get there
Who loves to walk will enjoy the stay.

title: not my best experience
text: not my best hotel experience. staff was amazing, but the hotel had an issue with temp control. to hotbfornmy liking, changed me to a different room at midnight because maintenance couldn't fix the issue at that time , for me to experience the same issue on an upgrated room.

title: Fall in the city
text: Another fantastic stay at the InterContinental Barclays.  Everyone was so nice.  Special thanks to housekeeping staff and club lounge who made it extra easy to be away.  Hotel staff all around were very polite.

title: Classic hotel in a great location
text:
Lovely hotel in a good location but away from the madness of Times Square. Room was spacious,  classy furnishings and very comfortable beds.
Slight confusion with the minibar/in room snacks, be careful not to move anything to look at it or you will be charged. You need to scan the QR code on the front of the fridge to see any prices. 
Main lounge area and bar are also very nice.
Front desk staff and bellhop team all very friendly and helpful. Would happily stay again.

title: NYC
text:
Always a pleasure to stay here; perfect location 
Staff phenomenal; early check
In a bonus! 
Rooms very clean and nicely decorated 
Delicious and expresso martini at the bar 
Would highly recommend for couples or families

title: Bien mais suppléments astronomiques
text:
Nous avons séjourné au mois d’octobre 2023. La chambre était bien (bon, nous avons eu le minimum pour la somme payée, avec douche et vue sur rien du tout en étage bas…). Tous les suppléments sont hors de prix (compter 70 dollars ttc pour un seul petit-déjeuner). Même ordre de prix astronomique au restaurant. 
Personnel attentionné, grande facilité pour prendre un taxi devant l’hôtel.

title: Excellent stay at the InterContinental N.Y. Barclay hotel
text:
Excellent hotel in Midtown New-York.
Nice room, luxury products  available in the bathroom, The breakfest buffet was amazing. We felt very welcome. Very friendly hotel manager. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and we will come back

We stayed at the Intercontinental barclay for 3 nights and we only have good things to relate about the hotel! The staff was super kind, friendly and helpful. Sofia Vandaele did an amazing job at making us feel at home. 
We will be back, thanks again!

title: excellent location and facilities
text: we had a great stay at this well located and beautiful hotel last week. Staff are very friendly and efficient. Got some top recommendations for places to eat and visit from them. Beds very comfy and tastefully decorated rooms in the heart of NY.

title: Great hotel will return
text:
This hotel was delightful. Staff were excellent. Always polite and courteous. This is a new hotel for me even though I visit NYC regularly. The breakfast as IHG rewards member was exceptional.  Best I have ever had in a NYC hotel.

I will definitely return

title: Comfy beds.
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights on a trip to New York with my mum. An incredible hotel with really friendly and helpful staff. The room was immaculate and beds were super comfy. 
Cannot complain and will 100% return next time I am in New York. 
Thank you!

title: Girls Getaway could  not have been better !
text: This hotel was amazing . I went for a girls weekend and it could not have been closer to shopping , Central Park and great restaurants .  The staff were all so friendly and attentive . The rooms were clean and I slept great on the comfy bed .  We also really enjoyed the breakfast and they has so many choices of Gin at the bar  which was a big plus . Will definately be back .

title: Second visit
text: An elegant hotel that evokes classic New York. The bar service and food is excellent. Rooms are great. Check in seems understaffed. Gym is functional but some of the equipment needs maintenance - the Pelotons in particular.

title: Disappointing level of service and amenities
text: Nice enough rooms and hotel.  Service isn’t 5 star. Asked for bottled water in our room and was told we weren’t allowed any. A bottle of water in a 5 star hotel is really a minimum level of service. Club lounge is empty and has a sad ambiance. You aren’t allowed to take food and drinks out and the atmosphere is too boring to stay. Breakfast is extortionate so don’t go unless it’s included. Service is impersonal.

title: Great hotel in Manhattan
text: Everything was excellent. The service was fast and the people were very friendly.  The room was quiet, the renovations were beautiful.  The room was quite large by NYC standards.  The lobby area is very well done-and spacious.

title: A well located hotel and pleasant to stay in!!!
text: The hotel is generally of a good standard and the staff tried  to solve issues quickly and amicably. I would say at night the hotel is understaffed and some key information was not relayed. However, I would stay here again and the location is good.

title: Warm welcome. Great rooms + location!
text: From the moment we entered, the staff was very friendly and paying attention to details. Our room was nice, spacious and was kept clean all the time. The hotel has a very central location to visit all the best of NYC. A personal welcome and attention from the hotel manager during our stay, made it a trip to remember!

title: Amenities Fees Rip Off.
text:
My wife and I spent four nights at the Barclay and overall had a wonderful time. Elegant hotel, friendly staff and comfortable room and bed. Food and drinks excellent, and a special shout out for the Club Lounge.
The only fly in the ointment, and it is sad that this marred an otherwise perfect stay were the “amenities fees”. IHG should really look into scrapping these, they are an absolute rip off and are added to each nights stay along with additional taxes, for services that quiet honestly, no one uses anymore, $20 discount on laundry services, 15% of at Bloomingdale’s (you get that anyway for signing up for a card). There is a $50 a day discount on club room access but as we booked that through our IHG account instead of at the hotel, we didn’t get that. Free local call, really? Most folks have cell phone now.
All in all the amenities fees added on an additional $190 onto our hotel bill with about $20 back as a “perk” when we spent $355 in the bar/restaurant.

I have completed a review on my IHG account and have sent two emails to a Ms Sfera whom I was told is the Front Desk Director but as yet have had no reply on either front.

There are many negative reviews on line that reference the amenities fees issue and I am surprised IHG still runs this program. Absolute rip off and it’s spoiling an otherwise wonderful hotel.

title: Classic Hotel on the East Side
text: Great classic hotel with an excellent location and wonderful, professionals and accommodating staff.  The location can't be beat if you want to be close to attractions and away from of the craziness of TimesSquare.

title: Great time
text: The room was neat and clean and well stocked.  The Parlor bar was fantastic for cocktails and latte's in the morning!  I had such a great weekend stay and would absolutely look forward to staying there again in the future!

title: Ripped off
text: We have stayed at the Barclay many times  my husband usually books through Priceline and we have stayed in both the classic and premium king with premium being a nicer room. This time he had booked a classic king on a high floor  upon check in I asked about upgrading to a premium king but was told none were available and the person at checking said only upgrade available would be an executive king for an additional 150$ per night - my husband suggested that I go look at the classic he had booked as maybe it would be fine and we would just stay with original plan the desk clerk gave me a key to go look at it and it seemed fine and on 14 th floor so we said we’d keep original room. 4 days later at checkout we were told we’d actually upgraded to the executive king and we’re charged 150$ per night additional. The clerk purposely led us to believe we were looking at our originally booked room  and was completely dishonest and very unfriendly at checkout

title: Geen uitdaging is teveel
text: Even vragen om een fototas bij te houden in de bagagelocker. Het personeel verzorgt een uitmuntende service!! Top-team van hoogste niveau op gebied van service, klantvriendelijkheid. Gewoonweg een geweldige ervaring!!

title: Perfect Hotel for a Great New York City Visit
text:
I arrived at the InterContinental New York Barclay on July 27, at 10:30 am for 3 nights and four days. Check-in was quick, friendly and I got a very nice room. As I had requested, they gave me a room on a higher floor, the 14th floor (room 1443). 

The room had a good view of Lexington Avenue with an art deco building in front and a thin glass skyscraper to the left. It was a good-size room with a beautiful and large lit and framed panoramic mural of a river with sailboats.
