The room was tastefully decorated and had a flat screen TV with a welcoming image of a Barclay Hotel. My name was shown as I put the TV on. The room also featured a small rest area. The bathroom was high-end,  classic and included all that you needed. This room was very comfortable, especially the bed and its pillows. This was a repeat visit partly because the rooms at this hotel are so enjoyable. 

In general, the entire hotel was high-end and the inviting lobby bar-restaurant was just so nice early in the evening. The hotel offers a $25 dollar credit on hotel services such as the bar or the restaurant as part of a small $40 daily amenity fee. This way of doing things encourages people to take advantage of all the hotel has to offer. Drinks are especially good and the manager there was friendly and service was outstanding.

The room was also made up quickly in the morning, was very clean and service was again perfect. Concierge and Staff on the main level were nice, really helpful, and efficient. I got really great advice on new New York attractions I wanted to see (the Highline, Hudson Yards, Little Island, etc.). 

The hotel is just steps from Park Avenue, One Vanderbilt and three blocks from Rockefeller Center. This made it easy to visit midtown and Central Park. Subway access was close in order to get to Lower Manhattan using Grand Central Terminal or an even closer subway access.

The entire stay at the New York Barclay was so perfect. After great days of sightseeing, of walking in different parks, of admiring the impressive New York Skyline and of going out to Lower Manhattan to see One WTC or take a city cruise, you knew you were coming back afterwards to a beautiful and relaxing room. New York remains my favorite city and this hotel helped make it a memorable summer vacation. 

I highly recommend this hotel for its location, easy access to transportation, nice staff and comfortable accommodations. This hotel offers great service and amenities that make a stay there again truly memorable.

title: DO NOT STAY: Disaster stay at Intercontinental Barclay New York
text:
Warning: DO NOT stay in this hotel. When i arrived in room 944 there was hair in the bathroom & the phone wasn’t working, if you push‘Excellent Service’ or ‘emergency service’ a continuous busy tone comes through. A room service waiter also knocked on my door at 2215 H (while the Do not disturb sign is on) asking to deliver hot water which cannot be for me since I can’t use the phone to call anyone. I talked to the manager Ms Sylvia Gomez at l1 AM who apologized and promised to fix the phone/ re train the room service waiter/ clean my room give me more water. 

When I came back at 1700H the phone isn’t fixed/ there’s no water so I went down and Ms Gomez is still there. I asked what happened the whole day how come nothing is done. Ms Gomez said management trusts the team to do their job. I asked if she double checked and followed up and she said no.

This hotel is in a good location & the rooms are bigger since it’s an older hotel but the basic concept of cleanliness and service seems to have been lost along the way. I advised Ms Gomez they should remove the telephone plate of exceptional service to call because there’s NOTHING exceptional about the service OR change the brand to Crowne plaza or holiday inn to align more on the service they deliver. 

The General Manager is a lady and it’s really sad the quality of service they have represented by the room cleanliness or releasing rooms with out of order telephone ☎️ even if you report it.

title: Nice business hotel
text:
Stayed one night for a work meeting. Hotel staff was very helpful. Front desk was able to check me in early and all the staff were incredibly friendly! You could really see the staff cared about the guests experience. Everyone said hello with a friendly smile. Room was clean and a good size for NYC. 

The only negative was that they don’t provide complimentary water in the room and no bar soap just shower gel. I like to have both but that just personal preference.

Great location! Will stay again for work travel.

title: Perfect New York hotel
text:
NYC is a great city to visit but it’s important especially if you’re an infrequent visitor that you pick the right place and area to stay . The Intercontinental Berkley hits all the right notes. This is a great traditional luxury hotel ( think the Plaza but without quite such an astronomical price tag ) in a great central location. 
If you feel like a bit of extra luxury splash out on the excellent Club Lounge … in my opinion one of the best Club Lounges in the Intercontinental’s porto folio and with marvellous staff who make you feel very much at home .

title: NYC September 2023 Visit
text: I am always a believer in that credit is due when credit is due.  This review is somewhat difficult to put into words, however; some of my stay was negative (not the hotels fault and I will not go into it here) but in the main, my stay, again, was positive.  I always look at the Barclay as my home from home when staying in NYC whether be on business or a private trip.  What makes any hotel are the staff and you will most certainly not be disappointed by the staff - a special mention should be made to Leslie, Sanella, Paulette, Silvia in the Club Lounge and Ambassador check-in area and also the concierge team of Yuri and Lillian.  In short, nothing is ever too much and I would say they do far more for business development than those charged with that task (probably giving the BD team a disservice there - not my intent).  I do hope the management read this note and give those name a special mention and reward.  I look forward to being back in the not too distance future.

title: Beware of hidden charge at Intercontinental Hotels
text: Intercontinental hotels charge an additional hidden tax on check in. USD 45 per night for WIFI and usage of gym at the Barclay. No choice. Even if you do not want to use gym. Wifi didnt work in the room we were given . Took over 4 hours to find an equivalent alternate as the first alternative room given was smaller than the original paid for. Would not recommend Intercontinental hotels as they do not clearly disclose the compulsory charges imposed at check in, on top of the room charges, in advance, at the time of booking.

title: Nice but hospitality staff aren’t super hospitable
text: Overall I found that this hotel was very nice in terms of other hotels that I have stayed at in New York. The room was very clean and well appointed which is sometimes hard to come by in NYC. Elevators were safe and you needed a card to access your floor. The only thing I found was that the lobby was incredibly chaotic and loud. There were so many people leaving and checking in that the checked bags were all over the place. I want to give the hotel another star but I found the staff not totally hospitable. Just was I was about to check out my flight was cancelled (for a second day). I needed some extra time to figure out where to stay and what to do. I couldn’t stay at the Barclay again because it was full for the night so I just needed to spend an extra half an hour in my room. Rather than just stay in the room I called the front desk and told them my situation and told them I needed an extra half an hour (which is usually fine in all hotels) and they refused to allow me any extra time and were incredibly unforgiving about it. Overall, I liked the hotel but I don’t think it would be top of my list to stay there again.

title: Best midtown hotel for work
text: Great location for working in Midtown. Clean, comfortable with all of the amenities. The bar/lounge area is also perfect for meeting colleagues for happy hour or a nightcap. If you are traveling to NYC for work, this hotel has everything you need!

title: Een centraal gelegen hotel met een top service
text: We verbleven 6 dagen in dit statige en mooi hotel. Het hotel ligt heel centraal en vlak bij een metro station. We hadden een kamer met twee aparte 1-persoonsbedden. De kamer was zeker ruim, heel proper en voorzien van alles wat je nodig hebt. Bovendien is iedereen in dit hotel vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Volgende keer komen we hier zeker terug. Ontbijt hebben we niet genomen in het hotel omdat we snel op stap wensten te gaan, maar ook hier hoorden we goeds over van andere reizigers.

title: A Horror Start That Gradually Improved…A Little Bit….
text: The initial check-in process was very sub-par, eventually rectified by another Front Desk employee who took the necessary action to fix a very poor first 20 minutes. Not “Intercontinental standard” by any definition. And as a IHG Diamond Elite member, I have a wide basis of comparison.

title: Excellent value for money
text:
After a few hitches regarding housekeeping requests which didn’t materialise, things worked out very well. In terms of price point, this is an excellent option. We come twice a year to NYC and September is always very busy (tennis, fashion week etc) but I think we felt that this was super value for money. We had a premium room with club access. My only issue relates to sound issues from neighbouring rooms but that is not my overriding feeling about the hotel. Room was super comfortable, very clean and spacious. Cleaning staff were delightful. 

If you can, I would really recommend a room with club access. Breakfast was superb: beautiful fresh fruit, Bircher muesli, scrambled eggs etc so we were fed and ready to go. Evening canapés were equally delicious.

But…a huge thank you to the LOVELY staff in the clubroom. Sylvia, Blanca and the nicest guy ever Henry made our stay a brilliant one. Nothing was too much trouble, and Henry would pop out, say hi and check that we were happy with the selection on offer. Thank you guys. We shall be back.

title: Great Midtown location for work or play plus an added bonus if in town for the US Open Tennis Tournament.
text:
We had a great 4 night stay at this property while in town for the US Open Tennis Tournament which runs for 2-3 weeks each year. It turned out that IHG is a tournament sponsor so there were some added amenities and excitement, like neat tennis themed displays plus players, coaches and US Open Staff on site, during our stay. We also leveraged a tennis tour provider for easy shuttle rides to & from the US Open in Flushing NY.  The #7 subway line is another easy option to and from US Open Tennis. 

The hotel is very nice and conveniently located  in Midtown so easy access to restaurants and not too long an Uber or Taxi ride or walk to and from the Theater District and Times Square and other attractions. The area around the hotel felt safe.

Once all the taxes and fees hit the all in hotel rate is pricey but it seems like good value, especially for a higher end property in Midtown. The hotel staff is super nice (shout out to Kevin at the Front Desk and Faysel at Breakfast). The Concierge Desk is also very helpful with resturant, club and tour ideas. The hotel also has a Bell Station to help with luggage and taxis and they will hold your bags if killing some time after checkout. We booked the breakfast package with our room rate which is a good deal compared to the menu prices. The breakfast buffet is very nice so it works out well if you plan to dine at the hotel in the morning - plus it’s served till 11 am which allows a sleep in if overly enjoying the nightlife (or if the tennis eve matches run into the wee hours of the morning). The buffet is also well maintained and the staff working the area seems to take a lot of pride in the food quality, presentation and general cleanliness of the serving area. There is also a nice cafe around the corner if you prefer to just go offsite to grab a quick cup of coffee and a bite for breakfast. The front desk will provide a card for a 15% discount at that nice corner cafe. The lobby bar is nice, well staffed, and stays open till 11:30. 

The hotel itself seems very well maintained, safe and clean. 

Our biggest takeaway was how nice the staff was. I tend to chat up folks and found that there were some employees who had been at the property for many years (one nearly 40) which speaks volumes about a positive work environment which translates to a well managed operation.

title: Unfortunately very bad experience overall!
text: Bad service, no willingness in helping, I booked thru my status Diamond Elite points and got no perk what so ever …. The hotel was pretty full due to the US Open and we were having breakfast at the bar of the hotel ..   a breakfast that they told me was complimentary due to my status and know I’m being charged for it. First ….. and last time I visit !! TOO expensive ..  for a mediocre service.

title: Restful Stay
text:
The staff is so professional and welcoming. I’ve stayed in many a hotel and this one rates as one of my highest reviews. 
It is also immaculate. It is old New York in a very good way. 
It is also very near subway to get you all over New York. 
The area is, of course, beautiful and walking Park Avenue is lovely.

title: Another wonderful stay
text: Another wonderful stay at the InterContinental New York Barclay Hotel. This is absolutely my most favorite hotel in New York, and anywhere. The staff are all so friendly and helpful, the rooms are elegant, spacious and spotlessly clean and so comfortable. The bar and restaurant are great and we always enjoy spending time there. We enjoyed a two day stay and especially loved the US Open theme this time, and seeing many of the players there. I cannot recommend the hotel more highly for both business and leisure stays, as I do both - it's so well located in Manhattan and an easy walk / taxi to anywhere in the city.  Thank you to GM, Sofia and all the team for making us so welcome once again.

title: Great experience - looking forward to our return soon
text: We really enjoyed our stay again at the Barclay - the staff were efficient and helpful as usual. We certainly would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to others and also intend to return very soon

title: Grateful for this hotel!
text:
Thank You!  Wow!  Andries and this team are creating remarkable experiences and I am their biggest fan.  Not just because of the awesome lobby, the high quality of service, the beautiful rooms, how the bathrooms sparkle or even the attention to detail.  Those are all remarkable.  

But when I called to tell them we believe my wife lost her wedding ring they possibly fell off a table.  They jumped into action.  They found it under the night stand and called to turn what felt like a stomach punch into massive relief and pure joy.   This integrity speaks volumes about this team and Andries Willekens.  

We will be back and telling the world about this amazing hotel team!

title: US Open stay
text: We stayed here during the 1st week of the US Open - nice and close to Grand Central to access subway to Flushing, NY.  Very comfortable hotel, friendly helpful staff and rooms were comfortable.  Strangely the hotel bar seemed to close early many of the evenings we came back from dinner which was a bit disappointing but probably for the best - ensured we got more sleep!

title: Super star staff and fantastic location
text: The entire staff at the Barclay were efficient, friendly, and very welcoming. From Orrin who checked us in (he is a superstar) to the bell staff and housekeeping, I can’t say enough about their great attitudes. Every time we walk by the front desk, people would say have a great day. When checking in, I was recognized as a platinum member, even though I’m not one of those people who really cares if they recognize me. The only negative about the Barclay was my friend and I got two diet Cokes to take to the room from the bar and the total was $22. They were good but not that good. I have stayed at this hotel before and he will stay there again. Great location, close to many great restaurants, etc.

title: Impeccable service!
text: If you are looking for a Hotel that provides clean and well maintained surroundings & staff that provides exceptional service InterContinental Barclay will never disappoint! Worth every penny spent!!!

title: Always a pleasure at the Barclay
text: I stay in midtown a lot for work and the Barclay is by far my favorite. Elegant rooms; comfortable bed; fluffy towels; great temperature control; and VERY professional and gracious staff. Be sure to keep your eye out in the lobby for the hotel pup, Bowie, who was the highlight of my stay. Nothing brightens your morning like a sweet dog like theirs.

title: Great experience
text: Lovely hotel. Helpful staff. Very clean. Big rooms for NYC. Beautiful, relaxing lobby. Easy to get cab or Uber in front of hotel. Close to lots of restaurants and attractions. My go-to place when I visit Manhattan.

title: Dans la moyenne
text:
La chambre est spacieuse et bien aménagée.
La literie est plutôt confortable.
Dans l'ensemble le staff est sympahique, en particulier au club intercontinental.

Nous étions au 15eme étage et avions une vue sur les autres chambres de l'hôtel. La lumière ne rentre pas. Les rideaux sont restés fermés toute la semaine.

Le ménage est fait tous les jours (mais faut pas regarder en détail..).

On n'entend pas le bruit de la rue mais très gros problème avec l'ascenseur (juste à côté de la chambre) qui fait un énorme bruit à chaque fois qu'il est appelé. Il faut avoir le sommeil très lourd !

Erreur d'environ 300$ au moment de check out, heureusement rectifiée ! Mais il faut vérifier..

title: Avoid at all costs - add hidden fees without legal basis
text:
I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel Barclay, New York for 7 nights at the end of April 2023. The hotel is fairly basic and certainly the worst Intercontinental hotel I have stayed in which includes Athens, London, Dubai, Paris, Mexico, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur and Tokyo.

Besides the basic experience which lacks any element of luxury or personalised service, I made the mistake of using their ‘express checkout’ and was astounded to find $313 USD levied onto my bill for a ‘daily resort’ which included ‘benefits’ such as free water and breakfast - which I neither received or was made aware of.

Having sought to resolve the matter, it is now August and the matter has not been resolved despite endless emails and an insulting 48 USD refund for ‘water’ consumed. 

The most infuriating part of this ‘resort fee’ isn’t the charge but the underhanded and clandestine way that ‘additional cents’ are taken from you without transparency. Why not simply put up the hotel rate by 50 dollars a night and be open and honest.

The t’s and c’s under which I stayed at the hotel were via a third party- which clearly stipulated fees applied in 2021-22 not 2023. 

I am utterly appalled by the lack of integrity and incompetence with which the aftermath has been dealt with.

With the underlying issue still unresolved, I hope that a professional company which values loyal customers known as Amex will simply resolve by way of dispute.

I will also consider it my duty to inform others to avoid the Intercontinental Hotel Barclay New York/ Intercontinental Hotels more generally - to ensure they are not victims to petty fraud, incompetence and contempt for their customers.

Having laid this matter out clearly to the hotel and requested a manager contacts me. I am still waiting and can only conclude this matter as theft. 

This was my second and last time staying at the NYC hotel. M

Avoid.

title: Abrupt & unwelcoming staff.
text:
I was very much looking forward to my stay in at the point I booked it. 

Communications with the hotel leading up to the stay indicated they were quite “abrupt” and when I arrived to check- in, YES - abrupt bordering on rude. 

As Diamond Elite Ambassador, I don’t feel they explained to daily fees at all, I kept on having to ask, and they certainly didn’t explain that the F&B credit had to be used each day or you lost it. I spent in the bar on Day 2 and was annoyed to see my checkout bill showing only 1 lot of $25 being debited on the bill.  When I challenged at reception I was snapped at “our state d can’t carry it over into other days” so I didn’t in good faith and ended up being $25 down as a result. 

I didn’t feel valued as Diamond Elite as a result of attitudes at check in and check out.  

Location of hotel - was OK, but k knew what I was booking up front/location, so I can’t complain there.  Not far from Grand Central if you wanted to get about on the Subway - was a short walk for the Subway towards LGA. 
Again - to demonstrate how unhelpful they were, I asked how to get to LGA on subway, was told her a taxi.  I said I didn’t want a taxi - and was told she didn’t know how to get there.  No offer of help.  

Breakfast - you usually get greeted warmly.  
I was simply asked where would you like to sit and was pointed to where I wanted to go. 
I saw other guests getting better treatment - some even being thanked for their status.  

All in all, not a great a experience.  Felt like an inconvenience.  And I simply won’t be going back. 

BUT - knowing I was heading back to NYC shortly, I took a walk to Intercontinental Time Square where the staff attitude couldn’t have been more different.  
Helpful, lovely & friendly, so I reserved my room whilst there, emailed them with questions and their replies were helpful, welcoming and it just shows the difference in attitude and the effects it can have.

title: Hotel historique très confortable
text: Hotel historique, très bien situé à 2 pas de la Gare de Grand Central. Très belles chambres, très propres. Les couloirs  sont équipés de moquettes qui semblent neuves. Excellente literie. Un tout grand merci à Yuri, le concierge qui s'est démené pour nous aider à régler un problême informatique!

title: InterContinental Barclay, A great one!
text: The InterContinental Barclay hotel is well located. Beautiful lobby and seating area, facing the front desk on one side and a classic bar across. Checking in was fast and excellent customer service. Up on the floor, common areas are clean, with a quiet environment. Our room was comfortable, clean, with the basic things for your stay. Housekeeping are very helpful and eager to help you.

title: Generally poor service, and lack of staff- there is no guest relations person at the desk to assist platinum ambassador
text: Generally poor service, and lack of staff- there is no guest relations person at the desk to assist platinum ambassador member in the evening , slow guest service, no call backs, etc.  very surprised with the high additional daily amenity fees charged that provides very insignificant benefits , complimentary breakfast for ambassador member not included (why?), etc. unlikely to stay here again.

title: Hospitality at its best!
text:
We stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay for a special wedding anniversary and could not fault the high standard of hospitality shown by all the staff. The warm welcome and friendliness was exceptional and made our trip a most memorable experience. GM, Sofia went above and beyond with special personal touches to ensure that we celebrated our anniversary in style! 

The hotel is an oasis of relaxing calm set just off Park Avenue in a perfect location for exploring New York. The room was spacious and a refined mix of metropolitan New York and modern chic. The soft furnishings and bedding were all in good condition and the room was clean and very comfortable. The temperature control worked very well and was fully adjustable so that we were never too hot or too cold. My only small gripe would be the presence of a weight control mini bar/fridge - in my view these are a hideous invention! There is a small space for your personal items but it is very small. 

The food and beverage offerings were good. Breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold items and the service was efficient. The Club Lounge is one of the best we have visited in the USA with a full breakfast range and excellent evening canapes. The staff in the lounge are first class and always had time to give you a smile and some friendly conversation. 

A great hotel made excellent by the friendly, warm, and helpful staff!

title: Great stay, as always!
text:
I had an excellent stay, as always back in June! The level of service from the hospitality staff is consistently brilliant from the point of booking to check out. 

The NY Barclay will always be my first choice when heading to NYC and I will always recommend to my peers.

title: Best Best in NY
text:
Club lounge personnel was excellent , Friendly and super helpful . 
The Hotel has gorgeous  Service and amenities , Awesome location and nice   
 Access in New York .
 Would love to come back again .
 Thanks .

title: Exceptional accommodations
text: We always book at this hotel and enjoy its amenities and location convenience  when in the city but this past stay was exceptionally good.   Things just seemed more guest centered & personalized in terms of staff friendliness and appreciation (early check in arranged with a smile and we returned after dinner to find chocolates and a beautifully handwritten note of gratitude on our bed).  Our room is always the perfect blend of charm and metropolitan luxury.  We are already looking  forward to future stays at this location.

title: Loved avoiding the masses at this upscale hotel, conveniently away from the chaos.
text: The IC NY Barclays has a beautiful lobby upon entering.  More a traditional atmosphere, upscale (more 'royal' vs modern/hip vibe). The check in process was very easy as being IHG members, I was able to check in online in advance and just picked up my room key cards as the front desk.  I'm no to minimize any sort of fuss with the check-in process.  It seems like the two parties ahead of me were just bogged down in trying to get 'their way'.  Anyhow, upon receipt of the room keys, I was kindly directed to the elevator and the bellman brought up our luggage about 5 minutes later.  The room itself had 2 full sized beds (for our family of 4).  Very clean and bathroom felt very tidy.  Seems as though IC hotels use the same brand of shampoo/conditioner/body wash as it was the same brand that we had when in Korea back in May (which I really liked the scent).  I really liked the location of the Barclays as it was away from the chaos/madness of Times Square or other tourist/heavily foot trafficked area.  It's NY, so you hear sirens and cars revving, but that's anywhere you go.  The lobby bar seemed very busy, but comfortable.  I didn't go as we had lots of other places that we needed to visit.  Nor did I go to the hotel restaurant or fitness center.  All in all, the price we paid for this up(per) scale experience and quiet location would make me very likely to come back in future NY visits.

title: A really excellent hotel
text:
Great service from the hotel prior to arrival as I asked the concierge to book some restaurants for us that I could not do online. 
It’s in a great location within easy walking distance to grand central station, Madison Avenue, Broadway etc. 
No issues with check in. Able to leave bags until room was available (we arrived in the morning). 
Room was very nice. Lovely bed, loads of storage, TV etc. 
We had access to the lounge which was great. They have breakfast, afternoon tea and snacks in the evening with complimentary alcohol. 
I would stay here again.

title: Well-appointed and well-located, but service and bad decision-making are a problem.
text: It may be our last stay at The Barclay Intercontinental.  Unfortunately staffing issues and poor management have spoiled an otherwise strong property.  While most rooms don’t have good views (the hotel is sandwiched between much taller buildings) they are large, (by NYC standards) very well appointed and furnished.  The bed linens and bathroom towels are of particularly good quality.  However the staff here need to retrained.  They are not very friendly or efficient and they are seriously under staffed.  I almost never went by the check-in desk when there wasn’t a long line, and I never saw more than one person working the front desk.  Luckily we checked in late at night, but had I had to wait on that line, I’d have been furious.  Most egregiously the air conditioning in our room never functioned adequately.  The thermostat was set to 65 degrees, but the temp never got under 74.  Unfortunately someone made the idiotic decision to install a motion sensor on the thermostat.  Therefore the system stops working if you are not moving around the room.  So when you go to sleep, the room begins to swelter.  We had to wake up every couple of hours and flail our arms around to get the system to cool the room a bit.   How idiotic.  Hotel managers:  Ask yourselves if you would want this installed in your home.  If the answer is no, then consider not subjecting your guests to it.

title: Missed opportunity
text: The hotel itself was great! Old world NY charm. Nice room and great location. But, we booked two days ahead and found a last minute deal and felt we were treated like we had gotten a last minute deal. Were told if we wanted to check in early it would cost $150. That means ”we have rooms available but aren’t going to give you one”. Also staff in the bar was rude. The hotel needs to encourage guests to use the lobby/bar in the lobby and enjoy it. I come in to NYC every summer for a night and they could have made a returning customer out of me but failed.

title: Beautiful property but service needs improvement
text:
This is a very nice property on a good location - but has serious shortcomings. I would have expected much more from such expensive Intercontinental. 

I would have given 5 stars without these problems:

1. I Did not see any Energy saving / Sustainability actions. Modern hotels show a list of environmental activities. This one did not. AC was running with excessive power, consuming a lot more power than needed. Despite the summer heatwave, visitors needed to dress jackets inside because it was such cold! Showers were still the old fashioned type that don’t allow adjusting water flow, but it always comes w full speed. These are  unfortunate reasons for climate change :-(

2. Reception service was a disaster. Check-in did not recognize our prepaid breakfast and we needed hotel management support for getting what we had already paid for. We did not get any briefing of the mandatory amenity fee and related benefits. Membership status was not recognized. At checkout, hotel management support was again needed for avoiding double charging of costs we had already prepaid.

3. Breakfast was delicious- but very unhealthy. High sugar and fat content. Service for getting coffee etc was slow despite high amount of employees around. 

Gym was good! 
Architecture is beautiful 

With improvements in management overall, this hotel has great potential

title: Health Risk (Water Contamination)
text:
This hotel is poor from start to finish. Firstly, the risk to health of having had Legionnaires' disease contaminate their water system and 3 instances of guests developing this severe form of pneumonia (lung inflammation) as a result was only evident to me when I found a "note" on the desk in my room a from the health department advising this. There was no apology, no mitigating support and no concern for the guests who, of course, hadn't been contacted so as to save business and revenue.

The lack of concern was not subtle and I usually have great experiences at IHG hotels and resorts. The Barclay is a far cry from the 4/5 star it advertises.

The advice to manage the situation had been to keep showers short or take a bath (with no bath tub in the room...) and my experience was that this is entirely impractical and basically a careless response. The Hotel should not be taking guests until the health concern is eliminated. Or at least the decision should be given to those making bookings - who are not provided with any notice at all.

The service was non existence, I had a broken hairdryer in my room and had to ask for a replacement. I also had to request slippers and a bathrobe, which never came and are standard in any room where you're paying upwards of $350 per night.

The only positive is the location, which is excellent, so my recommemdation is to find this place on the map and book into a different hotel nearby.

title: Great service, staff and food
text:
Checkin was breeze as I actually checked in online the day prior. I was provided an upgrade, but I think they gave me the same room. The Welcome Card had some other name on it.  Didn't really matter to me.  Small room, but still plenty of space for luggage and to not worry about stubbing your toe on the bed. The room was as the picture showed, 10th floor looking out the front area of the hotel. No great views to see. 

The club lounge was very good.  I stay in nice hotels all over the world. As for the US market goes, this club lounge had the best selection of food I have seen and was well prepared. Not just frozen junk food from Sams or Costco.  2pm they have a good selection of finger sandwiches and other items.  5pm they have wine, beer, champagne. No hard liquor.  The food selection at this time is also very good. Never had a need to go anyplace to eat. The bar area has some good food items for a late (after the play) dinner. All the staff was pleasant, curious and very helpful.  We went to a play and had to walk back.  It was only a 20 minute walk, and I think the cab ride was longer than that getting there. 

Overall, it was a good stay nd we would stay here again. Price was fair, location was good. Traffic?  Well, that's another story..

title: If I could give this hotel a lower rating I would
text:
I arrived in NY on a hot sultry, humid day and walked to the Barclay - I didn't mind the walk till I arrived at the hotel.  NO HOT WATER -- NONE -- They said it would be up at 2 pm.  Then it was 3 pm  Then it was 3:30 pm.  I actually needed a shower to attend a meeting -- but not at the Barclay -- the management just shrugged and said -- Oh, Well.

Then, when the water did come on, the water coming out of the tap was BROWN -- like tea -- I decided I really didn't want water.  We would have changed hotels, but they told us NOTING about the water problems before we arrived.

They also took their time letting people know that they have had LEGIONNAIREs disease in their hotel 3 times just this year.  When they did let us know -- it was very late to find other accommodations.  Then they send a note saying, "Hey, we are all good on Legionnaires disease finding."  Of course, they told other guests that 3 other times this year.

The staff at the hotel were wonderful -- the management and infrastructure were pathetic -- to be kind. I am not interested in the excuses that management kept throwing at us - as if they are the victims here.  

I would also note -- this is not one individual -- I was part of a huge conference of over 100 individuals.  Management just didn't want to lose money -- but they lost more than that - no one at the conference will ever recommend this hotel to anyone - so multiply the business they lost.  The number of people complaining about the hotel were numerous.  Find another place --

title: Great hotel ... magnificent experience!
text:
Great hotel! 

Personnel is particularly friendly and caring, doing its utmost to make you feel at home. Its central location is excellent, but offering a true oasis of calmness in a spectacular city of very fast pace … 

We had a wonderful time in this hotel during the summer break … Only magnificent memories about Intercontinental New York Barclay remain.

title: Nice hotel in the city overall
text:
Good location.  Rooms ok but I think a few things that could use improvement.

1) front desk at time of checkin was kind of rude.  They also didn’t want to help me when I wanted to change my credit card from the one that was used at booking which was very annoying.  I had to go back later in order to get assistance.  He also messed up and didn’t give me the breakfast tickets (which I got as part of my stay)

2) the bathroom door is a sliding door that is very heavy.  We felt it was fine for us since we are young and fit but may be an issue for some people who may be elderly or weak.

3) the only fridge in the room is a “minibar fridge”.  Not sure if you can request this to be emptied ahead of time.  I would have rather stored my own Coke Zero there but it is difficult to fit a bottle in the extremely small area they give you.

Overall, the lobby itself is nice.  Breakfast was a huge buffet with a lot of options.  The room was a decent size for NYC.  the elevators worked well.  The bellhop desk was nice as was the concierge and basically everyone except the guy when we first checked in.

title: Luxurious stay in New York
text: My stay at the InterContinental New York Barclay was impeccable! The staff really goes above and beyond to make each stay extra special for each guest. The rooms are very spacious and have everything you need to have a comfortable stay in the busy city. The location is also great to explore everything the city has to offer. The Barclay is truly the best hotel you can stay at when visiting New York! I would 10/10 recommend and will surely come back to this magnificent hotel!

title: Travel through times
text: The room is clean and spacious. Even though the building looks classic, the interior has been renovated to look modern. It is nice and yet able to retain the historical feeling on the decoration. The amenities in the room are excellent.

title: Faultless stay
text:
Very clean and comfortable hotel.  Friendly staff. No problems encountered.  Great location for.mid town.Manhattan sites and 5th Ave and Madison Ave shopping.
Atmospheric bar for evening cocktails and snacks.

title: Condescending & fraudulent night staff
text:
My wife and I have been traveling for about 2 decades and have stayed at numerous IHG properties. There is a certain level of service that we've learned to expect at an IHG property. Barclays is a beautiful property in a great location but an exception in terms of service and staff. I’m writing this review to document the unprofessional service we experienced at this property by the night staff.

We checked into the property at about 10pm. We had a reservation for a premier king room (high floor) for 4 nights. Upon entry into the room we immediately realized that we were downgraded. We went back to the front desk and were connected with Anthony (the night manager) and Kay (front desk). Both refused to acknowledge the miss. When we pushed further, Anthony repeatedly stated that there were no available rooms and that our only option was to accept what they had assigned us. We contested the response and after about 30mins, the only solution presented was to switch to another room starting the next day. Given that it was already 11pm in the night, this was acceptable to us until we asked, that Anthony confirm that we would be moved to the room category that we had paid for, to which Anthony responded that there aren't any guarantees that can be made.

Our substandard interaction with Anthony continued as now he had started bashing on Expedia and Hotels.com, claiming that there is no such category as 'premier king room (high floor)' at the IHG Barclay and that our booking isn't what's shown on their internal “system”. When we showed him the “premier king room (high floor)” on IHG Barclay's official website. He confidently claimed their own hotel website was also wrong. All while conveniently refusing to show us what their internal "system" stated as proof.

This was no longer about the room, we understand that stuff happens and sometimes hotels (just like flights) oversell on bookings. This was now about the absolute refusal to acknowledge a mistake, followed by zero effort to fix anything, and mostly egregiously, the blatant and incessant lying and putting the blame on the customer. If we had not realized and raised the issue we would have pre-paid a premium rate for a classic room. The entire experience left us feeling cheated and unappreciated. A truly terrible start to a vacation.

The next day we worked with the Day manager who acknowledged and fixed the issue for us. We are grateful for her response and handling of the situation and redeeming the rest of our stay.

title: beware of Amenity Fee and poor front desk service
text:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at InterContinental New York Barclay, and while my overall experience was pleasant, there were a few aspects that left me feeling somewhat disappointed.

One of the primary issues that caught me off guard was the Amenity Fee charged during my stay. Admittedly, I had booked the hotel months ago, and somehow, I overlooked the fact that this property has a unique Amenity Fee, unlike my previous stays at other Intercontinental hotels. It would have been great if the concierge had taken the initiative to inform me about this fee during check-in and the various entitlements that comes with it, especially since I had specifically inquired about any additional charges. This oversight on my part could have been avoided with better communication from the hotel's staff. 

What's worst of all was when I queried about the Amenity Fee with the Front desk, I was told that "the Amenity Fee is actually for all IHG properties and not just the Barclay", which was outright a lie to shut me off. (see screenshot)

Speaking of check-in and check-out, the process was quite slow due to the limited number of staff available. With only one or two people at the front desk, there was always a long queue of guests waiting to complete the formalities. Each time I had to wait for about 10-15 minutes, which was a bit tiresome after a long journey.

On a positive note, the room itself was lovely and exuded a classy ambiance. The bed was comfortable, ensuring a good night's sleep after a day of exploring the city. However, I was surprised to find that the hotel didn't offer complimentary bottled water in the room, and it was instead available at an additional charge. Such amenities are usually expected at a hotel of this caliber, and their absence was surprising.

The most disheartening part of my stay was the experience with the concierge call. I called to request a fork, and the lady who attended to the call was incredibly rude and impatient. Her tone suggested a lack of interest in assisting guests, and it almost seemed like she was forced to do the job. Sadly, it took a whole 40 minutes for a simple request for a fork to be fulfilled by the team, which was not only frustrating but also quite surprising for a hotel of this caliber.

I believe that with some attention to these areas, the hotel can truly shine and continue to be a sought-after destination for travelers like myself.

title: Very bad experience and Staff with bad attitude.
text:
InterContinental New York Barclay Hotel
Very bad experience and Staff with bad attitude.
I rarely post reviews but the bad experience my family had, has made me post this review. Hopefully, people would see it and not get scammed by this property or the paid high rating they get through Priceline.
We experienced a disappointing service throughout our whole stay. No one expects that when paying for a highly rated hotel with international high standards. (Take your money somewhere else where they will appreciate you as a guest)
We arrived to our room after a long trip and I found the room is not cleaned since the last guest left. Of course, the staff acted surprised and they challenged me. After they confirmed, it is true, they apologized and changed the room to a better one as they claimed. (after wasting an hour)
After that, I was assigned another room hoping I could enjoy my weekend but unfortunately the AC broke and started leaking in front of my room. (as you can see in the picture) instead of fixing it, they put a bucket. (Is this what they do in well respected hotel? I don’t think so?) The room started smelling like mold which is a health hazard. 
Out of their generosity they again switched my room. I’m being sarcastic here because they kept repeating that the reason they could not serve me well because I booked through 3rd party (Priceline) with a condescending tone, it felt like they were giving me charity.
Nothing was working in the room, and good luck finding someone to pick up the phone. I decided to demand what is agreed on in my stay. It took them 2 hours to replace a hair dryer. That is when I stopped asking for my amenities, because I’m probably asking for too much. (Having functioning machines in my room).
In this hotel they charge amenities fees, which I don’t mind at all if I’m getting my money’s worth. However, they will charge you and provide no service whether you like it or not. Also, good luck with room service because either they won’t pick up the call till you complain or never pick up. So I think they should just stop offering a service that they cannot support. 
My final observation for my fellow Arabs, I know we enjoy staying in nice places. However, they hate your guts here, they are racist. I overheard the staff talking about how stupid Arabs are and how they scam them out of their money. It was very disappointing to hear that. So my advice is to go somewhere else where they appreciate you as a guest. NYC has many other hotels with much better staff and service. 
I am shocked by the lack of service provided at this hotel and the condescending tone from the personnel. This is not what they claim (high standards the Intercontinental claims to uphold)

PS. I have wrote an email to the managers of the property. Sofia Vandaele and Lucien Bance. I did not get a response,

title: Terrible service, mediocre product
text: Customer service was beyond terrible. They did not have the rooms we were promised at check in and the staff seemed annoyed to help with any issues. When we did get a room, we arrived to find it dirty with toe nail clippings all over the floor. For the cost, there are simply far better options throughout New York.

title: Check in terrible.  Slept well, nice room.  Good location.
text:
Very beautiful hotel.  Room was nice and well-appointed.  Bathroom was nice, and appeared newly renovated.  We had enough towels and toiletries. 
 We were only there 2 days, so did not use maid service.  We slept well, with no noise issues.  Check-in process was not a good first impression. I waited in a very long line to check in  on a Friday evening, with not even one person at the reception desk.  There were 3 hotel employees chit chatting at the bellman's desk.  Finally, after waiting a significant amount of time, 2 receptionists showed up and the line began to move. This hotel charges a $40 a day amenity fee, which becomes $50 after taxes.  It gives you a $25 a day credit in the restaurant or bar, which charge double what all the surrounding bars and restaurants charge.  In a nutshell, it is just a con to get an extra $50 a night on the room. It feels like being cheated, which doesn't leave a great impression.  The quality of drinks at the lobby bar was disappointing, especially considering the high price. Drinks were typically $25.  Surrounding businesses in the area charged around $12.  Neighborhood was pretty good. We saw nothing to be concerned about.  Can walk to Broadway shows and several restaurants.  Check out process was quick and efficient.  Receptionist was very helpful and pleasant.  I doubt I would stay here again.  Not sure it is worth the cost.

title: New York elegance
text: The InterContinental Barclay is one of the finest hotels in New York City, and certainly has the most ideal location. A block away from Grand Central, in the heart of the Midtown business district and with easy access to get to LaGuardia and JFK airports. What always sets the Barclay apart is the team on the property. The staff is fabulous, responsive, helpful, and warm. Whether at the Gin bar, reception, the Ambassador Lounge, or housekeeping each and every interaction is a good one. The rooms are well appointed and sizable for a NYC hotel. The common spaces exude an elegance that is consistent with a 5 star property, and has housed many films and commercials through the years. You will be quite welcome here. I call it my home away from home!

title: Then only hotel you need in New York
text: The best hotel in New York with the friendliest staff. I don't even look at other hotels when I come to NYC. Competitive price, good size rooms with excellent facilities and the best beds! I can't praise the staff enough on every level of service.

title: What a treat
text: What a treat! Centrally located, nice rooms, good bar area. 5 minutes from subway. Expensive, but you only live once. Did not have breakfast so not able to comment, but in NYC you should grab a coffee outside anyway. One thing, I do not like this automatic destination fees. basically they add 25$ to your room, that you need to spend….

title: Fine stay
text:
Stayed for 4 nights and was a bit apprehensive considering some of the reviews but I was relieved to find that everything was (mostly) fine. The room was a good size for New York, and although the bathroom didn't have a bathtub, there was everything you need for a comfortable stay. The bed was nice, and everything was very clean. 

It's a grand old hotel and you really feel the history.  The décor was traditional but modern with a huge television, and an automatic mini-bar with a tiny space 'for you own items' – you could probably fit a can of cola in there but not much else. Which brings me to one of the issues – the prices! Room service and mini-bar prices are ridiculously, extortionately, unbelievably, crazily expensive. I know fancy hotels are always pricey, but these ones were laughable, and that's before they add various taxes and fees on top of the prices which have already made your eyes water.  

The amenity fee charged by the hotel does give you $25 room service credit per day, but I doubt that would be enough to buy you a glass of water delivered to your room. There's no complimentary water provided, which is pretty standard in good hotels these days.

Didn't encounter any of the check-in/out queues other people have mentioned however the room was only cleaned two days of my four. Location is a little out of the way from the main sights but its  a short walk to 5th Avenue and Times Square. I don't think this hotel is up to the luxury standards of other Intercontinental hotels but it's perfectly fine.

title: Small
text:
We went as a family of 4 under a British Airways package of flight and hotel for my birthday. We were extremely disappointed to be given a room with 2 beds which were just slightly bigger than a single bed and not even a proper queen size, only to be told you need to pay an extra 350$ per night excluding city tax etc. The towels, cups for coffee were all for 2 adults and certainly not a room fit to accommodate 4. The pillow cases were dirty on 3 occasions but were changed in the morning. Sound travelled easily through the thin walls and we could hear the neighbours arguing and an alarm going off at 6am which woke us up. We contacted reception and eventually the noise ended but our sleep was totally disrupted. 

I would also like to add that we travel regularly across Europe at 5 star hotels and have never experienced just poor sleeping conditions. I did speak to the hotel manager and he said it is the fault of BA for misleading customers to purchasing these rooms. BA must be clear to state that these rooms are only meant for 2 adults for a comfortable stay!

title: Love the Barclay!
text: Spending a weekend at The Barclay with my family friends for their birthday was amazing! From the welcome to saying goodbye we enjoyed every moment spent at The Barclay. All of the staff was very friendly, helpful and provided very high leveled service. Truly looking forward to be being back!

title: Great Stay
text: Wonderful stay again at the Intercontinental Barclays.  I want to recognize Paulette and Blanca in the club lounge and Precila with housekeeping.  All went really above and beyond to make my experience extra great.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: This is always a great place to stay.  I try to stay here when I am in NYC.  This was the first time with my family and they loved the hotel, food and location.  The staff is EXCELLENT!  I also found the car service to the airport from the hotel to be fair and reasonable.  I pair $120.00 to Newark for a Suburban Black.

title: Wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel
text:
We had a wonderful long weekend staying in NYC. The hotel staff couldn’t have been more helpful and professional. We were given a warm welcome by everyone, from the valet parking staff, at reception, and concierge, at the bar and restaurant. What an amazing team of people. The hotel room was super clean and lovely, and the cupcakes that were in the room to welcome us delighted us. My 15 year old English niece who was visiting New York for the first time was thrilled. 

The breakfast and dinner in the restaurant were equally delicious and the selection of world gins at the bar were a hit too. 

Thank you to Sofia, and adorable Bowie, and all your staff who made our stay so wonderfully memorable. We will definitely be back!

title: Fantastic hotel
text: great location close to all the attractions and subway, amazing sized rooms for NYC and excellent service from staff. The bellmen were outstanding and Eric in particular. Housekeeping was also outstanding. I would highly recommend this hotel .

title: Great weekend
text: I spent a weekend here June 2023 with some girlfriends.  We had a fabulous time catching up at this hotel.   The staff were very attentive and the rooms were very large for a New York hotel.   We were informed by the hotel that they were working with the Department of Health regarding something to do with legionnaire disease.   The hotel informed us that the Department of Health had stated the hotel was safe.   Having previously lived in NY, I am aware of the importance in seeking the DOH guidance.  Sometimes these pre war buildings need additional maintenance.  In this case we all felt the hotel had communicated with us and was able to answer any and all of our questions throughly.   I would definitely stay here again.  In fact we have already started organizing a trip for next year!

title: NO SERVICE AND CONDESCENDING BEHAVIOUR
text:
NO SERVICE AND CONDESCENDING BEHAVIOUR.

We experienced a bad service throughout our whole stay witch you don’t expect when paying for a 5 star hotel with international high standards.

We arrived to our room with amenities for only one guest even though we booked for two. Moreover a broken air conditioning. When we politely asked the front desk to take care of the room, the receptionist replied with a “whatever” look almost asking us to fix it ourselves. He ended up agreeing to send somebody up to look at it after a longer discussion…

This kind of condescending behaviour unfortunately continued throughout our stay with the staff being impolite and having no interest or heart for us as their guests. 

Our stay ended waiting for the bell man to get our bags in a locked room but as no one came we asked the receptionist just beside the bell man desk if she could help. Without even looking up from her computer she replied we had to wait. So we did. 

When the bell man finally came, he took our ticket and left. He apparently had more important stuff to do than to help us. When he came back he asked us again what we were waiting for even though he just took our tickets for the bags. Almost as something had wiped his memory and we were total strangers to him. Such a simple thing as getting our bags should be done quickly and smoothly as we had a plane to catch. This was not done properly.

I am deeply surprised of the lack of service provided at this hotel and the condescending tone from the personnel. Furthermore this led to us feeling very unwelcome which should be a hotels first priority.

This feels in no way like the high standards the Intercontinental claims to uphold and I am disappointed of the lack of interest for its guests and service provided at this 5 star hotel.

title: Strongly recommended.
text:
I am delighted to say that my stay at Intercontinental New York Barclay was excellent and exceeded my expectations. 

Excellent location, only a short walk to nearest subway station.  Taxis are available in front of the hotel all the time.  

The staffs are really friendly and helpful, from the day we arrived until the day we left, we received excellent customer service from all departments.

The room was spacious and impeccably clean, all the amenities are superb.

title: Great location, great staff particularly Eddie the Bellman.
text: Great staff, including the maids and concierage lady. Room was very quiet and comfortable and clean. Plenty of hot water and clean sheets every night. Excellent mid town location and near everything NY. Finally, a special word for Eddie the bellman. He can't do enough for you and really goes out of his way. Plus he is a very nice guy.

title: I love the Barclay InterContinental - NYC!!
text:
I travel frequently, usually 70-80 nights per year.  I stay at 4 -5-star hotels all over the world. One of my favorite hotels is the Barclay InterContinental in NYC.  It is conveniently located, beautifully appointed, and extremely comfortable in every way.  The lobby is pretty, and the elevators are accessible and efficient (in other hotels, I have waited “forever” for elevators). The hallways are brightly lit and nicely decorated.  But the best part is the rooms.  The rooms are very large by New York standards.  They are clean, modern, and comfortable.  All the amenities are excellent. 

The Club InterContinental is one of the better clubs I have experienced in the world.  The staff is warm and friendly, and the quality and quantity of the food is very good.  My only complaint about the club is that it closes at 8:00pm, which is a little early. 

The concierge and the executive desk employees all do an excellent job.

This is a first-rate hotel, and I believe anyone who stays there will be satisfied in every respect.

title: All the best of NYC
text: Great hotel in a great location in Mid Town. Easy walk to all the tourist attractions such as Central Park, Grand Central, MOMA and Rockefeller Center. Staff is great and the rooms are appointed well and quiet. Some have complained about long lines at check in and check out, but it's been a hospitality issue worldwide. Hotels are still trying to recover from covid layoffs, I have seen it from London to Los Angeles. Just be patient, the rewards once you get the room will be worth it.

title: Such a welcoming hotel in a great NYC location!
text: We have stayed at the Barclay for business  primarily but this past visit my entire family stayed at the Barclay.  I have always been impressed with the level of service when staying for business (seriously, the housekeeping team will make sure you have everything you need!) but this past visit the general manager and her team went above and beyond to make family feel special and welcomed!  Definitely recommend this hotel especially for the team, the concierge lounge and the location!

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: I was so pleased with this hotel! It's a gorgeous property centrally located in midtown Manhattan. The rooms are small for a family of four (we anticipated this knowing rooms are smaller in NYC) so we upgraded to the premium room for a little extra space. The service was stellar from the moment we arrived. Our room was beautiful and exceptionally clean. I'm a clean freak and I felt very comfortable with the level of cleanliness. This is a pet friendly hotel and I was worried since my daughter and I are very allergic to dogs. I called the hotel ahead of time and they made a note to ensure the room would be safe for us.  We had no problem with our allergies. The housekeeping staff really made our stay. They were so kind and efficient. Since we had a family of four in one room we often needed extra towels, cups, etc. and they were on it! Every time I encountered any of the staff in the hallways etc. I was always greeted with a cheery good morning or hello. We went to the bar downstairs a couple of times and each time the service was exceptional. Everyone was top notch! The only con I can think of with this hotel is that the walls are a bit thin. We could hear our neighbors pretty clearly. I always use a sound machine app on my phone when I travel and that drowned out the neighbors at night. Overall we had an incredible stay.

title: Pros & Cons
text:
Pros:
- Room is a great size for nyc! 

- great location (walkable distance to time square, Rockefeller center and main subway lines) 

- filtered water and ice machines available 

Cons:
- they charge an additional ‘amenity fee’ of $45 per night!!   Which was not detailed at the time of booking… checked their website also and this cost is nowhere to be found (advice: check with your travel agent before booking to make sure this is included in the cost). 

- not enough staff in reception (there were slow queues of 5+ people at every point of everyday during our 7 night stay)

title: Poor service
text:
We stayed at intercontinental Hotel on East 48th Street.

Rooms wasn't cleaned properly, shower gel was empty, one bathrobe for 2 people and the one that was there was ripped at the pocket.

The one that pissed me off the most is the resort fees.

What? I have visited New York for many years and this resort fees are never mentioned at the beginning.

What are the fees for? Why is it not part of the booking?

Very disappointed with this and the service from a 5 Star hotel.

Amirud Din

title: Small Chance you might get Legionnaire's Disease
text:
Not very comforting comforting be notified that there's of Legionella which causes Legionnaires disease have been found in the water at the hotel. 

Wouldn't stay here and woudl recommend staying away until water is safe. Can't believe they are allowed to stay open. Seee attached letter fro Department of Health to guests and employees of hotel. Won't even give you water to drink.

title: Great Location, But Extremely Poor Service
text: I requested the Front Desk staff three times (at 8:00pm, 9:00pm and 10:00pm), to send me bathroom slippers and additional comforters, since the room was cold at 66F, each time, with no response. I finally called the Front Desk and asked them to put together the items i had requested, so that I could pick them up myself. Upon arrival, the Front Desk staff explained that calls from the rooms are routed to a third party, who then forwards them to the hotel--a blatant and infuriating lie, contradicted by the manager. I expressed my frustration with the staff to the manager. She informed me that the temperature in the room is kept at 66F throughout the summer, and could only be adjusted by switching it off--an explanation that I find to be incredulously absurd. She also apologized for the tardiness of her staff for being unresponsive. It is unfortunate that management at this property tolerates willful incompetence, inconsistent with the terrific service I have received from all the other IHG branded properties across the globe.

title: Legionnaires Disease in Midtown
text:
Wish I'd read previous reviews but booked at last minute due to canceled flights. Some rooms have department of health warnings and other don't (we have 2 rooms). 

I don't really want to stay in a place where me or my family could get sick by simply showering or washing hands.  Should be shut down until problems are solved and guests should be made aware of issues during reservation process or at check in. 

My family's tired so we'll just stay here without using water or showering. 

Travelers beware...

title: Marked staffing issues, and Legionella
text:
While the place isn't a dump, it's not what I would expect from any InterContinental, or any 4* hotel, for that matter. Although it's a 15-story hotel, I never saw more than one person at the front desk, so you can just imagine the lines at check-in and checkout. When I arrived in our room, I noticed a letter on the desk informing me, a bit late, that the hotel's water system is contaminated with Legionella. It further advises those 50 or over, those with lung diseases, smokers, or those with weakened immune systems "Do not take a shower--not even a cool shower--since it could create water vapor (mist). Instead, take a bath, but fill the tub slowly. Try to minimize your time in the bathroom while the tub is filling." !! Never mind that there isn't a bathtub in the room. 
Wouldn't that be something one should advise guests before they arrive, so if you're 60 and have asthma, you can select another property? And the hotel's bar has an 11:30 PM closure listed, but when I came in at 11:10 I was turned away. I just wanted a quick drink before going to bed. Finally, I found the soundproofing between rooms to be lacking, though it worked well for outside noises (important in Manhattan).
Finally, the internet was quite slow. On the plus side, our room was clean and in good working order (though small, to be expected in Manhattan?). I wanted a place near Grand Central, but will pick someplace else next time. I've stayed in more comfortable and better-staffed places for less in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Second visit
text:
Second time staying here. Last was 5 years ago. Starting to show a little wear and tear but still a lovely hotel.
Clientele has changed a bit..and why everyone must hang out on the lobby sofas looking like a sloppy mess is beyond me. The intercontinental does treat you well with your a member of the IHG program. They give you drink coupons and nicer rooms. The thing that annoys me is they have so many entrances that are locked see you and having to walk around the entire building to get to the main entrance.. its quiet and cold in the rooms which i like but a hotel of this stature should have an ice machine on every floor and two of the ones I tried were basically out of order. I did do the  club Intercontinental level which is pretty good. The staff is nice but I really wouldn’t recommend anybody upgrade to that. It’s really nothing special and it’s closed half of the day. All in all a pretty good space but didnt need to go back again.

title: Beautiful Haven
text: Had a power outage in our home, we needed a quick & peaceful rest. What a great Hotel to stay in. The professionalism, caring staff was just the beginning. The room was immaculate, welcoming & comfortable. Thank you!

title: Legionaries cancellation policy
text:
Can confirm the cancellation policy for hotel because of the legionnaires is valid and easy. 

We checked in 7/4 and didn’t realize the health advisory until after we got to our room. The first room they gave us didn’t have the advisory but we asked for higher floor and that room did have advisory from health dept. 

After we decided to cancel the reservation and go somewhere else I realized there’s an easel towards the back of the elevator bank with the notice and a small electronic notice on the check in counter where they usually have hotel offerings. Wish there was an easel right at the front door, could’ve saved us and then a lot of time. 

Front desk didn’t care at all or offer apologies or anything. The hallways had tons of room service carts and left over trays lying around. Maybe July 4 issue but who knows.

title: Grand Dame in Midtown Manhattan
text: Old Grand Dame hotel, well located in Midtown East. Close to restaurants, theatres and Grand Central. Would definitely stay there again. This hotel is located on East 48th Street between Park Avenue and Lexington.

title: Very mixed experience
text:
We had a very mixed experience at this hotel.

On arrival, after a long transatlantic flight, the ,last thing you need is stand in a line and wait while 5 other people check in in front of you. We experienced delays at the reception desk every day. There were plenty of desks, but only usually 1 or perhaps 2 people working there.

Our room was booked as part of a package deal with British Airways. We weren't impressed to find some dirty underwear of a previous occupant on the floor in the closet. The closet was also extremely dusty.

We complained to the duty manager who promise us a new, upgraded room, which he would personally inspect himself. He also agreed to waive the amenity fee. We went off to grab some food and get our bearings, and came back to our new room. It was apparently an upgrade, but we struggled to see how it was any different to our original room whatsoever.

Our 2nd room was also dirty. The top of the headboard had thick, thick dirt on it. Not just a bit dusty, this had clearly not been cleaned in a long while. The skirting boards were thick with dust, as was the mirror, as were the bathroom toiletries, as were numerous other areas.

I went down to Guest Services, with photos and videos, and was accused of "looking for things to complain about". The previous manager was nowhere to be seen, and we got a half hearted apology, and offer of some more cleaning from someone. We were exhausted, so opted to sleep and deal with it the next day.

With full credit to British Airways, I emailed their duty desk in the morning, who called the hotel within 10 minutes. They emailed me to say the hotel informed them the matter had been dealt with and we were happy with the outcome. WHAT?! I wouldn't have sent the email if we were happy.

Off I went, again, back downstairs to find a member of the management team. She told me she thought we were happy in our 3rd bedroom, as that's what had been handed over to her. We were only in our 2nd room, not 3rd, and we did not feel the matter was resolved to our satisfaction. 

Eventually, they agreed to a free night as compensation. But the whole experience was unnecessary and poorly dealt with. As for being accused of looking for things to complain about.... there are no words.

On the positive side, the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! And the pillows and linens first class.

The doormen were a fabulous, and Eddie the Bell Hop was an absolute treasure. The barman was delightful, although the price of food and drink was above average.

The decor was lovely, and the fresh orchids in the foyer were beautiful.

All in all, we wouldn't stay here again though. The attitude of some staff was extremely questionable for any establishment, let alone a 5 star hotel. And finding dirty underwear in the closet was inexcusable.

title: Terrible check-in experience
text: We were told we could check in from 15:00. After a long flight from the UK we arrived at 17:00 to find a long queue for check-in. After 20 mins we got to the reception desk to be told our room was not ready and that we should return at 19:00. We came back at 19:00 to find another long queue (see photo) and another 20 min wait. The mandatory $39.50 "amenity fee" for amenities we didn't want and couldn't use rubbed salt into a wound.

title: Bad experience, never want to stay in this hotel again.
text: We booked two nights stay at the Intercontinental Barclays NY, but was told to change room after the first night stay, the reason was the hotel had another booking that needs to be accommodated. This trip was a business trip, with heavy meeting schedule, it is a huge hassle. I will never stay in this hotel again.

title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at
text:
Bed bugs in room

Room was clearly not cleaned, toilet was dirty upon entering the room, hair on sink, stains, it was disgusting.  

Was not informed at check-in that the water was contaminated even though the hotel knew this 

On the second day of the stay they sent a letter saying they knew the water was contaminated and were going to be treating the water as of then.  This is something you should disclose to your guests prior to checking them in and let them decide how to proceed.

Worse Intercontinental I have ever stayed at.  I doubt they will remain an intercontinental in the coming year

title: The staff is what makes this my favourite hotel in New York City
text: The Intercontinental Barclay is my “go to” hotel in NYC. I come here every month for business and love the elegant yet relaxed ambience of the hotel. The main reason, however, is the staff. The level of dedication and professionalism is outstanding and I would especially like to thank Miguel Vasquez, Milos and Peter (a supervisor) for always making me feel “at home”. I truly hope that the hotel management is aware of how much value their staff adds to creating a memorable experience. Thank you!

title: A Truly Upstanding and Wonderful Spot in NYC
text: My last visit to the Intercontinental Barclay was in December. I travel to the city 4-5 times a year. I have always had a wonderful experience. Recent reviews based solely on published issues, which occur all over New York as well as other vacation destinations, is beyond my comprehension. The Intercontinental Barclay has always been a First Class place and will be my GO TO for my future trips to New York. See you in July !!

title: A great stay at a classy hotel
text:
A lovely hotel experience from start to finish. 
Greeted at the door as we arrived and our bags bought in too. The hotel appearance is clean and very much old New York styling which is done in a real classy way. 
Check in was easy and the staff all very helpful. The room we had was on the 8th floor. The room was a good size and spacious compared to some others in New York. The room was quiet and little outside noise was heard. It was impeccable clean and tidy and serviced each day to a high standard. The bed was large and very comfortable. The pillows were amazingly soft and comfortable and perfect at the end of each day's exploring. 
We used the bar facilities that although a little expensive ( But similar to all high end Bars in New York) it was a relaxing experience. The hotel offers many other facilities too from dry cleaning to room service which all work great.
The staff were all very friendly and helpful throughout. I'd definitely recommend if staying in New York as the location was great for getting around too.

title: A GREAT hotel in a convenient location - excellent service.
text: I LOVEd this hotel: super convenient location close to the subway and Grand Central station, very friendly staff. The room was large and the bedding was so comfortable. All was perfect .. the vibe in the lobby with love jazz one evening, the food at the bar… I’m already looking forward to my next stay.

title: Exceptional Intercontinental
text: The Intercontinental Barclay is an exceptional hotel with lovely amenities, a helpful and kind staff, and well appointed and very clean and quiet rooms. The general manager went out of her way to help with an issue for us. Highly recommend this beautiful property that is convenient to so many sights.

title: Our favorite!
text: The Barclay always feels like going into a friend’s home—warm, thoughtful touches, cozy. The staff and leadership always go out of their way to make guests feel welcomed. The Barclay is always our go-to in NY because of the comfortable and and beautiful rooms and ideal location. Our favorite!

title: Nice hotel but beware of hidden fees which they charge you after staying even when they tell you taxes and fees are paid
text: Nice enough hotel in a good location (not too far from Grand Central station). When we checked in we were told the room was paid with all taxes and fees covered. We had booked under a package deal and not organised the hotel ourselves directly. However they charged me over $90 in extras (presumably for the ridiculous amenity fee). Was a nice enough stay but adding these hidden costs at the end really fouls the stay and I’d definitely not recommend this place to anyone because of it.

title: Adequate, nothing more
text: Functional, with some good and equally poor staff. Check-in is a particular weakness with insufficient staff to support the process. Legionaries bacteria present in the water negates the ability to shower. Refurbished rooms though are of good quality and sufficient power outlets including USB charging.

title: Take your chances with Legionnaires outbreak
text:
https://gothamist.com/news/nyc-health-officials-investigate-midtown-hotel-after-legionnaires-outbreak

Chain of events.. I checked into this hotel late.. I called them to let them know that. It was booked on IHG points. Got there late. Got a key card. Went to bed… next day room was made up.. then went to dinner. Returned to a letter under my door on the second night attached…. Ummmm ok, the manager on duty told me the procedure was for the letter to be in the room per housekeeping  and that their were signs in the lobby letting guests know prior to check in maybe,,, no one mentioned anything. Housekeeping didn’t slip the letter under my door later in the day… totally convenient  that it was slipped under right as I’m about to hit the sack again on the second night… it mentioned I could cancel. Umm scramble late night for another hotel… The manager assured me everything was ok. The hotel has known this issue was going on since June 6 according to the attached article.. thanks for letting me know ahead of time right? Wrong! Ohhh and don’t forget the “amenity fee” hidden in the fine print.. no one mentioned  39 dollar fee at all. It’s not in the  confirmation email at all people.. beware…. IHG couldn’t do anything for me, loyalty doesn’t mean anything to them, and the clerk I talked to was combatitive and sent me to the managers voice mail box... These are shady people and IHG is a lousy loyalty program. Go to Marriott. No hidden fees when you book…

title: Very Nice Hotel but quite impersonal
text: The hotel is stunning, but the check-in process was impersonal, failed to acknowledge my IHG loyalty, and was overall not very impressive. The hotel has impressive facilities and the doormen are particularly charming.

title: Not worth the price
text:
The hotel is nice and fairly accessible to most places. However as someone who has stayed in IHG Hotels since 1997 I have to say this was one experience to forget. 
You pay an amenity fee of $45 per day of which you get to spend $25 at the bar which covered one drink. You pay $54 a day in taxes ( I know that's a city tax but you should be forewarned). So you are $99 a day on top of your room rate. If you get a parcel delivered you are charged $12.50 handling fee. So the contents were $6 and the hotel handling fee $12.50. So no customer service there.
For the total you pay you would expect great service. Not here it isn't. 
Our room had one bathrobe and one set of slippers. When we asked for a second set we were told one set is normal however a second set would be sent up. Never came.
Another day we asked for some more milk for our coffee as 2 small containers  was not enough. Be right up they said. Never came.
They use paper cups for the room coffee which tastes of wax and are disposable. To save washing China cups I expect. One day the cleaner left her washing rag in the bathroom. In the sink to be precise 
This hotel stops at nothing to monetise your experience and the service is nowhere near what I would expect from an IHG hotel. They are nowhere near IHG Brand standards. 
A five night stay averaged $400 per night and we did not eat here or have breakfast. 
I will continue to stay at IHG hotels as normally the rooms and service are impeccable.
Just not at this one.
