title: Worst customer service : racist

Worst service: racist
 Very dissapointed with this hotel before I book a read many bad reviews in this hotel but I wanted to experience it and see to myself if the bad reviews is true, but it did have a worst customer service:

title: 7-Star Experience!
text: This is not our first time at the Barclay and its always a pleasure. We rented three rooms for a business trip and all of us had a very relaxing and luxurious stay. Our room were immaculate, very well decorated and cozy. We all slept like babies after a long trip into the city and meetings around town. The bar has a great vibe at night and has a great breakfast buffet in the morning. The location is perfectly situated in midtown out of the hustle and bustle but close everything. There are several great restaurants on the street and in the neighborhood, including Avra on the same block and Smith & Wollensky around the corner. Highly recommend for any trip in Manhattan, business or pleasure!

title: Really good but fyi
text:
Everything is really good - staff, bar,rooms BUT, beware.. there is NO HEAT in the building unless it’s 55 degrees outside and then the AC turns off and the heat will turn on. The floor electric heater in the bathroom didn’t even turn on. 
The manager was great, and sent up a bunch of comforters. Now it was 75 degrees outside, but for some reason it was chilly in our room. It’s a big building, that take good care but the problem is the building itself. Apparently, if you live in Manhattan this maybe something you expect and know.

title: Amazing as always
text:
Still my home from home in NY 
Staff are friendly, flexible and kind! 
Gin bar has the widest range I think I have ever seen ! 
I enjoy running in central park, but starting my run on park avenue and then 5th Avenue is quite special !

title: Unsafe & Unprofessional.
text: Letter in room from Hotel & NYC Dept of Health warning of residents contracting Legionnaires disease.  Instructed to use a bathtub (Rm didn’t have) and not create any mist from showering. Hotel also charged incidental fee of $1600.00!  Will not stay here ever again.

title: great hotel
text:
Loved the place, great location for exploring, rooms was well furnished, bathroom was lovely as didn't have the shower inside the tub, club lounge was fantastic , bar area served decent food and drinks, overall what's not to like? 

Great Hotel

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Recently stayed at InterContinental New York Barclay for one night pre-cruise. Hotel staff were all so friendly and helpful, especially the bellman and bell porter (didn't catch their names) and Peter at the front desk. Also had the privilege of interacting with managers Marioara and Matthias who were exceptional. Hotel was beautiful, room service was delicious, breakfast buffet had a great selection of food offerings, and our room had great views of the city. Location is perfect and is within a quick walk to Rockefeller Center and shopping, and not far from Central Park. Just wish our stay was longer to enjoy more of what the hotel and NYC has to offer. Will definitely stay here again whenever we are in NYC!

title: Horrible service in historic property.
text:
Horrible serviced. 
Requested sawing kit, delivered at 3:005 am. Knocked at door although DND was posted.
Inconsistent services. One person show at check in with 20 guests waiting.
No leadership. 
Property is nice and historic in nature. However the service ruins the experience.
No leadership. Left hand does not know what the right is doing.

title: Shocking stay - never again a choice for NYC
text:
Shocking check in experience- huge queue 30minutes waiting to checkin- insufficient staffing on reception, no recognition for being an IHG Platinum Ambassador member - lack lustre explanation of the amenity daily fee. No porter at the front doors to help with bags!

To cap it all off the cleaning of the rooms and hallway was very poor.  Crisps still left on the floor for night before in room, and a cotton ear bud was still In the hallway 3 days into our stay, in fact it was a topic of fun to see if it was cleaned up - it wasn’t .

Will I stay here again - not a chance, it’s got to be one of the memorable stays for the wrong reason.  I stay In IHG and especially Intercontinental brand as the service, cleanliness and staff are exception.  This hotel fell well short!

title: Summer Vacation in the Big Apple
text: This was our second time staying at the Barclay.  It's truly a magnificent hotel - top notch old world charm and elegance and the staff is service oriented.  And you can't be a the location - mid-town close to everything...We can't wait to come back next year.

title: Class and grandeur
text: The hotel breathes class and grandeur. The warm and friendly welcome I received, coupled with impeccable service, made my stay truly remarkable. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a luxurious and memorable experience.

title: Superior place to stay!
text: Absolutely beautiful hotel since the remodel has been completed. The staff is extremely friendly and very help full. The rooms are beautifully decorated and will laid out. Great location on East 48th Street between Lexington & Park Ave. Great restaurants within walking distance of the Hotel.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: The Barclay is in the perfect location, with beautifully renovated rooms, and the friendliest staff I have ever encountered. This glamorous hotel is easy walking distance to the theater district and right around the corner from Grand Central Station. We couldn’t believe how comfortable and spacious the rooms were. The staff are the true stars of this place-every single person we encountered from bell captain to reservation desk to the lobby bar was incredibly kind and helpful. Worth every penny and can’t wait for a return stay!

title: Excellent visit with Family
text:
Excellent location in the heart of Midtown. The staff are professional, but more importantly welcoming and friendly throughout. From Check-in, to Housekeeping they maintained a very high standard.
I would thoroughly recommend staying here

title: Nice hotel, poor service and misleading advertising
text: Stayed over Memorial Day weekend. Hotel itself is nicely furnished, clean, has larger than average rooms, and it conveniently located. Where it falls short is in service and it's misleading ads and billing. For starters, the check-in is horrendous and took almost 30 minutes on a Friday night at 9 PM. Even people who checked in online were forced to wait to just get their keys. And judging from the best constant line during our stay the long check in lines look to be the norm. In terms of misleading ads, the hotel offers rooms with a city view. These come at a premium to other rooms of the same size. Don't fall for this. Our city view room was on the 3rd floor sand overlooked a noisy street corner and building under construction. I raised this with the desk upon check in and they first said that this was in fact a city view and then rambled on about being overbooked. After already having waited 30+ minutes to check in were let it go. The other issue we had was in the price going practice of a $39 amenity fee which you can get a portion back if you decide to buy overpriced coffee or get God's from the minibar which automatically bills you if you simply move something. Overall, we enjoyed the stay but it would be much better with imported service.

title: Couples
text: Good place to stay in mid town , nice grand lobby , had to take own luggage to room so only 4 stars , rooms really nice give them 5 , high floor king ,breakfast was good , close to 5 th ave and grand central station, I would stay again , special mention for Sharon who checked me in great asset to the hotel

title: Once Again, a Pleasure
text: We have been coming here over 20 years. It is just s comfortable, convenient hotel in NYC for us. Will be returning. The staff is exceptionally friendly and cordial which is rather unique vs. the other 10+ hotels in NYC we have used. It is wonderful to stay at a NYC hotel where the staff doesn't need niceness training and to understand guests aren't an inconvenience. The Barclay is  a pleasure.

title: Our Stay in Intercontinental Barclay NY
text: If you like your food book for breakfast included in your stay "food fantastic" our room was lovely I went with my daughter it was a belated birthday present. No complimentary water in room, very clean location brilliant we were quite near Grand Central subway to enter main station. We had a terrible time with air train and Amtrack ending up getting yellow cab we had a fantastic time so glad I went but wouldn't go again New York was not the cleanest of places and coming back on American Airlines was the worst experience I've ever had 2 out of 10 for that airline BA going out brilliant

title: Disappointed
text: From where do I start, I could not believe that I am in a hotel belonging to the Intercontinental chain, first of all the prices are exaggerated in exchange for the services provided, there is no baggage handler or they are hidden Communication with customer service is miserable and slow without any treatment of your problems, as you enter from the main door you do not smell nice Or you see flowers, but you inhale all the smells of alcohol, which are strong in the evening. The rooms are unclean, narrow and annoying, especially those on the street due to poor insulation, and the cleaning is very bad and does not meet the standards. There is no water or service to arrange rooms in the evening. There are no considerations for membership holders except Only a table and it is often closed and the reception   table is always crowded due to the small number of employees, you hardly see an employee behind the concierge desk. This is definitely the first and last visit to this hotel and I will never recommend it

title: Friendly Staff always
text:
The staff all across the building are welcoming and friendly making you feel as if their are with you at every step of the way to make sure you have a better stay. The hotel is top notch and the lounge is great for a quick breakfast bite and coffee before heading out for the day. 

Special thanks to everyone!

title: Comfort and location!
text: Comfortable room and helpful staff.  Great location as well! Easy to get to anywhere in the city we wanted either by walking, catching an Uber, or taking the subway. The only thing we didn't like was that we couldn't figure out breakfast. We ended up getting the buffet when we just wanted to order off the menu. Other than figuring that out we would stay here again!

title: Looks Good but It's Not
text: The rude receptionist kept cutting my question and told me the wrong assumption. This is a very unpleasant first experience in NY. Then, she gave me an unclean room and did not explicitly apologize.  The second room had no noise installation, and I heard all voices from the next room.  The hotel looks great, but staying there was not a pleasant experience.

title: Always a pleasant experience
text: I’ve stayed here several times for work visits.  It’s always a pleasant experience.  Check in is very prompt and professional.  Rooms are well appointed and have modern amenities including a coffee/tea station.  Rooms are also very quiet and beds are super comfortable.  Locator is great for midtown.  Highly recommend.

title: Magnífica ubicación, hotel súper agradable
text:
Ubicado en la 48 entre Park y Madison Ave, este hotel tiene lo necesario para que la estancia sea agradable. Las habitaciones Premium  tienen muy buen tamaño y el baño está estupendo. Remodelado y lujoso pero en su justa medida. El precio es razonable dado lo caro que es NYC y el personal muy amable y atento a las necesidades.
Por ponerle un pero: hace falta un espejo de cuerpo entero en la habitación y la ducha podría tener más presión.
Volveremos

title: Great stay
text: Great stay! Would definitely come again. I bought my mac pretty close to there and they helped with the delivery. I would definitely stay here again if the opportunity arises. Couldn’t have asked for a better stay

title: Never more
text:
Non mi sono trovata bene per niente . Reception : scarsa oltre tutto fanno pagare le amenities fee ma non ti dicono che cosa ti da diritto . Anzi a fine soggiorno non danno la fattura ! Ho perso sconti e buoni spesa per la loro incompetenza . Poi ci avevano dato una camera terribile ! Alla reception nessuno ci ha aiutato sono dovuta andare dalla customer relations .
Servizio quindi non da 5 stelle ! Non ci andrò mai più

title: Spectacular
text: The room was very spacious. I booked a king bedroom and they gave me a double Queen as I was with my son ! The room was extremely clean , the bathroom was perfect. I was surprised I didn’t hear any noise from the street , well soundproofed .  I think I will book again in June when in NYC with my husband.

title: Wonderful luxury hotel in a great location
text:
We just returned from 4 nights at the Intercontinental Barclay. We were visiting from the UK & bought it as a package with our flights & paid in advance for breakfast.
Though there are cheaper hotels we thoroughly appreciated the comfort and luxury of this historic 1920s hotel.
Location was great and there was even an entrance to the Grand central station 1 minute from the hotel and Times Square was a 10 minute walk away, Central park 25 min walk. 

We were so glad when we saw all the lights & noise of Times Square that the Barclay is on a quiet road and we were never disturbed by traffic noise (nor by any noise from other guests.)
The beds were very comfortable and our room was a good size. I requested a bath not just a shower but I think most rooms just have showers. Breakfast was delicious- lovely fresh fruit, smoothies, overnight oats, hot food such as scrambled eggs and sautéed asparagus and lovely donuts and gold topped éclairs, bagels and bread to toast. I was glad we’d paid for breakfast as the hotel charged $108 for breakfast for 2. Mir served us attentively at breakfast and we appreciated him (sadly we saw some guests not being respectful to him.) 
Daily room charge was around $43 dollars but that included $25 credit each day to spend in the hotel so we bought drinks in the elegant bar area and enjoyed the tasty salads from the menu.

One consideration for the management- not environmentally friendly to only give paper cups and no mugs at all in the room. 
I take my British Tetley tea bags with me when I travel and having requested a kettle in my room was able to make myself the vital morning tea, but did not like drinking it from a paper cup. Ironic as even the cheapest bed and breakfast hotel in the UK has china cups.

The staff who cleaned our rooms greeted us pleasantly on the corridor and kept the rooms very clean. It was my husband’s 50th birthday and we were very pleased to receive a bottle of red wine and a card signed by the management. 

It was an expensive holiday for us (NYC is so expensive!) but we loved it!

title: wifi performance
text:
poor wifi performance! 
after asking for improvement - the hotel IT employee confirmed that the problem was on side of the hotel infrastructure and they would take care - nothing else happened.
sorry but his is not appropriate. Room and service were fine.

title: Top Notch Conveniently Located Hotel - Never Disappoints
text:
This hotel is built on customer service. While it is a very high end and busy hotel, the staff is always friendly and willing to help out, regardless of the request. 

I strongly recommend paying a bit extra to include VIP Club access.  The food and beverage offerings are really good and they have a great Illy coffee machine. Better than Starbucks any day!

title: Great location, wonderful staff.
text:
From the moment I arrived at the door, I felt welcome and treated with kindness and respect, The check-in was smooth and I was able to get into my room quickly.  The bed and pillows are more comfortable than my bed at home!  The staff were professional and went above and beyond to be helpful.  My only cautionary remark would be the bar--the food is very expensive for what is offered and the service is not exceptional.  Two cups of tea cost $20--could have bought a case of tea for that price!  The lobby is very nice and it feels comfortable to just hang out there and relax.  The hotel is in a great location and yet, given it is in the middle of everything, it is quiet and relaxing.  I will definitely stay here again and I would recommend it highly to others who want to have a nice stay in New York.
Anne H.

title: Great ambience with friendly stuff!
text:
We enjoyed the elegant ambiance. Our room was spacious, very comfortable king size bed.
The bathroom product were very high standard.
The stuff was very friendly and accommodating.
Great location, easy to walk to the mid town attractions like the MoMa.

title: Excellent stay in a fantastic hotel !
text:
Excellent stay in this fantastic hotel !
The beds are top and a very clean room  !  
The location is fantastic ! Everything is 
Very friendly staff !
The Belgian Manager made us feel at home ! 
I hope to come back in the future ! 
I would recommend this hotel to everybody !

title: Great stay in the city that never sleeps
text: Excellent hotel for a nice stay in NY, either for business or leisure. Great location close to 5th Avenue, walking distance to Central Park, Time Square and the East River. Nice rooms, nice vibe, very friendly staff and a great bed. We will definitely come back next time we visit NY.

title: Great experience
text: This was our 3rd visit to this hotel and we were very happy there. The staff was very nice and polite. Room very clean. Excellent breakfast we just wish they would put the it area in a bigger area. Saturday we had to wait 30 minutes for a table. It was a little bit frustrating…… Otherwise everything was perfect.

title: Service in need of serious upgrade
text: Good location and my room was clean and relatively spacious. Well lit and lots of power points, good storage space. Quick check in. No one helped me with my luggage or showed me to my room. No bath just a shower with poor pressure and no hot (just lukewarm) water. No cotton wool or shower cap provided until I asked housekeeping. Housekeeping were cheerful and helpful when asked and did a great job in cleaning the room. Coffee machine was fine, only green tea provided. The mini bar water was not replenished. When I called to ask they said the mini bar would not be replenished (even though I was staying for 5 days) but that someone from food and beverage would call me (!) - I never received any call and obviously bought my own water in Walgreens. Very limited tv channels, no pay tv. Room service only accessible through website. I ordered room service three times and on each occasion there were multiple mistakes. When I called to correct it each time the person argued that I got my order wrong rather than offering to correct it, apart from the waiter noticed there was no coffee and brought me the pot. Based on prior experience I decided not to have another argument about the missing toast and fruit (ie half my order). Breakfast in the Parlour was poor and the waiting staff were grumpy. Overall this is a well located hotel but the service needs a serious upgrade.

title: 100% Comfort and Class
text:
From the minute we walked through the doors at the Intercontinental Barclay's Hotel until we left was an extremely relaxing and comfortable experience. The staff were professional and welcoming. We found our room to be absolutely perfect.
Kudos to the General Manager of the hotel for keeping this hotel running as smoothly as it's run!

title: Liars, Thieves and Thugs
text:
Worst hotel experience of my life! I checked into room 457 (on the 4th Floor), unpacked my bags and left the hotel. When I returned 4 1/2 hours later, someone else was in my room eating a room service meal. Thinking I had possibly made a mistake, I went to the front desk. 

The front desk told me I had the wrong room and my room was on the 14th floor. I informed them that was not possible and that I had unpacked all of my belongings in my room on the 4th floor. The front desk attendant insisted I was wrong and argued with me before agreeing to let me speak with a manager, who took 15 minutes to come speak with me. The manager informed me that there had been a plumbing issue in my room and they were forced to remove my belongings on an emergency basis. This seemed unlikely as I had not reported any plumbing issue and I was only gone from the room for 4 1/2 hours (during which time someone other than me would have had to report a plumbing issue in my room, the hotel would have had to find an after-hours plumber, the plumber would have had to resolve the issue and repair any damage, the hotel’s housekeeping crew would have had to remove my items and clean the room and then have time for another guest to check in and that guest had time to order room service). 

I asked why the hotel did not contact me to inform me of the issue and the manager replied that none of my contact details were stored on the hotel’s reservation system, which was blatantly untrue as all of my information was included on the booking, as confirmed by multiple subsequent managers and my travel agent. I was also traveling as part of a conference and a number of the conference administrators' contact details were also listed on the booking. 

At this point, a bellman stepped in front of my face and began yelling at me. At first, he yelled "Do you want to argue with the computer?" I said that was ridiculous and he yelled "I don't care who you think you are. Shut the [blank] up!" The shift manager did nothing. The security guard did nothing. Instead of trying to assist, the manager and security guard let the bellman yell at me some more until they finally took me to the bell desk storage room, where my belongings had been put in plastic laundry bags like trash and left on a luggage rack. At this point, I felt physically threatened and in imminent physical danger. 

In the storage room, the bellman continued to yell at me and said I should collect my own belongings. When I started to push the luggage cart out of the storage area, the security guard stopped me and finally asked another bellman to assist with my items.

In sum, the staff yelled at me, cursed at me and made me feel physically threatened. The staff lied to me multiple times (and have since admitted that there was no plumbing issue and that they had my contact information). They did not move my belongings to another room but instead dumped them in plastic bags. I had to speak with 3 different shift managers before the general manager bothered to contact me, even though I had made multiple requests to speak with the GM and she had been on shift for many hours. To make it up to me, the 2nd shift manager offered to buy me a cup of hot chocolate!!

I was unable to sleep due to concern for my safety and absolute fury at my treatment at the hands of the staff. I was even more appalled when the staff manager informed me that the threatening bellman may be on duty when I return because he was a union employee and there was nothing they could do to remove him.

title: Nice hotel, just not outstanding
text:
Just back from a week long holiday in NYC staying at the Intercontinental Barclay hotel.

The good:
Hotel location in Midtown Manhattan is superb, close to basically everything including excellent transport links. Room was spacious, comfortable and beautifully decorated, it looked like it had been recently refurbished. Plenty of storage for our clothes and stuff. Room amenities included a coffee/tea maker and minibar. Breakfast (included with our room) was good and varied, they kept changing the hot food options every day. Check-in was quick with no queue when we arrived (mid afternoon). Staff were mostly friendly and helpful. Room service food (2 dinners) was good.

The not-so-good
Minibar was automated (the “touch that coke can and we’ll charge you $11” type) and coffee/tea maker was pod-type. Just 2 black tea pods on arrival that were replaced by 2 green tea pods (because hey, tea is tea and it’s all the same, right?). No proper mini-fridge meant no chance of buying a salad or yogurts for a light dinner and keep it in the room. Bathroom had just a shower and no bath. No way to know all this in advance, as the website includes zero information about room amenities (room details for our “King Premium High Floor” are listed as “Non smoking”, “1 King Bed”, “Premium” and “High Floor” - duh!).
We knew in advance about the “amenities fee” as our booking listed $360 for “additional charges”. In return, hotel offers some perks including a 10% discount at the café next door (saves you $3, tops), a 15% discount at Bloomingdale’s that excluded 2 of 3 things we bought there, and a daily $25 discount on hotel food that doesn’t get you far considering the prices.

The just plain weird
The in-room hair dryer was old, dirty and dodgy-looking. It did work, but sounded like it was about to perish and take me with it if it could, so I didn’t dare use it. The contrast between the tatty hair dryer and the plush room decor was bizarre.
Our room included a fancy huge Google TV that offered the same as any old TV set: no hotel bill viewing, no option to cast video content from our devices and no online services, not even YouTube. The options were there, just didn’t work.
Breakfast experience was hit and miss. First day we were made to wait until a group of two finished as we were told there were no free tables, however we saw two empty tables that were set up for four. The following days we saw groups of two being sat at tables for four. Also on the first day one of the waiters insisted on letting us know how the couple sitting behind us, who had just left, had been rude to him… We found this unprofessional. I wonder what he said of us to the next guys after we left!
Concierge hours are odd. On our second morning we tried to buy some hop-on hop-off bus tickets and were told the concierge wouldn’t arrive until 11am. Waiting meant losing the morning, so we just left.
The hotel appears to have a “virtual valet“ called Perle that kept texting me suggesting I join them for live music events. It asked for comments on our experience and I wrote some of the remarks above, but it never replied and nobody got in touch.

All in all, our stay was nice enough and we might consider going back next time we visit NYC, but we’ll look at other, similar hotels in Manhattan first.

title: Best of NYC
text:
Classic elegance, art deco lobby, impeccable rooms and bathrooms, reasonable priced (affordable) for NYC caliber. Top quality linens and comfort. Stylish room. Modern and spacious bathroom. 

Check in was amazingly efficient for NYC during the holidays and much more impressive than experience at Sofitel NYC. Took about 10 minutes to get through even though the lobby was teeming with tourists. There is a delicious bakery (Ole & Steen) right next door with delicious assortment of cinnamon buns.

I liked the neighborhood - down a quiet walkway and not the dingy Midtown that is overrun by noise and tourists. Easy access from hotel to Grand Central Terminal and quaint bars, restaurants and lounges of Midtown East.

The breakfast was actually quite scrumptious. I believe it was quite costly at the fixed all you can eat price ($35), and only tried it one morning but eclairs with gold flakes and pistachio filling, along with basic hot/self-serve meals were delicious.

This will be my go to NYC hotel - reliable, classic and clean and upholding well standard of IHG brands.

title: Just arrived . Shocked
text: Never seen such a small room in my whole life in a 5 star hotel . Cannot even open the door and walk around . Probably the worst in the whole hotel . The reception was empty and had to wait for someone to come . Why ??? Why did I book here instead of my usual Warwick ? Why !!!!

title: Good service
text: Great service at the bar! Would definitely recommend to anyone. Was greeted accordingly and the bartender was very kind. Unfortunately I don’t remember his name anymore but either way, great experience.

title: Great Experience at Intercontinental Barclay
text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay for our 15 year anniversary.  The stay was fantastic!!  The room was clean, service was outstanding, and the hotel went over and above to make this a truly special occasion for us.  We would highly recommend for anyone celebrating a special occasion, or just for an overnight stay in NYC!!

title: Best hotel in the city
text: My favorite hotel in the city by far! The service is impeccable and the hotel looks fantastic. I also love the location as it is centrally located. We attended two shows on Broadway and it was an easy stroll back.  I am going back next week and I can't wait to be there again.

title: Lackluster and frenetic
text: Crowded lobby, very high food prices, one elevator broken for most or stay, and hidden amenity fees.  Felt fairly commercial and transactional.  On the plus side, the rooms were well kept and the beds were great.  In the end, you can get more for your money in NYC.

title: Loud hotel - terrible customer service.
text: Had an awful experience. People in room next door were partying all throughout the night. We called and complained multiple times and we're continuously ignored. I reached out to customer service after the trip as well to see what we can be done and it took multiple emails before getting a single response. No resolution has been found and I haven't received an e-mail back since my last e-mail request over a week ago. I travel all the time and this is by far the worst customer service that I have experienced at a hotel.

title: Excellent NYC base to explore
text: What a fantastic hotel - excellent location to visit central NYC (Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller, Grand Central, Empire State etc). Room was excellent and well maintained daily. Concierge was very helpful with tips for getting round. Extended to later checkout with no costs. $25 credit daily which we used in the bar most evenings

title: Leave the teens at home next time.
text:
Requested via British Airways Holidays a family room. Turned out to be a dark little space on the 3rd floor with a view of some rubbish bags that had been left on the flat roof.  The two beds were 4'6" so small doubles - really two small for a hotel such as this to consider them suitable for a family.  Water pressure in the shower was a joke, unfortunately I did not have a wrench and so could not remove the money saving water device. 
The bar was ok, but $30 for a glass of cab after T&T is stretching things.   
Got breakfast at the Danish place on the corner of 48 and Lex, the best coffee in NY by a country mile. 

Great location however, which is why I booked it,

title: Almost…
text: Excellent hotel but for one issue (and it’s a showstopper for future scheduled trips to this hotel chain). The so-called amenities charge felt like a dash for the cash. Gave us useless “amenities” while adding substantial increase to the overall cost of stay. Too bad. Nice hotel otherwise.

title: Could be better......
text:
There are many positives for this hotel. It is in a great location for Times Square and Central Park, generally staff are very friendly, beds were very comfortable.  But it just didn't really do it for me or my wife.

Room service has limited hours. The bar closes at 11. Shower pressure was not so good. No tea in the room, except for one capsule for the coffee (?) machine, which once used was never replenished.  No proper cups or mugs - just paper ones.  I mean, paper cups in a 4/5 star hotel? What is the world coming to? A short wait for check-in with a staff member who seemed completely disinterested in us and our stay.  (For balance, check-out was fine). 

When we do come back to NYC, we won't stay here. I am sure a lot of people will have a great stay. But, it just wasn't for us.

title: Tired and unfriendly Hotel
text: Upon check in, only 1 member of staff on reception,  so a long wait In a long que after an internal flight was not pleasant. Greeted by a rude Recep staff member, and slapped with a daily $45 resort fee added to my booking.  This should be made more clear when booking this hotel. The room itself was tired and the shower water pressure was horrendous! Stuck with shampoo in my hair as I couldn't shower it off we had to get maintenence in to fix this...again, after a very long flight and extremely long wait in ques at the airport you just don't need it! The shampoo and conditioner was never replenished, ended up buying our own from a convenience store. Charge $25 for 2 bottles of water. The bar closes at 11pm!!! So much for the city that never sleeps!! All in all, I will not be returning to this hotel. Unfriendly staff, tired rooms with dirty carpets, only plus was free WiFi and the bed was comfortable.  The location is also good. But with the added fees, you can get a much nicer hotel for the same price in a similar location!

title: Nasty Surprises
text:
We were hit with an unexpected $45 per night tax which was never mentioned when we booked it!!
The bar shut at 11.00 so much for the City that doesn’t sleep !!
Staff were rude and abrupt
Won’t be going back in a hurry

title: Great for business travelers
text: The Barclay is perfect for a business traveler as it is quiet and offers a central location for midtown Manhattan.  The bar and restaurant are convenient, offer great service, and a well-balanced menu.  Rooms are clean, well-maintained, and consistent in their layout.

title: Perfect stay
text: From check in to check out, all perfect. Special thanks goes to mr Bance, who did understand my “special request” about delivered package. And mrs Sharon, who allocate a nice room at the time of check in for my stay. Thank you and see U soon. Miha

Come on attention to detail-these little things make way for a better experience!
It could be a great hotel!
Bar over priced bottle of water $16
Central hotel
Clean hotel
Great location
Would I come back maybe if there was a good incentive!
Would I recommend not so sure!
I think there is much better In NY!
Maids done a great job-housekeeping!

title: een echte aanrader
text:
Het hotel is centraal gelegen in NY en is zijn Vier sterren meer dan waard.
Van de eerste minuut in het hotel voelden we ons zeer welkom.
Zeer ruime kamers.
heerlijk ontbijt.
Een Hotel waar iedereen tot u dienst staat er uitermate vriendelijk is.

title: Great stay
text: Amazing and elegant, this place is beautiful and the service is great. Would definitively come back as many times as possible. Location is perfect as well and there are lots of fun things to do nearby.

title: Excellent choice for Diamond Ambassador Members
text:
We are Diamond Ambassador IHG One members, and I used the annual free weekend night certificate for our stay. To maximize the benefit, I booked a club-level room, to which we added a third night at a significantly reduced AAA rate. As great as the savings were, I was overwhelmed by the sheer volume of taxes and fees. Even though the second night was “free,” I was still charged double the taxes and fees, including taxes and fees for the club lounge, something I’ve never even seen before, so this may be a uniquely NYC tax. I was also charged amenity fees, including for the “free” night,” even though I was never informed what amenities were included in this fee at check-in. I still don’t know what they were, only that I didn’t benefit from any of them. My tip for future guests: Even if you are exhausted by a late-night check-in and long line to be helped, ask about taxes, fees, and amenity charges so that you won’t be surprised upon check-out.

Prior to check-in, I had communicated by e-mail with the hotel’s manager, Sofia Vandaele (Sofia.Vandaele@ihg.com) and requested an upgrade to a suite, which was one category above the room that I had booked. She confirmed the upgrade the day before our check-in.

We arrived to the hotel around 11 PM, and there was only one employee at the check-in counter and a line three-people deep upon our arrival. There is a dedicated counter for Ambassador members, but it is not staffed at night. As Diamond members, I asked about the difference between breakfast at the restaurant or at the lounge, which the employee referred to repeatedly as the “VIP” lounge instead of the club lounge. He claimed that the food selections would be the same, so I should choose the VIP lounge of the hotel’s restaurant. From pictures I’ve seen of the breakfast buffet in the restaurant and reading the menu, I was surprised and impressed that in fact the club lounge buffet is even nicer than the hotel’s restaurant in that the buffet display is more elegant, and the rooms are private, whereas the restaurant spills out into the lobby. Outside of a Ritz Carlton, it was the nicest breakfast buffet that I have seen in a domestic club lounge. Certainly no Marriot or Westin that I’ve ever visited could compare. An especially nice touch is that there were some different food items each of the three days instead of identical offerings, which could have gotten old by the third day.

The suite was elegant and felt like we were staying in a posh, upper-east-side apartment. The hotel provided a delightful welcome amenity of a taxi created out of white chocolate with chocolate-dipped cookies inside as well as a strawberry dipped in white chocolate. The bed was comfortable and had soft pillows. The bathroom did not have a tub but had a heated floor. While there was no bidet, there was a bidet-like wand next to the toilet which was both tricky to figure out how to use and ended up being unwieldy. The mini-bar was one of those where you can’t move anything without getting charged, but it had a small section where you could put your own food or drinks.

My only complaint were the televisions, which had no capacity for allowing guests to view the bill, use Chromecast, or even provide a selection of streaming platforms to use. While we didn’t end up spending much time in the room in any case, these features would have come in handy, and the manager did tell me that the televisions were due to be upgraded by the end of the second quarter, whenever that is.

Because there was no way to view my folio, I had to go to the ambassador desk twice to look at it. I was charged an upgraded internet fee for one day which the employee removed but only after scolding me for not using an access code, even though I explained to her that nobody had informed me about an access code. This employee turned out to be the only rude person at the hotel, whose staff were otherwise exceptionally friendly and helpful. Each time that I tipped the housekeeper, she demonstrated a genuine appreciation, so let me put in a plug here to please tip the housekeepers. They did a terrific job keeping the room tidy during their twice-daily visits, something that almost seems obsolete in this day-and-age. The turn-down service included a collection of Neuhaus chocolate eggs on Easter.

The hotel’s location was ideal. In debating between the Barclay or Times Square locations, the latter of which would have been cheaper, we decided on the Barclay for its history (according to the lobby museum, Hemingway put his final touches on For Whom the Bell Tolls while a guest) and its quiet, yet convenient, location. We definitely felt like we had made the right choice. This is a property that knows how to treat its Diamond Ambassador guests.

title: Nice
text: Very comfortable hotel. Teeny tiny rooms. Good area if you are visiting for business, not great otherwise. I had a free night so decided to stay for fun. Bathroom was a nice size, whereas the bedroom was a little too small.

title: No IC ambassador benefits given, ignored
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel many times before the pandemic. As IHG ‘Diamond Ambassador’ I previously always received the guaranteed upgrade that is part of this paid membership level. Not this time. 
The app had shown an upgrade of the room the evening before my arrival, so I didn’t bother asking. And I checked in quickly at night so as to not hold up other people after waiting in the queue for more than 15 minutes like me. Note, there is no ambassador/member counter anymore. 
To my surprise when I got to the room it was not an upgraded one, and in the app it also showed the booked category. When I called the reception, they plainly said I got what I booked. After being *that guy* and politely explaining the ambassador “guaranteed upgrade” concept, they said that no higher categories were available. A quick check in the app proved that wrong. They said a manager would call me back. I just worked a bit in the room and called them again 30 minutes later. Again, a manager would call me back. After another 30 minutes I was done with my work, unplugged the phone and went to sleep. 

In summary, they if you are an IC ambassador member and think you should be getting what you paid for, I cannot recommend this hotel. Also, if you think your politely communicated concerns should at least be acknowledged, I also cannot recommend this hotel.

title: Nice but expensive
text:
Having never stayed in an American hotel before I have no points of comparison, however I got the impression that the Intercontinental Barclay is quite an opulent hotel with quite a history, which includes being where Ernest Hemingway finished writing For whom the Bell Tolls. There is a display by the lifts telling the story.
We had a 2 x double room for a family of four. The ‘double beds’ however were more the size of a 3/4 bed and very soft. My back ached throughout our stay but our daughters surprisingly managed to share a 3/4 bed without too many arguments.
Breakfast wasn’t included and cost a fortune at the hotel so we got up early and walked to nearby eateries for breakfast. My favourite was New York Luncheonette on E 50th two blocks away. We tried to be there by 8am and only once had to queue for a table. They served quintessential New York breakfast fare such as pancakes, bacon and maple syrup, waffles and fruit etc as well as healthier options. The staff were very welcoming. This breakfast really set us up for the day. One morning we tried Ole & Steen, a bakery which is on the corner and part of the hotel building. There was quite a long queue for danishes and coffee at the counter, and not a lot of choice of juices for the children, and finding seating was difficult. The staff here were not as pleasant and one in particular was quite rude.
The hotel gave a $25 per room per day credit in the bar as an enticement, however $25 didn’t go far at this bar so expensive were the prices, which meant we had to spend more for drinks for the four of us. Therefore we only went once.
A block south on Lexington Av is a pharmacy  where it was much cheaper to buy bottles of water etc than the minibar in the room. This was actually a tip we got from the bellboy.
We tried Toscana 49 on E 49th for dinner one evening. Booking online was easy and we were warmly welcomed, but it was slightly expensive, especially the wine. Patsy’s Pizzeria on 2nd Av was more reasonably priced and while we were there there were NYPD cops eating there which made it feel very authentic.
Grand Central Terminal is really close to the hotel giving access by subway to the whole city. 51st Station is nearer to the hotel but didn’t have as many journey options.
Times Sq and Bryant Park was within walking distance as well as Central Park.

title: A perfect Stay
text: This hotel is fantastic. From the moment i entered I was captivated by the grand lobby. The checkin was warm and friendly. The room was elegant and well appointed. My room service order was timely and the food was hot and delicious.

title: Perfectly located
text: From arrival to checkout, staff was attentive to all needs and were always there to assist. Room was exceptionally clean and well appointed for working between meetings. The Lobby bar was perfect for meeting for cocktail either before or after returning from outings. Will definitely be returning here for future visits either for business or pleasure.

title: Understated elegance.
text: An older hotel, so the rooms are smaller than newer builds, especially noticeable in the bathrooms, but this is essentially impossible to fix. But it is expected in a hotel built shortly after the First World War. That said, the experience was wonderful. With one small hiccup, the staff could not have been better, friendly and helpful without being intrusive/ The club experience, for those who are able to use it, could not have been better - great food for both breakfast and early evening munchies and  a well chosen wine selection.  Understated elegance at a first class hotel at a good price for the quality. Recommended.

title: Very expensive, rip off fees and poor rooms, service and amenities
text:
Huge queue at check in with only one person behind the desk. No real sense of urgency or anyone else trying to step in and help their colleague or customers. Surprise surprise room not ready at 3pm check in time and had to wait an hour. Room very small, dark and very noisy despite being a so called “Premium Room”. Housekeeping didn’t come until the late afternoon most days. 

Breakfast was good but never enough tables as usually half the tables hadn’t been cleared so another wait every morning. Wait staff very slow to refill coffee, clear plates etc - but still happy to add the automatic gratuity fee to your bill. 

However my biggest gripe with this hotel is the rip off “Amenity Fee” that is charged. Not sure what it’s for other than a way to print money. The whole hotel is stupidly expensive - $9 for a can of coke in the bar, $200 for 4 people to have breakfast etc. this hotel is no way good enough in terms of rooms, amenities or service for the prices it charges. Then when I checked out my bill was completely wrong and took another 40 mins to resolve. 

Had a similar experience at their hotel in Miami on a work thing in December and put that down as a one off but I guess it’s standard for their US properties so I don’t think I’ll bother again staying at any Intercontinental.

title: Chronically Understaffed
text:
Understaffed
Arrived at 11 pm AON a Monday after a 7 hour journey.  Long line at reception and the one guy they have there to check guests in had disappeared.  This isn’t the first time this has happened.   Not other check in options.  They just make guests wait.

title: A cross between 4 and 5 stars
text:
The Intercontinental  Barclay is an interesting and perplexing hotel. The way I describe it is a hotel that is confused on whether it wants to be 5 star hotel or a 4 star hotel.  Why do I say this?  To argue for 5 stars, it's a historic building in a premium Park Ave almost location. The rooms are recently renovated to a very good standard with great bedding, nice bathrooms and the hotel has beautiful common areas.  It's well staffed with the feeling of a high end Park Ave hotel.  

The reason why I say it's somewhat of a 4 star hotel is from the culture and service of the hotel.  If I stay at a Four Seasons, you get the 5 star treatment.  Customer is almost always right and they are there to make sure the experience is top class.  Of course you'll likely pay 2x or more than the Barclay. So the price of this hotel is more reflective of a 4 star hotel.  And the service is more akin to a 4 star hotel.  Less personal service. They charge a $45 amenity fee and claim you can have $25 credit per night.  I spent $54 on the buffet but then I find out the $25 can only be used until midnight the night before.  As a Platinum IHG member, I would think they would apply it to my buffet since they didn't inform me of it but they would not.  Again, this is not something I've ever experienced at a 5 star hotel.  Why fight about $25 fee that I paid for? Again this goes back to the service. The front desk attendants are more like a typical Marriott.  It's not bad it's just the culture of a 5 star hotel.  Don't expect an exclusive premium experience here.

title: This is a scam !
text: Did not receive the rooms booked and my children had to sleep on a stroller for 4 nights. On top had to negotiate for 2 hours to get at least the initial rate and as a gift I had to pay 900$ more for a service I did not book. Well done Intercontinental, you just lost a customer for live.

title: Great stay and customer service at the Barclay
text: We had a wonderful weekend at the InterContinental Barclay hotel! The room was spacious, quiet, and very comfortable. We were checked in by Gregory who ensured that we had a wonderful room and stay, and Gregory checked out us at the end. I had told him that he provided superior customer service from the start to finish of the trip! The hotel feels polished, upscale, and comfortable. I would stay at this hotel anytime in the future!

title: Engaging Elegance in the heart of NYC
text:
Over the last five years, the Barclay has become my preferred home away from home when in NYC.  Whether they're for business or a weekend getaway, the top notch team and wide range of stately rooms offer me every option I need for the occasion.  The staff always goes out of their way to make me feel like I am their most important guest each time I am there! 

The property has become one of the preeminent homes for some of New York City's major events and is often featured in television shows and movie productions.  From international conventions to the US Open and the annual gathering of the United Nations, you never know who you might be standing next to in the elevator or lively bar scene in the lobby.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: An unexpected night in NY due to canceled flight and chose the Barclay. Great value for the money. Spacious and well appointed room. Classic decor and great water pressure! The room was bigger than I expected and bathroom was more updated than expected. A perfect stay.

title: Good
text:
Great location, nice room.
Otherwise no service 
Very overpriced food and beverage, as well the minibar, plus heaps of fees and tax.
Bar charge tip without asking.
Charging of a “crazy “ amenity fee of USD 39 for each night on top of the rate, 
Plus tax certainly.

title: Good service and hotel experience and bad breakfast experience.
text: The Pillows were not very confortable. They are to high and is likethey are inflated. In general it was very good. The only complain is that breakfast is really, really overprice and really bad.BAD. Ploastic scramble eggs, minipancakes that are hard as cookies, etc.

title: Excellent as always
text: It has been awhile since my last stay, but as always the InterContinental New York Barclay is a welcome retreat. The staff was extremely nice and room was fantastic. I am looking forward to my next stay.

title: Nice weekend stay in NYC
text: We had a reservation for 2 rooms for a weekend in March to celebrate my dad's 70th birthday. We requested 2 rooms on the same floor but were given rooms 1114 (2 double beds) and 1246 (one king bed), which was a slight hassle to keep travelling back and forth between rooms on opposite ends of the hotel. The rooms had lovely bedding that was crisp and clean and all of the products given in the room had a very nice smell. All of the staff that we encountered during our stay were phenomenal, especially the bellman at the front door on Saturday and Sunday evening helped us immensely with our belongings when we were travelling home. The housekeeping staff were also exceptional, smiling and speaking to us each day. The hotel's location is also great with a couple of bakeries and Starbucks right across the street. Definitely a good option when looking for a high end stay in NYC.

title: Top!
text: Heerlijk hotel op een top locatie. Dichtbij Subway, grand centraal en wandel afstand van times square en 50th avenue. Medewerkers waren zeer vriendelijk. Standaard kamers zijn wat aan de kleine kant maar van alle gemakken voorzien. Hotel rekent wel een amenities fee per nacht aan. Maar onderdeel van die fee is onder andere dat je tegoed krijgt voor eten en drinken.

title: always a great experievce
text: due to our business travels, we are usually in this hotel two times per year and we are always very pleased with all aspects from the doorman, check in, rooms, service, food, and more.  i really enjoy this hotel... I've grown very comfortable with it, and it feels a lot like a second home than a hotel.  i plan on being back there again this fall if not the summer.

title: Third Time is Still Charming!
text: This was my third stay at the Intercontinental Barclay and I enjoyed it so much again. The staff is very accommodating and kind, the bar is great for a snack, meal or drink, The beds are incredibly comfortable, and the room was very generous in size and has good light thanks to the center courtyard. All in all, a great stay!!

title: Old World Charm
text:
Beautiful old world charm meets new world luxury. Easily walkable to Times Square and many good restaurants in the area. Service is excellent from front desk, housekeeping to concierge. Rooms are small but comfortable with luxury bedding and amenities, but are efficiently planned so desk and workstation comfortable to use. 
Breakfast buffet offers excellent selections, but overpriced. Appreciate The Parlour Bar, a trio played music on Saturday evening and the bartenders make top tier drinks.  
Would stay again.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We stayed recently on a package deal with BA. The hotel is beautiful & grand; rooms are immaculate and cleaning frequent. All staff were friendly and interested in asking about your stay. 
It was my birthday and we received cake in the room upon arrival which was a lovely welcome touch.
Usually we stay Times Square area, but enjoyed this location as wasn’t as noisy and hectic. We will return.

title: A nice hotel to stay in while enjoying a special holiday.
text: We stayed here having booked a flight holiday package and its location was pretty much central to places we wanted to visit. Orin on reception at check in was absolutely brilliant, friendly, helpful and informative.  The room was nice, although the furnishings were a little dated. We particularly like the fact the windows opened a little way so we could enjoy the crisp New York air although at night better to have them closed as the city does not ever get quiet. The bed linen was very crisp and nice and the bed extremely comfortable. There were tea and coffee making facilities although this was in a pod machine, no kettle. There was a machine supplying hot / cold water next to the ice machine which was a short walk down the corridor from our room. The housekeeping service was very good. The gym was pretty well equipped and open 24H. We ate out every day so cannot comment on the dining facilities.

title: Always a pleasure returning
text:
Fantastic location and great staff. Always a pleasure at the Barclay.
Rooms are nice and its a little quieter at night in this area which is perfect.
The do have an ambassador lounge which has great food and a wonderful staff.
Conceirge at the hotel is very good

title: Solid hotel in great location
text: Hotel was is old but still clean and charming. Staff was very friendly and the location makes you close to everything in New York. My only complaint is the location of my room was directly across from the housekeeping station, so it was a bit noisy.  If the hotel can accommodate this, I would recommend not assigning those types of rooms to travelers if other rooms are available.  All in all a great trip and I would stay again.

title: An enjoyable stay and would definitely stay again
text:
My first stay at the InterContinental Barclay having stayed in MANY of the 4 and 5 star hotels in the area over the years.  Yes the rooms are small, but that is the norm in NYC.  

Overall, the staff were wonderful.  I arrived VERY late after airline issues and did not check in until around 2 in the morning.  The clerk seemed a bit confused about Diamond breakfast at first but then wrote out the coupons.  The bellman Eric delivered our rooms and I was glad to have bell service at that hour as I was exhausted.  Eric remembered our names and spoke when on duty for the rest of our stay.  

After going to bed very late and having to be up early, I arrived at breakfast and presented the coupon.  The hostess, Kristen, as she was seating us pointed in to the breakfast buffet stating we could have anything on the cold side with our coupon or could have the hot side for an additional $10.  I pointed out that there had to be a hot option per IHG terms and conditions, and she said I could have scrambled eggs.  After being seated I went back to discuss showing her the direct wording from the IHG app.  She said she is just the messenger and I understood that, but asked her to convey that up and I would like a better answer from Management.  She waived the $10 charges for that morning while it was being researched.  I did indeed receive a call from Hotel Manager Mr. Kaiser who relayed that procedures had been changed and coupons were being reprinted to appropriately reflect that Diamond members are entitled to the full buffet.  I appreciated the follow up and quick action.  This shows the hotel is indeed in tune to its guests.

Having lounge acces through Milestone Rewards, we very much enjoyed the Club Lounge.  Staff are wonderful, a full range of selections are offered both morning and evening along with nice wines in the evening.  We very much enjoyed the lounge.

For the room itself, the only issue was the thin walls as have been referenced.  That is a function of the age of the hotel, and you find similar in similar aged hotels all over the city.  

This was a points stay, and this particular hotel does not waive the amenity fee on rewards stays.  In my personal experience, roughly 2/3 of my stays it is waived, and 1/3 not.  I do wish IHG would develop a uniform policy and waive the fee for "free" stays you have earned. 

I would stay again when I need to be in that area of the city.

title: its okay  - you get what you pay for and skip the breakfast you'll thank me
text: It is really a 3 star hotel despite what ever travel service you follow. Tiny rooms old furniture and lots and lots  of cleaning products that are overpowering in the room. Look the price is good for location and its quiet at night. The free breakfast thing from Amex didn't happen and the bill for breakfast instead was ridiculous (like $100 or so) especially as the hotel breakfast was just not good as they have a variety of not good food. The staff for us was helpful but check-in is painfully slow at peak times. seriously you get what you pay for with this one being a good location and an okay hotel

title: Beware of Amenity Fees
text:
We chose this hotel mainly because of its location and the fine reputation of Intercontinental a brand I have used extensively over many years. 
Overall it’s a very nice property, the rooms are comfortable and well appointed and I liked the retro bar-in the lobby, (Paloma on Fire is an excellent cocktail). 
However there are some big negatives. We checked in and were allocated a room on the third floor, the road noise was horrendous and thankfully we did persuade the hotel to move us after one night which they did with no problem. 
On day two I noticed that we had already been billed $500 on my credit card at check in so queried it with the front desk. They said there was a mandatory $45 per day amenities tax plus they took an extra amount to cover any potential room charges? However they did say we had a $25 per day credit that could be spent in the hotel, hence the visit to the bar to try the cocktail. 
On checking out we saw that we had still been billed well over the expected amount as the credit had not been correctly applied 
I visited guest relations who explained that the $25 per credits were not rolled over and could only be used each day, this was not what the front desk had told us on day two. Guest relations did take off one bar bill as a good will gesture. 
Basically I think the front desk team need to be made aware of what the hotel policies are and how they are applied and do a better job of explaining them to guests on check in not letting them find out when checking out. 
I suggested to guest relations that they should give each guest a card with the details inside the key card , she then gave me a printed card and said that is exactly what they should be doing. Turns out that we were not informed about other “benefits” of paying this charge either such as a 10% discount at the Danish coffee shop that we had visited on each day of our five day visit! 
In conclusion I think the fees are ridiculous particularly as the staff don’t really understand them or inform guests about them 
Corporate greed doesn’t encourage customer loyalty. 
I will now make a effort in future to avoid hotel’s charging Amenity Fees although it’s not always easy to know when these charges may apply , I would rather they just increased the room rate for the sake of clarity.

title: Wonderful Stay at the intercontinental
text: Very cozy stay at NYC. Upon checking in was greeting with an warm welcome. Was upgraded to a high floor room. Room was still very tiny considering it was an upgrade. Besides the size of the room everything else was wonderful. As diamond member we got complimentary continental breakfast. Breakfast was okay. Could use some improvement. Overall the service was great. If you’re in NYC and need a good hotel to stay in that’s close to everything. This is it.

title: Great City Hotel
text:
I stayed for one night with work and it was a fantastic experience. 

The room was clean, and comfortable and had everything you would need including a very well stocked mini bar, shaving kit , sewing kit, coffee machine, a good working iron and the the shampoo and shower gel were of decent quality. 

The Downstairs bar was great and a decent price for being in a city. 

Staff were friendly and if I was come to New York again whether it’s family or buisness then this is defiantly the place I would choose.

title: Acomodações boas, mas o pior customer service da minha vida!
text:
Infelizmente, ao realizar o check-out, tive um dos piores customer service da minha vida com a atendente de nome Kay. Durante a estadia, comprei alguns itens, como leite e cereais, para armazenar no frigobar do quarto, o que fez com que ativasse os sensores dos produtos do frigobar ao encostar neles. Quando a recepcionista imprimiu o relatório de consumo, inúmeros itens do frigobar que sequer tinham sido consumidos estavam constando. Gentilmente tentei explicar que não havia consumido nenhum daqueles itens, solicitei que imprimisse um novo relatório com as devidas correções, mas o novo relatório veio ainda contendo erros. Ao questionar novamente, a recepcionista começou a ficar rude, SUGERIU que eu tivesse consumido aqueles itens do frigobar e me encaminhou para resolver o "problema" com o seu gerente, no guichê ao lado (o gerente, acredito que de nome Christian, foi muito cordial e educado e prontamente resolveu tudo).

Agora, eu me pergunto: o serviço de limpeza esteve TODOS os nove dias de estadia na minha suíte, em nenhum dos dias foi recolhido ou reposto nenhum item do frigobar. Como poderia ter sido consumido algo?

Para finalizar, no dia seguinte (último dia de viagem), tomamos café da manhã no próprio hotel e, como já havia pago as pendências do quarto, me dirigi à recepção para realizar o pagamento do café da manhã ($110 USD). Apenas solicitei que fossem retirados os $25 USD da "Resort Amenity Fee" que tínhamos direito por dia, por acomodação (e que praticamente nem utilizamos durante a hospedagem). E, para minha surpresa, a atendente da manhã (não me recordo o nome), disse que não  faria a redução da taxa de resort porque já havíamos realizado o pagamento na noite anterior (ainda estávamos hospedados, com pleno uso do quarto). Nas palavras dela: "I am telling you, it is better to pay and leave the way it is". Realizei o pagamento para me poupar do estresse de uma nova discussão.

Esse é o tratamento que você recebe por se hospedar num hotel 5 estrelas. São situações de constrangimento como essa, que fazem com que eu nunca mais queira pisar nesse hotel na próxima viagem à Nova York, muito menos recomendá-lo a qualquer amigo ou conhecido que esteja planejando um viagem. 
Podem ter certeza: hotéis menos estrelados tratam seus hóspedes com muito mais cordialidade e educação que o Interacontinental Barclay NYC Hotel. Lamentável.

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
I'm still here as we don't leave until Friday morning. I just had to write a quick review!!

This hotel ticks every box!! Staff are great, the room is spotlessly clean, the beds are super comfortable, the pillows are amazing, the bar staff are faultless, the drinks are great....  it's an oasis of calm and comfort after a frantic day in NYC. If you are looking for a friendly and comfortable place, this is the hotel to come to. We will certainly be back. Thanks to all at the Barclay.

title: Hemingway Stayed Here; You Should Too.
text:
Like Hemingway, when we returned from Spain we needed some place to reflect on our experience and see the greatest city in the world. Some place uniquely American, yet with service and an atmosphere that was of international quality.  The Barclay is the place to do this.  

At check-in, Kay took such great care of  that we were actually a bit taken aback. Thanked for our member status, checked in quick and made to feel welcome we left the counter with a stack of discounts at local shops and a couple drink tickets--we were on our way. 

At the bar, Herman took great care of us, striking that perfect balance as a bartender: the ability to keep your drinks full, take you food order, and make you feel welcome but not overwhelmed. Sitting at the bar, it's easy to see why it's called The Gin Parlour--Papa Hemingway would be proud. It's hard not to feel like royalty there. 

At check out, Orin settled our bill and got our bags checked by the bellman so we could spend the day out on the town.  

We've stayed at a number of places in the city, trying to find our "Go-To" for weekend getaways. That search is over.

title: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location! We will be back!
text:
We really wanted to stay at this hotel and we were delighted that BA managed to book it. The hotel is exceptionally well run, and as we needed two rooms (5 of us) they moved things around so we could have two rooms that were joined. 

The housekeeping team work so hard and our room was always amazing to come back to. Lovely bathrooms and showers and the towels soft , and the beds so comfortable. The little extras says it all: a lockable safe, sewing kit, lovely smelling soaps and lotions. 

Moreover, as our flight was an evening flight we did enquire about keeping a room on for a fee. So glad we did. Would recommend the Ole and Steen coffee shop for a danish and a coffee; and search for the New York Luncheonette for breakfast. The Gourmet Deli on second avenue is great for a sandwich. 

So consequently, this hotel is glamorous and well maintained and in a great location for Times Square, Rockefeller and 5th Avenue. 

The amenity tax is a pain, BUT we had did our research before we booked and this is common place in NY so we’re content to pay. 

Well done everyone at the Intercontinental New York Barclay. Five stars from us! *****

title: Amazing team & a fun Parlour!
text:
The staff at the Intercontinental Barclay is amazing!  They went out of their way to accommodate us with directions, arranging car services, and locating items that needed to be purchased.  They even kept the bar open late so we could finish a West Coast football game that we wanted to watch!  The rooms were great - very quiet and the housekeeping staff is 100% on it - both for morning cleanings and turndown.  

I also appreciated the location, as it's walking distance from Times Square, Grand Central and the UN, but also far enough that you can catch your breath and go out for a cup of coffee and a bagel.  I highly recommend and can guarantee to Sophia Vandaele and her staff that we'll be back!

title: Very good. Great location.
text:
Although refurbished, there are signs that this hotel has had a life. A long and arduous one.

The location is excellent, off Lexington and 48th, and two blocks from Grand Central.
You can stroll up to Central Park and down to Rockefeller Plaza, the Summit, Bryant Park or over to Times Square …in minutes.

Hell’s kitchen provides the best food, and isn’t too far from the IC NY B.

The Club Intercontinental is the best option for food and drink, as the Parlour bar is good, but slow and pricey. And the staff were jovial too.

The hotel Staff were polite, professional and pleasant, even if I had my own private war with towels and bathroom roll… allocations. Laundry was a little hit and miss over the weekends, but redeemed itself.
Valet parking… could buy you a decent bottle of Barolo, at restaurant mark-up.

Great location to base yourself at.

title: Walls are thin
text: The hotel is lovely. The staff is nice. However, beware: walls are thin. My friend and I visited this hotel for the first time; however, we were awoken by a knock on the door on the second night at 1:24 a.m. The person did not identify themselves and, being females, we were not going to open the door. We immediately received a call from the front desk,  inquiring if we were okay. We quickly found out that the neighboring room had lodged a noise complaint with security. Frankly, we were shocked. We didn’t have music or the television on, and we had come back from a play and were simply talking in a room that had double beds. We had not even been drinking or laughing loudly. So, if you have children, I would suggest looking elsewhere!

title: Fabulous
text: A quiet, elegant oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the city.   Tastefully appointed and spotlessly clean from the inviting lobby bar and common areas to our comfortable room / jr. suite.   The staff were exceptional - everyone who assisted us from the doorman to the front desk to the bartender to our room attendants - so professional at all times, yet they made us feel as if they had know us for years.  Truly, it felt like home.   I can't wait to go back and can't imagine ever staying anywhere else in New York.

title: Indifferent service and hidden fees
text: As a frequent Intercontinental guest, I was dismayed by the Intercontinental New York Barclay this time around. With the exception of Orin at the front desk, service was generally indifferent and perfunctory, in stark contrast to other Intercontinental hotels. The only thing swift about this hotel are the erroneous (in the case of the mini bar) or hidden charges that are added to a guest’s bill. The latter cropped up when I found two unexpected separate line items -- USD11 each -- added to the bill because I had a single medium sized envelope delivered to me at the hotel. One would think that with a hefty daily USD 39.50 Amenity Fee on top of standard room charges, the Barclay would be able to accept an envelope sent via regular USPS without having to add on such charges. Disappointing.

title: Really great service by the concierge, Karim
text: Location, room and amenities were wonderful. The staff were very helpful and nice except for one or two who were very vitriolic. But upon our complaint a kind staff named Karim at the concierge went out of his way to help us for our inconvenience very kindly and ensured we had a wonderful experience! Thank you to Karim and the team!

title: Great Stay
text:
1. The club lounge staff were all excellent.  A pleasure to see each morning for breakfast and in the evening.  Paulette is great.  Food was great quality. 

2. Katrina M with housekeeping was very nice and kept my room in top condition.  Amenities were helpful to have. 

3. Peter at the front desk was very helpful, kind and attentive with my questions.

title: Aanrader in Manhattan!
text: Een prachtig hotel op een uitsteke de locatie, met mooie, ruime kamers en heerlijke bedden! Een topervaring, ook door de uitstekende service! We hebben een heel fijne tijd gehad, en daar had de persoonlijke service ook een grote rol in! Een aanrader!

title: Excellent service
text:
I got treated so well, Great service at the front desk.

 Karim Was very helpful in trying to make me happy.

And his manager Christian, Also made sure to check up on me to see if I was satisfied..

Great place to come and stay.

title: Honeymoon
text:
We stayed at Intercontinental Barclay from January 11th to 17th on our honeymoon.
The hotel was absolutely fantastic. Staff were super friendly and the hotel housekeepers were first class.
Room was gorgeous with the most comfortable huge bed.
We added on the club lounge, $150 per person per day. Sounds expensive but saved us a fortune.
All the staff were so helpful and couldn’t do enough for us. 
We have been to New York four times and stay at the Intercontinental Barclay every visit.
Just be aware of the extra taxes. We booked with BA with no hotel taxes included.
Highly recommend this stunning hotel and we will be back next year, guaranteed. Next time we will book hotel direct.
Thank you to all the staff who made our honeymoon so very special.

title: Your rock GM Vandaele and staff
text: My sincere apologies to GM Vandaele and her wonderful staff. My wife and I stayed last September while the UN General Assembly meetings were going on and while I wrote her thanking for a wonderful stay I forgot to write a public note thanking her and her staff for a wonderful stay, great service, great upgrade as an Ambassador Member and to complement the décor of the lobby, floors, lobby bar (right out of the movies) and just about everything else. I have in the past attended functions and even recommended the Hotel for Weddings and Receptions so know it well but it was some year since we actually stayed at the Hotel. From the Concierge who advised us where to get off because of street closings, bellmen, front desk, housekeeping ( fellow guests please remember gratuities for their hard work to keep the rooms looking spotless) to the wonderful room, our stay could not have been nicer. Right next door is Ole & Steen for delicious pastry, close by Starbucks, 3rd avenue for restaurants, and of course the Hotel itself the Parlour for fine dining. Located on the East Side, it was really easy to get around visiting family and friends and of course with the UN so close, was super easy attending various meetings. Planning a return visit this April and hoping another wonderful stay. You Rock GM Vandaele and staff!!!!

title: Not a bad option
text: We stayed in suite, which is nicely decorated and even has a fireplace, but it is only for decoration. It has a very nice and comfortable king-sized bed. The bathroom is nicely decorated and spacious. The furniture in the living room was a bit outdated. The hotel lobby and common areas need a facelift. It is stuck in the 90's. Also, they don't have an executive lounge and they don't grant you access to any club or lounge even if you pay for a suite (seems ridiculous). The location is great because you are walking distance to shopping, restaurants and sightseeing but you do need to walk a few blocks to everything (average 5-10 blocks).

title: Excellent service, hotel and location
text:
Lovely hotel in an amazing location. The front desk  and Management were excellent in making my sons 21st birthday a great experience. 
We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a much larger room for the special occasion  and we were presented with balloons, chocolates, cakes and sparkling wine on his actual birthday. Another evening we were presented with some super desserts. 
I could not fault the service provided by Karim at the front desk and Management Matthew,  Christian and Mathias. They all went above and beyond to provide outstanding service.
I would certainly visit soon again as it’s the location which was perfect, not too busy but still near all the attractions
Thank you all for doing such grand work, it was certainly appreciated and I’d definitely recommend your hotel to family and friends . Thanks again to you all as customer service was on point!

title: NYC in January 23
text: Love this hotel!  The bed is super comfortable and overall room & bathroom is spacious and clean! The hotel has classic NY charm with modern amenities.  Located in mid town East side and its quick walking distance from the Rockefeller center. Friendly staffs from receptions to concierge.

title: This is not a 4 stars hotel
text: 4 stars hotel???? The service provided by the reception desk is terrible, they are very unprofessional and rude towards guests, there are much better hotels around this area, the only 4 stars about this hotel was the price they charged.

title: Great Location and Great Staff
text: I recently came back from a short business trip and felt compelled to write a review. Firstly, it's a great location, has a great gym and reasonable sized rooms.  What did impress me though was how nice the staff were. Everyone from the doorman to the cleaners seemed to take a pride in their work and never failed to smile and wish me well. Eric in particular who was the first to greet me set the scene for my whole stay.  Very aimable, always with a smile, he lifted my and my friend's mood every time we saw him.

title: Perfect location
text:
Great hotel and staff.
Extremely comfortable room and beds decor beautiful/tasteful.
Location perfect for everything New York has to offer.
Doormen fabulous! Offering great advice on best places to eat/visit.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely hotel for our family stay over Christmas.
text: We had a wonderful 8 night stay over the Christmas period. The hotel is in a fantastic location making many places easily walkable. However despite its close proximity to the bustle that is New York, the thing we appreciated the most was the calm, warm and welcoming atmosphere that you get as soon as you walk through the doors... even down to the gorgeous scent that welcomes you as you walk in. New York can get pretty intense at Christmas but the hotel offers a 5 star service whilst still managing to make it feel like a home that you can really relax in. The mattresses on the beds are the best I’ve ever slept in, our rooms were very quiet, the housekeeping service is top notch and the hotel is very good at attention to details - welcome Christmas cupcakes, the provision of an extra fridge which was brilliant as there were 5 of us. We even came home on the 23rd to the surprise of a Christmas tree in our room. Thoroughly recommend The Barclay!

title: Average, dated, but well maintained
text: Very average for the price and segment, but ok. Rooms not tool loud, ok water pressure, good aircon and ok service. Small rooms, overall 'historic' design ok, but dated and dark nevertheless. Bathroom size very average as the whole hotel. Ridiculous prices at the bar. Will come back if there is no other choice.

title: Great location, but could do better
text:
Pros: the hotel is located near an entrance to the grand central terminal with connections to the green subway line and the midtown shuttle.
