It is in a very nice area near park avenue surrounded by beautiful skyscrapers. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the hotel itself is beautiful with a very nicely designed lobby and bar area.

Cons: We called ahead and requested early check-in and were promised the room would be ready for us at 1pm. We arrived at 1h30 and were informed that there was a problem with the computer system and that it would only be repaired at 3h00 pm (conveniently, the initial check-in time). The receptionist was very kind and offered us a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe room. When we finally got to the room, we very quickly realized that it was not turned over properly (no bath mat for the shower, stains on the pillow covers and we even found a pill in the cabinet where they store the nuts and water items for sale - Imagine if a child had found it!). We called the concierge and they sent up housekeeping who promptly came and offered to turn over the room or move us to a new room. We opted for the later, only to find out that they downgraded us back to a regular king room instead of the deluxe room we were supposed to be getting. At that point we just decided to make the most of it and did not call back. 

I was pretty disappointed although I do understand that sometimes staff does not perform their job properly and it must have been a day where housekeeping was just not up to par. I did not think however that our room upgrade would be taken away.

title: Good choice for Midtown
text: This was a very pleasant stay.  Nicely traditional hotel but modernized enough so stay is wonderful.  The room was very comfortable.  Bed a bit firm.  Bathroom small and shower pressure just so.  Common areas are nice.  Breakfast is great but too expensive at 109 for two (including all taxes and tips).  We had a deal through our credit card which made the stay reasonable with good perks extra $ 100 room credit)

title: Always enjoy the Barclay!
text: This was a return visit to the InterCon Barclay. There is more than one InterCon in New York So one has to be specific when booking with InterCon reservations.. It was as enjoyable on this visit as the past. We had a friendly greeting on check in and as members of IHG were upgraded to a very nice room. The lobby is clean and inviting with an adjacent bar. We enjoyed cocktails after the theater and found the bar tenders friendly and interested in our holiday. Our room was clean, well equipped. Amenities were nice. Bed very comfortable. The room had Keurig coffee maker which is always appreciated. There was a glitch with my folio which was corrected by telephone. This is my midtown choice.

title: Christmas in NYC
text:
We stayed during the Holiday at the Barclay with our family, 3 teenagers. From arrival until departure this hotel experience was just fantastic. The staff, always went the extra mile to make our stay and Christmas time unforgettable.
A big thank you to Angel (nicest doorman in NYC), Yuri (concierge) and Kim for keeping our rooms super clean.

THANK YOU & SEE YOU SOON!

title: Service needs to be improved
text:
Arriving at our hotel in the morning we had no complaints at all when we were advised our rooms wouldn't be ready until that afternoon at 3.
However when at 3 after heading back to the hotel after an early start and seven hour flight wanting to unpack and freshen up we were advised our rooms were not available.
We were told they would text us when the two rooms were ready and finally at 4 an hour later than check in, no text At all I had to complain before they finally found us two rooms. We couldn't have  them on the same floor but I could live with that.
There was often only one desk with someone checking in so could be really lovely long waits.
Checking out wanting to leave bag's the queue had about 20 people waiting to leave bag's and no one for over fifteen minutes even arriving.
One evening we wanted a drink in the bar and was closed by eleven.
We were made aware of the tax per room per night but told on check out no Bill provided nothing extra to pay but have transactions left and despite two emails still waiting for the invoice for one room.
The staff when finally served were friendly, and the hotel is in a good location.
Large enough bedrooms with really comfortable beds.
 I've stayed previously in lovely hotels like the Lotte, Waldorf Astoria in NY and did like this one to but they do need to drastically improve on checking in and out and bag drop off.
If this improved I would have given Max star's.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Greta hotel, Greta location and amazing staff. Thank you to Yuri for booking all our amazing restaurants and places to go. Yuri is a credit to your team. Arthur on reception was very helpful and had a great personality.

Thanks for an amazing stay.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Great location, clean rooms, and best of all kind and helpful staff. Did visit the bar which was good but did not have any meal. I did find it interesting? that some guests were able to reserve a table at the bar but did not have to give a specific time. Table sat empty the entire time we were there. 
Third time at the Barclay and am planning a return in the spring. 
Special hello to Angel !

title: Great room, solid rate, Snacks and Sodas are where they get you!
text:
This is my second time staying here and I must say, I love the hotel lobby and the rooms  and staff are top notch. Couple things to watch out for- 

1. Don't eat here- the restaurant service is slow. 
2. Room service is fast- but a waffle and two eggs with a side of bacon came to $102.00
3. DO NOT eat/ drink  their in-room snacks or sodas. The snack boxes look like they are complimentary, but the small bag of pretzels are 16 bucks and that is the cheapest of all the snack items offered in room. The Diet Cokes are 19 dollars apiece. Couldn't even imagine what they tag the beers for. They do have a small, fine print piece of paper which prices everything out, but it is easy to not see it. There are no price disclaimers on any in room items.

title: Overpriced breakfast
text:
Had a meeting downstairs at the restaurant . Had few cappuccinos .. probably the most expensive coffee I have ever had . It’s a ripoff .
Old hotel totally outdated . Will never go back.
Good location , but then agai it’s New York everywhere is a good location .

title: 歴史と伝統しか無いのだろうか。
text:
立地はとても便利です。

アーリーチェックインをしていただき非常にありがたかった。
部屋はHigh Floorにアップグレードされましたが、外の景色はビルの壁でUpgradeの価値は無かった。

部屋はバスタブ無しのシャワールーム。ホースはあったが。。
水量は弱かったし排水も悪かった。

クラブラウンジは良質でした。
IHGのリワードラウンジのアクセス権を持っていたのですが、担当が変わるその都度説明しなければならなかったので非常に面倒だった。

チェックアウト時に飲んでもいないMini Barの料金を請求されそうになった。
少しでも動かすと請求されるらしいのですが、とんでもない罠です。
説明したらキャンセルしてくれたが、事前にメールでミニバーが無料になるようなことが書いてあったような。いずれにせよ動かしたら請求は恐ろしい。

あと無料の水が置かれていなかった。

なんと言うか中途半端。
もっと安いクラスのホテルかもっと高いホテルに行った方が良い。

title: Christmas in New York
text: Service is everything… Bedrooms are important.. location is key . This hotel has everything and more. We bumped into a lovely lady in the lift who casually asked how we were enjoying our stay. Turns out she was the general manager… this takes getting customers feedback to another level. Thank you for making my 60th and Christmas very special

title: Good choice for a business or fun trip!    Having IHG and Ambassador status  helps a lot.
text:
Had a nice weekend stay and would absolutely return to this hotel for both business and fun.  

Appreciated the upgrades for my Diamond Elite & Ambassador status.  If you are an Ambassador be sure that you are given your guaranteed upgrade as I discovered upon check in that they change the names of the rooms to make it appear that they are giving you an upgrade, when in fact it can be a downgrade.  After talking to management we were able to get a great room.

If you would like to have easy food options the lounge was great!  It was rarely crowded and the food was good.  Please note that you have to purchase club access as it does not automatically come with status.

The room itself was a nice size and had some older furniture, but that is the style of the hotel.  Housekeeping did a great job and would check in with you if you wanted service.  They were great about restocking water, towels, etc.

title: Disgrace
text:
Dishonest, disorganised, disgrace. The hotel was booked months in advance and confirmed as such. Upon arrival at 530pm we were told, the rooms we needed, inc a twin for my adult children, weren’t available. When challenged that they’d overbooked and given the room away, there were no denials. My adult son had to sleep on a roll out child’s bed, for 4 days it looks like. Totally ruined his trip, a Christmas present.

I was also told, they’d message the booking agent in the day to tell them, totally unacceptable excuse I know as we were already on a plane. I didn’t believe them do asked for a copy of the correspondence. Of course, despite the assurance, nothing has been shared.,

Of course the signed were there in retrospect. I mailed the Consiege service to some restaurants reserved, I got the we’ll be in touch in 4 days reply, 10 days later still no reply!!!

It’s now 6am on day 2. The coffee machine and the phone in the room don’t work!!. We’re trying to call the hotel to get assistance using our mobile, going through the switch board, of course….nothing 

Horrendous

title: Very ordinary and extreme prices. Breakfast must be avoided
text:
Had 3 rooms books. Nothing special about our welcome or our rooms. Promised up grades, never mentioned, please avoid breakfast it’s a daily disaster. 
Having travelled the world I would never come back , shame on you embarrassing. It’s always the management

title: Wonderful hotel bar staff let it down
text: We are still here at the Barclay.  The hotel is gorgeous, reception staff excellent especially Gregory and Shena. Also Lilian in guest relations helped us beyond belief with phone issues  We booked for Christmas and our daughters 16th birthday. We were moved to a bigger room immediately after mentioning why we has come. We had chocolate mouse in the room as treat for her birthday too.  Nothing seems too much trouble at all. Our maid is Shirley and she works so hard, our room  always spotless. Our resort fees we included with BA. The New York  people from police officers to bus drivers and shop workers are so welcoming. Sadly this is more than I can say for the bar tenderness at the hotel. They are rude, cold, abrupt and miserable.  They make your feel as your an inconvenience. We waited nearly 40 minutes to be served the other evening and when I approached Muhammad Mimi.. after been looked at several times by different table waiters and being ignored and ushered away.. I thought he may serve us but he was totally aggressive and in my face telling me I'm not the only person in the hotel and to sit down and wait he is busy.. he then said he was going to check the CCTV as there was no way we would have been waiting that long!!  I was on shocked that a member of staff would speak to a guest with such aggression and annoyance as he did to me.  As nice as the young lady that managed the bar was,  I got the feeling that nothing would be done but probably not for the want of her trying im sure. We don't want anything from the hotel but we feel that this is badly letting the team down.  We have not been to the bar since.  We wouldn't normally write a review whilst still away but had to be done as such shocking behaviour. To  end on a positive note ..if the bar/lobby area for a relaxing hot or cold beverage wouldn't be something you would use then this hotel is wonderful.  We are on the 12th floor and are really pleased with everything except Muhammed Mimi and Co !! Thank you to everyone else here the bad press they may get on other reviews is not fair in our opinion

title: Fantastic hotel and brilliant locations
text:
This is our second visit to the Barclay and I cannot fault it in anyway. As we had booked with BA our resort fees were included, so this is something to consider when booking your trip. 
The staff were all friendly and polite. 
Our room was always immaculate and couldn’t fault the house maid at all. 
The hotel is central to almost everywhere. If you aren’t keen to walk, Grand Central is just around the corner. My husband and I prefer to walk so walked on average 10-15 miles so we could take in the views of this fabulous city. 
The complaints about the hotel do seem to be from people who are ‘ambassadors’ or ‘members’ of IHG, where people seem to have the opinion that it gives them entitlement, or an upgrade. I would advise to skip past those reviews as they are complaining about IHG and not the hotel. 
This hotel is fantastic and I cannot recommend it enough. It has an old feel about it but almost modern in design. 
We had our return flight home cancelled with our airline and we asked reception if we can have a late check out to the 11:00 and although the hotel was fully booked they extended our check out until 13:00 without any issues. 
Would absolutely recommend this hotel and we will definitely be returning either next year or 2024.

title: Fantastic hotel and the staff made it very special
text: I had a fantastic stay in the Intercontinental. From the minute we stepped out of the taxi Angel welcomed us so warmly and taught my 2 children how to talk New York😂. The bar staff especially Martin and the reception staff were all amazing and so good and friendly. Aisling the manager was so professional and a beautiful lady. Every staff member we encountered including rhe lovely ladies who cleaned our room were top notch. Hotel is beautiful (I would do the tree hold though instead of silver) and our room was great. We had dinner in the parlour and it was super. Best cocktails too. We will be back. Happy Christmas to all the staff x

title: Fantastic Stay
text: We had a wonderful stay at the NY Barclay.  Wonderful room, service, amenities, and all of the staff was incredibly friendly.  Location is very good and I thought the room value was terrific.  The location is convenient to everything in Midtown Manhattan.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful girls weekend at the Barclay
text:
As a Diamond Elite and IHG Ambassador, I go out of my way to find Intercontinental hotels! I generally love the bustle of these larger hotels when I'm on business or traveling with friends (as opposed to a romantic getaway). We rented two rooms and were upgraded to a connecting premium king and double room on the 4th floor — we found the rooms to be comfortable and quiet! 

With the holidays in full swing, the lobby was festively decorated and the scent of pine trees was ever-present and just wonderful!

Little hiccups here and there keep me from a 5-star rating. On three occasions, maintenance and housekeeping knocked once and just entered our room! We of course quickly remembered to close the latch on the door, so future unrequested stop-bys were thwarted. 

I have also had several issues with the bill related to the daily amenity credit, complimentary bottled water and the Ambassador night stay, but a phone representative is handling the errors with the hotel directly.

One teeny issue with cleanliness involving the previous guests' empty water bottles. An easy fix.

Still, I am due to return in a few weeks for business and will be happy to give this beautiful historic hotel another go!

title: A great seven days in New York
text:
A really good stay. Peter on reception is a real credit to the hotel and the IHG brand.
Hotel fully embraces the IHG Rewards programme and our Diamond Benefits were awarded to the full.
Room was well appointed and comfortable but the only disappointment was the walls were a bit thin and our neighbours seemed to be on a different time zone.
Continental breakfast was excellent and service great.

title: Just not quite there…
text: Having been an IHG Member for over 20 years I have had the pleasure of staying at many of the groups brands across the globe. The Intercontinental Barclay fits the premium profile, from location - accessible to everything NYC has to offer (5 mins walk to Grand Central) to the impressive lobby and facilities. We were upgraded on check in (after a gentle reminder that Diamond Elite members are due this privilege). Breakfast was included in our rate, thankfully as a cheque for $108 was presented each morning, selection was good but not worth $50+ per person. Our room (King Double corner room)  was great, no issues at all - fantastic  bed! One minor point I cannot get my head around was the regimental way the bar was closed at 11pm. NYC the party city?! Not at the Intercontinental Barclay. The waistcoated generals were wrapping that place up asap after 11pm…. No fun to be had, off to bed 🙁 would I stay again? Probably not, though far from party animals, my other half and I enjoy a drink in the bar after a days adventure, we don’t expect to be shunted to bed long before midnight, especially in a world party city.

title: A must stay at Holiday Time
text: Very well located very clean staff nice but a little impersonal no greeting on arrival or safe trip on departure but that would not deter me from coming back. Alicia the Housekeeper  so pleasant it was a delight to speak with her each morning. She told me she loved to come to work and say hello to guests.  I guess that is why I found the front desk staff a little impersonal. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC

title: Good rooms, poor service and amenities
text: Our stay at the Barclay was below expectations. The room was comfortable and well equipped and the location is very convenient but the positives end there. The customer service was dismal. Checking in we were greeted by a receptionist who was downright cold with us and made us wait even though there was nobody in line ahead of us. She assigned my partner and me to a room that was clearly meant for one person (see picture of bed attached). We were among several customers who complained and asked for a king size / larger bed leading me to believe that this is a stunt the hotel tries to pull regularly. The hotel also charges an amenities fee which they partially “refund” by giving guests $25 per day to use on hotel amenities - keep in mind that a bottle of water is already $11 and even a basic green salad from the bar is $29 once you factor in the $4 gratuity they automatically add to the check. They also charge $9 for bringing food to a room (something I’ve never heard of at any 4 let alone 5 star hotel and which gave very “cheap” vibes). The general feeling we got was that it felt like the staff were doing us a favor anytime we consulted them, often brisk and uncourteous in their manners. If you just care about room and location this hotel is perfectly fine but if a decent level of service is a key ingredient in making your stay more pleasant, definitely try something else - there’s plenty of options in Manhattan.

title: Rudest experience
text: There was no water in our room overnight- we left before 6am for our flight and upon going downstairs I requested a bottle of water from concierge, room service, or the bar (which two people were setting up at) Everyone was extremely rude. What hotel does not have water for its guests? It was not only very odd, but also the manner in which I was spoken to was unacceptable. Would NOT recommend- the service is atrocious.

title: Business & Family Trip to NYC
text: I had two trips to the Barclay in just a little over a week.  My first was on business and then a second with my family who had flew over from Northern Ireland.  The staff where truly welcoming and outstanding in every way.  A special shout out to Leslie at the Ambassador area and Yuri the concierge, in short, nothing was too much for them to do and I would like to thank them both personally - thank you.  My room was excellent with all amenities that you would expect and the housekeeping team was second-to-none.  I availed the Club Lounge which is a great space to catch up with some work of take a well earned glass of wine and nibbles at the end of the day.  The location of the hotel is ideal for all things NYC and although it was November, the weather was outstanding and was able to walk to most places and of course conduct my morning run up to and around Central Park.  The buzz around the hotel last weekend was excellent due to the large amount of runners for the first NYC marathon.  Excellent stay and will be back again.

title: Overrated
text: The hotel itself is cute but a lot of dated furniture, bathrooms, tv etc. The thermostat also did not seem to work in our room. The hotel charges $35 a night for amenities but doesn’t really have any aside from a fitness area.  Overpriced and overrated.

title: Amazing hotel, staff and location
text:
We stayed for a few days at the Intercontinental Barclay and had a great experience. 
The hotel met all our expectations and more. we stayed for 5 nights and had 2 rooms booked (one queen size and one with 2 twin beds)
The rooms are large and spacious (in comparison to other NYC hotels). It has an excellent location just minutes from Times Square, Moma and 5th Avenue.
Everything was wonderful, starting with the greetings at reception, the room decoration with personalized welcome note and treats from the general manager .
Rooms were spotless, beds were excellent, and comfortable. 
Staff are very friendly and always smiling. Everyone was outstanding! From the moment we checked in to checking out; with every person in between from housekeeping staff to concierge, everyone was so kind, professional, and courteous.
I had a wonderful stay  and will definitely return next time I'm in New York. The staff at this hotel really make your stay that much better! Highly recommended

title: New York New York
text:
The door staff are very efficient and friendly. Checking in was a quick process, I was informed we would receive $25 credit per day to spend at the hotel upon check-in, we ate at the hotel on the first day and ordered room service on a separate day but didn't receive the credit on the invoice and also forgot to ask for it. 
The room was spacious and clean. I think the walls are a little thin (you can hear your neighbours). 
Location is great, you can walk to all the big attractions.
I had read about the amenity (tax) charge on checkout so had been expecting it but I agree with many of the reviews, it's a little pricey. 
I have 3 stars as I'm lucky to have stayed in many lovely hotels and although this hotel is nice there's nothing outstanding about it. 
I'm not sure if I would stay here again....I think I would want a little more for what we paid but overall a good experience.

title: Ik kom snel terug …
text:
Schitterend hotel centraal gelegen in Manhattan. Dicht bij Grand Central en de metro. Super vriendelijk personeel die jou een gevoel geven van ‘thuis komen’ na een vermoeiende dag NYC. Toppers daar! 
Kamer was zeer net, gezellige bar en lekker ontbijt. 
Ik kijk nu al uit naar mijn volgende verblijf daar 👌🏻🍏🇺🇸!

title: Beware of reception staff
text:
Reception staff rude, unhelpful gave no information about room, sensor mini bar, so charged automatically - beware! Hotel tax charged at end of stay not warned about! 
Rooms small but clean one positive.

title: Fantastic location and beautiful rooms
text:
We loved staying here!  It is in the perfect location in midtown.  Close to everything.  We walked to 1 Vanderbilt, Grand Central, Fifth Avenue shopping, Moma, 30 Rock, and even walked through the park all the way to The Met.  
We usually stay at The Carlyle but had our daughter with us and needed a room with two beds.  The rooms were lovely and sooooo quiet.  I rarely bother to leave reviews but this is worth the effort if you want a prime location with great rooms and lovely staff.

title: Failed to credit free breakfast and double billed us after we left
text: Review your credit card statements after you get home. I found this hotel to be dishonest in its billing. While checking out, they failed to credit us for free breakfast for Diamond elite members, and charged us for 2 breakfast. When we pointed it out, the front desk staff pretended to not know that this was a Diamond elite benefit. The refunded the breakfast to us after 15 minutes. Then, after returning home, I found another surprise - a duplicate charge of close to $150 this time. I doubt this backhanded behavior is an isolated incident because during breakfast, the family at the other table was arguing with the manager that they handed downgraded the free breakfast to cold items only - they had stayed a few months ago, when hot items were included. I travel to relax. Overall, this was a not relaxing experience and not a comfortable place to stay.

title: A very good choice in Manhattan
text: When a team goes an extra mile to provide a suitable room to it’s guest, when even in the biggest crowds in front of the reception all the staff stays calm, professional and kind, that’s Intercontinental Barclay. Thank you to Mr. Matthias Kaiser, Ms. Jacqueline Oda and Mr. Karim from reception for taking care of my stay. Compared to Intercontinental Times Square - you made us feel welcome - and we look forward coming back again.

title: Check the additional charges...
text:
Stayed for 10 days at this hotel, is in a central location, close to Times Square and the Grand Central Staton so easy enough to travel anywhere from here. We stayed here previously and had no hesitation rebooking. The hotel itself is large but quiet, we had no issues or problems with noise from within or outside of the hotel. The rooms were of a generous size with large walk-in shower in the bathroom, in-room safe and tea/coffee making machine. The daily maid service was excellent, and our room always maintained and cleaned to a high standard.

Our only confusion this time we stayed was the room/city tax as we were charged but our friends were not and we travelled with British Airways and booked together so we are investigating that currently, might be worth checking as you check in if staying here.

title: Not a luxurious hotel
text: We were looking forward to staying at a luxurious hotel. However, the hotel did not meet up to its star rating standards. When we checked in we were told that although we already paid for our rooms, there is an additional resort fee of $40 per night. Also, they will be charging another $40 for requesting a double bed instead of a king. The front desk clerk stated it’s  because they are fully occupied, so to honor our request, we need to pay more. So, thinking the resort fee includes all amenities. We did not get go use the amenities. For example, it is supposed to include wifi,. The only area with wifi was lobby area. There was no signal near our room. There were no coffee for the keurig machine in the room. The safe was inoperable because it was out of battery. The mattresses was firm but had a slight indentation. The room was small and thermostat only has heat mode or fan. We ended up sleeping with our windows open, but the hotel is near a construction site a block away, so it was extremely noisy and was awaken many times through the night. Overall, we were disappointed with our stay.

title: さすがバークレー
text:
本来のインターコンチ。設えの重厚感、サービスレベル良いです。
朝食も美味しい。客室は狭いがセンスが良い。
難点は１つ。せっかくの素晴らしいロビーでエチケットを知らない連中が時々。一番ひどいのはロビーのエレガントな椅子に家族で腰かけて外で買ってきたハンバーガーをパクパク(笑)
誰も注意しないのはいかがなものかと。
ニューヨークも多くのホテルに泊まりましたが、ここが一番かな。

title: Makes me question IHG-loyalty
text:
We stayed here for one night before flying out of JFK and unfortunately left a bit disappointed. As a platinum member I used my rewards points to stay here, but that was also pretty much everything that membership could be used for (but I did get a chocolate and note in my room).  

To take the positives first, location is of course great and being refurbished in 2016 the rooms are also quite delicate. Common areas are also nice, clean and classy. Other than that though I'm not impressed given it's general price point and what you would expect from an Intercontinental hotel.

It even started before our stay as I sent an e-mail to the hotel with a question before our arrival, and after about a week without answer I had to send a reminder for them to reply. It's disappointing enough that a hotel like this feels they need four working days to reply to e-mails (as per their auto reply), but when they can't even deliver on that, it's not good enough.

I also tried to enquire about an early check-in for at least one of our rooms, but no luck. When we arrived the request had not even been recorded. Pretty much all IHG-rewards benefits are now "based on availability" which means that the feeling is that most hotel staff rather don't bother to go the extra mile anymore and hide behind this. Given it is the policy though, I can of course not expect that such a request will be granted, but I'm quite sure that one of 700 rooms was ready before 3PM sharp, so my mother and my 4 year old didn't have to wait in the lobby for 2 hours while my wife and I were delivering our rental car. When I came back to check-in I also found our luggage standing unattended outside the luggage room, with PC's and everything else up for grabs if anyone had wanted to. My mom neither had received any ticket/confirmation of the baggage being registered, so when claiming it we just had to point it out (and they didn't do anything to check that we were actually the owners).  

Check-in itself was quick, but with no possibility of upgrades given membership status or any acknowledgement of being a member. I did however notice that they added had attached information about an amenity fee to our stay (without informing me during check-in), even though my confirmation states that all taxes and fees were included. This is a dodgy way of doing business which unfortunately has spread like a plague through IHG-properties (but also in general in the US hotel business). 

The rooms were as mentioned quite nice, but on my shower just before check-out I realized that both shower heads a major black areas. I didn't have time to look thoroughly, but suspect they haven't been cleaned properly in a while and either dirt or mold has been able to "settle".

At the day of check-out I again tried to use one of my "benefits" and asked for late check out on at least one of the rooms, but where promptly brushed off due to the hotel being fully booked. Now, having extensive hotel background myself, also as a general manager, I know that it's of course not possible to clean all rooms at the same time anyway. This "policy" has therefore a tendency of just adding a pile-up of checkouts at the same time, which was just what happened here. Queues in the lobby were constant and the hotel was not properly staffed to manage this, leading to long wait times.  

All in all I'm very glad I didn't pay full price here. I really looked forward to my stay here, but instead it has made me seriously consider if IHG is the chain I want to stay loyal to, with so many alternatives out there. Many of the staff members I talked to were nice, but there was also too many that reflected what I feel IHG is becoming now, a chain where policies and procedures minimizing hotel effort is more important than the customer.

title: Great stay
text: Room nice and very clean. Staff really helpful and room service good.  We were bit worried as the price seem too good to believe - but really good value. Location suited us - in the center, but not as crazy as Times Square. Would stay again.

title: Classic, Well-run Intercontinental, in a very convenient spot of Manhattan.
text:
We had a lovely 3 night stay at the Barclay Intercontinental.  It is my favorite type of hotel - old world charm with an outstanding staff who know how to provide intelligent hospitality.  We stayed for three nights and originally were given a classic room with a king-sized bed on a high floor.  The room had a bit of a view, but only a bit.  It was well appointed with a nice dresser (my new pet peeve is the growing trend of hotels not providing any drawers so you can take your clothes out of your suitcase and put them away properly,)  a comfortable bed wjth great bed linens, and a large, well-appointed bathroom.  

We had a small, but fairly annoying problem with our room.  A couple of times an hour a high-pitched squealing would emanate from the bathroom.  We supposed it was a dried out gasket somewhere.  The hotel initially tried to come up and fix it, but couldn’t.  They offered to switch our room, but I was able to negotiate our way into a one-bedroom suite for an extra $100 per night, which I thought was a suitable and more exciting solution.  The suite was lovely, had great views and was very comfortable for the remaining two nights.  

Every staff member we dealt with was very friendly, competent and genuine.  The hotel is located on 48th St between Park & Lexington Avenues.  Most things were within a 30 minute walk.  We walked to the west side and two different theaters in about 20 minutes.  The blocks are well-trafficked and about as safe as any blocks in NYC.

We had a terrific stay here and expect we will be repeat guests in the near future.

title: Disappointe
text: Disappointed to find pure service specially at the breakfast restaurant that is actually at the lobby. You need to wait until someone will get up. Pressure from the staff to eat in a hurry. Lobby is crowded. Not lighting in a proper way. Old furnitures

title: Superb
text: This was our second stay here, it was busy compared to our last visit but that was  due to the US Open. A great hotel and location.  Our room was lovely, bed comfy and the hotel is very clean everywhere.  Staff are efficient especially the young man who served us in the bar, unfortunately we didn’t get his name.  The hotel does add the amenity fee but ensure you use in in either in the bar/restaurant or for laundry. The previous week we’d stayed in  hotel in San Francisco where the fee was much higher and I don’t think you could use it against the bar etc but they justified it by saying they supplied filtered water stations and a gym!  If we got back to NY we’d defined  stay at the Barclay again

title: Classic Hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text: What a great stay.  We enjoyed the room, the view, and the excellent service in the Club Lounge.  Although the hotel was busy because of the US Open we felt welcomed and really enjoyed our visit.  The location is perfect for walking to restaurants, shopping, and the park.

title: Super stay
text: We stayed at this nice hotel for 5 days early June 2022 to celebrate my birthday with my husband. The room was elegant and comfortable.  We would like to especially thank the Reservations Manager, Michael Gabriel for arranging this incl. access to the Club Lounge. Every day we had the pleasure of super service from the Club Manager Paulette Hope. The food and beverages were excellent ;breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and canapes.  We would love to come back in the near future.

title: Amenity fee charge
text:
The hotel debits authomatically 50$ per person  indipendently you consume or not  beverage or food  from minibar or breakfast meal!!! Indicated as amenity fee!
That are extra ameninity fee sales tax and amenity fee city tax
Position is good !

title: Wonderful hotel and nice staff
text:
We loved our family stay (8 adults and 3 children) at the Barclay's.... Convenient,  elegant,  clean and great amenities in the actual hotel.
Check in went super well and even accommodated some early check-in by Anna Marie.... Great staff help on the floor as well.. Especially Tsering (try to stay in section 9a where she works!)

title: One step below the usual high standards of  Intercontinental
text:
1.  Keys repeatedly didn’t work, and no, we didn’t expose them to any devices that could have caused it. This happened repeatedly to several different people in our group over several days.  2. We had rooms on the 10th floor (1057 and 1058)  which were plagued by periodic whistling sounds like those produced by a boiling teapot. All thorough the night.  Off and on.  Off and then on again.  3.  Our rooms came with a breakfast buffet included but it was rather modest..again, nothing like we enjoyed at previous stays at other Intercontinental hotels.  4.  The remote control for the tv didn’t work very well…maybe just old batteries?   

On the plus side, service was excellent. Staff were responsive and pleasant.   Also, there was a nice free chocolate candy bar!

We have stayed in Intercontinental hotels before and we’re always pleased with quality and service. This one was a cut below what we expected.

title: Perfect stay!
text: We booked 1 night in this hotel having had a negative experience at a nearby hotel and we wanted to end our holiday on a high. We explained this to Shena at Reception who treated us to a room upgrade and goodies as Diamond Elite Ambassador members to ensure we had a positive stay. Shena was very friendly and helpful and we chatted with her for ages! The room was lovely - it was quiet, the bed was very comfortable and the slippers were like walking on pillows. We were given a lovely box of chocolates and breakfast which had a huge variety on offer and was served until 11am (great for a lie in). The bar staff were also very friendly and gave us recommendations for how to spend our limited time in New York. The hotel was within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square and subway stations. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel is in a great location. As you enter you will be bowled over by the foyer.  The Hotel struggles to recognise Ambassador and Diamond Elite  Members but after a few prompts   and reminders  they just about get there.

The hotel is spotlessly clean both in the common areas   and in the bedrooms.

At Checkin, despite contacting the Hotel in advance, none of our requests had been noted despite emailing the Hotel in advance.

Despite our status our room was not noticeably upgraded. Nice furniture but no desk to work from.

Breakfast is a strong point for the Hotel. Great choice and friendly staff.

To return to the Hotel , I would want IHG Status and Ambassador Status to be recognised. I couldn't do any more   than contact the Hotel prior to arrival.

title: Good Hotel Except for the additional Charges on Checking Out
text: Good Hotel we were there for six days for a family wedding.  Room was good and spacious house keeping was great.  The hotel is close to everything Midtown has to offer.  However a few things not so good the charge in the hotel for two cups of tea was $30 which is ridiculous the guy even charged $3.50 tip for what pouring water on  a tea bag.  Also there were the additional charges on checkout which accumulated to around $40 per day for all types of additional taxes.  Unfortunately my husband paid the bill or I would have refused to pay which can only be described as a Resort Tax which is just a hotel tax it does not benefit the government in any way therefore I would have queried it and asked for it to be removed from the bill but I didn't realize we had paid it until we returned back to the UK .  However I will be contacting them and requesting a refund. I would recommend this hotel but would not eat or drink in here as there are lots of local places to eat which do excellent food at a fraction of the cost of this hotel i.e., the New York  Luncheonette is wonderful for breakfast just a small stroll to 135 E 50th Street and the tea is only $2.75 a cup? and free refills on Coffee too.  This Hotel is a good base to go site seeing for Times Square, Grand Central Station etc., we found taxis to be good and reasonable as well.

title: July  visit
text:
We had a wonderful 3 day trip at the Barclay. We booked the hotel through VISA for its midtown location, perks ( breakfast etc), and pricing.  It was our first trip back in 3 years to NYC. Check in was efficient with Orin who also gave us the Visa welcome letter. The rooms were clean and spacious for NYC standards at the Premier level. There was  a welcome fruit bowl and waters Air con was quiet and efficient in the July heat . Bathrooms were clean with good water pressure in the shower and toilet. Beds were very comfortable and the blackout curtains appreciated for good sleep with minimal street or hall noise. Wifi nominally fast for a most applications.
Buffet breakfast was fresh, delicious and varied by the day. Hot items with eggs, sausages, egg whites as well as yogurts, oatmeal, fresh berries and fruit, pastries and cereal. There was bottomless coffee  - thank you to Xazi and Mir for attentive service.
There was daily room cleaning and towels .
Hotel was quieter than some midtown given its East location but 15- 20 minute walk to Times Square  and Broadway shows or 15 min to Bloomingdales or 5- 10 min to 5th avenue
Peter was professional and polite during checkout and corrected some erroneous charges on the bill to my satisfaction.
We would definitely return to the Barclay if needing a NYC Midtown hotel  with charm, wonderful breakfast and professional service.

title: Great stay!
text:
We had a comfortable stay at the Intercontinental Hotel NY Barclay. 

The hotel is a walk away from the Grand Central Station. An Ole & Steen Lagkagehuset cafe is right next to it; and there are many restaurants and bars in the area.

The room is clean and the beddings are soft and comfortable. The shower has good water pressure. The wifi is fast.

NB special mention to front desk staff Shauna - keep up the fantastic work!

title: Excellent hotel for our 4 night stay in New York
text: Excellent hotel very clean beautiful room and bathroom. Bar prices on the high side but worth it for the service and ambiance.  We loved Angel the doorman he took great care of us addressing us by our names whenever he saw us. He recommended a great restaurant The Seafire Grill and walked us there just one block away. All in all an excellent 4 night break in an excellent hotel that was central to the places we wanted to see.

title: Fourth of July weekend
text: Hotel is excellent, beautiful rooms, excellent staff. Room service is on time. Location is superb and provides easy access around Manhattan. But most of all, Bartender Alam is the very best! Stop by and see him.

title: 5 star service I will be back
text:
We came here for family vacation and we had quite the great experience! Sharon C at the front desk was so polite and he me hotel hospitality was wonderful! I I loved the location it’s in the middle
Of everything! Room was nice and a good size as well! Food pretty standard and good for hotel food ! I will be coming back to stay at this luxury hotel ! What a great experience

title: A lovely hotel in midtown
text: Overall this was a great hotel. Well positioned, spotlessly clean and comfortable. My only slight negatives were the description that toiletries provided (one tiny shampoo and body wash for three people for the day is not enough) and the two doubles are small and so fitting three/four in the room was a squash. So take your toilet bag and be prepared to cuddle up and you’ll be fine.

title: Yerson Hidalgo, intercontinental's Bellman
text:
Quiero felicitar la buena predisposición y la amabilidad del señor Yerson Hidalgo, bellman del hotel intercontinental.
No duden en consultar por el ante cualquier problema con compras o envios al hotel

title: Great Mid-Town Stay without the Tourist Crowd
text: Great experience.  Absolutely beautiful hotel with old world charm and sophistication.  Rooms are quire spacious for a NYC hotel with incredibly comfortable beds (and pillows!). Service is prompt, professional, and courteous.  Location in mid-town is outstanding (i.e., easy access to major sites) without too many tourist crowds.  We selected this hotel due to a very favorable similar experience in the past.  We will return again for sure.  Thank you.

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text: Hotel is modern, clean and comfy. We used it as our base while we explored the city and the bed is so comfy! Bathroom is also modern and the shower is bliss! Location is great, walking distance for the subways is literally around the corner. To say we were in the middle of NYC the soundproofing on the windows is great, didn’t hear any of the sirens or typical city noise.

title: What an experience!
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights.  Prices are not cheap, but you get a lot in return.  The check in was fast.  Our room was on the 12th floor and it was spacious enough, for being in New York.  The room had all modern comfort and bath room was also spacious.  We got welcomed with a personal note, Belgian chocolate, candy and Belgian Beer.  We encountered a problem with the safe and they came almost immediately to fix it.

The breakfast is not cheap either, but the food was amazing. A lot of healthy choices were available.  There was also choice in warm and cold dishes.

If you had a question or you needed something, they helped us out, if not immediately, they informed when.  

The staff is wonderful and therefore we would like to thank them for the great stay we had in this hotel.

The location is also very convenient.  You are at walking distance of Rockefeller Plaza, Fifth Avenue, Central Park and Times Square.

title: amenities fee not mentioned at check-in and a surprise!
text:
As IHG gold members, we stayed at the Barclay on points for 4 nights. Immediately afterwards, we stayed at the Wharf Intercontinental in DC on points for 2 nights. So a 6-day trip. Quite a difference in tax approach!

The amenities fee at the Barclay was not mentioned when we checked in and so was an unpleasant surprise at check out: Four nights' worth of amenities fee plus sales tax on the fee, oh and city tax on the fee! ($40 per day) Googling does not explain much. 

DC has plenty of taxes and is not the cheapest city either, however the Wharf charged me nothing (again stayed on points) other than the breakfast we ordered + sales tax which I signed off on before leaving the breakfast room.

Very different experience.

title: Over Payment of Bill and still not Rectified
text: We stayed here in January and when we were checking out we told the receptionist that they were overcharging us. We were told that the money would be refunded back into our account. When we realized the money had not gone back in we contacted the hotel on numerous occasions through email and phone calls. There was a different excuse each time and some times we were told we weren't due money back. Eventually they sent back some money but have still left us hundreds of Euro short. 5 months later and still fighting our case. Would not recommend anyone to stay here unless you want to get overcharged and not get it back. This was supposed to be a special trip for a 40th birthday and it was ruined.

title: Very good but beware of bill when checking out!
text: I found the hotel very good, my room on the 8th floor was superb, everything I needed. Location wise the hotel was great too, short walks to Rockafeller, Times Square, Central Park, etc. Staff seemed pleasant, but, as my title says, beware of bill when checking out. The hotel charges a daily Ametity fee, to which they give a $25 credit against food and beverage, well they say they do. I purposely rounded up my daily F&B bills to $5 and when I came to check out no discounts were applied and I was told the charge was after the credit, which once I challenged I was immediately refunded $100 for my 4 day stay, but with no apology whatsoever. It was my only fault with the hotel, but that alone would mean I would never return :(

title: Good hotel. Maybe a bit crowded.  Food obscenely overpriced
text:
Stayed for 4 nights around 10 days ago, as part of one of my regular US business trips. Decision to stay here is mainly location-driven because is located 2 mins walk from the NY offices of the company I work for.  Just because of this, it is convenient to me.

Hotel is quite good, very nice in fact, nice room, ok size for NY standards, clean, well equipped, very good wifi, great bed allowing very good sleep.  I really have nothing but positives around the room.  Staff is quite attentive and friendly, but hotel is really big, you see lots of people all the time in the lobby, bar, checking in and out, that it feels like a factory.....zero personalised attention.   Even staff in the front door seem to be more concerned about the tips they get from guests and car drivers than to serve the client. However, nothing of this bothered me.

The one thing I found really excessive was the price of the food, mainly around room service.  If you consider the food, service charge, gratuity and delivery charge, having a salad and one coke in your room can cost you around $80, what is really excessive. I'm not sure which is the strategy here, but they should definitely adjust this, because it doesn't make any sense. You pay fine-dining prices for standard room service.

In summary good stay, nice hotel, will return on coming business trips later in the year.....but definitely not eat in my room/order room service.

title: Incredible Staff and we weren’t even staying there this time!
text:
A big shout out to the hiring managers here because they have top-shelf staff throughout the hotel.
We went to visit the bar as it is one of our favorite places to relax with a drink.
We first interacted with Yerson Hidalgo, the bellman on duty last night. He greeted us like old friends and made us as welcome as we could be. Nothing but smiles and a wonderful conversation with Yerson. Next we met Sharon C.  at the front desk who answered a few of our questions regarding a future stay at the hotel and again, was more than happy to speak with us, smile and laugh with us as we made our way to the bar.
The third and final staff member we dealt with was the bartender Alfredo. He made our drinks to order while engaging in wonderful conversation. He had great recommendations, including a dinner suggestion of “Mimi’s” for delicious Italian food. He told us he has gone there and even recommended some dishes. Once again, the Intercontinental shows why it is among the best of NYC. The only reason we didn’t stay there was because we had a few free nights at another brand-name hotel chain (that wasn’t half as nice or fun as the Intercontinental).
See you next visit…we promise.
Joel & Rosalie of Boston, MA and Delray Beach, FL

title: Very disappointed
text:
I very rarely write reviews, but I was so disappointed in my l experience that I’m was compelled to share my thoughts on this hotel and the management. I’m not sure how this hotel receives more then 3 stars because it’s an old hotel with a musty smell and arrogant managers. The rooms are very small and the bathrooms are tiny. The service is very slow and if you try to call the front desk it’s takes quite a while to get an employee on the phone. 

When I checked into the hotel, I asked for an upgrade and was told by a manager that it would cost $150.00 per night. It seemed reasonable, but given that we were only staying for two nights I decided against it. When we arrived to our room, it had a very musty smell and lacked some of the basic items such as towels. I went to the front desk and spoke with the same manager and he agreed to find a different room. Several hours later, we switched to a new room, which wreaked of smoke. I immediately went to the front desk spoke with the same manager who insinuated that I was just trying to get an upgrade, and even suggested that I should find a new hotel. I travel quite frequently, and  I’ve never been so insulted by a manager in my entire life. This sums up the lack of customer service at this hotel.

title: Location e tranquillità
text:
Ottima location, a 5 minuti da Grand Central e 5 minuti da Fifth Avenue.
Hotel appena rinnovato, letto comodissimo e stanza insonorizzata.
Non do l’eccellenza per l’assenza di cordialità della reception mentre buono il servizio ristorante e concierge.

title: Beautiful hotel in a wonderful location
text: This hotel is fabulous and in a great location. the rooms are spotless and the staff(most) are very helpful and kind. I would rate this a 5 star but a couple of things let this down. You get charged $200 dollars for tax and use of facilities that are seemingly deducted at $25 per day. A minature of gin is over that amount in the minibar. The receptionist upgraded us straightaway after telling me I had booked the smallest room, in  front of my daughter. It was for her 21st so not the nicest welcome and a little upsetting. Paying over £2k for a long weekend then being slated was not that nice and a bit snide. The bar staff were amazing. Helpful and friendly. I think that maybe New Yorkers have  different sense of humour but rudeness should not be the go to response. Saying that, this hotel is beautiful.

title: Highly Recommended.
text: Great location, minutes from a subway station and an easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and Empire State Building. Good local restaurants on 2nd Ave. All staff we encountered were helpful and pleasant but housekeeping especially so. Twin room was an acceptable size, typical of a city centre.

title: Hotel without proper management
text: Nobody cares about customer service. Got a terrible check in experience. General Manager was unresponsive. All staff was defensive. Extremely disappointing stay overall. Very noisy. The only good aspect was cleanliness. Next time will anoid this property.

title: Great place to stay in New York
text: Really helpful and polite staff. In particular, we had a lot of help from Michael and Yuri, the concierge staff, who organised several things for us, including a Broadway show, a Helicopter trip and a tour of the United Nations Building; and some great restaurants! The hotel was very clean and the staff all  went out of their way to help. We didn't eat at the hotel, but did visit the bar and, contrary to another recent review on here, we found the bar staff very well informed and professional. we would definitely recommend it.

title: Great location, great food, great staff, EXCELLENT Hotel
text:
We stayed here based on a recommendation and I am so glad we took the advice. 

It was my 5th trip to New York and I have stayed downtown, along with Times Square. This was streets ahead. 

The location is perfect for anything you need to be doing in New York and the hotel itself is stunning. About a year before the pandemic, the whole place was refurbished, so it all felt like new. The rooms were lovely and it was all very comfortable. 

The breakfast is a help yourself buffet but is of very good quality. Also, the bar is always vibrant and busy and the bar staff are amazing. A big shout out to Herman and Jose who are lovely blokes and made our stay even more enjoyable. 

Thank you Nee York Barclay. We WILL be back

title: Over priced bad service
text:
One towel was placed in the bathroom on the second day instead of two.

I asked for an old fashioned at the bar that was very far from being an old fashioned. Basically it was a very strong jack daniels with a slice of orange.

Ordered buffalo wings to the room that I wouldn’t feed to a dog. Disgusting and expensive.

title: Wonderful stay in a lovely hotel
text: The service at the Barclay was exceptional. Check-in was welcoming. Michael, who brought our bags to our room was so helpful, hanging our coats for us and placing our suitcases on the folding racks. After a long flight and a long ride from the airport, it felt good to be able to relax right away. We are not breakfast eaters, so did not eat at the restaurant, but did get coffee and danish a few mornings at Ole & Steen downstairs. We did enjoy a cocktail at the bar on a couple of nights and dessert one evening and used the resort fee credit. The room was lovely and very clean. The bathroom was spacious and had a make-up mirror. No street noise on the fifth floor, though I did hear the neighbors speaking from time-to-time. The hotel is in a good location mid-town, near Grand Central Station, which is worth a visit, and some good restaurants. We were without dinner plans one evening and the concierge recommended Toscana 49 near the hotel and made a reservation for us. We enjoyed our meal there. Getting a cab was easy, either by using the Curb app or asking the doorman to hail one for us. Because that part of mid-town is mostly office buildings, our room had a view of one across the service alley, but that was not important to us as we were gone all day and in bed early.

title: Amazing Service and Team
text:
Always a great experience Every time I stay with them.

Great rooms, location, great customer service and nice food.

They are also pet friendly with great concierge and management on site. 

Anything you need within a phone call away to the front desk.

title: Muito boa mas pode melhorar
text:
Hotel excelente funcionários muito resolutivos dispostos a te ajudar na experiência 
O restaurante é excelente apesar de pouca variedade de comida 
 Mas a limpeza do quarto deixa a desejar, camas demorando a trocar de lençol e muita poeira não retirada

title: à éviter en ce moment
text:
C’est la troisième fois que je descends dans cet hôtel et je dois dire que j’ai cette fois été vraiment déçu.
Tout avait bien commencé, à mon arrivée la chambre était prête et sans avoir rien demandé j'ai été upgradé dans une corner room au 15ème étage.
Hélas en ce moment l’hôtel est entouré de chantiers importants. Les chambres qui sont sur la 49ème sont face au chantier du Waldorf et ma chambre était juste au dessus du stop des camions qui enlèvent les gravats et amènent les matériaux. Un défilé de camions non stop et du bruit en permanence avec les travaux dès 5h du matin !!
J’ai dès la seconde nuit demandé à changer de chambre, pour être sur la 48ème et surtout pas en bord de rue mais à l’intérieur du batiment qui est en forme de H. Je recommande à ce sujet les chambres qui se terminent par 02, 03 et 04 qui sont plus silencieuses. Ce n’est bien entendu pas la faute de l’hôtel, mais ils devraient prévenir leurs clients qu’en ce moment, il y a de gros chantiers à proximité immédiate.
Sont hélas venus ensuite d’autres problèmes. A mon arrivée on m’annonce que j’aurai accès au Lounge qui rouvre dans quelques jours.
Le jour venu on me refuse l’entrée au Lounge et lorsque je me renseigne à la réception on me dit, sans s’excuser, que la personne a fait une erreur à mon arrivée et qu’en fait je n’y ai pas accès car il faut soit prendre une chambre Club, soit être Royal Ambassador. J’explique alors qu’avant de réserver j’ai pris la peine d’appeler IHG pour qu’on me précise quel niveau de chambre je devais prendre pour avoir accès au Lounge et qu’on m’avait répondu qu’étant Platinum Elite Ambassador il suffisait que je réserve une executive room pour avoir accès au Lounge, ce que j’ai fait. 
J’explique également que sur le site d'IHG, je ne vois pas le niveau royal et qu’il n’y a que le niveau club, et 4 niveaux Elite (Argent, Or, Platine et Diamant).
Tout ce que j’ai pu obtenir, c’est une réduction du prix de l’accès au Lounge parce que j’avais déjà payé l’amenity fee qui du coup ne servait plus.
L'entretien pose également problème, je joins les photos des vitres de ma chambre,  très sales, qui sont restées ainsi pendant tout mon séjour (7 nuits)
Lorsque j’ai quitté l’hôtel, on m’a fourni une facture que j’ai immédiatement acquittée. Deux jours après, je constate que le débit sur ma carte est supérieur, l’hôtel ayant soumis un nouveau prélèvement sans m’en informer. 
Pour finir, je constate sur mon compte IHG qu’aucun point n’est crédité, que soit disant ce serait un séjour qui ne me permet pas d’acquérir de points alors que je l’ai réservé par l’interface d’IHG et que ma confirmation de réservation fait même apparaitre l’estimation des points gagnés avec ce séjour. 
En résumé, le seul point positif de cet hôtel reste la gentillesse d’une grande partie du personnel, notamment ceux du Parlour et du Lounge, mais l’hôtel est à éviter en ce moment en raison des nombreux chantiers qui l’entourent, de l'évidente désorganisation de l’équipe de la réception et de la dégradation du niveau de service qui en découle.
J’ai fait plusieurs Intercontinental (Carlton à Cannes, Clement à Monterey, Dublin, San Francisco, etc..). Le Barclay n’est clairement plus au niveau Intercontinental pour le moment.

title: Hotel bonito y bien situado
text:
hotel muy bueno, trato agradable, no podéis perderos las tardes de Jazz en su bar
su lobby es precioso hotel con mucha vida. 
acogedor y muy cosmopolita, adecuado a la ciudad donde descansa  
en tiempos antiguos fue un referente como hotel

title: Excellent hotel.
text:
Excellent hotel in a great location.
Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Staff were brilliant too. Highly recommended for a family break.
Never had the breakfast etc as we had so many places planned to eat however it looked decent.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Customer Service / Miguel Vasquez
text:
We stayed at this hotel back in February 2022 ( I'm a little late in doing this), and I wanted to highlight what a fantastic hotel this is, but also what exceptional customer service we received
Our 5 day visit did not get off to the best of starts, unfortunately we fell victim to non licence taxi driver inside JFK airport, The fact the male was outside arrivals we thought nothing of it, but looking back now the way he drove to our airport, it should have made me think alarm bells. For information this was a black SUV plate number D30 LFM New Jersey. Please don't do  what we did, yellow cab depending on traffic and time of day, $65-80 dollars no more! Anyway, when we arrived at hotel my other half was upset that effectively we had been robbed, and I was just ANGRY. This is where we met Miguel Vasquez, what a guy. He quickly changed things around very quickly, with his empathy, and the fact he wanted to ensure our stay was going to be a good one. Long story short, the guys on reception with the help of Miguel, up graded our room, and waived the resort fee ( Which we did not know about) so be prepared to pay. Throughout our stay we were treated like royalty. Hotel is fantastic, right in the heart of Manhattan, short walk from Grand Central. All staff were pleasant, and told us tips and best places to see in New York, please ask them!! We will be back here in 2023, but Miguel you made our stay and you are a credit to the hotel.

title: Lovely stay
text: We were slightly trepidatious about staying giving a few recent negative reviews but we were very happy with the stay . I couldn’t fault the hotel on anything to be honest . Yes, I suppose it is quite expensive for drinks etc . However, it’s no worse than London and we are talking the Center of Manhattan here . Staff were excellent and very friendly and helpful particularly Leslie on the ambassador desk. I was worried due to the stereotype about New Yorkers being rude and unfriendly but I found the stereotype to be unfounded .  Housekeeping was particularly good with excellent attention to detail . I will definitely stay again . Oh final point - the location is perfect in mid town and right next to a Green number 6 subway line

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent housekeeping, other service practical but not engaging.
text:
Just completed a 9 night stay from UK.

The hotel is truly beautiful - an homage to 1920's luxury, and the decor theme is continued both in public spaces and the rooms. 

Our room - very comfortable beds, the size of the room was good, comfortable for a 9 night stay. Well appointed bathroom ( shallow bath but fine size ( tho I am small!). Plenty of sockets, and an excellent tea/coffee maker.

Staff - housekeeping, absolutely, totally outstanding! We had several different people but each one cleaned the room beautifully, and provided ample tea/coffee/ sugar sachets and towels for 3 guests.
Each time we walked in the room after our day trips, felt like a whole new stay!

Rest of staff - at best, practical but not congenial, at worst ( bar/breakfast) a little rude. I bought a cup of tea on room credit at 7:30ish am from bar and was treated quite poorly. When I commented on the 9.50 dollar charge ( plus added gratuity!)for a paper cup of tea ( as opposed to 4.50 dollar charge for coffee) I was met by a rude shrug of the shoulders.
No food/tea coffee service before 7am or after 11 am till  evening. Poor, as an early morning, afternoon tea would be nice in the lounge 

Amenity charge - saw many, many complain about this ( especially the 25 dollars credit at the bar being eaten up by tax and gratuity). We ourselves bought one tiny coke/diet coke in bottles each day at bar.This came to 21.06 dollars ( including gratuity and tax!).

We had of course counted in the amenity charge, but really don't rely on making use of the 25 dollar credit - hard work!

Overall we would definitely stay again - but we'd be aware the service is more business orientated than luxury leisure.

A nice touch - a card and chocolate bar from the manager left in our room.

With special thanks again to your outstanding housekeeping team!

title: Disappointed
text:
We are currently staying here. We have visited and stayed at many NYC hotels over the years,  but for this trip it was a special occasion as it was for my daughters 16th birthday as well as my birthday, and we wanted something really special. I chose the Barclay based off of their impressive website and positive reviews. About a week before we arrived, my husband called and requested a room with a nice view, preferably of the Chrysler building. “No problem” he was told. So to our unhappiness we checked into a room yesterday that looked straight into an office building. After speaking to a manger we were told that they were booked for the night , but would move us today to something f wifh a nicer view. After a long day out, we came back, picked up our new room key and now have a room looking across to other rooms in the hotel. It might actually be a worse view than before! 
The room itself is very nice and well furnished. Beds are comfortable. As part of the $40 a day facility fee you are given a $25 daily credit to use. So last night we selected two cans of soda from the mini bar for $9 each, PLUS a 20% “restocking fee”. A bit outrageous even for New York. The other thing that I found odd is that I’ve never stayed at a five star hotel before that had  Dove brand soaps and body wash. Not at all what I would expect from a hotel at this level! 
I just was very excited to stay here and feel a little let down. I realize they can’t guarantee a specific view, but considering that we booked a premier room for five nights and made a special request in advance, I had hopes for something much better than what we got. If you want a luxury hotel with a nice room and the view isn’t important, then you should be happy here.

title: Hoped for better
text: This hotel is certainly well located, but overall it’s a bit of a disappointment. For three of us, we had a room with two double beds. At least, that’s how they were described. They were a bit small. They were too soft too. The food options are limited right now. Breakfast is available but it’s expensive. Another reviewer has described this hotel as “three star hotel with four star prices”. That’s an apt description. Staff were friendly and helpful, but this is not a hotel which I’d book again.

title: Lovely Hotel Spoiled by Rip Off fees
text:
A nice hotel in a good location but really disappointed to see they are just trying to “milk” customers with add in fees:
#1 - A non negotiable $35/night “Amenity” fee added. I don’t like this practice at places like Vegas but at least there it’s charged for pools etc. here there aren’t  really any amenitys and it’s just an added charge so they can present rooms at a lower price on comparison sites. Yes you get $20 of drinks but I’m in New York I don’t really want to be eating / drinking at the hotel.
#2 - On top of this Amenity fee for decent speed internet they want another $22/night - fast woof isn’t covered in the Amenity fee it’s extra.

I book these nice hotels for service levels and expect a high level of amenities and service as a standard not to be told there are a load of extra fees when I arrive.

Intercontinental please just increase your room prices by 35/night and get rid of this stupid daily fee we want to know what we are paying when we book.

Spoiled what would have been a really nice experience by annoying me  which is a shame it’s a nice hotel.

title: Please be aware of “amenity charge” before booking
text:
Firstly the positives; physically this is a lovely hotel, conveniently located. Very clean with good sized bedrooms, walk in shower and large comfortable bed. Unfortunately our room had no view to speak of. 

Now for the “amenity charge”. This hotel charges an amenity fee of  $35 a night (plus tax) which unless you scan the small print on website could come as a surprise. On checking in we were advised that, as unbelievable as it sounds, this covers WiFi (what 4/5* hotel charges for WiFi?) and $25 that could be used against cost of breakfast or drinks at the bar. Unfortunately, given the cost of drinks at the bar, this wouldn’t have covered the ice let alone a drink!!! However, if you don’t use it each day you loose it - absolutely disgusting.

Unlike every other hotel of this standard, there was no turndown service, chocolates etc. In fact there wasn’t even a bottle of water provided in the room but then why would the hotel provide water when they can charge guests $12 a bottle??? 

Intercontinental management please can you confirm what the amenity fee covers as you have no amenities? After check out we learned that we could have used the $25 this against the mini bar yet no mention of this by the receptionist on check in??? We really feel as though you have treated us as cash cows and interestingly every single person checking out in front of us raised the same concern and queried exactly what they received  in exchange for $40 a day.

We also feel the need to compliment the hotel on employing the most miserable, unhelpful receptionist we have ever encountered. This was particularly evident on check out when there was no longer any incentive to be pleasant to guests coupled with constant queries regarding the amenity fee.

In summary, we left extremely disappointed by our experience at this hotel. Needless to say we won’t be back and will be recommending that family and friends avoid this hotel !!

As an aside, if your looking for excellent quality breakfast/brunch with amazing customer service check out the brassiere across the road.

title: Well rounded hotel
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of March start of April
Hotel was clean and comfortable
Staff on site were friendly and helpful with any queries or recommendations for local restaurants.

Had a kingsize room with en suite. Bed was comfortable.
Bathroom was provided with toiletries, hairdryer etc 
Upon arrival we was asked to pay a deposit of $160 - this was not mentioned in our booking or on the website. The lady on the desk didn't explain very well what this was for so we asked someone else later. The deposit was against the room so we could charge services against it including drinks or food from the restaurant. When checking out you then have the remainder returned to your account which will take a few days. Just a note - the hotel does not have luggage scales to weigh suitcases.

Hotel is well located. 10minute walk to times square
5 minutes for shopping at 5th avenue and approximately 25 minutes to central park. Will look to stay here again if visiting the city

title: 3 star hotel, 4 star prices
text:
I am writing from the perspective of a Spire (top level) IHG member. I spend 50+ nights a year at IHG properties and have stayed at the Barclay 2x before Covid.  I will not be returning to the Barclay again. 

My 4 night stay in March 2022 was by far the most disappointing stay in a hotel over the past year.

- Booked the highest category room (Barclay King) were dismayed to find holes in the headboard from a previous guest’s nails or teeth

- 700 room hotel, yet not a single bar or restaurant open during the middle of the day to have a drink or snack? Really, a 4* property, come on…
This resulted in guests bringing fast food (think whole pizzas, buckets of chicken) in the hotel lobby to consume.  

- Sent away for laundry, wild goose chase involving multiple phone calls ensued as I tried to locate my laundry ahead of having to get to the opera in time for the curtain 

- Only ever a single reception desk working, despite consistently  very long queues (took 20 min to check out)

- Hotel bill completely wrong on check out.  Front desk looked exasperated. 

- Hotel does not upgrade IHG Ambassador members to suites as a matter of policy (fine), opted instead to offer my 10,000 points which I had to chase them for afterwards by email 

- service generally sloppy and anaemic (eg wrong drink delivered at breakfast, pointing this out got a huff rather than an apology)

Won’t be coming back.  So many other options in NYC at this price point.

title: Simply not good enough when charging $500 per night.
text:
Stayed here recently and to cut a long story short my simple advice as someone who loves hotels is to avoid at all costs.

You are treated like a cash cow--ridiculous bar prices, crazy taxation, breakfast is. complete rip off and as others have mentioned if you want a drink during the night there is no water put in the rooms so you have to use the mini bar where a bottle of water is something like 20 bucks??!!!

It really is a poor poor effort at trying to get as muh cash as possible out of the guests--perhaps if they put as much effort into guest service they might be a little better--I very much doubt it??!!

title: Faltou avisar que 460 quartos seriam bloqueados para a convenção!!
text: Hotel bom mas não para passeio.  Custo benefício não compensou. Fiquei no Intercontinental em março para uma semana de férias em NY para descobrir que o hotel estava recebendo uma convenção e todos os dias o lobby estava abarrotado de gente, elevadores indisponíveis, restaurante lotado para o café da manhã. E não, eles não avisaram e nem se preocuparam em se desculpar.

title: Great … will do it again definitely
text:
To be honest … The location is amazing … Rooms are clean … Room Rates are reasonable… 

Beside that Ruchi Sura “ Front office Manager“ was always there for anyone who had any questions … 

I’ll definitely be back … Thank you Ruchi … i wish i can give you more than 5 stars…

title: Clean, central hotel.  Would recommend
text: Very central hotel , great for exploring NY    Bedrooms are spacious and well equipped.  Very clean and well maintained hotel.     Hotel staff are brilliant, so helpful and knowledgable.   Dont be scare to ask for help for restaurants in your price range

title: Theft! Avoid
text:
Terrible experience A valuable piece of jewellery went missing during my stay Realised it was gone after I left the hotel to join a cruise Contacted the hotel numerous times by message , e mail and directly by phone to be told over and over again that housekeeping and security had been informed but nothing had been found in the room 
Returned to the UK very upset and contacted both the hotel and NYPD who advised me to file a police report with the hotel After contacting the hotel yet again and advising them of this the item suddenly turned up !!! This was 2 weeks after my initial call to report it and constant daily  e mails and calls to the hotel 
I am very grateful to have the item back but there is still the question of how the item went missing , who found it and what was done with it ?? Again after numerous e mails the hotel are now ignoring my messages This includes the hotel manager , head of security and head of housekeeping 
Other smaller items went missing too and if you look back in other reviews mine is not an isolated case Avoid at all costs literally!

title: Disastrous Hotel - avoid at all cost
text:
At the beginning of my stay, I thought this hotel was clean and comfortable. Service was very average since beginning.

Then I noticed dirty robe and towels on the floor were put back on the hanger instead of replaced. And worse when I raised the matter manager, he/she did not follow up on this.

Breakfast costs 52 dollars and is very average. 

There is no complimentary water in the room. There are small evian bottle that cost $12 and are not even replaced each day if you drink them. This means for a few days I did not have water to drink in my room. And when I called Concierge for water at 5h30pm I was told mini bar is closed now so I need to pay $12 + the room service ($7.5) if I want water.

I am at middle of my stay so might have other bad surprises. We will see. I have now been waiting in front of the manager office for 20min now and she did not really mind to make me wait for so long (no-one was in front of me). Will see for how much longer I have to wait.

title: Midtown in March
text:
Huge thank you to the staff at Intercontinental NYC Barclay for first class service - very helpful, friendly and courteous. Lovely  room on 9th floor with a particular vote of thanks to Tserin for super service throughout the week. 
Really enjoyed my stay and looking forward to returning to this hotel on my next visit to NYC.

title: Perfect hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text:
Stayed here for an impromptu trip to manhattan. One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at in a major city. 

The location was perfect in Manhattan, very close to an accessible subway stop that could take me anywhere in the city. The hotel itself was clean, service excellent, and beautiful lobby. The bathroom was also very clean! The neighborhood was quiet and safe and felt safe walking home from the subway 

Had a very cute danish bakery right below the hotel! 

I would like to stay again if I come to Manhattan. The bell hop even let us keep luggage at the hotel even after we checked out because we had a late flight.

title: Fantastic stay
text: This property was lovely, and the staff were very nice. I was upgraded upon check-in, and the room was well appointed. I would not hesitate to stay here again. The bathroom was also very nice and updated.

title: large rooms, helpful staff
text:
we first had a room where someone had eaten asian dishes, the smell was very present and there were pieces of feed on the floor, so we asked to be moved rooms, which was done swiftly . the new room was very clean, as was the bathroom.
towels were changed each day and the rooms have been cleaned each day.
the staff was helpful to helps us find a restaurant, and to take care of sending postcards on the day of our departure.

a nice hotel, situated on 48 street, not far from midtown attractions and shops

title: Well worth the wait
text: We are currently staying at the Intercontinental Barclay in a Deluxe Double Double. It is well equipped and spacious enough for our family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Housekeeping do an amazing job, they have been in everyday so far to change the bed linen and restock the mini bar. We where due to visit last year however Covid put a stop to that, however I am so glad we eventually made it! The hotel itself is beautiful, tastefully decorated throughout, and the staff are all so helpful and friendly (especially Shauna who arranged for a kettle to be sent to my room as I am a keen tea drinker). The bar is very welcoming and the perfect place to enjoy a cocktail in the evening.
