The hotel is ideally located a little outside Times Square so it avoids all the associated bright  lights and noise. Overall I would highly recommend staying here, it’s for sure going to be our hotel of choice for future trips to NY.

title: A Lovely Stay
text: Midtown hotel, close to transportation; taxis readily available. Well maintained, lovely classic 1920's luxury hotel built by the Vanderbilts. Not for the budget conscious. Very quiet (those thick walled pre WW II buildings are a delight). Up to date bathroom facilities. Very clean. Staff helpful, accommodating. Concierge on site. Remember that this is a city hotel in the middle of an overbuilt area - rooms are not large, but perfectly comfortable.

title: Average 4 Star Hotel
text:
Very disappointed for the level of this Intercontinental,  this  Is not a 5 star hotel from my point ov view.

Staff are very nice and friendly, great location if you need to stay in midtown area.

Rooms nice and clean but small, is not ‘business friendly’ if you need to work.

Bathroom has only one hook to place the towels/bathrobe so if you are in 2 person you cannot hang other towels/bathrobe. 
Shower pressure is very low. Shower gel by DOVE in a 5 star hotel?

Since the 1st day where glasses on the floor just outside the room and they removed only after 2 days,  this is very dangerous if someone accidentally fall down and for especially for kids. 

The minibar was not cleaned properly as I found previous guest items.

$200 extra charge for ‘no sense’amenities ,do include a $25 daily Food & Beverage credit, complimentary WIFI (IS COMPLIMENTARY IN ANY HOTEL ON THE PLANET, so why underline this?), $15 laundry credit per stay and a Bloomingdales discount (that you can have it anyway even if you-are not at the IC)  If I want to use an amenities I pay for it! You can use the ‘credit’ (that you pay) only once a day and is not combinable. 

There not a bottle of water in the room or any welcome amenity for IHG Members, you need to pay $12 for a small bottle of water in the room minibar, or you can use the credit that they will add to your bill as amenities…..no comment!

Room service has 23% surcharge plus $7.50 for the delivery.

$200 for early checkout, this is another ‘rule’ that has no sense.

Poor security, during my stay I was at the bar and a women enter in the lobby and start to yell to an employee (looks like they know each-other) for 10 minutes! No one came out from security to take a proper action. this is not acceptable!

This is not a 5 star property, is a 4 star.

IHG Platinum Elite Member

title: a little distant from the hustle bustle but walking distance.
text: the hotel is centrally located, like a 10 minute walk from times square so its a little away from the main hustle areas but close too. 5th avenue is a 4 minute walk from the property. the hotel rooms are pretty good and decent enough size for Manhattan area. the staff is very courteous and accommodative and willing to help.

title: Loved the heated bathroom floor!
text:
Stayed here for five days and four nights close to New Year last December. We stayed at a Deluxe Room and even though we conditioned ourselves that rooms in NYC are small, we were pleasantly surprised that it was not that small. We were actually able to move around the room even with four large luggage around.

Another pleasant surprise was the heated bathroom floor. Lovely thought especially during the winter. It's one of those things you didn't know you need until you've tried it. The lobby is grand and it's quite central to all the places we had planned to visit (Fifth Ave, St. Patrick, Central Park, etc)

We arrived before 12pm and our room was already ready. The women at the front desk were all nice and friendly. To those who are saying that they're surprised with the amenity fee, it's shown in the IHG app prior to booking that there's a $45 amenity fee, so it was not a surprise to us.

Overall, it was a great stay and my parents (it was their first time in New York) was impressed.

title: Amazing holiday, amazing hotel
text:
We have just returned home from New York. We stayed 4 nights at the Intercontinental Barclay.
What an absolutely stunning hotel, the lobby is beautiful, and gave a great first impression. Staff at check in were polite and helpful, actually all the staff we encountered were.
Our room, was lovely, tastefully decorated with a huge bed (so big, I didn’t have to nudge my husband over to his side once!)
Absolutely spotless, House keeping were superb, fresh towels, bathrobe and toiletries every day, they really looked after us.
The location is brilliant, everything is within easy walking distance, grand central station, 5th Ave, Park Ave, the Diamond district and Time Square.
The doormen were always there for advice, directions or getting you a cab, and always done with a smile!
Lovely coffee, breakfast, pastries, just on the corner which was delicious too.
Well done Everyone at the Intercontinental Barclay, you made our holiday, just that little bit more special.

title: Great service
text: Thank you Ruchi for welcoming my husband and myself to stay in loving suit #1441, you definitely out did yourself and Jeremy Kahn for your hospitality for delicious bottle of champagne. We are greatly appreciated to well relaxed mini gateway that was much needed. Thank you again.

title: Got scammed by the Hotel.
text:
Stayed there 5 nights in December 2021. My overall stay was ok: rooms and service weren´t great but location made the Barclay quite central.

However, despite the fact that I had prepaid the whole reservation (USD 2000) since October 2021, the Hotel charged the whole amount again when we left. 

What's worse: the Hotel now refuses to refund the money despite their error and blames the travel agency, while the travel agency blames the hotel. In conclusion: ended up paying USD 4000 for a mediocre stay at a mediocre hotel. To add insult to injury no one from IHG has contacted me or answered my requests or even offered an apology for this horrible experience.

Total scam, don't stay here.

title: A solid 4 stars. Great location.
text:
The property underwent a very extensive renovation.
The rooms are clean and well appointed.
The shower pressure is not up to par and very low.
The style is classic and the common areas are welcoming.
The staff is a ht-and-miss-, some very kind and some with an attitude.
Stay away from the concierge it is a bona-fide rip off on any of the 'suggestions" given. Beware.
The value is very good.
Housekeeping is the problem. starting at around 9 am, the roam the floors loudly knocking at doors with an ever louder "HOUSEKEEPING" scream!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Visited here January 22 for our wedding . The hotel was clean and immaculate and we were looked after really well especially by customer service who gave us gifts because we were getting married . Our room was clean and a decent size and was serviced well each day . All the staff we came across we friendly and helpful and the bar area is nice . The hotel is in a good location and within five minutes walk of fifth avenue . I would highly recommend a visit here and thank them again

title: Excellent hotel
text: I stayed here with my fiancée to get married in New York between 3-8 Jan 2022. The moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome and had a decent room on the 15th floor. You are given a resort card for discounts which was applied on leaving . Our room was quiet and clean and on the days it was serviced the room was cleaned well . The guest relations were fantastic and Jennifer from there really looked after us as we were getting married. The bar in the lobby is nice and so is the atmosphere. The hotel feels safe and the surrounding area has plenty of bars and restaurants . It’s only about a five minute walk to fifth avenue. We had a perfect stay and I cannot thank the hotel enough for making our stay perfect. I would highly recommend using this hotel.

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel!!!
text: I've been staying here for about 20 years and it's my favorite property that is conveniently located near Rockefeller Center and all the upscale/flagship departments stores e.g., Bloomingdale's, Saks 5th Ave. and Bergdorf Goodman.  The last comprehensive remodeling/renovation occurred between 2014 and 2016.  The hotel reopened in 2016, more beautiful than ever with a grand signature staircase/chandelier in the lobby.  Even the marble bathroom floors are heated which is a welcome addition during the winter months.  Their breakfast buffet is the best one that I've ever had in all of my 40+ years of traveling.  The breakfast buffet offerings vary but one time they had a truffle quiche that was out of this world.  You can also order omelettes of your choice with the buffet.  The staff is very personable and aim to please.  They always remember me which makes me feel valued as a longtime/frequent guest.  Just want to acknowledge some of the great staff members whose names I know, Annmara, Leslie, Gregory & Sharon but they're many, many more whose names I don't know.  Always look forward to returning to this my home away from home in Manhattan!

title: Beware Hidden Charges Scam
text:
This hotel is in a great location in midtown Manhattan. The staff are nice, and it’s 1920s Manhattan chic. However, I was charged $494 on check out for services I did not use. They called it “amenity fees” for things like discounts at department stores and laundry. They also did not detail this on the booking or on check in and offer no way of opting out. 

It ruined our trip to New York and I will never return. I’m also alarmed that a reputable hotelier like IHG think this acceptable. This is something I’d expect in the third world, not the US. They should be ashamed of themselves.

title: Staff that stunned me with their kindness.
text: I've just returned from a truly wonderful Christmas spent at the Intercontinental Barclay. I was travelling with my Mum, aged 82, who has a lot of mobility issues and when I say that the staff couldn't have gone out of their way to make us feel more welcome, I'm not exaggerating. From the moment we arrived, Michael at the front door was straight over to Mum, welcoming her, chatting to her and even escorting her to a chair while I checked in for us both. Every day thereafter, Michael would bounce over to us and greet us like old friends, which was so lovely. Then there was the fabulous Sharon at check in, who upgraded my room (thank you, Sharon!) and who made sure that every tiny little detail was perfect for Mum. Sharon, you were extraordinary and this hotel are lucky to have wonderful staff like you and Michael. Thank you also to Julie at the Parlour bar for her warmth - not to mention the fabulous food. We had a fantastic Christmas break and will most definitely see you all again in 2022!

title: Terrible experience
text:
Day 1. Curly hair from a hair piece of previous occupant found under bedside table.
Day 2. Handed ‘clean’ towels by cleaner with blood on!! 
Day 3. Nighttime - dog starts barking madly in the room next door. Dog had been left alone which is against the hotel policy. Eventually after 4 phone calls and an hour, the owners return. Hotel says we will have to move rooms not the people with the dog who violated hotel policy!!! 
We had booked a QUIET room and I have disabilities but now we have to move. 
Very hard to speak to anyone on the phone. Hard to get room service. So many problems I’m upset we left the Westin to move here thinking it was a better hotel. 
Stay at the Westin or anywhere else!!

title: A haven in NYC
text:
Well. Where do I start…
This hotel is a haven in the middle of the city that never sleeps. We stayed in room 1530. I had emailed ahead to request a quiet room on a high floor along with a walk in shower, both requests were realised. The lobby is impressive, the hotel bar very well stocked with wonderful staff. The welcome was warm, efficient and excellent. From start to finish every, single member of staff (big shout out to our Housekeeper, Delia who deserves a Christmas bonus!). I wouldn’t hesitate to return to this holiday haven, the beds were comfortable, pillows delightful and linen soft. The shower gives a really good pressured shower. There is no down side to this hotel. The doorman arranged a cab to take us back to JFK, no hassle at all. Fantastic! Check out was clear, no hidden surprises. I would do anything for a pre-dinner Malibu and Pineapple juice with ice from the bar again….
I miss you Intercontinental Barclay NYC!

title: Great location
text: The hotel provides a quite room allowing a good nights sleep – vital in New York, this along with a great mid town location, make this our default choice when staying in Manhattan. A short walk to 5th Avenue, Lexington, Central Park and Times Square.

title: Didn’t refund my money
text: The hotel charged my credit card for a stay that i payed for in advance I contacted the hotel and was told that they will refund the amount and it was the accountant mistake   since Dec 6 till today they did not ,

title: Glad to return to NYC
text:
1st time staying at this hotel. 
Check in late as our flight was late, 1st impressions were I love it.
Next day noticed a few stains on the carpets and then noticed £1000 taken off credit card. Spoke to front desk who said it’s a blanket in case we use mini bar/ restaurant etc 
At this time of the year £100 per night (we here 10 nights) is very steep and we were not told this at check in - the reception blamed British airways for not telling us - we had already paid the service charge before arrival.
On a positive the bed was very comfortable.
On a negative we had 2 Stella’s at the bar & all I’m saying is they were smaller than pints and the most expensive pints I’ve ever had.

Central location. Nice decor. Bring own conditioner as it is difficult to get out the conditioner provided!

title: Kein Service, komische Fees, viel zu teuer, schwache Coronamassnahmen
text: 2 Tage in NYC, daher haben wir uns für ein Hotel in zentraler Lage entschieden. Diese Lage erfüllt das Hotel auf jeden Fall. Ich bin keiner der sehr schnell schlecht beurteilt, aber hier muss es wirklich sein. Als wir im Hotel ankamen (gegen 17 Uhr) war fast kein Personal am Check-in, keiner half mit den Koffern. Als wir dann einchecken konnten, hiess es nur, ah auf Punkte, here is your room... Das war es. Kein Hallo, kein Erklären, keine Wertschätzung... Dann zahlt man einen Amenityfee von 40 USD, das beinhaltet dann Internet (das ich mit Status kostenfrei hätte) und 25 USD Food and Beverage Credit. Jetzt kommt es, dieser muss am gleichen Tag bis Mitternacht genutzt werden. Fürs Frühstück kann man diesen gar nicht nutzen und das kostet mit Tax USD 52,-- Das ist einfach nur frech. Haben wir auch nicht genutzt, da jeder Bagel in NY besser ist. Zimmer war super klein, das Bad dafür schön (endlich mal eine Dusche und nicht eine Badewann mit Duschvorhang und Dusche). Was mich aber am meisten gestört hat, Leute laufen ohne Maske rum, das Personal sag NICHTS, obwohl überall steht only with mask. Im Zimmer hat man nicht das Gefühl, dass viel Wert auf Desinfektion gelegt wird, auch gibt es keine Desinfektionstücher wie in anderen Hotels. Einer der Aufzüge war kaputt, daher dränten sich viele Menschen in den Aufzug. Sorry, wir sind mitten in einer Pandemie, mit kleinen Sachen kann hier das Hotel einen grossen Unterschied machen. Einmal mehr bin ich glücklich, von IHG zu Marriott gewechselt zu haben, denn das Service, der Status und die Hygiene empfinde ich bei diesen Hotels wesentlich besser. Und das ist keine Werbung sondern eine Erfahrung der letzten 2 Jahre. Fazit: Lage super. Aber der Rest ist meiner Meinung nach kein 5-Sterne-Standard.

title: 3 out of 5 raring - some customer service needs working on
text: Hotel very central couldn’t fault, the doorman provided excellent service, bar staff couldn’t fault. Rooms were a reasonable size, however when we arrived to when we left the bedside tables had not been cleaned as I could of wrote my name in the dust. One of the days our room had been made up  but no tea, coffee, sugar or milk had been restocked so had to chase to send some up. We wasn’t flying home until 11pm so we asked if we could have a late check out which they provided an extra hour, so we had the room until 12.30 noon. so later that day we went back to the reception desk to ask how much it would cost to buy an extra day where we were met by a very unhelpful receptionist where they were just not interested and didn’t want to know. They did advised it would cost between 500-600 dollars which we would of been happy to pay but because of the attitude we got from the receptionist we decided not to spend any more money at this hotel. Unfortunately some of the reception staff let this hotel down .

title: Thieves….Stay Away…. Awful Management
text:
Awful experience!
Come to this establishment and be robbed.
My Wife’s wedding band and engagement rings both stolen from our room.
General Manager unable to appear…Customer Relations Gabriel Nogueira, comes out with such poor manners and lack of knowledge… only repeats “ we already filed a claim with insurance”… said it four times!
Chief of Security, Robert Jenks, able to be approached over the phone; unable to appear today when I flew across country to discuss this matter.
UNPROFESSIONAL, on all accounts.
We have filed a theft police report at 17th and midtown north NYPD both great, and extremely helpful handling it.
Stay away from this thieves nest!
Unreal, dishonest, and unprofessional management and obviously hotel staff.

title: Below average stay in NYC
text:
Terrible check in experience, inattentive front desk assistant when checked in, the rooms weren’t ready for early check in and thats alright, but there was supposed to be a good attitude when dealing with customers instead of just telling me to leave and come back at 3pm like I was there begging for a room, and not explaining what was Im going to be charged. 

The hotel was always crouded and the resort fee is useless, actually there shouldn’t be one, I used to take some drinks that a two stat hotel would offer complimentary, just because I  knew I payed for them in advance. They claim they offer wifi, but come on for $400 a night wifi should be free! And they give you 10% of bloomingdales. Bloomingdales would offer you 10% discount  if you put your email in their website and get it directly, so you can do better intercontinental!

Location is great only two of blocks away from the 5th, this is the ONLY advantage of this hotel!

2 Double beds rooms where very very cramped, they would barely fit 2 comfortably, if you’re more there just won’t be enough space for all of you.

House keeping by the last nights of my stay didn’t even bother to put shampoos and soaps, I had to ask for more.

For its expensive price, I would definitely not consider staying there again it certainly doesn’t worth it.

title: Affordable old style NYC luxury hotel
text:
For years we stayed at The Essex House on Central Park South, mainly because it was always reliable, convenient and a luxury brand. Since JWMarriott took over it has steadily disappointed on all levels...Hence, we took a bold move and tried the InterContinental Barclay and every aspect of our stay was wonderful.
The hotel is nicely situated within walking distance to the Broadway shows, RCMH, Rockefeller Center, GCT.   This is a totally renovated property that echoes the grand days of hotel experiences of old NY.  The lobby is just beautiful, with a lively bar at night and a very nice breakfast buffet and lots of cozy nooks to sit down and enjoy the peaceful bustle of NYC life.  The rooms are a nice size, (we booked 3 rooms, each about the same size) and the furnishings are of a very high quality. The marble and tiled bathrooms also spacious.  Remarkably clean. Spotlessly clean as if no one had ever even stayed in the rooms.  The entire property was stunningly spotless.
So if you are tired of paying the unearthly high rates at the Central Park properties, InterContinental Barclay delivers so much more for so much less.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Absolutely amazing hotel! Couldn’t fault
It, don’t listen to the bad reviews! Maids cleaned our rooms throughly every day, we were given new towels, and constantly topped every thing up! Beautiful bar too!

title: Very, very poor service delivery - and I’ve only checked in so far!!!
text:
We have just checked in, but thus far the experience has been very underwhelming. 

We are here on honeymoon, as well as it being our first wedding anniversary - cheers covid!   The hotel were aware but made no mention of. Now I don’t expect room upgrades, petals or anything else - but what we basically had was 

“name? Can I see Id.  Credit card - This is your room key” all barked at me  - and that was it - a very poor show by the man on the desk - I made a note of his name but won’t state on here. 

Not even a hi! Or enjoy your stay - the poorest example of customer service delivery yet - let’s hope the rest of my experience here is somewhat better!

title: Consistently comfortable......
text:
This was our third visit to the Intercontinental Barclay since the renovations a few years ago. The impressive and stunning lobby is the perfect start to the Barclay experience. Enhanced by the pretty Christmas Tree.
As regular visitors to New York we were desperate to get back after nearly two years iff being bale to get there due too COVID, we chose the city and this hotel to celebrate a birthday and it was a good choice. New York at Christmas time is magical and the Intercontinental Barclay just made it perfect.
We arrived early and greeted by Sharon on the front desk who was a joy. She greeted us and completely exceeded our expectations. The room had been changed from a Queen to a King (Thanks to our Spire membership level) and we really appreciated her efforts to make the stay special. 
The room was cozy and immaculately clean and well maintained. A lovely fitted bathroom filled with fluffy towels and a very comfortable peaceful room.
We enjoyed drinks in the lobby bar (The parlour) and used our $25 NYC Amenity credit a day there while we watched people come and go in the busy impressive lobby. The hotel is situated in Midtown, a short walk too Theatres and shopping but much less hectic than the Times Square area, we love the location. 
Before we arrived we contacted the Concierge too get some Dinner reservations which we were struggling with. Yuri was so helpful, managing to get us a table at the Gramercy Tavern on a busy n night and we really appreciated his kindness.
We cannot wait to return to New York and the Intercontinental Barclay will be at the top of our list of places to stay!

title: Perfect location for a New York adventure
text: I have to be honest, I’ve read some of the bad reviews by people who stayed at the same time, and am really surprised. I’m sure all hotels are facing considerable challenges right now, and I think it’s right that as guests we give a little leeway. Having said that, we were really happy. The welcome was great, the staff friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, … the bed was sensationally comfy! As I’m sure is the case with most visitors to NY, the hotel is merely a place to rest your head before the next adventure begins. What a city. We can’t wait to go back and without hesitation would definitely stay again at the Barclay. The location was perfect for us.

title: Think Twice - Not a 5 or 4-Star!
text:
Where to start… this hotel was once a reference, but this was the past. 
For some stupid reason I cancelled my reservation at the Peninsula to stay at the Intercon - in retrospect, this was a very bad idea. 
The arrival was “Fend for Yourself”! No doorman or bellhop present to assist with the bags. I needed to fight to get my three bags through the small revolving door all by myself. 
As an Elite Club Member I was lucky to be able to check-in at the special guest’s service desk which allowed my to avoid the long line. The benefits ended there ! 
I was asked to wait a few minutes while the lady at the desk finished filing and arranging her papers in front of me. 
To my surprise, the property didn’t offer a membership upgrade claiming they they were full. One click on the IHG app and it was obvious that there were multiple rooms available for the upgrade. 
The room was musty and smelled of mildew. It was obviously not thoroughly cleaned as there were hairs on the credenza and in the bathroom from the previous guest! The IHG Covid procedures don’t seem to be applied at this property!
They kindly moved me to another room, but I think they punished me with a lower category. The second room was smaller. Needed to call maintenance because the safe didn’t have batteries! 
I searched for the welcome amenity or a complimentary bottle of water, but to no avail. 
To my disbelief the hallways were scattered with discarded room service trays, trash other classy guests left outside their doors snd housekeeping carts left in the middle of the corridors. 
Figured that this would be removed, but everything was sill on the floor and in the corridors the following day! 
If you are thinking of staying at the Intercontinental, think twice. 
They are clinging to their old reputation, but unfortunately the property is a far cry from what it once was.

title: Never again.
text:
First this hotel is selling club rooms when the club lounge is closed.
I booked my club room more than 2 months ago and havent been advised at any moment not even at check in that the lounge is closed,this is a ripp off and being dishonest selling something that doesnt exist and replacing it with free breakfast and drinks makes no difference,its your duty to publish it on your website,e mail guests or change the description of club room benefits.
Ambassador members benefits comes with free mineral water usually placed on table,bathroom,not a single bottle was on show ,the only one in minibar and no sign stating they are complimentary for ambassador members.
IHG reward members have the possibility to set their room preferences on their profile so the hotel will know in advance.
Assigning a room on 7th floor when the hotel is 15 floor or placing my room close to the lift and cleaning staff room is totally ignoring my preferences of high floor and away from lift and i wonder if any staff cares to read our profile.
The ripp off at this property reached a degree where minibar items are taxed a surcharge of 20%for stocking and when a can of coke costs 9$ you will have to add city taxe and another 20% surcharge for stocking,i ve never seen this before at any Intercontinental,and you will not find any pricing list in your room until you log on tv you go to room service enter minibar where you are advised to scan the QR code on fridge and i guess many will never find out the price of their consumption until they are handed the bill.
A huge property like this have what they called a restaurant set in a corner behind the bar,in the morning it looks like a zoo,so crowded it could be,and when i paid for a club room is to have some peace while having my breakfast.
As they said you just notice little details when they are not there anymore,we all enter our hotel room and find a welcome message on tv with our name,yet this hotel might be the only intercont i have been to where this little touch is missing .
Needless to say i had 2 separate booking at this hotel,i cancelled the second and moving to sister property at Times square.

title: Fabulous Stay!
text: Very impressive from the moment you arrive in the spacious and beautifully decorated foyer.  Great night's sleep in the extremely comfortable and well appointed rooms and perfect location for exploring  everything Manhattan has to offer, every time we stepped into another hotel we were very grateful we chose The Barclay.  The bell boys were great, however the doorman and the lady on the front desk (not check in) made us feel like a bit of an inconvenience but this did not detract from our overall experience which was first class.  Thank you!

title: Staff are the worst I have ever come across! Dont stay will ruin your trip
text:
Staff are the worst I have ever come across! Rude and think they own the world.

Got treated in a disgusting way by the night manager on the 14th Nov 21. Had lost all my cards and wallet on day I landed so couldn’t leave a card for a holding charge or ID they said when I checked in that was ok and they could check me in without it. I would like to add I had paid for the hotel upfront before I arrived so actually had no money to owe the hotel.

3 days in me and my partner had come back from a mega NHL match at MSG which was amazing was on a real high. Went to unlock my room non of our cards worked. Went down to reception and the guy wasn’t sure why they had not worked so got the night manager.

Well what a horrible woman! Aggressive before I even talked saying if I couldn’t give them a card or ID she would kick me out the hotel. Baring in mind this is 11pm on a Sunday night. I explained my situation and she said she knew as it was on the system but that it “wasn’t here problem but your have a problem if you cannot sort a card and ID out” This was in the middle of recpetion and kept treating me saying she would get security to escort me to the room to clear it out and throw me and my partner out the hotel. I was very calm and was trying to find a solution. Offered to pay via the only card I had on my phone via Apple Pay and she would not take it, said I would let her hold my passport until I left as that was the most valuable thing I had left. But she just looked at me and said that’s not the holding charge that we need so no good. She then questions how I was surveying in New York with no cards and I said with the cash I got out before I come. Apparently I was lying she said I mean how rude! Then she was getting angry and said she would be getting security again to escort me to the room  even though  was being very calm and was trying to settle it with what I had. 

In the end I was getting fed up and threatened to walk to the British embassy as this woman was trying to kick me out of a hotel I had paid upfront for and was being unreasonable towards me. Then she all of a sudden let me go up to the room to talk to my partner but only gave me 10 mins. Luckily somebody very kind offered to help out which was kind. Its was 1am by this point and was very tired and when I went back down to sort it out the manager didn’t want to deal with me so let one of her staff do it.

Won’t lie wrecked my time in New York as left a bad taste every time I went into the hotel. I was a IHG gold member for years but that meant nothing either. The $35per night amity charge which is never mentioned was a kick in the stomach but I had given up as just wanted to get home.

Please anybody wanting to stay at this hotel DO NOT !! Also everything is a rip off $42no tax for one breakfast and $25 for one beer and a can of coke. I am used to London and Dubai prices but this is a joke.

Do not stay at the interContinental New York Barclay it will ruin your trip.

title: Très bon Etablissement
text:
Nous nous sommes déjà rendus à plusieurs reprises à l'Intercontinental Barclay . Les prestations sont toujours excellentes , et notre chambre en étage supérieur était parfaite pour être à New York ...Nous reviendrons dans cet Etablissement.
Par contre il serait souhaitable que la direction de l'hôtel se préoccupe du comportement d'une grande majorité de son personnel à l'accueil. Le personnel n'est pas accueillant et celui ci peut être dans certains cas désagréable . Nous concernant , lors de notre enregistrement quel comportement ! 
Urgent de revoir ce point.

title: No tan bueno
text:
Ubicación: está muy bien, cerca de la Iglesia de San Patricio. 
Habitación: muy bien, cómoda. Con cafetera y cama cómoda. 
Lo malo: MUY ruidoso, a cualquier hora. Las habitaciones no están aisladas como debería. Arruina el resto de lo positivo. 
Desayuno básico.

title: Worth a stay
text: Pretty iGreat location near Rockefeller Center (could see Sacks Fifth  a couple blocks down from my window) some things that were fantastic included the gym; the bell staff who explained to me why no reception/front desk staff was present to assist with my check-in (I waited for a few minutes - strange to arrive to an empty desk but it was handled well); room was immaculate, gorgeous and comfy; room service deliverer was polite; towels, slippers and robe were soft and fluffy, among other things all in all five star stay if it weren’t for the last point below

title: HOTEL MODERADO CON ESCASO PERSONAL
text:
Hotel muy moderado, un tres estrellas simple que pretende ser más. Muy poco personal atendiendo, llamar por teléfono desde la habitación para preguntar algo es imposible (nunca atienden). La señal de wifi es muy mala. Se corta constantemente. 
Lo único rescatable es el servicio de mucamas.
Recomiendo contratar previamente el desayuno, sino es obscenamente caro el buffet.

title: Truck stop motel service at 5* rates
text:
Stay here if you want truck stop motel service. 

I am an IHG Spire Ambassador, one of the highest levels of loyalty anyone can demonstrate to this brand. Today is my first day here at the Intercontinental Barclay, and it is a pathetic experience so far.

1. Check in is chaotic with no organization and unduly long wait, even late in the evening with hardly any guests

2. The lady working at the reception was confused by the fact that I had done an online check-in that was offered in an IHG email.

3. She did not acknowledge my status nor bother to explain any of the amenities or features of the hotel, nor did she offer any of the benefits that are due to a Spire member upon check-in

4. When we exited the taxi, the bellman took possession of our bags, and gave us a ticket but didn’t ask for my name. And neither the last at reception ask me for luggage ticket.

When we arrived at the room, we started to wonder how will they know to bring our luggage to our room. After waiting 30 minutes for the luggage, I called downstairs and after sitting on the phone for 15 minutes, I was informed that the reception should have collected the ticket from me.

5. Further one hour wait for luggage, resulted in me calling twice more, then finally I demanded to speak to the manager and she finally endeavored to locate our luggage and have it delivered

6. To add insult to injury, the gentleman who brought our luggage to the room decided to lecture us on the procedures of the hotel related to luggage tickets. I firmly disposed of him with a reminder that I’m not the bellman or the receptionist, neither of whom performed their function of proper check in or proper handling of our luggage.

7. There not a bottle of water in the room, nor any welcome amenity, so we went out to buy water so we can make tea/coffee in the morning.

I truly feel like I have checked into a truckstop motel, with poorly trained people with for more attitude than skill. New York is well known for poor service but one expects the Intercontinental brand to at least make an effort.

Again, if you’re looking for additional level of service well paying a five star rate, this may be the right place for you, but for me this hotel in particular is to be avoided at all cost.

title: Deceptive Resort Fee & Food Credit
text: The staff are very nice and the room well kept. What they don’t tell you is they charge $35 a day resort fee but there are no resort items.  There is only 1 place to use an alleged $25 per day food credit and that is at the bar.  Breakfast at the bar is over $35++ and there is no cafe or place to get coffee or anything else for that matter.   Deceptive.  Be aware shame on you Intercontinental.

title: Great concierge services
text:
I had left my AirPods and toiletries at my hotel room. I called them when I remembered about it. They confirmed they had it and and plan to get shipped. The person I talked to first didn’t reach out to me. I then left intercontinental emails to help me out. 

Isaac Anderson reached out to me shortly after the email, apologized for the delay and arranged to get the items shipped over FedEx ASAP. Though items were not expensive it carried sentimental value as it was a gift. I really appreciate intercontinental for doing this and ensuring I got it back. 

Thank you for the kind gesture Isaac. !!

title: Great location for Midtown
text: Excellent hotel with friendly staff and attentive service. The door man suggested a bagel place on E51st. It didn’t disappoint.  The bartender was friendly and made an amazing Manhattan.  Desk and Manager were so kind and professional.  I’ll be back.

title: A nice stay during the pandemic
text:
My wife and I booked our Ambassador Anniversary night and stayed three nights total. We are NJ residents and took NJ Transit and the subway and sidewalks to the hotel.

Online check-in made our interaction with the desk brief. So brief that our IHG membership and Spire Ambassador status were not mentioned. We did not receive a room upgrade.

The Barclay King room was generally in excellent shape and well decorated. We were pleasantly surprised by the heated bathroom floor! Everything in the room worked. The only problem was that the headboard was torn with a angled rip about 2 inches on each side (see picture). We were surprised that it wasn't repaired or at least taped.

We both got a solid sleep in the room. The usual NYC noise was muted.

There were some changes for the pandemic. Housekeeping was only a change of towels and trash once a day. The Club Lounge was closed and the restaurant and bar had reduced hours. Mask requirements are merely suggestions and not well enforced, to our dismay. We turned down several elevator rides with the unmasked. In general the hotel did the best that they could with the situation. Many 4 and 5 star hotels around town are still closed.

All in all it was a comfy place to base our few days in NYC.

title: Terrible Decision to stay here
text:
If you have ever stayed in a nice hotel, please don't be fooled into staying here. 
 You will be severely disappointed.  This is not a high end hotel.  It's not even a decent one.  We normally stay at The Palace, but decided to try a new place.  It was a very bad experience from the very start,  We went with our kids and I called to make sure we would have adjoining rooms.  Of course, when we got to Check-In, there were no adjoining rooms available.  When we asked what the solution was, the front desk guy got agitated and combative.  The manager came out and tried to bribe us with meal tickets.  Frankly, I was embarrassed for her.  She said she would have something for us the next night.  Guess who never bothered to follow up?  We had breakfast in the hotel - powdered eggs - truly inedible.  The server couldnt be bothered to give us water.  We had to get up and get it ourselves.   Literally the worst meal I've ever had in NYC.  Finally, the rooms are tiny.  My wife and had to stand single file in order to be in the bathroom at the same time. 
There are many other hotels.  Even if you have to pay up $100 a night, you'll be happier.  There's a reason this place looks like a "deal."  Avoid.

title: Amazing NYC
text:
Beautiful hotel in perfect location. The rooms were above average size for NYC. Beds really comfortable. Room was quiet and cozy. Keurig coffee maker and fridge . Nice size closet. Bathroom smallish but manageable. My only complaint is there weren’t. Enough hooks to dry towels , but that’s about it. There was a resort fee, but when you check in you get a $25 credit for food or drink at the bar/ restaurant. 
About 5 minute walk from grand Central. of course tons of bars and restaurants . We went to Le Relais de Venise for dinner. HIGHLY recommend. And ESS a Bagel for breakfast. long wait , but seriously worth it!!
Would absolutely stay here Every time I came to nyc and I’ve probably stayed in a minimum of 20 different hotels in NYC thru the years.I just fear the prices will once again go through the roof once we’re through COVID.
DO NOT forget Vaccine card/ picture and AN ID . you’ll be out of luck for most things, including sitting at Hotel bar!!

title: Great stay
text: We were at The Barclay for six nights with a group.  Things you might like to know: great beds, the sheets are wonderful, the breakfast varied and plentiful, Peter behind the desk will be of great assistance as will Tony, Angel and David the door men.  Brian the concierge has wonderful resources.  While tucked away you will be in the middle of it all.  We did not select this property but will certainly return.

title: Great stay
text:
The facilities and location were superb, walking distance to Central Park and Chelsea. Rooms are clean and beautiful. 
Staff were friendly and efficient, and they were making sure you feel welcome and safe.
Highly recommended, would absolutely stay here again.

title: Outstanding customer service
text: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks. The service and hospitality were superb. I got to know the staff and they were top notch . The managers Ruchi, Crista , Matthew and Jennifer went far above the ordinary experience you receive  at hotels nowadays. These managers deserve to be acknowledged for how they treat and make their guest feel. Housekeeping was also excellent my daughter though she had lost her iPods and a housekeeper by the name of Vivian found them and returned them to us . Even though we had not even asked housekeeping for them since my daughter thought she had left them in the park. It was a true enjoyment staying at the intercontinental and this will definitely be our go to hotel when we visit New York again.

title: Fabulous Property
text: I just came back from a 3 night stay at the Barclay and I have not stopped raving about since. I went to New York for a show at Radio City  and the hotel was super close to it. They were able to accommodate an early check in for me which was VERY appreciated, the room was spotless, spacious, welcoming and the beds were heavenly. Best nights sleep I had in a while. Armando the bartender makes delicious cocktails, his skinny margarita was one of the best I have ever had . I also used the gym and it was small but very well equipped. My only thing was that I as I was checking out I found out I could have use the mini bar with the credit I had from the amenity fee. I wish that had been told to me at check in. I would've been nice to have known that.  All the staff were courteous, but special shout out to Armando at the bar.

title: Housekeeping disaster
text:
The physical property is pretty nice with a huge lobby and a relatively modern room. However, the service is definitely not up to par with the prestige of the intercontinental brand. I stayed here for 10 nights and I have to say it was the worst housekeeping service I have ever experienced, notwithstanding the fact that this is a premium hotel. My room was not cleaned, there were stains on the floor, bins had dirty liquid residue, table surfaces were not wiped. Floors were not vacuumed. My tea is never replaced and I have to request them on a daily basis. Laundry bags were not replaced and the list goes on. (These are just things that I could see with my bare eyes, I wonder if they actually changed the sheets, towels, wipe down the phones, remote controls etc, in between guests)

I made a complaint on day 3, but the issue present itself again a few days after. Cleanliness is a basic requirement for any hotels, more so during the covid era. It has been really disappointing to say the least with the level of cleanliness in this hotel, I have definitely expected better from a hotel of this calibre but clearly it is contrary to how it presents itself.

I always try to be understanding and give them some tolerance, however with the issue persisting over the 10 days period, it is clearly an issue.

At the end of the day, it is a comfortable enough hotel but it is definitely not a premium offering. The cleanliness and housekeeping are just unacceptable. Very poor standard with no consistency. It is definitely something they have to improve on, before they start losing customers.  Also do note, the wifi is NOT highspeed. I have done speed test throughout my stay and it tops 10mbps at times. Noise insulation is also quite poor, you can easily here conversations from next door guests or from the corridor. 

I have attached some photos for your reference.

title: It was a great experience...
text: I really liked this resort, however, they changed a couple of times our room with very unrealistic reasons, so, it was not a happy experience at the end. This is a great place to stay and the location was really good.

title: Beautiful property, abysmal service...
text:
The facilities and location were superb. The hotel itself has maintained the elegance of the era in which it was built. The lobby was beautiful, the elevators were from another, more gracious time,  the rooms were spacious, beautifully appointed and the public areas were also spacious, ample and lovely.

The support of the staff was mediocre at best. 

We submitted basic requests repeatedly thru the initial reservation, email, & front desk, all were ignored. Although one of IHG's premier hotels, there was no streamlined check-in accommodation for elite members (I am a platinum elite member). We came to this hotel to celebrate a special occasion-the 30th birthday of one of the members of our party. We indicated this in our reservation emails, as well as in response to an email inquiry from the hotel and notification to the Guest Services desk. We would not have mentioned this if we had not been asked about it, & there was absolutely no response to this special occasion. While we did have a lovely room (we were told it was an upgrade), our Platinum Elite member didn't have their status acknowledged, didn't receive any information about a welcome amenity (despite asking about it) & it's almost a month since our visit we still haven't received bonus points for declining daily room cleaning . 

A simple request to have the 2 rooms for members of our party near each other was consistently responded to as an exceptional and marginally possible request and apparently completely ignored, as each time we made the request, we were told there was no record of it - despite individuals at the front desk and guest services advising us they had made a record of the request. The stress associated with ensuring our rooms would be near each other was excessive and profound.

We requested a quiet room;we were directly across from the service door resulting in persistent noise from staff starting early in the day, and continuing til evening. 

When we entered the room, I found some garbage from the previous occupant (an amenity wrapper in the dresser drawer)

I provided all of this information in response to Barclay's request for information shortly after our stay and have received no response. Maybe placing the information here will result in a better (any?) response.

title: New York City at it's best
text: At a time of uncertainty with travel and being in New York City the Intercontinental New York Barclay instilled a sense of confidence and reassurance that NYC can still deliver at being the best. As with everything, restrictions and staffing continue to plague every area but it is the staff at the Barclay that in the most subtle and elegant manner makes you forget how much has changed.  Its the little things that you sometimes forget how important they really are that this team effortlessly delivers on. From asking about reservations or

title: Classic historic Hotel in NYC
text:
Historic New York hotel on East 47th Street. Close walking distance to offices, shopping and top restaurants.  Due to COVID none of the restaurants in the Hotel were open. Fortunately there are many good restaurants in the area so it’s not the end of the world.  

I stayed on the 14th floor. The room was comfortable and clean.  Bed was comfortable.  The view is nothing exciting. The decor is classic, not modern.

Staff were friendly and efficient.  No issues with billing.

Due to the absence of room service I had a good delivery one night.  No issue with it but you need to go to the lobby to collect.

Would stay there again.

title: Solid, classic hotel in central Midtown East
text:
Had a quick one night stay end of July - would definitely return but not a perfect hotel. Overall suited our needs for the couple of days.

Pros:
- Historic details abound, very beautiful property
- Room on 12th floor was very clean and good size for NYC (2 doubles) with interesting details, comfy beds, and a large bathroom 
- Fitness center was large, clean, and pretty much empty
- Employees were friendly
- Location (although not the most interesting) is safe and central to sights 
- Room was very quite despite facing Lex

Cons: 
- Toilet had a small leak in the back
- All dining is shut, services in general are still limited
- Small line to check in
- 'Resort fees' in city hotels don't sit well - wasn't advised of the benefits so didn't use them (e.g. minibar credit) - if they're not being offered at the time, the fee shouldn't exist right now

Like I said, would definitely return but not a 'must stay'

title: Nice hotel and location
text:
would like to begin by saying this is  a beautiful, very clean, well maintained property in a great location... Although this property is not known for its views, I thought my room was very nice and clean, (except the kurig). A robe for both guests in the room, an extra paper cup and a back up roll of tp would have saved me a few calls. 
Beware! …if you purchase from the high priced, (as expected) mini bar, the QR code on the fridge door will provide you with an bit outdated price list, it also does not mention, each item you pick up, even if you put it back, you will be charged for automatically. I count calories and carbs therefore picked up and read the label on many items. Fortunately I decided to wait in line and check out at the desk and was able to have the invoice adjusted. I was given the impression this happens often.
I was nice when they verified we were celebrating an occasion several times prior to check in. Twice in an email and once at the front desk upon check in.  Staying in hotels quite frequently for business and pleasure, and often to celebrate a special occasion, I was surprised when there was not so much as a welcome note of acknowledgment. Out of curiosity I asked what they normally do for guests celebrating. I was told normally they would send a lovely dessert to your room, however due to Covid restrictions they couldn’t currently do that. This is a luxury property with expert management and well trained employees?! …Be a little creative! …any tiny gesture, how about a bottle of water? A postcard was slid under our door within minutes of me jokingly saying…not even a card? lol. You do tend to expect a certain level of courtesy and service from a first class property. Any lack of amenities and service was blamed on Covid.
No platinum elite status acknowledgment or perks in affect at this time. I knew service was limited therefore I was not upset or surprised. Oddly however, We visited several hotels with bars and restaurants in that area and they were fully operational. I understand employees are hard to find during this hiring crisis however just be honest about it, covid can’t be the answer for everything.
Upon arrival, not even a returned hello or nod from the employee cleaning the entrance door, just a pointed finger in the direction of another door. 
These times are tough post covid, we are all adjusting to the world reopening. I simply expected to feel welcomed, I did not.

title: Average
text:
We stayed for 4 D/ 3N. The check in process was smooth and quick. It was sort of sad seeing the hotel empty, restaurant and bar area included. The front desk was nice and attentive, however despite having an Ambassador Status and there being rooms available, he said there were not any. I checked the app and I could see some available, however, I chose not to say anything and proceeded to get my keys to the room I had previously booked. Room was average, I was not impressed to be honest, I didn’t  feel like taking a picture of it. My room did not have some basic amenities (bottle of water) something you would expect as part of benefits from having status with the brand. When I inquiry about breakfast, I was told that I would get 10% discount at a restaurant nearby. I love NYC and I was expecting more from this property but I regret to say it was lacking. 

P.S: Their fitness center needs serious attention.

title: 環境安全 房間乾淨
text:
客房乾淨舒適
位在E48街，近第三大道、第五大道
中央車站在不遠處
附近有Smith & Wollenski和Morton等知名牛扒店
也處於飯店密集區
藥房密度高
星巴克也在咫尺步行距離
E53街和E51街都有subway
去uptown和downtown皆方便
因為疫情關係
飯店餐廳、吧台處於不營業狀態
但一樓丹麥咖啡廳/餐廳/麵包店有開放
住客有10%折價卷
冰箱mini bar飲品豐富
服務中規中矩
每天都有人進來換水（瓶）和點mini bar食物
覺得頗被打擾
已告知某天要late check out
電話櫃檯說已處理好
隔天外出房卡又被鎖住
排隊排到天荒地老
發現根本沒處理且浪費時間
叫車的doorman會站到路中間吹哨叫車
感覺盡責
服務就是員工都有在做事
但不是日式的那種細心貼心
可以一住

title: No service
text: Checked in over the July 4th weekend. While the hotel was very clean and the rooms were a nice size, there was practically no service. The lobby had one check-in person and a long line of 10 people, while the sole bellman was trying to fit in a large volume of luggage. Thee did not appear to be anybody else in staff present. The room itself also had no coffee and the bar and restaurant were closed. The only option in the morning was a pricey coffee shop from Denmark next door. I am an Ambassador member and received no amenities either, They could easily have set up some coffee in the morning and had another couple staff of members assisting. The reservation system should at least warn customers

title: Disappointing for an Intercontinental hotel
text: What this hotel has going for it is location. The strangest thing is that it charges an extra $22 (soon to be $40) amenity fee with no amenities!!. It does not have a pool or a spa. The restaurant and bar are closed. We only got housekeeping on one day during a 4 day visit. Only after check out, we found out that the amenity fee entitles each room to $15 in mini bar purchases. The front desk person that checked us in never mentioned that. Nor did he mention that we can get discount cards for the next door bakery and Macy's as part of that amenity fee. He actually looked bothered when we asked for the wifi code, which   turns out to be part of the amenity fee. The only bright spots were the doormen and bellmen who were always very polite and helpful.

title: Needs some tweaking post covid
text: As an Intercontinental Ambassador, I tend to stay loyal if the city I visit has this brand.  Upon arrival, the room was super clean (albeit there was one errant hair on the bathroom floor that was clearly not mine).  The bed was extremely comfortable.  I had no issues with noise as I believe my hall may have been half empty (although I see how some that have complained may have this issue as the doors nor windows are soundproof).  None of the bedside outlets fit any of my adapters for my phone (USB or plug).  I had to charge my phone on the floor using the random extension strip behind the dresser.  You do receive a mini bar credit, but I really only wanted one thing and repeatedly asked every day I was there for them to refill this item.  It never happened.  I basically had to beg for it the day I left.  Shout out to Shauna at the front desk as being the nicest and service forward human being ever.  Before my business trip, I did some research between the 2 Intercontinental Hotel locations in NYC.  I wanted to make sure whatever I picked best suited me as there was a possibility that I would need a month-long stay in the near future.  I was told before my arrival that bonus points would be provided to Intercontinental Ambassadors since restaurants, bars and food and beverage were unavailable (despite the city being fully open during my stay).  I did not receive any upon arrival.  I inquired during checkout and the front desk attendant informed me that guest relations will give me 5,000 for the inconvenience.  I have yet to see this bonus and/or resolution.  This is the biggest issue I had with my stay.  I am not normally one to use a hotel “for the bed only.’  I want it to always be a multi-level experience.  If you take away a level, I expect something in return, especially if it is promised.  I would have given this hotel 5 stars if they fulfilled their promise.  Therefore, I think I will be checking out the other Intercontinental next time.  Hopefully, my experience will be more memorable.

title: pervasively pathetic and depressing
text: This is one in new york that's retained none of its charm or even appearance .  The staff is terrible, the food is so much worse than it was decades or even years ago that I'd rather pay to go somewhere else than dine here free.  From the smallest rooms to the biggest rooms the renovations are disgusting and tacky, unwarm and sad ...not in the classic new york gothic way but in the pathetic could-be-anywhere way.  I will never go here again.  If the place were under different owners and management maybe there'd be some hope for a RESTORATION rather than these grotesque no-class renovations.  They even showcase the aforementioned in display cases .  They might as well get their food from the trailor park and they're housekeepers from costco's janitorial department except I'd hire the latter over the former.  The staff are also invasive and nosy although they don't let you see it they want to know anything and everthing about you it's creepy.  I can tell when my personal info is being pried into and they tried .

title: Great stay over night
text: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for one night this week. The hotel was super clean and the staff very friendly.  The room was a little warm but very quiet.  The bathroom was spacious and clean.  We would stay here again!

title: Trip with my daughter.
text: It was a great stay! Breakfast was included in our package but the restaurant was closed. Unfortunately the place next door didn’t quite cut it. Nice hotel overall in a nice location and the staff was very friendly. Rooms were a decent size as well.

title: Thank you Gabriel and the team!
text: Due to an emergency I had to leave the hotel after staying only one night instead of 3 as originally planned. Basically I gave no notice and just explained why I need to leave. The hotel gave me a full refund for the two remaining nights. I would really like to thank Gabriel Nogueira, Director of Guest Relations, for being so kind and understanding. This is a type of service that will make me prioritize IHG group for all my future bookings.

title: Beautiful hotel with incredible staff
text:
Stayed here a day after they re-opened and was wowed. What an incredible lobby first of all, it’s absolutely stunning. 

I checked in late with Shauna and she was so friendly and personable. It made for a great start to my stay. Then Eddie helped me with my bags to the room. Provided me with a few bottles of water as well and explained the layout of the hotel. Both Eddie and Shauna were extremely professional and had a service first mindset. Thank you!

The room was spotless and bed extremely comfy. Shower was hot. They had multiple sets of elevators throughout the hotel. Typically a complaint of mine in NYC hotels. So I never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. 

Great location and walking distance to Central Park and Chelsea. Would absolutely stay here again.

title: Dream wedding
text: In between covid surges in NYC, we had a small, intimate DREAM wedding at Barclay! The service was exceptional. The property was safe, clean, and beautiful. Our guests are still raving about the accommodations. We cannot wait to return!

title: $35 'destination fee' no thanks
text:
Any hotel that charges a $35 compulsory 'destination fee' does not deserve my custom - #noresortfees

I am looking to book 5 rooms for a family holiday, but IC Barclay will not be getting my business purely on the basis of this fee.

title: Excellent in cleanliness, hospitality and location
text: I visited and stayed at the Barclay several times before the pandemic and always loved it for the vibe, the awesome and friendly staff and how detailed and perfectly organized and clean everything was. This was my first time back since re-opening in October and I still love, love this hotel. I congratulate the team in how they are handling the new procedures with regards to Covid, their kindness and commitment to excellent service and making sure you feel welcome and safe.  The eye for detail is noticeable in everything: how clean everything is from the hall to the elevators to the beautiful rooms. I look forward to visiting again soon.

title: Great Stay thanks to Hotel Manager
text:
Last July we had a horrible experience that I reviewed in detail previously. Apparently this review was brought to the attention of the Hotel Manager and he reached out to me to correct the problem. Without going into the details, we returned for an outstanding weekend.

My wife and I have been Intercontinental Ambassador members for about 15 years and this was one of the best stays ever!

Mistakes are unavoidable but how they are resolved reaffirmed why we continue our membership.

Thanks

title: Great location walkable to many sights
text:
Great location walkable to many iconic sights that Manhattan has to offer. Rooms are clean and warmly decorated.  Easy access to the light rail and subway system. It's been nine months since I stayed here but was reminded to post a review after binge watching Homeland (a TV show in the US) . Several episodes were filmed here with the lobby ceiling being the most obvious.

The downside is the poor service at the Gin Parlour bar. The hotel charges a daily fee which can be used as a credit at the bar but not enough to cover drinks for two. Did not appreciate the bar's mandatory 15% service chargel. Gratuity should be based on customer's satisfaction which typically range from 15%-20%. Felt the service is poor because of the guaranteed gratuity. The waitress had an attitude, and was hard to get any acknowledgement, smile, or any type of service.

Aside from poor service at the bar, the remainder of the hotel staff were professional and things went smoothly.

title: Perfekter Service
text: Aufgrund von Corona musste ich die Buchung für April 2020 leider stornieren. Ich wurde kompetent, professionell, zuvorkommend und äußerst freundlich behandelt. Mein Anliegen wurde ernst genommen und ohne Diskussion sofort umgesetzt obwohl ich über eine Buchungsplattform gebucht habe. Nur wenige Tage später hatte ich meine Anzahlung wieder auf meinem Konto! Auch auf Bali waren wir in einem Intercontinental Hotel und haben hervorragenden Service genossen. Sollte es wieder möglich sein nach NYC zu reisen werden wir uns  bestimmt wieder für das Intercontinental Barclay entscheiden! Das Geld für meine Austrian Airlines Flüge nach NYC habe ich nach über 5 Monaten noch immer nicht bekommen, obwohl mir dieses gesetzmässig zusteht. Umso mehr weiß ich den hervorragenden Service des Intercontinental Barclay zu schätzen. Vielen Dank und liebe Grüße aus Wien!

title: Great hotel
text: The lobby, rooms, the bar, the gym and the entire experience one of the memorable stays of all times. Absolutely beautiful hotel. On my second visit, it was a surprise the front desk staff knew i stayed there before.

title: 立地と部屋は良い
text:
20年2月に3泊しました。
立地はメトロE線のレキシントンAv53stに近く、またグランドセントラル駅にも徒歩圏なのでJFK空港から鉄道を使って移動にも便利ですし、グランドセントラルからのメトロを使えばタイムズスクエアやダウンタウン方面にも簡単にアクセスできます。
通りの向かい側には大きめのデリもあり、ホテルで朝食を取らなくとも食事には困りません。
星1つ減点なのは、IHGスパイアアンバサダー会員としてアーリーチェックインのリクエストを入れていたにも関わらず部屋が用意されていなかったことと、コンプリメンタリウォーターもなかったこと位ですが、水についてはスーツケースの荷物が動かないようにするために2リットルのペットボトルを日本から持ち込んだため別段不自由はしませんでした。

title: central location
text: Friendly welcome by reception staff.  All hotel staff we interacted with over the 4 days were super helpful, friendly and professional. Good breakfast . Very central location. Nice room, comfy bed ( very soft pillows, too soft for me but i'm sure if i asked they provide firmer pillows ) Room is  on the small seize but it's New York. City...  The walls are thin , you can actually hear conversations from neighbouring rooms, so be prepared for that.   There are many bars and restaurants nearby.

title: Long weekend
text: I have stayed at several hotels in NYC but this is the best. The location, comfort,price and of course the staff. I love the bar and the guys behind it really look after you. Special mention to Jose and Alessandro. Can't wait to go back yet again.

title: Great service from Paulette Hope in Club Intercontinental
text:
This is our third stay at the InterContinental Barclay Hotel. We love it’s style, location and service.

This time we booked a room with Club Intercontinental access. 

Compared with other Club Intercontinental Lounge facilities, this one is on the small side,  with services limited when compared to the fantastic Lounges in Medellin, Hong Kong, or London. 

However, what is in offer is of good quality, and the stand out thing is the service from Paulette and the rest of the team. 

Always there to welcome you personally, making sure the lounge is well stocked, clean and tidy.

Thank you to you all, it was a pleasure to meet you and thanks for great service at Club Intercontinental. 

David and Mike

title: Good location and comfortable stay
text:
The hotel is ideally located, close to the Rockerfeller Centre and is an easy  walk to Times Square. The hotel decor was lovely and the hotel is clean. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfy.

However, not so good was the amenity charge and the reception staff were not the most helpful. This felt like a hotel for business clients rather than for tourists. 

Be prepared to pay an amenity charge of $30 plus taxes per room per night. While this charge  can be used for credit for food and drink, the prices are relatively expensive and the hotel bar, the "Gin Parlour", tended to busy and loud in the evening as the hotel seemed to have lots of conferences.  We went to the diners nearby for breakfast and also Ess-a bagel which we would recommend.

title: Comfortable stay in a fantastically located hotel
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in early March and we found the hotel to be clean and comfortable and the staff to be friendly and helpful. It's located close to Grand Central Terminal and the major sights in Midtown. The hotel gives guests $25 a day discount on food and drink charged to the room but wasn't fully explained upon arrival and so we didn't take full advantage. As with all NYC hotels the food and drink was expensive so we had breakfast every morning in Ashley's Fine Foods across the road from the hotel which was good value for money. Please be aware that the mini bar has censors which means that if an item is removed or moved you will be charged meaning that you can't put your own drinks on the shelves but there is room to put a small bottle or can of your own. Also, the ironing board in our room was broken.
We were there to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday and having read other reviews we had hoped for a room upgrade but didn't get one, however the room we had booked was sufficient for our needs. We did receive two small cup cakes on arrival two days before her birthday which was a nice touch albeit less than we would've expected from a 5 star hotel. All in all it was a great hotel and we would stay here again.

title: Highly recommended
text: I went here with my friend and our partners for her 40th birthday and it was amazing. Our room was really big, comfortable and very clean. The doorman called Angel was amazing and would go above and beyond his duties, he was extremely helpful and so friendly we looked forward to going back every night to see him!

title: Soggiorno d’eccezione 🤩🤩
text: Esperienza eccellente e di altissimo livello in questa esclusiva struttura anni ‘20 sita sulla 48esima strada nel centro di Manhattan pochi passi da alcuni dei monumenti simbolo di NYC, dotato di camere di lusso, ristorante e lounge bar chic. Pulita, ben arredata e con splendida vista la premiere room dove ho soggiornato  per 4 notti. Ottima la colazione e il ristorante ma soprattutto ottimo il personale dell’albergo. Servizio a 5 stelle fornito in particolare dal maitre d’hotel, che mi ha accolto ogni mattina con un sorriso, professionale e simpatico. Complimenti vivissimi🔝🔝🔝

title: Great stay at the Barclay!
text: I stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay with my family. We had such a great time. The room was very nice and clean. The beds are very comfortable. The service was perfect from check in to housekeeping . Any request was answered withing minutes and with a smile! The concierge was very helpful with restaurants bookings.  Food at the bar is good and service is excellent. It is a very good NYC location for tourism and business. I would highly recommend it.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: We had a fantastic 5 night stay at this Hotel.Room was amazing,so clean and beautifully decorated.Location of the hotel was ideal as well as it’s only a 20 minute walk to Grand Central Terminal.Staff were brilliant and extremely helpful.We had Room service a couple of nights and the food was excellent and arrived very quickly.Everything about the hotel made our stay so enjoyable and I will definitely be making a return visit and very soon.

title: New Year Stay 2019/2020
text:
We stayed here for five nights over the New Year period. We booked from the UK as a flight/hotel package with British Airways, so therefore included the resort fee.   
We travelled with our niece and nephew as a special birthday trip/bucket list.  The hotel was in a fantastic location and a touch of luxury for our five night stay.  We booked  standard rooms and we didn't spend much time in there!  But it was perfect for our needs.    The hotel foyer really had the wow factor with the Christmas trees! 
The only damper was that on checking in to the hotel, my niece handed over her debit card rather than a credit card.  Due to a mix up with the booking (not sure who as the hotel said it was the hotel and BA said it was the hotel)  my niece ended up with a "held" charge on her debit card for two weeks after we returned home.  The charge was around $1,200 and affected her using her card and available funds!  Apparently the reservation was on two bookings from BA and one of the bookings hadn't had the room paid for or included the resort fees.  It eventually sorted out after several emails and telephone calls to BA, it was a hassle we didn't need.

title: Only one incapable employee can ruined the whole image
text:
Do you know one of your reception employee works like a supermarket cashier? Well, i was stunned but the lobby's fancy ornaments confirmed me that i wasn't in the wrong place but a five star hotel.
I chosed your hotel mostly because of your reputation and spent two nights in room 1563.I checked in late afternoon on 28th Feb. A lady at the reception welcomed me, nice warm &patient.She kindly explained me that the hotel amenity fee could be redeemed by consuming minibar food or beverage. 
While checking out on 1st Mars around 10h30, I found out the minibar food was charged. It's alright, mistakes will happen. I explained to the poker-faced lady about the wrong surcharge. So she handed me a new invoice with again another wrong amount telling me because I took more snacks than I told her. "I'm sorry lady,but I won't pay for what I didn't take."Logically, even if is a teeny amount. She just replied in a impatient and irretating tone:"Alright, I'll remove it. Is it ok for you?" What? You and your colleague made mistakes surcharging the clients whatever you want, and you didn't even apologize your fault but questioned your client like a dishonest and sway the client off as quickly as possible. NO! IT IS NOT OK the face you showed to the clients. IT IS NOT OK the tone you speak.IT IS NOT OK the way you solve the problem. What is more, when I feeded back the room cleaning problems, she just squeezed off two words:'oh~' 'yeah~'. Yes, she's listening but the way like telling clients' I DON'T WORK HERE AND I DON'T CARE.' UNPROFESSIONAL, ICY & EMOTIONLESS, that's what I see and feel as a client. Totally inappropriate to your five star level. A receptionist is the primary impression of a hotel. And unfortunately I got a terrible memory just before I leave.

title: loved it!
text:
What a fantastic property. My family and I spent the weekend at the Barclay and loved this property. The staff was very welcoming and helpful throughout the stay. A few minutes after we checked in, a server knocked at the door with cookies and milk for my 8 year-old son. WOW!.
Concierge was able to change the time of some NBC tour studio as I requested. Rooms  were very clean and comfortable. windows are nicely isolated from noise and cold temperature.
The bar is awesome, it has a great buzz, and offers delicious food.
This property is highly recommended for leisure or business. location is excellent.

title: Hotel Amenity fee ( be careful)
text:
The hotel charges an amenity fee on top of the room charge which is quite deceiving to customers and not transparent. 
This is a 35$ charge per day per stay plus taxes ( see photo)
Which customer must pay. It includes a credit of 30$ towards food and beverages to be used  per day on the same day before midnight or it will forfeit. Can’t be carried on or added in total if not used. 
I find this a very cheap sleazy way to trick customers into paying more. my room was 191$ plus 35$ which makes it 226$. 
the hotel should just advertise there actual price of 226$ and stop misleading customers.
Read the tiny fine prints which are not meant for you to see!

title: Fabulous respite from the busy/cold city
text:
For the hotel and room, definite 5 stars (separate review for the Gin Parlor).
Well-appointed rooms and very clean. It was a wonderful location - close to EVERYTHING and very easy to get around. Felt modern, but also historical. We had zero complaints about noise or smell, and the bathroom worked wonderfully for our two night getaway. Things that could make a difference: the bathroom door is a sliding panel, not a real door with a handle (less privacy). The coffee is a keurig - and not good. Bring your own k cups or just go get coffee downstairs in the morning (though the price is outrageous). Great outlets in the room, Iron was good. Hair dryer needed serious lint removal, but no big deal for us. The staff at the front was wonderful and the support staff inside and out were great too. If you're in town on Friday... PLEASE make plans to go to the lobby before dinner. GREAT jazz music. Wish we didn't have dinner reservations - would have stayed to listen longer. Concierge was nice enough - helped me feel less anxious about a reservation I had made and gave us an awesome map to use the whole weekend. Every staff person was very accommodating with everything we asked. Overall, really glad we picked this place.

title: Excellent
text:
We spent 5 nights for a New York City break and were very happy. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. The lobby and hallways were always spotless with a hint of grandeur thrown in. 
Location wise we were a 20 minute walk from everywhere in Midtown and southern end of Central Park. 
We had a medical incident on our last night and needed hospital attention. The night duty staff, Matthew and Jennifer were brilliant. They took care of everything and went above and beyond to look after us. 
The only downside was the ridiculous bar prices and surcharge and service charges for room service; I know it is a prestigious Manhattan hotel but there are limits!

title: $30 surprise amenity pack
text: I had booked into this hotel but stayed 30 mins in room 417 before booking out again; the mandatory $30 amenity pack (full of things that I didn’t want) made me so cross that I left. Went across the road to the Marriott, which agreed to waive the amenity pack charge.

title: My new favourite Intercontinental
text:
This property is by far my favourite hotel. Every single detail is thought of, even the number on the door to your room has gold sculpture with eagle around it, B logo on the floor in the elevator and even B logo stamped into french macarons I got. I love when small details like this are thought of. The decor is beautiful in this hotel, me and my husband we felt so well in this hotel, that in the evening we preferred to stay at the hotel than out in town.

The club lounge was my favourite lounge of all Intercontinental hotels I have stayed in. Josefine and  Bianca are the most wonderful hotel staff I ever a crossed in my life and I stay in hotels all over the world for at least 2 months a year no staff member has ever came close to them, we really enjoyed the lounge and their courtesy and smile every day.

Thanks to the ambassador desk for making my Birthday great. 

There is really something special about this hotel I don't know what it is but probably the decor, the staff, the every little detail that is thought of and that just makes the stay perfect. Definitely going to NYC again and this hotel might be a part of the reason I want to come back.

title: Great location, beware of the surprise nightly tax!! Bit of a downer to a great week
text:
Great hotel, location is excellent  just off 5th Avenue and almost next to Grand Central Station. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, beds are so comfortable- I need to know what pillows they have!!

Bar is a little pricey but a nice atmosphere, breakfast is extortionate at $42 each , i would recommend sampling some of the city's cafe's and food stalls, cheap and tasty :)

The only downfall was the surprise city tax at check out,$30 a night plus other random little tax charges! Ours amounted to $220!! Not one of the best surprises especially as we booked a package with Bristish Airways and the small print states all taxes included! If we had known this we would have drank $30 worth at the bar every night (you get a $30 daily credit) which we were only to find out on check out. 

Otherwise a really beautiful hotel :)

title: 安定のクオリティ
text: 仕事でニューヨークに一泊。いつもなら我が社のバジェットだと無理なんだけど、コロナの影響か、オフシーズンだからか、インターコンチネンタルが取れました。年季の入ったエレベーターとかツッコミどころはあるものの、さすがのクオリティには満足。11階の角部屋は眺めもよく、綺麗で日当たり良しでグッド！インターコンチなら部屋にスリッパくらいあるだろうと思い、飛行機のスリッパは放置してきたら、まさかのスリッパなしだったのは残念。バスタブなかったのもちょっと失望。シャワーの水圧もイマイチだったかなあ。朝の10時半くらいに着いてアーリーチェックイン所望したら通常午後4時チェックインなのを2時前には入れてくれました。訪問先にも程よく近く、個人的には何も問題はなかったので星4つ。

title: A great check-in experience
text: Elegant, comfortable property with terrific staff.  Exceptional check-in service by Ms. J. Lopez, who jumped in (even on crutches!), divided our long line and assured everyone would get prompt, first-class attention. Ms. Lopez was professional and gracious every step of the way. Also, quality/appointments of the rooms were first-rate and room service did not disappoint. Highly recommend all, with extra stars for the people who work there.

title: Ideal for a “city break”
text: 3rd time visiting this wonderful city. the first time staying at this hotel. Booked a 3 night break for my 60th birthday treat with my daughter to embark on sightseeing & shopping. The hotel is ideally located for everything, a short walk to Grand Central Station, Time Square within easy reach and Central Park easily accessible. Check in very straightforward, staff very pleasant.
