Unfortunately we were given a room with a queen size bed despite requesting a twin room, they did offer to change but for an additional $30 per night per person we declined. They also charge a room tax of $35 per night but this includes $25 of credit from the bar, mini bar etc per night so it only actually works out as $10 room tax if you take advantage of this but when they charge $9 for a small bottle of water it’s not difficult to use the full amount! The room was very clean, a queen size bed, well equipped walk in wardrobe with hangers, an ironing board & iron, fab bathroom, huge shower & TV in the room.  As the room was quite small there was no chairs to sit & relax, the only one was on wheels to use at the desk so if you wanted to sit and read you had to use the bed which although extremely comfortable was very high. Of the 3 hotels we’ve stayed in whilst visiting this is the best for location but 2nd for the actual room but I would definitely stay here again as location is key when doing a short city break. Can’t give 5* due to the bed situation and the lack of seating but it’s a worthy 4*.

title: Lovely
text: Clean spacious room, lovely foyer, you do have to pay room tax $35 per night plus taxes. 5 nights were $160.60. Would definitely recommend this hotel as in Manhattan area and close by for all major area, 5th Avenue, Central Park, Rockefeller centre, 20 mins walk to time square

title: First class hotel.  Dishonest pricing policy.
text: Its a lovely hotel ... there was some great jazz on Friday night in the bar and rooms were newly decorated and first class.   However, as other's have pointed out, the room rate is not the room rate ... thy add $35 and then give you a $30 credit at the bar or some other service in the hotel.  I had the really dig to find out that I could get a credit ... no one wanted to tell me about it but I persisted and found out.  I suspect they hope that many people will not ask and just pay the extra.  Its dishonest and I plan to complain to ihg hotels about the practice.

title: Great location, filthy rooms -Bed bugs!
text:
Location is great. Midtown East, across the street from Grand Central. The whole Midtown East area is not the most exciting, but it's definitely convenient. 

Pricing is not too bad for a Midtown East hotel. 

Room size is ok, reasonable for Midtown East. Sufficiently big, and surprisingly big bathrooms that are pretty well-lit. 

The room was fairly well designed and spacious. The only thing.....bedbugs!! This ruined the whole experience. There were small spots of blood on the bedsheets that I only found in the morning after waking up itchy. ARGH. The surprising reaction of housekeeping was that there were no bed bugs, and the itching must've been caused by the laundry spray.

I'm never staying there again.

title: Hidden charges - Your room rate is not the room rate.
text:
Beware, staying at this hotel. The room rate is not the room rate. When you arrive they add $35 plus tax per room per day to your invoice. In return they say they reimburse $30 per room per day. 

We had three rooms but “stupidly” when we were asked to sign for food and drinks we should have insisted on having the drinks and food split between the three rooms. In that way we would have had a reduction of $30 per room and not just once.  

In addition, what you signed for was not the amount shown on the final bill as without saying so the figures was adjusted by adding mini bar consumption and if lucky a $30 deduction.

When I get a bill I like to see all items I ordered and if there is a refund I like to see the refund separately.

I don’t like spurious figures with no backup appearing on my bill.

Finally, you must use your $30 per room before midnight. You can’t as I found out use it against breakfast which costs $50 plus taxes.

Full disclosure is the honest way to run a business and a hotel. Hiding and disguising only leads to distrust.

I complained vigorously and ended up with a total of $180 being deducted from the bill.

I can’t believe that this sort of business practice is ethical. I also understand that the city of New York are investigating. I hope the city win and they are heavily fined.

title: Beautiful classic hotel
text:
We stayed at the Barclay for four nights and absolutely loved it.  Location is great, rooms are decent sized for NYC, service is good!
In particular I wanted to call out Josefina Montes in the club lounge.  She is a spot of sunshine every morning!  Greeting everyone by name, recommending items, and being so pleasant day after day.  
Thanks so much for a lovely stay!

title: Great value, location, staff
text:
Stayed for 3 nights for business in February 2020. Had a standard room on the 7th floor. Very comfortable, the bed was amazing and surprisingly quiet considering it is in central NY. 
The weather wasn't great but they hand you an umbrella as you walk out each time. 
The staff were so helpful with directions etc.
I needed a couple of zips cut off a blazer and their engineer did it for me!!
Highly recommended, will definitely stay again -business or personal

title: Christmas in NYC
text:
A fab hotel, extremely good service. We travelled as extended family and cannot fault the hotel. Comfortable and very clean, excellent breakfast and gin bar.
Great location we walked everywhere!
Had a fabulous stay and certainly recommend this hotel

title: Amazing!
text:
We spent 5 nights in a club room which we had access to the club lounge for the duration. 
The lounge is beautifully set out with a great choice of breakfast after snack and evening canapés.
Paulette was a wonderful host along with her colleagues nothing was too much trouble and they do an amazing job always keeping the lounge looking impeccable.
Our room had a lovely large bed which was so comfortable we asked for a fridge in our room and that was dealt with swiftly.
The highly recommended the Barclay it was such a great hotel, relaxing atmosphere so much so were playing a weeks stay in October along  with our son who I know will love the facilities the Barclay has to offer. Room 1218

title: Never take fried chicken Sandwich in intercontinental
text:
The Sandwich was awful. It was overcooked and hard like rock, that’s why I couldn’t eat it. it was too crunchy and I couldn’t believe that I payed 25$ for that. 
So if you have a time to go some where else, go for it, Manhattan have better places to eat.

title: St Valentines Day.
text: For Saint Valentine, my wife and I had the opportunity to stay at the InterContinental New York Barclay. We live in New York. This was kind of romantic and special, our little getaway staycation in New York. I had high expectations, as I really wanted this to be something special and something relaxing. So, Friday the 14th, after a hard day of work, we finally arrived at the Hotel. Entering our Suite, there was a plate with fresh strawberries covered in chocolate, and a nice bottle of bubbly. After freshening up, we went downstairs to The Parlour, where we enjoyed a good cocktail followed by the restaurant's Valentine's Menu and some delicious wine. The service was excellent. The staff was warm and friendly, paying attention to every little detail. After dinner, we went back up, ready for a night of hibernation. The room was comfortable and quiet. Not a sound. The Kingsize bed was a dream. We slept like babies. This is the first time that we did a Night out in our own city and we can recommend this to everyone. We loved the attention, the hospitality. It was so relaxing. We felt special. Thank you, InterContinental New York Barclay for making this a winner.

title: Our favorite getaway
text: This was our third visit to the Barclay Inter-Continental - it’s become our favorite hotel for a quick weekend getaway without the kids. We love the location, close to Grand Central (we typically take the train into the city) but away from the craziness that is Times Square. Rooms are both elegant and cosy, and all the staff members with whom we’ve interacted have been polite helpful and friendly. Can’t wait for our fourth visit!

title: To celebrate my 50th
text: Im shocked this hotel is not accomodating and the customer service is ridiculous.i intended to celebrate special birthday where i turned 50 and all they did was provide 2 cup cakes. We were willing to pay the room rates but as a IHG member was expecting some service.  My experience and my birthday ruined by this hotel. Not as child friendly. Never again.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Rude Staff
text:
I have stayed at the Barclay at least ten times since 2018; each stay is at least three nights. The hotel is in a great location close to many attractions, yet it's nice and quiet at night. The rooms are wonderfully appointed and comfortable. Sadly, the staff is not as welcoming as the hotel itself.

Upon arrival, I wasn't even greeted with a simple smile, and the front desk staff didn't even acknowledge my elite status or give me the upgrade I was guaranteed when I made the reservation, and no one even offered to help me with my bags. The housekeeping never changed the toiletries nor the towels during my stay, and I doubt they did anything other than making the bed. They are also extremely loud, as I can hear them outside my room. I don't know what's the point of "Do no Disturb" as they keep knocking and calling even when the sign is on the door, 

One night at exactly 11:23 pm I called room service with no one answering, and 11:30, exactly when room service closes, a lady from the front desk answered and rudely stated "the kitchen is closed it's 11:30" I explained to her that I have been calling since 11:23 and no one answered, yet she again rudely replied, "the kitchen is closed I cannot take your order." I was so surprised that she didn't even apologize or offer an alternative or even a suggestion. During the summer, I stayed at the Intercontinental Amstel in Amsterdam, the staff there ordered me takeout because the dish I wanted was out of stock, and this was at 2:00 am. The staff members there are very different from those at the Barclay, as they go above and beyond what is expected and truly make you feel like a welcomed guest.

The Barclay used to be excellent when I first started staying there, and the staff was friendly and welcoming. I have kept returning, thinking that these issues are the exception and not the norm; however, I was disappointed. I am surprised that this is the treatment an IHG Royal Ambassador gets, I can't imagine how a first-time guest is treated. 

I don't think I will come back to the Barclay. I have given it many chances, and even when they checked-in another guest into my room, and they walked in on me while I was asleep, I simply laughed it off with the other guest. I have voiced my concerns about these issues to the hotel management before, but I see little has changed, and sadly things are becoming worse. The building is beautiful, the atmosphere in the lobby is quite lovely and the rooms are cozy. I used to recommend this hotel to my family, friends and clients; however, I can no longer do this as the service is subpar for one of IHG's flagship hotels.

title: Very good
text: Very beautiful hotel. I went there with my husband to expend a few days for s. Valentine. Good service, clean, nice decoration. The unique problem were the prices in their restaurant, 2 orange juices and 2 cups of soup 50 dollars. All the rest was perfect but because of that I didn't give them 5 stars.

title: Mostly great
text: Beautifully maintained rooms and public spaces and terrific conference venue.  The food?  Nothing special.  Group breakfasts and lunches were bland and unimaginative.  Still, a great experience and would stay here again.

title: Amazing NYC gem
text:
It was a special occasion, 8 nights stay, and our expectations of Barclay were exceeded. Our room on the 15th floor was overlooking the quiet side street, with enough day light and privacy. We used our resort fee every day in the Gin Parlor, which was a fun thing to do before going out (kudos to Mauricio Citrolo and other friendly and knowledgeable staff members in the GP). The hotel serves as a great base for business and leisure guests, can't beat its' convenient location to various subway stations and Grand Central terminal and short walking distance to all the Midtown attractions. Winning!
Our Premier 2 Double Beds room was generously appointed with more than enough space for two adults (with large suitcases), bathroom was beautifully arranged - authentic nyc subway tiles and marble bath/shower with bright lights and good air vent. The AC was working perfectly and windows could be cracked open to provide some air. The walls were adorned with quirky framed pictures and a calming wall size mural of Hudson river valley. Cable TV channels were plentiful only to be implemented by smart tv features - highly tech friendly. Wi-Fi worked as it should in our day and age. We have requested the mini fridge for our room, wich was seamlessly brought up to our room by a cheerful staff member. No request was too much trouble. The maids were smiling and replenished our (excellent) bath products upon request. The front house was also very attentive, so was the bell staff. 
Special thanks are due to Ms. Sofia L. Vandaele, who made our stay perfect with delicious gifts in the room and personal greeting cards, as it was my birthday. 
Highly recommend Barlcay!

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: I stayed there in December for business. the location is great in the heart of midtown and walking distance to many restaurants and attractions. the staff is very helpful as well from the check in to the departure. always welcome you with a smile and truly tried to address any query you might have.

title: Expected More.
text:
Expected more from a 4-Star Manhattan hotel. We stayed here for a week. 

Things we did not like: Mini fridge completely full of alcohol w/ sensors - would have liked more/ some room for our own things. No tea options in room and no water kettle* in room (we're Asian) just a bulky Krueig (spelling?) machine w/ weak coffee options. Bedside table drawer was half full with discarded pamphlets, wet plastic bag, and other random. Called a few times for additional clean glasses and services without response/ delivery. 

Things we liked: Location was fantastic, close to GCS, Subway, etc. Close to Midtown touristy things (Broadway, museums, TS) without being in the center of the chaos. *We were able to get an electric water kettle (but no tea). Bed was very comfortable. Nice and quiet room (some street noise, we're city people, this did not bother us).

title: Outstanding!
text:
Have just returned from a 5 night stay at this wonderful hotel to celebrate my 60th birthday. From the moment we arrived until we checked out we received excellent service from the amazing staff.
We had a corner room on the 11th floor which was spacious and immaculately clean. We had a great sleep every night as it was so quiet and the bed and pillows were so comfortable.
One of the highlights for us was the club lounge where we enjoyed a delicious breakfast every morning and tasty snacks and coffees at various times throughout the day. Blanca, Josefina and Silvia were amazing and a credit to the hotel.
The hotel is in an excellent location and all of the major tourist attractions are easy to get to.
We hope to return to New York next year and if we do we will definitely return to the Barclay. Thanks to all the staff for making my birthday trip so special and for the lovely treats that were delivered to our room to mark the occasion.

title: Nice hotel but beware of rip-off breakfast
text: The room was small but comfortable and tastefully decorated, the hotel was clean and felt new (not tired like some of the previous reviews).  The low point for me was breakfast: no a la carte option, just a buffet akin to any Hampton Inn.  I had three pieces of bacon and some scrambled eggs.  The eggs were really powdery and the bacon was...fine.  I also had a cup of black coffee.  All of this came to $52 which I now have to try to justify on my expense report. I told the restaurant manager i was disappointed and that it was overpriced and he merely apologized and offered no credit.

title: Home from home
text: I am delighted to have stayed once again at the Barclay. Great atmosphere, often deals and bargains to be had, fabulous staff and comfortable rooms. Don’t go cheap, go for Club room or above...it’s worth it! I always stay at this hotel when I am in Manhattan.

title: Very nice hotel in midtown
text: We spent a week in the hotel and had a great experience. We had a corner room. Large enough (in NYC hotel rooms are very small). We opted for the Barclay room because it included more amenities, but we did not use them that much, most of the times we ended up using the daily credit in their beautiful lobby bar. Next time we will choose the executive room which is larger. Very good service.

title: An old hotel gets older
text:
I booked at the Barclay because it is around the corner from where I had a meeting.  I found it altogether.

There are lots of kinds of old hotels: old and charming, old and beautifully renovated, old and falling down, or just old.  It maintains some lovely features — old moldings and such— but mostly, to me, looked old and tired.

When you walk in, the lobby is large, grand and faded.  There is an odd kind of sweet smell when you walk into the lobby that gets a bit grating with time, and makes you wonder if they’re covering up a worse smell.

My room was small, but comfortable enough, and the bed was good.

Barclay hit one of my pet peeves — the ‘amenity charge, then the tax on the amenity charge, then the tax on the tax.  They added almost 10% to the quoted price of the room, and, frankly, there aren’t that many amenities.  They don’t even leave you a bottle of water at night, leaving you to walk around the block to CVS or resort to the $9.00 water in the minibar.

The hotel was clean enough, and felt safe.  It isn’t awful, only average.  I suspect there is better in the neighborhood.

title: Very poor service marred an otherwise fine hotel
text: I stayed at the hotel this week for business and checking my bill from this morning, I saw I was charged for laundry on a shirt.  The shirt was dirtied by black scale leaking from the hotel iron that I couldn’t remove with a damp cloth.  I rang to replace the iron and was told that the shirt would be washed free of charge.  I rang the hotel four times this afternoon to try to speak to someone to reverse the charge and just got the run-around; for example, “shock” that I was complaining and transferred to numbers that either rang out or went to voicemail. I will email the hotel when I get back home on Saturday.  All-in-all, shabby service that I haven’t encountered in many decades of travelling that makes me question the quality of the hotel, especially since the immediately emailed my about IHG points.  Otherwise, the hotel was fine in a good location, although room service was expensive.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
We went to New York in December to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary and my ‘special’ Birthday ,I was soooo very pleased that we booked this hotel . 

I am a ‘clean freak’ and this hotel surpassed all our expectations regarding this, the bed was so comfortable after a hard day sightseeing lol and the room and overall hotel decor is so classic and welcoming we really felt as if we were treating ourselves staying there. 

The hotel is very central for attractions and far enough away from Times Square so you don’t have to travel through ‘the thick of it’ to get back to your sanctuary , and that’s how it felt a sanctuary to rest weary feet and reflect on the fabulous things you’d seen , readying yourself , refreshed for the next day:-) 

Nothing was too much trouble for the staff we came into contact with and the icing on the cake was some treats sent to our room by the management to congratulate us on the the special events we were celebrating.

This will be our go to hotel if we go back to New York and we would highly recommend it to friends and family going .

Thank you Intercontinental New York Barclay

title: Long NYC weekend
text:
We arrived at 7pm and were checked in straight away - no lines and very friendly and helpful clerk.  

Upon entering the hotel it is very grand and impressive.  The hotel has recently in the last few years undergone an extensive refurbishment but still maintains some of it's original features which makes it very unique. 

Our room was on the 7th floor and was spacious, clean and had a good sized bathroom with the usual amenities.  We didn't spend much time in the room other than sleeping, however, the walls are fairly thin and you can hear voices clearly from rooms either side and above.  The view was onto Lexington Avenue.  

Our room included club access, which offers a full breakfast (with both hot and cold options), all day hot and cold drinks, lunchtime snacks and evening service from 5pm-8pm with beer and wine and three hot plate options.  The lounge on week days had more business travelers talking work and doing business meetings over breakfast.  I can't fault the three ladies who work the club lounge, each were friendly and always had time for a chat with us.

The hotel left cupcakes and a bottle of Prosecco in our room which was a nice touch and appreciated.   

Hotel is located within 2 blocks of the subway and took around 30 minutes to reach JFK this way on the E train.  Easy to walk to Central Park, fifth Avenue, Grand Central and Times Square area.

From our experience I feel the hotel is more catered towards business travelers but I can't fault the hotel at all.  It is on the pricey side and a resort fee is added to your stay.

title: regular
text: Hotel bien ubicado. La habitacion era comoda, pero la calefaccion hacia mucho ruido, al punto que era dificil dormir.Faltaba limpieza en el baño. El desayuno es excesivamente caro (US$50 por persona).

title: Great Stay in Manhattan
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights late November over Thanksgiving and we loved it.

Great location, only 3/4 blocks from Grand Central one way and 3/4 blocks to 7th Ave the other. 

We had a Club Room and despite reading previous reviews that it wasn't great, honestly it was one fo the best we've experienced. Yes it's only beer, wine and sparkling wine at night - but they were all great. Along with the breakfast in the morning (remember to have it in the Lounge, not the small restaurant or you will be charged!), all the snacks during the day AND they do great nibbles at night, in a city as expensive as NYC it was brilliant.

Theres not a huge amount of public spaces, but we were out all the time anyway, so it didn't matter to us.

We'd stay again in a heartbeat

title: Horrible end-to-end experience - from check-in to IHG customer care hotline
text: Arrived approx 1.5 hour early from official check in time, after a 16 hour flight and really tired, but was told very coldly by Reception staff that check in is at 3 p.m. unless I pay USD 100. Alternatively, directed to store my luggage and come back later at 3. Friends staying at another five star hotel close to Grand Central in contrast was able to check in when then arrived at 12 p.m on the same day. This is in mid Jan, and does not appear to be peak season. Hotel staff if explain that hotel is full say, because of function/event, would really help the situation - but no, just a curt, you're early or pay additional USD 100 to check-in. Room amenities such as body lotion not refilled even though none left. In previous stay with hotel, similar poor experience, whereby I'd contacted housekeeping for an international adapter, and was given one that does not work.  Subsequently asked to purchase the adapter if I want one that works. Simple things were made so difficult, and frustrating. The last straw that drove me to write this review is the horrid experience with IHG customer care.  Virtual Help is terrible, does not understand requests, and when finally patched through to customer care, I was routed from one group to another group, and on the phone for quite some time waiting and listening to music. Horrible horrible experience given this is supposedly a five-star hotel.

title: NYC Jan 20
text: It’s my first time staying at Intercontinental Barclay hotel in NYC and I highly recommend this hotel. Hotel is in a convenient location which is super important. The hotel staff at the receptionist desk were  all professional and very friendly. My room was modern with nice wall painting ( very peaceful) and clean. My bed was comfortable and I was able to sleep soundly. I travel for business often and been in NYC many times. I am happy to find this hotel and will definitely return here.

title: Nice but NYC has much better on offer
text:
I've stayed in NY many times, most times in different hotels. I like to try something different each time and this time it was the Intercontinental Barclay.
The hotel is nice, clean and modern. 
I was however really disappointed by the staff. The door men turn their backs on you when you walk out like you're doing them a disservice staying there. These are the fist people you see when you arrive to a hotel and they couldn't even be bothered to say hello when I arrived. 
The beds aren't made properly. Every single night when I pulled back the duvet to get into bed it would pull out the sheet that I would then i have to tuck back in. I've never seen that before in a hotel and I have stayed in many. 
The staff on the front desk as curt and unpleasant.
I wanted to leave my luggage in the store before my flight. I pretty much had to do it myself. For a 5 star hotel I shouldn't have to do that or even see the store room. Retrieving the luggage was the same thing. 

I could have moved hotels after the 1st night but at that point it's more of a pain than just getting on with the trip. 

I feel I need to leave this review for people travelling to NYC for the 1st time especially. You can get a lot better than the Barclay. Everyone in NYC is really friendly and the service is outstanding. This hotel is some kind of weird anomaly.

Avoid disappointment. 

The Lotte NY Palace is great for midtown and similar price range.

title: Nice hotel but the Destination Fee is a scam
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times but will start looking for other options that don't charge an extra fee.  It was called a Resort Fee here but that seemed silly on its face since the hotel clearly isn't a Resort.  For $35 you get a $25 food credit, free calls (does anyone actually use a hotel phone to place calls?), some coupons for shopping, and a piece of dry cleaning done.  Oh... you also get free Wi Fi--- isn't that free at every coffee place in America? So, nice hotel but that fee is bad form.

title: Wonderful hotel to be back
text:
This is definitely one of my favorite hotels. I only stay here when I am in New York. The lounge staff are some of the nicest, professional and attentive people that I have met in the IC Group. I wanted to especially recognize and thank Silvia Guido. Also, Paulette, Blanca and Josefina are superb. I look forward to returning in April.
Dr. Erick J Mann, PhD
Professor of History and Fulbright Scholar

title: Best Hotel in NYC...without a doubt!
text:
We stayed at the InterContinental New York Barclay from December 30 to January 11 2019. It was my sister and I's first trip to New York ever and the hotel became our home for the time we were there.

Arrival
The service on arrival was faultless. We were greeted, welcomed and checked in within minutes and the person behind the counter was an absolute pleasure to deal with. They even upgraded us to larger suite, something we were truly grateful for.

The Room
Upon entering the room, we were met with what I can only describe as pure immaculate opulence. The room was perfect. Two massive beds with crisp white sheets, large desk, television (which we never watched), huge bathroom and, of course, a coffee machine! We were excited about what our stay here was going to be like, let alone our time in NYC.

During Our Stay
We ate at the hotel restaurant on the first night. Food was delicious. I had my very first NY Pretzel! Cocktails were also fantastic! Throughout our stay, our room came to be our refuge from the busyness that is New York. We were out every single day and night, exploring everything New York had to offer, and coming back to a clean room with our beds made really helped bring a sense of calm and normalcy. The service during our stay was absolutely perfect.

Departure
After what we would consider a "long stay" in NYC, we were excited to be finally going home. Bags packed, elevator down and straight to reception, we were greeted once again. Within 60 secs we were checked out, thanked and a cab organised for our journey to the airport. Truly exceptional service!

Last Words
I think I've said it all. In all, we experienced outstanding and super-friendly customer service that really helped make a difference. Smiles and greets whenever we arrived back after a long day exploring and an immaculate room whenever we entered. If you're looking for a real home-away-from-home, I would highly recommend a stay at the InterContinental New York Barclay. You won't be disappointed! I know I will be back again should ever I visit the "city the never sleeps" again. #happytravels #siblingsabroad

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
We have stayed at the hotel a few times. The hotel is stunning and very central for tourist attractions.
Staff are wonderful from reception to first class housekeeping. The club room staff are excellent.
First class hotel and all staff are very helpful.
On the negative side, we booked through BA and booked the most expensive room available to us on the website. However, on arrival we were shown to our room which was very small. We had to pay an extra 50 dollars per night for a bigger room.
Apart from that, it was a totally first class hotel. We will book again for later this year and will not contemplate staying in any other Manhattan hotel.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: Beautiful entrance to this hotel, we knew we were in New York! Great customer service, very helpful staff, delicious breakfast! Picture of Rockerfellar centre added, short walking distance from the hotel.

title: True NYC!
text:
I've stayed at the Barclay last week and I'm extremely satisfied with my stay. Service is perfect. From easy and fast check-in with room upgrade  to departure  all was perfect! 
I loved the cosyness of my room, bathroom amenities  (especially Barclay-branded accessories). Breakfast is superb! God that orange juice was delicious! 
The renovation is fantastic! Usually they spoil the charm and historic touch of a hotel after renovation...But at the Barclay it's done perfect! 

What I REALLY suggest and even ASK the management  is to put several classic palm trees in lobby area (near marble columns) like it can be seen on a historic pictures. Plants (especially palms) will add more chic and luxury. This kind of interior  simple needs them! Please! PLEASE!

Also I would love to see more bell boys outside to help with luggage.  

Looking forward  to come back! 

P.S. location is PERFECT. I swear it is the best hotel in this district!

Thank you!!!

+ Location is close to Grand Central and moderate walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue shopping

+ Rooms are decent sized, and get good outside light, with remarkable Hudson Valley murals to make up for lack of any real view 

+ Bathrooms are well appointed, with lighted vanity mirrors, ample towels and a clever bidet attachment, which can be useful for more than just spraying your but (although would be nicer if water was warm)

+ There are USB Ports in the clocks next to the bed

+The lobby is spacious and elegant, with ample seating areas flanked by an elegant bar/restaurant and a large reception area

+Bell desk staff is welcoming and helpful, if a bit overwhelmed at times

NOTE: There are plenty of decent restaurants nearby, but the absence of a restaurant in the hotel is curious. Breakfast buffet and room service are pretty decent, if expensive. There are wonderful reception and ballrooms, but we stayed for 11 days in the holiday season and they were only used for one wedding. Curious, possible kitchen limitations?

- I don’t recommend arriving by car. Parking is complicated. Reception on the street is rather chaotic due to the busy narrow street. If there are taxis in the small loading zone in front of the door, you may need to circle the block a few times. Although bell staff is great, you need to leave 20-40 minutes to retrieve your vehicle, and sometimes with traffic it can be much longer.

- There was a slightly overwhelming air-freshener in the lobby and again in the room

- Only a very few rooms have bathtubs and, frankly, they are so small as not to be worth it.

- All of rooms have a rather perplexing set of shower controls- take a while to get used to.

title: Pleasant, well-located hotel but "destination fee" leaves a bad taste in the mouth.
text:
Chose this hotel as a base for a week's holiday in New York on the basis of price, star rating, other reviews and location. We chose a room with 2 double beds. The room had all expected amenities but felt a bit cramped with 2 double beds. Housekeeping and cleaning were excellent although our hotel towelling bathrobes disappeared a few days into the stay and weren't replaced (not enough of a problem for us to mention it during the stay).

The location is excellent if you want to do the tourist "must sees"; most are in walking distance. There are very good coffee shops and restaurants nearby.

The staff were all pleasant and helpful.

The "destination fee" is a problem. We'd read about it in reviews and asked for it to be explained when we checked in sometime around 9.00pm It was explained but we were too tired after a long flight from London, and still on UK time, to take it in properly. It's a compulsory daily fee ($35 by the end of our stay), per room, that entitles you to various "credits" against expenditure in the hotel (eg $25 off 'food and beverages'). If you don't spend up to the fee amount, it can't be carried over to the next day so you spend it in the hotel or lose it. It's a ploy/incentive to get you to spend money in the hotel and it also seems to be a ploy that hotels use to make their room rates on hotel booking sites look lower than they actually are. This hotel doesn't have a traditional restaurant and coffee shop (it serves breakfast and bar snacks) so it has fewer amenities on which to spend your money

We were able to argue that we checked in too late to have a reasonable chance of spending up to the fee on the first day, so we were  given a credit. Also, when we checked out, the bill didn't show how the credits were applied each day so it was hard to check it. The bill did show that the fee had increased from $30 - $35 for the last couple of days. We weren't notified about this in advance so the hotel agreed to refund the increase.

The Barclay does most of what you expect from a decent 4 star hotel. But a good hotel should let you choose whether you want to spend your money in it without using tricks like this to get into your wallet. It felt sad to end a holiday there feeling that we had to check our bill thoroughly because we didn't trust the place to be straight.

title: Great location, comfortable room
text: Was given an upgrade to a superior king and it was spacious with nice, modern, clean amenities.  It also looked onto a street that had no traffic so it was very quiet.  Shower was nice although the handheld shower did not work (I should have reported this to them but forgot).  Just a view into an unused office opposite but as I was there for work that didn't bother me too much, as the quiet was more important.  Only disappointment was that I left my passport in the safe and they didn't try to contact me to let me know they had found it, so something really stressful could have been made better if they had been proactive and emailed or called me rather than just putting it in a bag and handing it into lost property.

title: New Year in New York
text: With my partner and another couple we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over new Year. This is a fabulous hotel, the staff were wonderful from the moment of checking in until we left. They were so friendly and eager to please. Our rooms were lovely and cleaned daily. We had emailed the hotel prior to arriving to tell them of a couple of birthdays and they put cakes in our rooms ... Thank You. The hotel is in a great location, not far from 5th Avenue. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely return.

title: Wonderful Service, Beautiful Hotel
text: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the Intercontinental for a night in December.  We were met outside by a warm and friendly staff who immediately unpacked our car and brought our luggage inside.  The lobby staff was eager to make our check in as seamless as possible and they succeeded.  Our room was clean and beautiful and we loved spending time in the lobby and the Club Intercontinental which was full of delicious snacks and beverages.  The checkout process was easy and everyone was willing to help with a smile.  They even gave our daughter a few rides on the luggage carts which she loved!  All in all a great experience and we would go back in a heartbeat!

title: New Year in New York
text: We have just returned from 5 days in New York for New year and have had a fantastic time and the Intercontinental Barclay added to our special time. From check in, to check out the hotel lived up to our expectations, the reception staff were friendly and helpful as were all the staff we encountered. The rooms were a decent size with very comfortable beds and the rooms were kept very clean. The hotel is in a good location for exploring NYC and we would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here the next time we visit this amazing city.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Stayed for the second time at the property and the hotel is really incredible, the lounge space is one of the best in NY and people at reception are really warm and helpful. The bellboys are so friendly and the rooms are always well appointed.

title: Lovely Hotel but Service was lacking...
text:
After reading the reviews here, I had some high expectations, but sadly, the check-in experience could be best described as "indifferent".  As an Intercontinental ambassador/spire elite, I have access to a more private check-in area.  I would not describe the agent rude, but she was not kind.  She was robotic and even borderline rude at times.  I was not a demanding guest, other than asking for a higher floor, which she was not able to secure.  However, I was checking in at noon, so I did not expect better option.  I booked a Barclay room, which was apparently the highest level of guest room, and since the hotel only has 23 suites, she could not upgrade me to a suite.  I did not ask for any upgrade but somehow she was in this defensive mode.  She offered me either 10,000 points or $50 credit for the inability to upgrade.  The whole check in experience basically ruined my impression.  I used to live in NYC and knew that type of NYC attitude but I am in a 6 stars hotel, so just pretend that you care.  Thankfully I got a different agent for check out.  Honestly the only truly extraordinary staff that I came across was the bell captain, Richie/Richard.  He was kind and helpful.  He seems to be the only one, who knows what service is.  

Since Barclay Room is the highest level of regular guest room, I am just underwhelmed.  It is a nice room but if this is a high level room, I expect more space and at least enough space to put in a sofa.  Anyhow, the bed is comfortable and I appreciate the tiny touches like heated bathroom floor.  However, I am surprised they don't have bedside wireless charging pad, as well as more power outlets.  WIFI, to my pleasant surprise, is truly premium.  

Just a funny side note, I got a $20 food & beverage credit as an ambassador club member.  I got get anything I like including the mini bar.  The prices are just IMHO ridiculous.  I don't know how they can justify charging $9 for a can of 330ml coke, or $10 for a small bottle of Tropicana Orange Juice.  I expect high price, but this kind of prices is just ridiculous.  I recommend folks just use it at the bar, and you can easily get these soft drinks and bottled waters at two nearby 24 hours CVS/Walgreens.  

Honestly I am let down with this experience and seriously doubt that I will return to this hotel again.  For a luxurious hotel, the service just needs to be better.

title: GREAT STAFF AND RENOVATION
text:
I begin with a word of WARNING. We were in NYC on December 24 and found we needed to move to another facility. In my haste to find suitable accommodations, 2 king size rooms, one with adjoining double double, I began an Internet search. Several locations could not satisfy our needs for 6 nights. The toll free number I found was NOT the Intercontinental’s. It was a room finder. Several conversations, the last of which was in the lobby of the Barclay after I prepaid for the rooms, I learned I was lied to about accommodations and charged for a non existent type room. GREAT NEWS, Sharon, a wonderful front desk staff person and PETER , Front desk supervisor, took immediate attention to our plight. We were provided with the accommodations we wanted. (I am protesting the erroneous prepaid charges.)
NOW THE BEST. My wife and family had stayed many times at the Barclay in the past because of its great location and staff. When the Barclay closed for 2 years for renovations and remodeling we went elsewhere. This was our first return. My daughter and son  were extremely impressed with the renovation as were we. THE STAFF from front desk to room service and housekeeping are some of the best in NYC.  6 nights in NYC,for the Christmas holiday, were wonderful because of the BARCLAY. NUMBER 1 Hotel in our opinion.

title: Beautiful and clean hotel. Make sure you take a debit or credit card!
text:
We arrived at the hotel two days after Christmas and stayed for a week into the new year. On arrival, the member of staff on reception explained that as our destination fee had been included in our package deal, we didn't have to worry about paying it. The destination fee, I believe, is around $30 per day, but you get a $25 credit each day that must be spent by midnight. This credit can be used in the Gin Parlour and will not accumulate if left unspent on any day. You will also be required to provide a credit or debit card as a $500 security deposit: this will show as pending on your account but no money will actually be taken unless you use the mini bar, for example.
The rooms themselves are very clean and as beautiful as the reception area and Gin Parlour. The maids clean the rooms and replace the towels every day, without fail. All of the staff seemed to be very friendly and always smiled. I would definitely return to this conveniently located hotel and will recommend to anyone I know who plans to visit New York.

title: Best Hotel and Service in NY
text: Wish I could give this hotel more stars. I had the pleasure of staying at this gorgeous hotel this past weekend with my family. We are New Yorkers so we did not really need to stay at hotel for one night, but we were celebrating two very special occasion, so I thought, why not. We were greeted by wonderful, warm, and very welcoming staff. Once we got to our rooms we were shocked to find enormous rooms with exquisite decor nicely coordinated adjacent to one another. This one night stay was nothing short of amazing. Thanks to Hotel Manager Jeff K. and Sharon Persaud who made this stay a memorable one. Not only will we recommend this place to all of our friends and family, but we now know where to go in the city should we ever feel the need to escape our day to day escapades once in a while.

title: Thanksgiving Holiday
text: This is the first time I write a review and I'm doing so because of the incredible staff at the Club Lounge.  I took my mom to NY to visit the grandchildren.  Travelling is difficult for my mom and the lounge allowed her to take things easy and feel involved when she couldn't quite deal with walking.  The staff were incredibly kind to us and made sure she was comfortable.  They were always there taking care of the area and making sure we had everything we needed.  Josefina, Paulette and Sylvia were great and made our visit a lot easier.  Thank you!

title: Beautiful, Comfortable Hotel
text: The Intercontinental is located within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Radio City and many other Midtown attractions.  Several subway stations are nearby, too.  The lobby is elegant and hosts a restaurant and bar.  All staff were friendly and helpful.  Our room was a decent size with a comfortable king size bed, closet, desk and refreshment bar.  The bathroom was gorgeous.  I don't think I've seen a more spacious shower in a hotel room.  Thumbs up!

title: Location location location
text:
This hotel is located close to Rockefeller centre, grand Central station..times Square etc.
Rooms are good quality and spacious.
Breakfast is great served in bar area.. which is beautiful.

Hotel staff are pleased to help.. special mention to Angle who calls the cabs!

title: Just for one, everything perfect
text:
We were only in the city for one night to take in an Alvin Ailey performance, with so many choices we decided on the Barclay for its proximity and reviews. From the moment we arrived, James at the front desk welcomed us, selected a perfect room for us, and was professional and courteous. Our room was stylish, immaculate, comfortable, and spacious. The linens, towels, shower, and restful sleep was truly blissful. We even signed up for a rewards program! Pretty sure we found our "go to" accomadations when we travel from the Boston area to NYC
Tannus n' Joe

title: Disappointing hotel. Not a 5 star property!
text:
I stay at many IHG properties. This has to be the most over-rated, unimpressive hotel in IHG. I am an Ambassador member and I booked this hotel because of this program. The benefits were minimal, at best.

I am really big on first impressions. When we arrived, the doorman was friendly and took care of our car, I was very happy. Then we went to the Ambassador check-in area. We were 3rd in line. We were supposedly upgraded to a nicer room. I'll cover that later. So in this hotel, you need a room key, to go up the elevator. Neither of our keys worked. Went back to Ambassador check-in, and there was no line, so we received quick replacement keys. Go up the elevator and the new keys will not open the door. So my partner waits at the room's door and I go back down to Ambassador check-in. There was person with the agent. She said to wait. WAIT!!! This is the second set of keys that don't work! She called out a manager, who made new keys, and then accompanied me to the room. These keys worked. Electronic keys were not invented yesterday. TOTAL FAIL for this hotel! We had dinner reservations, show tickets, and had been on the road for 8 hours. Making people wait for keys, multiple times is just plain wrong!

The room was very nice. Very clean. The bed was comfortable. We did not have the neighbor noise problem as others describe. Matter of fact, I found the room to be quieter than I expected. This is New York City. But, I do not understand how this room was an upgrade since it was just the standard room. 

We had drinks at the lobby bar, Gin Parlour. Our drinks were very good, but expensive. Expect to pay about $20 per drink with no tip. On our 2nd morning, we had the buffet breakfast. This is served behind the bar in the lobby. Seating is limited. Cost of breakfast was $42. The food tasted good with decent variety. But overall, the quality wasn't 5 star hotel level. I generally found the dining and bar staff capable.

Our departure was another mess. The bill didn't include everything, like our parking, even though the car was parked 2 days earlier. The hotel also doesn't have change of US money. The excuse of a holiday weekend was just another excuse for poor service. Although the door man was the same friendly guy that we had at check-in. Maybe management should have him training the rest of the staff?

All in all, an average stay at a supposedly 5 star hotel. That is the issue. This isn't a 5 star property, not even close. I also did not care for the location. Great for shopping, but not sightseeing. We will not stay here again.

title: Perfect
text: Just perfect. Beautiful centrally located hotel with very friendly staff and excellent service. Rooms are very modern and comfortable. Bed is extremely comfortable. Close to public transport (metro and train).

title: Great location but not all good
text:
I love the location of the hotel and the room I’m currently in is well appointed, spacious and meticulously clean at all times.

On the downside my credit card was swiped on arrival to cover the $30 per room per day but on checking my account I have been charged $100 a day? This was not explained to me when my card was “swiped” and I’m really hoping it’ll be refunded.

In addition yesterday at around 18:00 I asked for some coffee pods as we were only provided with 1 each and we had already used them. These never arrived so I didn’t have coffee when I woke (struggling to sleep due to jet-lag)

Part of the reason for my lack of sleep is also that the walls are paper-thin and the couple next door decided that 02:30 was a good time to get amorous the night before last. 

Despite all that I would probably stay here again or at least somewhere nearby.

title: Beware of hidden charges
text:
The Intercontinental Barclay is In an excellent location. The rooms are beautiful although lack sound proofing because you can hear the conversation happening in the room next door. The service is what you’d expect from a 5 star hotel. I actually really like this hotel. 

So why am I only giving 2 stars? The answer is because of the hidden charges that are applied to your room rate. A little bit about me. I have platinum status with 2 major global airlines, and silver with a 3rd. I spend 50+ nights a year staying in hotels and I’ve stayed at this hotel a few times. This is my 1st hotel review and this was the 1st time I’ve had a “destination fee” of $30 (plus tax) per day applied to my bill. The “destination fee” is NOT applied to corporate room rates. 

What is a “destination fee?“ - Currently 100 NYC hotels out of 700+ Apply a destination fee. This is currently $30 (plus tax) which is applied to your bill daily to make your stay more enjoyable....Eg. it allows you to enter the restaurant free of charge - why is a hotel even charging guests a restaurant entry fee? When people can walk in off the street and use the restaurant for free. There isn’t any guidelines on what destination fees cover. It’s just an amount the hotel can add to your daily rate. 

The “destination fee” is a hidden charge allowing the hotel to offer a lower daily rate when it’s really $30 per night higher. You will not see the destination fee as a line item. It’s hidden in “taxes and service charges”. The destination fee is also increasing. The Hotel’s General Managers decides what “destination fee” is applied. It’s not applied to corporate rates. 

When booking a hotel in NYC you might want to consider a boutique hotel that is more honest and transparent in the actual daily room rate. Check if a hidden charge is going to be applied.

title: Good, but...
text:
...while the staff is typically friendly (and I haven’t booked as a IHG Gold member) there were still some unpleasant issues during our stay. 

On arrival day it took housekeeping more than four (4) hours to bring two pairs of slippers to our room. We had to wait until 1am to finally be able to slip into something more comfy. Annoying. 

And while working out in the gym at 7pm the cleaning crew passed, cleaned up a bit (omitting a couple of littered plastic cups) and turned off the gym’s lights on me when leaving the room. Not to mention no ‘hello’ or ‘good bye’ was uttered. Not nice. 

Rooms are clean and well equipped, nothing to argue here. The walls could be thicker to drown out the amorous adventures of the couple next door though :)).

title: Check your bill and then recheck it
text: We stayed at the Barclay as a family in 2 rooms. The morning that we checked out I reviewed the bill. Our package included all local and international calls. Notwithstanding, we were billed for long distance calls. When I pointed this out, they corrected the bill. I then approved the final bills and paid by credit card. When I received my credit statement, I noticed that they charged us an extra $104 « package overage ». I called the hotel and they couldn’t explain the charge. We had to make several long distance calls to follow up on our complaint. They said that accounting would look at it in a couple of days. Finally we were told that the charge will be reversed. Another error on their part ( in their favor). But at the end of the day, the long distance charges incurred to resolve the issue and the foreign currency exchange  fees we incurred on the reversal, exceed the amount in question. Not to mention an hour of our time. Very disappointing.

title: disappointing!
text:
Location is central.  Love the thick carpet and slippers.

That said, none of the front desk staff acknowledged my Spire Ambassador status, nor did I get any room upgrade.  Also, didn’t get any food & beverage credit or any complimentary mineral water during my stay.

Rather disappointing!

Ps beware of the extra destination/resort fee.

title: The perfect stay!
text: My wife and I have stayed here a few times. I will keep it simply by saying it is absolutely incredible from check in to check out. Annmara at the Ambassador Check in is absolutely wonderful. She has quite the personality and made me laugh. She took great care of my wife and I and made sure we had everything and more for our stay. At the bar there is Jose and Herman. Two incredible bartenders, who know how to make a cocktail. They keep us entertained and make sure we have fresh drinks. The main lobby itself is stunning. The rooms are super clean and comfy. If you are looking for a fantastic hotel this is it!

title: Excellent Hotel, Staff, and Location
text: We stayed in a king corner suite and had the adjoining double room over Christmas with family of 5.  The room was older and had a lot of character (including a fireplace!), yet everything looked really new and very nice.  Bath was amazing, including a heated floor.  The staff here was extremely professional and very welcoming.  Location, just off Park Avenue, was really convenient--5 minutes or less walk to 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, etc. We used the pull-out sofa, and needed sheets late at night--two staff members brought the sheets and completely set up the bed for my daughter, which was beyond what I expected.  This was our first visit, but it will not be our last--excellent hotel!

title: Pricey but lovely
text: We stayed here over New Year for 5 nights. Beautifully restored with a 1920s look, very helpful staff - the concierge is great for bookings and discounted vouchers to various attractions. Rooms are well appointed with everything you would expect from a four star hotel but not particularly big - Premier Inn rooms are bigger. We had standard rooms so I'm guessing the more expensive rooms have more space. Great location for mid town Manhattan, easy walk to 5th Ave, Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building, Empire State etc etc. Loads of restaurants nearby and a great deli just across the road, with a lovely coffee shop on the opposite corner. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel - very expensive but I'm sure both would be excellent. There is a 30 dollar per day "destination fee" which entitles you to various discounts on hotel amenities which took us by a bit of a surprise, but otherwise no complaints. Not cheap, but highly recommended.

title: Breakfast was awful Luke warm each day!!!!
text:
Room absolutely lovely . Minibar extortionate!!!! Nice and clean.
Rude staff on reception. 
Breakfast came in with our 5 night holiday, 
If we had to pay 110.00 dollars , which was on the bill then Not a chance would I have paid this amount!!! 
Given wrong room initially. BA Customer services gent sorted this problem out.....may I add NOT RECEPTION!!! 
Location great.

title: Lindo, bem localizado e bastante limpo
text:
Excelente localização, muito bonito, bem frequentado e lindo.
Tive uma ótima estadia em NY. Próximo ao metrô e a diversos pontos turísticos.
Servem café da manhã no quarto caso solicite, o que é maravilhoso em dias de frio. Oferecem descontos a algumas atrações, e serviço de recebimento de correspondência / ou entrega.

title: Brilliant Hotel and Brilliant Staff
text:
This hotel is located in mid Manhattan, just 5 mins from Grand Central Station, handy to get around to north and south Manhattan.

Staff could not do enough for us and were very friendly, just ask and they will accommodate you as best they can👍

With definitely be staying here again on our next visit 👍

If you can book club lounge, you get a wonderful breakfast, with lots of choice which covers most world tastes. However fantastic scrambled eggs, crispy bacon and toast suited my Anglo Saxon needs. Nibbles and sandwiches throughout the day and a hot and cold buffet from 5pm to 8pm, also complementary free booze, getting tucked in to that good red wine! You will save money doing like this, as you will be paying top dollar for the above if you go with the cheaper booking option!

Please note, pre order tickets to the attractions prior to your holiday, this will save time having to queue to buy the, sometimes 1 to 2 hours and then queuing again to enter the attractions. As for the the Empire State pre book red carpet fast track tickets and will save hours of time you will never get back again!!!!

Con men operate on the Brooklyn Bridge, so if someone is trying to give you a music CD for free, put your head down and walk past as quickly as possible and they can be aggressive too!!!

Lots of attractions are walking distance and sometimes getting a taxis can be slow, due to the busy traffic systems on a evening. 

I would recommend "The Book of Mormon " as it more un PC than London and is just very very funny 👍

We found Bloomingdale's store the best store with a great deal of branded clothing half price when we were there. Also if you speak to concierge service they give you a card to get an additional 15% off a this store👍

Hope this review is a help especially to folk who not been to NY before👍

Sorry before I go, make sure you pre book tickets for the ground zero museum, this will save you hours of queuing. Also be respectful and don't take photos.  Remember this a mass grave too 👍

title: Great Hotel, would stay again
text: Great hotel, good location, can't really fault it at all.  Only thing I would say is we upgraded our room to a superior room at a small cost and i didn't really think it was much of an upgrade. Overall, i would stay at this hotel again

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
text: The location is amazing. The staff are friendly, the rooms are very nice, comfortable, not much of a view and very very very poorly cleaned, even after several complaints, nothing changed. They even refuse to keep giving us the free water bottles every night so we have to keep asking for them. The Concerige didn't help much with reservations over emails before we arrived. The breakfast is nice but pricy. The gym is pretty good for its size. The wifi is good and free, nice Club Lounge, with very good food and drinks. If they really focus on keeping it clean it would be a great hotel.

title: Best place to stay in New York
text: A BA representative advised me to book this hotel and thankfully I took that advice.  This hotel is situated in Midtown, the best place to be.  You can walk from this location (or take the tube) to everywhere and anywhere that is worth visiting in the city.  Great service, great bar.  Lovely bed and pillows.  Large bathroom full of everything you could need. Slipper and robes to die for.  I hope to come back soon and this is where I will stay.

title: Excellent All Around
text: Stayed overnight while visit NYC to see the holiday decorations and shop.  The hotel is located just steps away from GCT so perfect if taking the train into the city.  The hotel is gorgeous and evokes the old school charm and well appointed.  The room was a bit small but very nice. Service was friendly as well.  The lobby bar is also great although prices are steep as one would expect at a top line NY hotel.  Very comfortable bed and well appointed bathroom. Loved everything about it and will definitely be on our list of places to stay when in the city.

title: First time in New York
text:
We arrived at this lovely hotel and were immediately told we had been upgraded to a corner suite. The room was so beautiful and helped make my first trip to New York more special.  My boyfriend has been to NY 5 times before and he was also impressed with the hotel.
The room was so luxurious and beautifully clean.  All the staff we came into contact with were so nice and helpful.
Would I return to this hotel?  A big fat yes from me!!!! you can’t top perfection.
Thank you all soooo much and thank you to my Frank for arranging it.
Oh yes and the bed was divine 🤗🤗

title: Excellent hotel for a city break.
text:
Easy hotel to find. It isn’t too far from the ‘action’ as it’s a 10-15 minute walk to most tourist places like Times Square, grand central terminal and the Rockefeller centre.
Check in was a breeze, pleasent receptionist who had an amazing welcoming attitude, made us feel right at home straight away. 
Got a corner suite that had the most amazing bed... seriously.. it was perfect.. as soon as you lay on it, you fell asleep,,. 
Really nice shower room, very clean and a heated floor to boot.. perfect when getting out of the shower.
Concierge were very helpful for every time that we asked for help, from moving luggage around, helping us to taxi’s or just pointing us in the right direction.
Would stay again in a heartbeat...

There is a resort fee of $35 per day that we were told in advance of so it was budgeted for.. with this you get $25 credit in the bar, some dry cleaning, wi fi and the gym... couldn’t complain as it was enough for a couple of drinks after a hard day of walking...
The only downside is the bar staff are the most arrogant that I have ever experienced... you can stand around waiting for acknowledgment for ages, until they deem you have spent enough time waiting. This was every day...

title: Comfortable and well located 5 star hotel
text:
I stayed at this hotel with my daughter and a friend and her daughter in October for 4 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location in the heart of midtown, close to the metro station, but on a quiet (for NYC) block. The room was spacious by New York standards and very well appointed, clean and had an exceptionally comfortable bed and good sound proofing and double glazing, we slept well!

My only criticism is that the hotel charged my debit card with the resort and city taxes which I had already paid as part of my booking with BA holidays. However once I pointed this out they were quick to refund me. 

We didn’t eat at the hotel so do not have any feedback on the restaurant but liked the ambience in the bustling lobby.

title: HAPPY HOLIDAYS IN NEW YORK - DECEMBER 2019
text:
This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel. It has become our 1st choice hotel in New York due to the General Manager Sofia Vandaele and her great team who provided us with excellent friendly service and make us feel so welcome. We were particularly looking forward to staying at the hotel during the Christmas holidays and we were not disappointed given the wonderful Christmas atmosphere and ambience created by hotel. The hotel has a great location for shopping and restaurants in mid town with many attractions within walking distance.

During our stay It was my wife's birthday and the hotel organised a great surprise for my wife to celebrate her birthday with flowers and chocolates.

Thank you for a very special Christmas Holiday experience.

Deborah & Keith

title: Disappointed Experience
text: Although the hotel and room is nice and clean, the restaurant experience was beyond disappointing. Breakfast was included ($42/person brunch). Spread was OK. Staff was rude and extremely unhelpful. Three people were squished at a tight 2 person table, when we asked to be moved to a bigger table, we were told no (despite the restaurant being half empty). Asking for salsa at brunch was a surcharge to the $42 brunch. We came one night to order tea and desserts after dinner, the waiter left mid order and never came back. Beyond frustrating considering the price payed for the hotel.

title: OK - but too expensive.
text: Nice hotel. Clean. Good location. Facilities barely up to the 4½ star status. Service OK. All in all OK - but NOT something special - and NOT worth the high price. The standard rooms are TOO small - for the price.

title: Another Amazing Stay At The Barclay
text:
When traveling to New York City this hotel is where I stay 100% of the time. As I’ve reviewed this hotel extensively in the past I’m going to use this review to point out how the staff at the property consistently goes above and beyond to ensure nothing short of perfection. Specifically I’d like to mention the entire staff that operates the Club Lounge, housekeeping, and concierge. 

As I’ve said in previous reviews the only other domestic Intercontinental Club Lounge that even comes close to this one is San Francisco, however The Barclay’s is still a step above. Sylvia in the lounge takes the term “Above and Beyond” to a level setting the bar so high that I can’t imagine any hotel in the city coming even close to the service provided by her and the entire Club Lounge team.

I’d also like to take a moment to point out a specific member of the night housekeeping staff. Alfie set the bar so high that I’m not sure any hotel will ever beat it. Keeping in mind that we had a large suite she was always able to clean the room and turndown down both bedrooms without being seen. I’m not sure exactly how she managed this but it was like magic. We could leave the room for 20 minutes or 4 hours and it didn’t matter. The room was cleaned and turned down each and every time we left in the evening. On out final night we had the chance to speak with Alfie. She is a true asset to your hotel and she alone would have been enough to ensure future visits.

Finally the concierge, Norman. This was a very special trip for my mother and I. I phoned the hotel to ask if they could do anything to make the room feel a bit like home. When we first entered the room we noticed that it was full of framed family photos going back 4 generations.

It’s details like this that truly set the bar and set hotels like the Barclay apart. When you find yourself in New York I can’t recommend this hotel enough. It’s a gem in a sea of Urban hustle.

Trust me💯🥶☺️☺️👹👹

title: Lovely stay in NYC
text: After having read the reviews I was worried that i had made the wrong choice. On arrival we were greatly warmly by very attentive staff and checked in to our room. The double beds are small but we never had any issues with this even though we are used to a superking at home. The room was very clean, well decorated and we received a number of written cards and small gestures from the front desk during our stay. The maids were very polite, attentive and left chocolates and coffees each night during turn down service. We didn't use our resort fee allowance but this wasnt an issue for us. On check out we used the lobby to catch some last minute wifi and rest before our journey home. The staff were clearly hard working and I never encountered anyone rude, quite the opposite in fact. I'm not sure why people are so dissatisfied in their reviews here, I couldnt fault anything. A wonderful trip before xmas in the big city x

title: Love The bar
text:
Stayed at the hotel for a business trip and brought some clients to the bar in the lobby one evening. Maurizio took such wonderful care of us. He remembered what each of us were drinking and was quick and friendly with each round. He made my business meeting very seamless and fun. 

The room was clean and comfortable, and the other service in the hotel was friendly and professional. Highly recommended!

title: Great location, Indifferent attitude
text:
Stayed here on my way to London. Rooms are dated, lack modern amenities. 
Lack of restaurants in the hotel. There should be something outside of the bar and on,y one restaurant which was not great.
Service was slow and inferior. The bellman were MIA.
There are so many options in NYC. Try other hotels.

title: Pre Christmas break
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay . Hotel in an excellent location for shopping and sightseeing. Service excellent. From check in to check out it was spot on. Great continental breakfast range. Great sized rooms for families as well . Would recommend to anyone going to the “Big Apple”.

title: Beautiful central hotel
text: Lovely comfortable hotel in a great location! We loved the big comfortable bed and how central the hotel was so we could basically walk to most attractions/sights. The only thing which let the hotel down was the service in the bar restaurant area. The service was slow and one of the bar staff was very rude to us. We arrived and sat down at a table and after about 10 minutes asked a passing waiter for a menu. He replied with 'I'm too busy, ask someone else'. I have stayed in several intercontinental hotels and this kind of service is very out of character for the hotel and standards we expected. Its a real shame the service let them down as both the cocktails and food were 10/10! With this in mind we would still return to the hotel and just avoid the bar.

title: Lovely hotel but staff let it down
text:
Hotel is stunning and is well located. We had a lovely stay. The breakfast food was lovely and well stocked. 

The room was lovely and well decorated and hot shower. 

Only complaints- destination charge isn’t great. Felt obliged to spend in hotel to get us out of it, and bar so expensive two drinks sent you bill to 40 dollars. 

Very small space at bar so often no room to sit.

Staff weren’t that friendly. I told my husband how friendly Americans are, but we got a very different experience. I think I’ve had better guest services in a budget 30 dollar a night hotel. 

Every request seemed too much and they didn’t even take your suitcases to your room which I found very odd when every hotel does this, even budget ones. Also, they seemed reluctant to take your luggage to the store room and made you do it yourself. 

Please make sure you have staff that go above and beyond please, in the future, it will change the experience completely.

title: Great Location / Great Stay
text:
I am a little shocked at some of the previous negative reviews, our stay was completely different in comparison to these other posts.

We stayed two nights at this property, and its location is amazing. Its so easy to get around either by foot or Subway which is within walking distance from the hotel.

The property itself feels warm and welcoming with a great Christmas vibe, and the room that we had was more than adequate for our stay. It was clean, well appointed with a super comfortable bed, and most importantly...quiet, in a city like New York.

I would like to say a very big thank you to Sharon on the front desk who completed our check in and check out, Sharon is a true ambassador to the IHG and Intercontinental brand and made our stay with the Intercontinental New York Barclay a memorable one.

title: Very poor service and rude staff
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay. The hotel is in a great location and is clean and tidy with larger than average rooms for NYC however that’s where the positivity ends! With the exception of one of the door men, every member of staff we had any dealings with were rude, uninterested and abrupt. A special mention must go to the bar staff who were so rude that my very mild mannered husband nearly lost his cool. My husband ordered 2 drinks at the bar and brought them to our table as our friend arrived so he  went back to order another and the bar man literally shouted at him to sit down and he’d bring the last drink over! The bill for that one drink then included an $8 service charge!!! Who we checked out the reception staff tried to charge us tax even though we’d already paid it in the uk. No apology or how was your stay, we literally felt like we were a nuisance staying there! Will not be returning

title: Amazing stay
text: This was our second time staying at this hotel and we were just as impressed as the first time.  The location is ideal- centrally located in midtown, but far enough removed from crowds of Times Square. The room was updated and spotless.  The service was great in every aspect- check-in, maid-service, valet and at the bar.  This is just an exceptionally run hotel, and we will stay here again

title: Disappointing guest experience- bizarre hotel
text:
This hotel has the worst guest service I’ve ever experienced- no one ever answers phone when you call front desk or concierge - and when they do if they do they are not particularly friendly. 
Rooms are fine- nothing special - 
Booked for three yet only had one bathrobe, had to call twice to get two more AC and still no joy. I had constantly had to chase for everything , blankets for rollaway bed , cups - one thing after the other. This is not a hotel that prizes it’s guests , in fact you finder whether they realise you’re even here !!! 

This hotel feels sterile and cold with little warmth in service or atmosphere, would not recommend or return.

title: un peu déçu
text:
Petite déception que cet hôtel pourtant l'un des mieux côté à Manhattan.L'accueil à la réception est un peu froid et distant ( peut être notre anglais ?? ) Dans l'ensemble,c'est un très bon hôtel,très bien situé sur la 48e rue, pas loin du RC et de Times Square avec un beau lobby.La chambre est spacieuse et très confortable avec tout le nécessaire.Un pdj excellent avec un super buffet et des produits de qualité.
Un petit merci à Morgane ( française) qui nous accueilli pour notre premier pdj.Très sympa.
Petit bémol pour cet hôtel:le bar du lobby qui sert à la fois de bar,de resto pour le dîner et pour le pdj , la structure n'étant pas très grande pour tout cela , surtout quand il y a beaucoup de séminaires,les places devenant rares.
A conseiller pour la situation dans Manhattan.

title: Central location and helpful staff
text: I stayed at this hotel with my wife on a holiday. Before our arrival and during our stay the staff were very helpful and were not abrupt unlike some other places we have stayed in New York. It is also a well located hotel that is very convenient to many places of interest as well as the subway. It also only has one restaurant that may be limiting, although we ate out the nights we were staying. We stayed in a club room that provided access to the club lounge which had a good breakfast each morning.

title: Cannot eat past 11:30pm at this hotel
text: Shocking and disappointing. We came back to our hotel after a show on a weekend in December and they said they stopped serving food in the lobby bar (it was 11:20pm) we went to the front desk where they also said yes no food at all at the property after 11:30 (although again it wasn't 11:30 yet). The front desk person proceeded to suggest a GROCERY STORE for us to get something to eat and sadly nothing around the area was open. SO not NYC. Not a great location if you want to be a part of the action and for goodness sake have a bite to eat after 11:20pm/ Shame. Isn't this the city that doesn't sleep??? Horrible and rude customer service all around. On top of all of this -- we waited forever for our room to be available even after calling for early check in, the basic rooms are super small.

title: Terrible service, stay elsewhere
text:
Unfortunately, the service you receive is terrible.

In order to expense the stay to my company, I requested a receipt via the mobile app. 
 It never arrived.  I requested it again to a different email address.  It also never arrived.  I waited a day.  Checked my spam folders.  Still no receipt.

I therefore called the hotel.  The first time, they couldn't hear me, even though I had good reception.  I called again and this time they were able to hear.  They sent me a receipt.

On it, I noticed I was charged $13 for the minibar--I don't even drink.  I called the hotel to ask them about this charge.  They transferred me to the bar phone line.  It went to voicemail which wasn't set up yet so I couldn't leave a message.  

I therefore called the front desk again.  They apologized and told me that the person from the bar is expecting me and they would transfer me again.  The phone rang multiple times at the bar with no answer.  It went to voicemail again.

I called the front desk again.  This time, it went straight to voicemail.

This is unacceptable.  I have started traveling quite frequently and am now hesitant to stay at another IHG.

title: Disappointing
text:
My husband and I stayed in a suite.  We have always enjoyed our stays at the Intercontinental Hotels in Europe, truly outstanding, but this hotel in NYC was a huge disappointment. One does not want to meet a statue bust on a stand wasting space already very small accommodation. It did not meet the quality standards compared to Inter Cont. in Europe.  Housekeeping though was excellent. But the receptionists at check-in were unfriendly and superior.  As in previous InterC. in Europe staying in suites includes access to the Club Room, but not this time USD 100.- extra for that.  This hotel needs updating in every way.

Judith and Gestur Arnason

title: Moderate
text:
So, the good bits first - the location is good, the gin bar is quite nice and housekeeping keep the rooms immaculately clean. 
However, the Barclay misses the mark somewhat for the price it charges.  The facilities in the room are not really up to snuff for the price and also given facilities at competitors just across or down the road.  For example, power outlets, for a hotel in that price bracket you'd nowadays expect the ubiquitous bank of sockets for US, European or UK devices that's become pretty standard, instead you're let scrabbling about on the carpet for somewhere to plug your laptop in (until you spot the ones hidden on the alarm clock - the obvious place for power outlets). If you drink tea, you're out of luck, you've got a choice of coffee or some dubious green-ish tea in the room. The turndown service is somewhat random - we were there six nights - one night we even got a chocolate on the pillow. 
Secondly, the IHG Ambassador status, which IHG seem to push quite heavily is a total con.
