The words "guaranteed upgrade" are used on the website - LOL, and little things like complimentary mineral water are also promised, but when you enquire about these, and why they're conspicuous by their absence, you'll likely be met with a surly receptionist who will look at you like you've just asked for a return ticket to the moon.  
Also, if you're thinking of eating at the restaurant or having breakfast here, you might want to consider selling an organ first, it's overpriced, even for nyc.

title: I sogni si avverano
text:
Se desiderate raggiungere New York e soggiornare in un ottimo hotel, vi consiglio di scegliere l’InterContonental  New York Barclay! Bello, bello davvero. La hall, i servizi, gli addobbi natalizi e la camera a due letti che avevo visto nei film. Pulizia, cortesia e comodità perfette. La colazione allineata a quella di altri hotel dello stesso target. Noi  siamo stati benissimo; grandi spazi, letti comodissimi, biancheria avvolgente.
Posizione invidiabile, a pochi passi dalla Fifth Avenue.

title: Perfekte Lage
text:
Vom Hozel war unsere Buchungsentscheidung
Check in war perfekt und der Service in dem Bereich ist sehr gut
Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 4 ten Stock und dort fanden/finden Renovierungen statt
Damit hätten keine Ruhe am Nachmittag 
Es war aus meiner Sicht etwas zu laut , da wir Geräusche unserer Nachbar hören konnten
Nett ist, wenn eine Kaffeemaschine im Raum ist, aber sie funktionierte nicht
Ein Angebot an Tafelwasser sucht man vergeblich
Auch wenn wir häufig interco buchen und Expire Member sind , reicht das Preis Leistungsverhätnid nicht für gut aus

title: Very nice hotel
text:
I had a few days of business in midtown, and had always wanted to try the Intercontinental Barclay.  I am so glad I did.  While the hotel is in Midtown East, it’s very well located for all of midtown and is basically a stone’s throw from Grand Central.

The hotel was recently renovated from top to bottom, and it definitely shows.  Absolutely every surface was fresh, and had a kind of a modern take on a federalist style.  It was a nice change of pace from the cold modernism and/or the Hollywood Regency style that seems to be everywhere now. 

I was traveling solo, so the entry-level room was absolutely fine for me, and actually felt quite spacious — even though the square footage description indicates it was not particularly spacious for any American city other than New York.  The room had all the bells and whistles you would expect in a hotel of this class.  The bed was comfortable, the mini bar was filled, and the room was very, very quiet.

My only knock on the hotel – and it certainly is not a large one — is that the restaurant is literally part of the bar.  It’s a great bar — don’t get me wrong there — but after spending a few evenings around that bar, it would be nice to have another space for dinner.  

I would definitely return, and have already recommended it to colleagues who have business in the area.

title: My favorite NYC hotel
text:
My hubby and I do quite a few of NYC "staycations" when we need a little one or two night break, so we've stayed at a lot of different NYC properties.  However, lately it's been very difficult for me to consider booking our stay some place other than the InterContinental New York Barclay.  

For me, it has a terrific confluence of elements to make me happy about a hotel.  It's a beautiful balance of old and new -- although it opened in 1926, it's been lovingly renovated so that it has an old New York elegance but still provides 21st century comfort, like the HVAC and plumbing, for example.   Elevators are efficient.  The new furniture is "real" -- sometimes you show up at a hotel that looks great online but then realize upon arrival that the furniture is only a bit better than if it were on a theatrical set.  Here the furniture is quality.

The staff are pretty much universally service-oriented.  The only place where I sometimes experience less-than-attentive service is in the Gin Parlour.  Otherwise the staff are friendly, helpful and professional.  Lately we have been booking rooms that include access to the Club Intercontinental lounge.  It's located just behind the Gin Parlour and it's a fantastic "add" to our stay --- there are snacks and beverages, a breakfast buffet, and afternoon hors d'oeuvres.  I love that there is nitro cold-brew on tap and bottles of French sparkling water.  It's a comfy place to hang out, too, with lots of tables and chairs, it's own restroom, and a conference room you can book if you need one.  My only wish is that they were open later in the evening as I'd love to be able to hang out here with a cup of something after dinner but, alas, they usually close at 8 p.m.

My hubby is an InterContinental Ambassador which gives us a few extra positives including a 4 p.m. check-out, a little upgrade to the room, and a special check-in desk in the concierge area.  When we walk in the front door and get a whiff of whatever scent they pump into the lobby, I immediately feel happy and relaxed strolling to the check-in desk because I know that I'll soon feel like I'm back in my NYC "home."

title: とても素敵なホテルでした。ロケーション雰囲気最高です！
text: 11/28から２泊しました。入ってすぐのクリスマスツリーやデコレーションもホリデームードを盛り上げています。５番街やMOMAからも頑張れば徒歩圏で、地下鉄の駅も近く、主要な観光地に行くのにはとても便利でした。道をはさんで向かいに２４時間営業のコンビニ（スーパーというには小さいけどデリとイートインスペースがあり）があり、朝食はそちらでいただきました。こちらのホテルの後に、6thAve.にある別のホテルで２泊しましたが、ホテル内もホテルの外も新宿駅くらい混んでいて部屋に戻るだけで大変でした。出来ることならこちらに戻ってきたかったくらいです。

title: Wonderful hotel, excellent staff and great location
text: We stayed at the InterContinental New York Barclay for a family trip over Thanksgiving.  Excellent experience!  The team at the hotel was extremely helpful both ahead of and during our stay.  The General Manager Sofia was an absolute delight.  Our room was quiet, clean and well-appointed.  The location of the hotel was great for proximity to Times Square, Broadway shows, etc.  We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
text: Stayed in the New York Barclay for 4 nights for a family trip - everything was superb! Our room was lovely, staff so helpful and everywhere was well presented and top standard. It’s a great location - we walked everywhere in Manhattan but it’s next door to an entry to Grand Central if you wanted to get the subway or taxis are in regular passing. We were blown away by our stay and wouldn’t hesitate to return if in NYC again!

title: stay at intercontinental Barclay
text: nice hotel in New York, great location . Weak for bars and restaurant inside the hotel but go outside , there are plenty . Exec lounge is not big but good enough if you go for work . A good value for money

title: Business
text:
The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Central Park Station, Rockerfella Centre and Times Square. 

The hotel lobby has a strange smell but thankfully the rooms are comfortable and clean. Unfortunately the rooms don’t come with complimentary drinking water like most hotels. They were renovated in 2013 and the bathrooms are nice and modern. 

The beds are comfortable and heating works well, nice and silent. There’s a great coffee place called Ole and Steen  next door which serves really delicious sandwiches and pastries and coffee.

Concierge service is hit and miss but the most helpful was an Asian guy and a lovely lady with great personality and curly hair.

title: Great hotel suite 1138..
text: Everything went like clockwork thanks to Peter on reception. He was able to solve a an early arrival and late departure with helpful suggestions taking the stress out of our arrival.  Many thanks see you next time

title: Don’t dare to shop online during your stay at the Barclay!
text: I’ve stayed 5 times (2-3 nights per stay) in 2019.  Overall a very good hotel: nice rooms, good service, great location in midtown, and decent price vs quality.  My last stay will most likely be the last though. When I checked out I saw a 90usd charge in my bill labeled “package handling fee”.  I decided to shop online and had the packages sent to the hotel during my stay only to find out that each had cost me 30usd more just to be received at the hotel!  It’s totally unacceptable to get charged for this in an era when online shopping is the name of the game.  Anyways, I sent an email complaining, and didn’t even get a reply.  If you’re looking for a great hotel with no package handling fees, try the Lotte New York Palace, huge rooms, 3 blocks away from the Barclay, great quality and online shopping friendly.

title: No show fee was charged on the Rewards night booking
text:
No show fee was charged on the Rewards night booking. Hotel didn't make this policy clear enough at the time of the booking and when I called them to figure it out they didn't want to help out at all. 
Not to mention that they were bouncing me back and forth between different employees at the hotel and one them agreed with me that there should be no No Show charge on the rewards booking.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: We stayed here from 25th To 29th November and had an Amazing stay, we were lucky enough to be here for Thanksgiving so got to see the Christmas decorations and this was wonderful display, our room was spotless and had everything we needed, the staff are all friendly and we even met the general manager in the lift and she was most friendly, I cannot recommend this hotel enough and we will definitely stay here again thank you very much intercontinental Barclay for a wonderful trip

title: Lovely stay
text: Quite rare to find a ho tel in NY with coffee maker in the room, makes it less of a rush in the morning to get to breakfast.  Large rooms and beautifully clean bathroom (rm 839). Nice, informal bar. Recommend it.

title: Muy disgustado
text:
Teníamos la habitación reservada hasta las 16 y pagamos un extra importante por ello.

A las 15:30 llamo al Ambassador Front Desk
Mi hija para decir mi mujer se encontraba muy mal y si podíamos alargar la estancia en la habitación 15/30 minutos.

La respuesta fue que si, si pagábamos 150 USD, sin preguntar si era grave, si necesitaba un medico ni nada de nada, solo la pasta!!!!!

Una auténtica vergüenza. Dejamos corriendo l habitación y fui a quejarme personalmente a la recepcionista del Ambassador Department y ni caso!!!

Pedi por la directora del hotel que tan solo se disculpó ligeramente.

Le dije que era la
Última vez en el hotel y ni se inmutó.

NUNCA MAS!!

Desayuno carísimo, recepción muy pobre y si a penas sitio para sentarse, etc...

title: Ultimately can't recommend
text: Spent 5 days over the long Thanksgiving weekend. Have always been a fan of InterCon hotels in my travels - Singapore to Sydney, Lisbon to London. Definitely not the same experience here that you get overseas. Customer service is underwhelming, especially in the Club Lounge, the restaurant, and check-out.  Prepare to be ignored by the wait staff in the restaurant while waiting for coffee or the bill. Preferred to seat guests all squashed into the same corner of the restaurant instead of spreading us out for comfort and privacy. Manager and host of restaurant didn't care when I walked up and asked for things because waiter could not be found. Take away coffee was $4.50 - you can get it for free at a Courtyard Marriott! Ambassador Check-out preferred to do paperwork instead of helping the growing queue of guests. Couldn't even be bothered to ask me how my stay was. Had reserved a small conference room to work out of - but it was actually a small dining space in the Lounge, not a true work conference room (Note: this hotel isn't really for the business traveler - no desks in the room, no business offices or conference rooms, awkward power outlet locations, etc) Was constantly interrupted by kitchen and wait staff as they tried to access their supply closet which bizarrely was in the room I reserved for quiet and pricacy. Even though I contacted the hotel ahead of time, they forgot to reserve that room. Rooms themselves were so noisy - no soundproofing so heard children running and screaming, neighbor guests slamming doors and talking loudly on the phone, cleaning staff knocking on doors, etc. Inconsistent room cleaning and turn-down service. I fee like the staff needs to visit their overseas properties, particularly in Asia, to see how it should really be done and meet InterCon standards as the "luxury" brand of IHG.

title: Intercontinental New York Barclay.
text:
I booked a holiday to the intercontinental New York Barclay on 4 November to the 9th of November. We had very bad and loud banging noises throughout the nights from the building next door moving containers and only had a few hours sleep a night. 
Also I am still waiting for the return of my deposit taken at the hotel desk three weeks later.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Wow, our stay in NY was perfect. The location was perfect, the hotel was beautiful. Very clean, no noise, the staff were really nice. We can't wait to come back, I can't praise this hotel enough.  Thank you!

title: Perfect
text:
I came here to celebrate my 50th birthday in New York.  Wow what can I say this hotel is fabulous.  The staff are a credit to this hotel/chain and I mean all staff, reception, bell boys, housekeeping .... everyone.

Nothing was too much trouble, they upgraded my room and left some lovely cakes on my birthday.

I have read some negative reviews on here and think these people must have stayed somewhere else as this hotel is stunning.

Thank you for making my birthday weekend so special - I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: 50th birthday
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights for my partner's 50th birthday, they kindly upgraded us to a lovely double aspect room on the 11th floor with  a view of the Chrysler building, absolutely amazing views of the New York skyline.

Can not fault the level of service you receive from all the staff, from the first moment we arrived until we left. 

It's  not far from all the tourists attractions but far enough to be just away from the hustle and bustle.

We really  enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend a stay here.

title: AMAZING 5 STAR SERVICE
text: I brought one of my friends here to see the Gin bar they have in the lobby.  I’ve been several times and was lucky enough to land Maurizio again for our server.  Hands down he makes the experience there worth the trip!!!  Made the best suggestions and handled the evening from beginning to end.  This is the 3rd time I have had the pleasure of him taking care of us and he does not disappoint!!  When in NYC and if you get a chance add this to you list to stop by and ask for him.  Enjoy!!!

title: Disappointment by a favorite
text:
We have been staying at Intercontinental Hotels since the 90’s. We’ve stayed in US ,Canada ,Europe and Asia.
This was our first visit since the renovation. We had been staying at the Times Sq location.
Check-in went smoothly. We were upgraded because of our membership status. We entered our room, to find the worst room we have ever had. When we called to ask to change our room, we were told nothing else was available.The room size was approximately 10 ft X 14 ft , it contained a king bed, 2 large dressers, closet with room for husbands clothing only. Had to put my large suitcase on a table. Distance between bed and dresser only allowed one person to walk. However, bathroom was redone and nicely appointed. 
Rooms here were always generously appointed in the past, but now just a shadow of it’s former life. If one wants a five star experience, it is not at this hotel.
Disappointed with this hotel, will not be returning, anytime soon.

title: Love this hotel!
text: One of my favorite hotels. Nice sized room especially for NYC. Ordered room service and it came very quickly. Very clean room and the beds are so comfortable! Very convenient. Great service. Restaurant was high quality. I would stay here every visit to NYC!

title: Five star experience in Midtown East
text: We stayed for 2 nights in mid November. We had a delightful stay thanks mostly to the courteous, friendly and generous staff. Special thanks to Jeff, Gabriel and Donna for taking special care of us during our stay. The hotel is in a great location, in excellent condition, rooms are spacious with high quality furnishings and decor. Beautiful lobby and facilities throughout the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: A few evenings in the city
text: When visiting New York we love staying at this classic hotel. The staff is always friendly and hospitable. Rooms are comfortable, clean, and understated. Room service is prompt and very good. Location is convenient to walking to theater district and Bloomingdale’s. The hotel through Bloomies offers a 15% discount too at Bloomingdales too.

title: Great Property In Manhattan
text:
Great property in mid-town manhattan. I have stayed here twice for business during the summer. The location is great for getting to Grand Central, the staff is great, I love that they have free New York Times and Wall Street Journals every day, wonderful services. 

It's not a hip place and I wouldn't stay there if not for business. Walls are a bit then, hotel bar and the scene a bit stuffy and it seems like that the kind of place older people (myself included) stay in to be "safe".... but it works..

title: Feeling home
text:
It is always a pleasure to stay at hotel Barclay! 
A super experience and a very hospitable welcome.
Sofia and her team are always ready for you. 
It makes me feel at home.
Well located, away from the hustle and bustle and everything easily accessible.

title: Mrs wood
text: Hotel was clean, friendly staff was told on check in that only had to pay $100 that would be kept on hold everything else was covered by ba. Got to room a double, double three adults sharing beds are very small rang down to change was asked to come back down to reception with our cases to be given another room. When we got down was told no rooms available and if we want to change next day would be a extra $200.we,checked out after five days with a $170 bill we had to pay resort tax although we had been told it was covered. Nice comfy hotel my second time staying but will be my last. no apology more interested in business customers

title: 古いが便利、快適
text: 建物は古いが中は完全にリノベーションされていて古いが故の不便さはない。部屋はひろめ。部屋にアイロンがあるのもよいが少し古いタイプで使いにくい。難点はエアコンの音がかなりうるさいことと、ロビーやラウンジがあまり広くなくいつも混んでごつた返していること。

title: Super update of a classis
text:
As a lifetime Bonvoy Titanium Elite, I tried staying across the street at the Marriott Eastside. Beyond disappointing, I changed to the Barclay across the street and could not be more pleased. Great staff, super lobby, and wonderful rooms. Peter Solis-Sison, the Front Desk Supervisor truly cares and Paulette Hope, the Club Lounge Attendant is equally caring - both are gems! And the club lounge is what a lounge should be!

sison

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: Extremely clean hotel with active lobby/bar and all the amenities. Very spacious room that was spotless.  Perfect location in mid-town NYC.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Easy check-in and check-out.

title: Location at a high price
text:
The Intercontinental Group has an iconic image and usually deserves its accolades but this Hotel disappoints in many areas.
The rooms are ok by modern standards but  don’t stay here unless you have unlimited funds. 
It has a cold and unwelcoming feel on arrival with the lobby area resembling a railway station concourse presumably as it was formerly a railroad hotel. 
A simple salad and a beer cost $44 and if you do choose to eat breakfast it will set you back over $50. Considering it has a very sparse buffet and no a la carte option it really is outrageous and probably accounts for why its virtually deserted in the morning whilst a stream of guests pour in loaded up with delicacies from Starbucks.
New York can be expensive but this really breaks the mould and sadly is not compensated by style and comfort

title: A splendid city trip in New York
text: We did a short city trip to New York City, staying 3 nights at InterContinental Barclay and had an excellent time. The hotel is very conveniently located, close to the subway, to Central Park, to a bike rent shop (a must do in NYC!), nice diners and eateries. The rooms are spacious and there is no noice (exceptional in NY). But most of all, I want to thank the friendly staff and specially the concierge for making good restaurant recommendations and the security (Eric) for preventing that my wife got into a tourist trap rickshaw. You made our experience unforgettable.

title: Very nice stay with a couple of suggestions
text: Wonderful first-time stay.  Very, very quiet hotel with beautiful lobby and bar area.  Centrally located.  Rooms are spacious and very nicely appointed (I believe the hotel was redone within the past 3 years at most...).  Has a bit of a business traveler type ambiance, so if looking for Old-World or Boutique, this is not for you.  Our room was lovely, but suffered from incredibly poor lighting - a lamp on either side of the bed, a lamp on the desk and a picture light hanging above the wallpapered mural.  For the size the room, all of this little lighting left much of the room in various degrees of shadow.  Also, for a hotel of this caliber, there is no reason at all to have paper coffee  cups in the rooms...none.  A couple of ceramic mugs are easy to do, are "green" and offer much higher end touch.  We did have a very unfortunate experience with housekeeping, which was really never completely corrected.  Had that ended on a better note, I would be leaving a better review.  As it is, we enjoyed our stay, but will stay someplace else next time.

title: Great time
text: We are just back from this hotel, we booked a one bedroom suite which was amazing, it had everything we needed. It was very quiet all the the time which we were pleased with. We also had club access which is breakfast, afternoon bites and nibbles and wine 6-8pm. We enjoyed the breakfast as it had everything you could want. If we were in the hotel in the afternoon we would have a coffee and a small sandwich, but we did not rush back for it. The evening nibbles were good to have a glass of wine or two before going out for the evening and they had my favourite Rose ! The girls in there Donna, Paulette and Silvia were all very pleasant and friendly. One doorman was marvelous with us, so friendly, EDDIE you are a credit to this hotel ! Lastly the Resort Fees - well like everyone else not happy when this started, but it is mostly all hotels in New York so we just have to get used to it. But when staying I rang home to the UK twice, I had laundry done, and we had drinks in the gin bar, so you might as well use it ! So not as bad as we first thought. I would say this is more of a business hotel, with conferences going on.

title: Get a Suite or Stay Elsewhere
text: For a mid-level luxury hotel, the suites at the Barclay are gorgeous. They’re comfortable, well appointed. The beds are terrific and comfortable. The bathroom is lovely, complete with heated floors (I like my floor at 81F) and a bidet. I’d highly recommend a suite, at the right price. The regular guest rooms are a bit small and bland.

title: Classical New York
text:
I was hoping for a trip I would never forget... and the Intercontinental Barclays Hotel gave me that! All the class and comfort, with a good splash of opulence that you would expect from an Intercontinental - but also had a great buzz to it - very New York! It is so close to all the great places to visit in New York - The Rock, Time Square, Central station.
The rooms are very spacious, and wonderfully decorated. The staff are very friendly, making me feel very welcome..... making the Barclays a home from home.
Ps you have to try the breakfast in your room - granola to die for!

title: Great stay for our wedding!
text: We stayed here in October for our wedding and we were glad that we chose this hotel. The design of the hotel is a very elegant and classic style that was a great backdrop for our wedding photos. They also surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates in the room! That was a really nice touch. We booked three rooms and they were all great. The room was a decent size for NYC. The bed was very comfortable, it was a king size I believe, tons of pillows, we were able to sleep just fine. Location is also very good, right at the center of midtown, just a few blocks away from grand central station. There are a lot of amenities around, coffee shops, convenience stores, etc.  The $25 voucher thing was pretty decent, we got drinks from the bar each night.  Overall we had a good stay and would recommend this hotel, especially if you are celebrating a special day.

title: Very disappointed
text:
absolutely disappointed in the service and the lack of attention given to my wife’s special birthday which was notified to the hotel weeks prior to our arrival 
It’s appears that we have been given the smallest room in the hotel 
Next to the noisy ice machine 
A room with no bath despite requesting one 
And for this privilege have been charged over £2400 
We won’t ever return here SPOILED a special celebration

title: Hotel de luxe avec un caractère historique. Localisation unique !
text: Hotel de luxe avec un caractère historique. Localisation unique ! Service excellent et personnel compétent et serviable.  Chambre spacieuse et confortable. Excellent petit déjeuner. Très bien placé près de nombreux points d'intérêt

title: A Haven in hectic New York
text:
Our first trip to New York from Australia, my IC Ambassador status made the Barclay my obvious choice for our six night stay.   Away from the hustle and bustle but still an easy walk to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square and Empire State Building some of the sights we wanted to see.
After an overnight flight from the West Coast we arrived tired and weary and were warmly welcomed into the Club Lounge to rest and enjoy refreshments until our room was ready for an early check in.  The Club Lounge was to become our haven each day for sumptuous breakfasts.......so much variety........to restful and relaxing cocktail hours from 5 to 8 in the evening.......again with delicious canapés.
What really made our time in the Club Lounge so enjoyable was the impeccable, friendly and helpful service we received from all the ladies who looked after us in club.     Paulette, Silvia, Josephine and Blanca you are all true assets to the organisation. If we are lucky enough to find ourselves back in New York your club will be the top reason we would stay at the Barclay again.

title: Super place in the middle of the city
text:
If you look for a place in the middle of NY from where you can explore the city this is the place to be.
Comfort, luxery, super friendly staff help you discover the most beautiful city in the world.
Every question you have they can help you with.

title: Style over substance
text:
Stayed for 5 nights, constant issues with housekeeping, also had night time disturbance due to filming in the hotel, although they did try to recompense us there was inconsistency with the reception staff and a general lack of communication, leading to us leaving on a heated discussion, pretty hotel but service is lacking 
They advertise a beauty booking system on their website that let us down 10min before the appointment

title: Nearly really good
text:
It's a really nice hotel, but there a some things that are a bummer.
First of all, I can't give five points to a hotel that charges an extra hotel fee.
You will get discounts for that fee
But two soups and two drinks for 65,50 $. Hell, that's a lot of money.
And then the service was questionable. After we decided what to eat, they told us, that we have the wrong card. They gave us the midnight card, but also that the kitchen will close in five minutes...
A plus, we could get a soup, what we wanted. But I told you the price before.

Then the service charge with 15% is automatically on your receipt. Yeah, that's also questionable.

Now, what was good about our stay. The room was really nice and the first person who checked us in was really, really kind. I wish I could remember his name.
When we later came back to get our keys, the person was worse than a quality inn staff member.

The king bed is really comfortable. The room was tidy and the bath room was really nice.

For New York I would say, that the room was really nice and comfortable for our  stay.
The service could be a lot better.
So five stars for the room and for the first guy at the counter.

title: Joanne Chinery
text: Just about to leave this wonderful hotel. It’s bright clean very quiet after a long day sightseeing. Rooms are modern and extremely clean. Housekeeping do a wonderful job in looking after you. All staff very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. If and when I come back to New York I wouldn’t go anywhere else. The hotel is about a 10 min walk from pretty much any attraction you want to visit. We last stayed in a hotel smack bang in the middle of Times Square and after a while it got too much. This hotel was in s perfect location. Couldn’t hear any street noise so had a very good nights sleep every night of our stay. We didn’t eat in the hotel but at a little place called Ashley’s find foods where you could get something to suit every bodies taste. Sorry to be going home

title: Great stay and made to feel very welcome
text:
Visited a week ago where we celebrated my partners 50th and got married at city hall. The hotel were aware and on arrival a knock at the door with some macaroons and cakes to help kick off the stay, a few days later and a celebratory bottle of Prosecco and chocolate strawberry’s and finally some chocolate mouse on another occasion. These small things helped to make the stat along with a great room , location and staff including management. 

Would recommend this hotel to all...

Paul

title: Good hotel. Great position.
text:
We stayed 5 nights here whilst visiting New York. Great position near Central Park, 5th Avenue and Grand Central. You really are at the heart of things.

We upgraded the room to a superior king which by UK standards was still small and very small to other tourist parts of the US. But standard for New York. That said the room was comfortable and well appointed. The bed was fantastic and comfortable. 

The lobby bar has a good atmosphere and the service is very good. The drinks menu is large but the food menu is limited.

title: Disappointing room
text: Just checked in to what we have been told is a delux double room, the beds are the smallest doubles I’ve ever seen. Spoke to Receiption who told us “that’s what you get in city”. Unfortunately we had just come from Washington a ‘capital city’ where the room was almost double! If you are travelling with teenagers make sure you and they Less than 5 foot!

title: Charged us a fee that was not disclosed
text:
The hotel was very nice, as we expected and as the price would indicate.   However, we balanced this "no resort fee" hotel against others with fees and made the choice to stay here.   The travel booking site even specifically wrote, "Hooray!  This hotel does not have a resort fee!" on our confirmation.   
At the hotel, they charged us a resort fee.   They said it was a miscommunication with the booking site when I showed them the confirmation, and would not let us check in unless we paid it.    It was only $30, but it was $30 that was should not have been charged.  If it was miscommunication with the travel site, it was not my problem, but the manager would not remove it.   Bad business practice.

title: Very disappointing stay. Would not recommend.
text:
I booked a 3 night stay through British Airways. I booked a package flight & hotel. I wanted to stay in a 5 star hotel mid town that would be family friendly & could accommodate 3 people (2 adults & 1 teenager)
After a delayed flight (American Airlines) we arrived at the Intercontinental Barclay. Disappointed that there was no one at the door to help us with our bags. We entered the hotel and my first impressions were not great. The hotel feels very corporate and dated considering it was supposed to have had a recent refurbishment.
The receptionist was very friendly. It was a tall guy I can’t remember his name. I asked him if I was eligible for a room upgrade as I was told by American Express that this was something I would be able to request if available. The receptionist offered a room upgrade with no hesitation which I was thrilled about. We made our way to the room and we were shocked that the hotel had a stale smell especially in the room. When we got to the room it wasn’t an upgrade at all it was exactly the room I had already booked, which I thought strange. We soon realised that there were only 2 beds in this room despite paying for 3 flights & 3 beds through BA. My mum & nephew laid next to each other on the bed and there was no room either side. I called reception straight away to ask if there was a pull out bed? I was told that we would need to move to another room with a king bed and a pull out sofa. We were asked to come back down to reception to be shown to another room (10 floors) at this point we had been travelling for 12 hours and we were very tired. When we arrived at reception nobody knew what I was there for whoever I had spoken to was no longer at the desk I asked for a manager and explained that I had paid for 3 people but the beds were only big enough for 2 and that the room was too small. The manager was very unhelpful she told me that there was a room available that could accommodate 3 people it had a king bed and a pull out bed but I would have to pay an extra $50 per night in addition to the fee I had already pre paid. 
I repeatedly said that I had already paid for 3 people and that we should be able to sleep comfortably during our stay. Sadly she didn’t agree and told me that no hotel in New York would have 2 large beds big enough to sleep 2 people? I understood that there might not be 2 king size in the room but we needed a double and a single. That room was available but she was not prepared to move us without a charge. I was told that to have enough room to sleep 3 people it would be an additional charge as they were providing an extra service. I would completely agree if I had booked and paid for 2 people but I had booked for 3 people. I was told to contact British Airways. However at this point it was 10pm in the uk and the phone line was closed. After a very uncomfortable and embarrassing conversation we left the reception area and returned to our room. The room was very dark. It had a musty smell. Which I also mentioned at reception and nothing was said about that.
We left the hotel for dinner and returned at approx 10pm for a reasonably early night as we had left our house at 4.30am almost 22 hours earlier. We got into bed exhausted from travelling to be woken up by loud knocking at the door (2am uk time) we called out to see who it was and it was someone asking if they could check the room as I had complained about the smell. This was 6 hours earlier by the way. It was as though they had waited for us to go to sleep to wake us. I thought it was very strange to wake us up to ask about the room now. We told them we were sleeping and they left.
We woke up in the morning. We had no tea. I called downstairs to order 3 pots of tea from room service. When it came we were handed ‘2’ paper cups and 2 sachets of tea to use in the coffee machine. Rather than the tea I had ordered. We opened the mini bar to find 2 half drunk bottles of water in the fridge that must have been left by the previous guest. 
We quickly realised that having breakfast here was not a good idea and we left for the day. When we returned we had a message on the room answerphone offering to move us to a room suitable for 3. (24 hours after our initial request)  My mum was so embarrassed by the managers response when we told them we were not happy with the room that she said she would prefer to stay in the room to avoid any further conflict and hassle. And she just wanted to enjoy our short break rather than repacking and moving rooms at this stage. We were in a rush to get out to a show and we didn’t have time to move rooms. I feel that I made them aware of the situation as soon as we arrived and despite there being rooms available they were not prepared to offer us a different room they were more concerned about their $50 dollars per night rather than our comfort. Despite the fact I had already paid $3463.00 for our 3 nights in the hotel and flight! This service I would expect from a basic 3 star hotel not a 5 star hotel. I will also be mentioning this to   Airways and I think they need to update their description and grading for this hotel as it was not as advertised. 
We were also told at check in that there would be an additional $35 per night room tax added at  checkout. Which apparently is normal for New York. 
We spent very little time in the hotel. My mum would not have breakfast or drinks at the bar as she felt so embarrassed that we had to argue about our room. 
After 3 crowded nights we checked out. The manager was present and despite our complaint and the ‘message’ that was left by another manager offering to move us, she didn’t even ask how our stay was or offer any kind of apology. I’ve never experienced such poor customer service.
We wanted to leave our bags at the hotel as we were leaving at 7pm. The man who took the bags from us was very grumpy and it was clearly an inconvenience to him. However on a positive note the man who retrieved them for us when we returned couldn’t have been nicer and the door staff went out of their way to find a taxi to the airport for us. I would also like to add that the 2 Male concierge staff were very helpful. The female guest relations was not and tried to send me to the 3rd floor business centre to print my boarding pass. The concierge (in the same room) did it without any    hesitation. I think the management and guest relations assistant need further training on customer care. I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely Luxurious Stay
text:
We recently stayed at the Hotel as a family  of 3 sharing 1 room with 2 queen size beds. The room was spacious and  comfortable with all amenities you would expect from a hotel of this standing.

Without exception, the Hotel staff were amazing. Polite, kind, conscientious - all going that extra mile to ensure our 4 night stay was a special one. We had arranged Club lounge access, superbly hosted by Paulette Hope on the days we were there in the evening.  Paulette did everything to ensure we were comfortable, was interested in our days and happy to help with any queries we had. The food and beverages in the Club Lounge were superb - msny compliments to the chefs.

Our room was cleaned to a very high standard, the Hotel should be very proud of their chamber staff.

David, the doorman, was also incredibly helpful in arranging transport whenever we needed a taxi. Always happy to assist.

This is a perfectly located hotel (Midtown) for a stay in New York,  it is tastefully decorated, clean and tidy.  I would highly recommend it for solo travellers, families and business travellers alike.  As ever with hotels, staff can make or break a stay - the staff at this hotel all helped make the trip a very pleasant one.

title: ΚΕΝΤΡΙΚΟ ΚΑΙ ΥΨΗΛΟΥ ΕΠΙΠΕΔΟΥ
text: Στο κέντρο του Manhattan , σε ήσυχη για την Νέα Υόρκη περιοχή , ένα ιστορικό ξενοδοχείο που διατηρεί την αρχοντιά του και με υψηλό επίπεδο service . Το μόνο στο οποίο μειονεκτεί είναι ότι επειδή είναι χαμηλότερο από τα κτήρια τριγύρω δεν είχαμε θέα από το δωμάτιο.

title: Nice space
text: Big rooms and handy for everywhere but the prices in the bar are rather high. Needs a bit more attention to detail as asked three times for another robe and it never arrived and the rooms were only very basically tidied each day

title: Great location.
text:
Hotel is short walk from Grand Central Station so easy to use the subway to the major sights we planned to visit.  The bed was very comfortable but the bedroom was very dark, even with lights on, due to the close proximity of the nextdoor building. We paid for club lounge access and this was extremely good value.  The breakfast spread was plenty big enough to satisfy most tastes, afternoon sandwiches and cakes were available if back in the hotel and evening hor d'oeuvres with wine were  enough to provide a small meal if didn't want to venture out again after a long day's sightseeing!
Silvia and Paulette in the club lounge were always kind and helpful and gave excellent service.  The concierge department were also helpful in our planning.  We had a late checkout which fitted in perfectly with our travel plans.  This was probably a better location than the noise and bustle of Times Square.

title: Least impressive IC Hotel anywhere
text:
This is difficult as I’m an IC fan and have used them all
Over the world with mostly nothing but praise.
The Barclay in NYC has let the group down.
From the moment I arrived it’s been no where near any of the others I’ve stayed in.
The attitude of the place isn’t good. Whilst some of the staff have been lovely, others have the NY attitude that they are doing you a big deal simply talking to you. This by the way is general throughout NYC.
I was challenged at check in about my ambassador status and had to pay $200 to supposedly maintain it when having stayed in the IC in both Hong Kong and Shanghai
Less than a few months before this stay nothing was raised by either.
I was then told that I had been given an upgraded room by the Ambassador check in person only to find that I had what I’d booked, no upgrade.
I then spoke to a “manager” in the lobby who also told me an untruth re the access to the club Intercontinental. I was told by him that it was IC policy that ONLY royal ambassador members had free access to club lounges.
So how come in both HK and Shanghai in the last few months and Tokyo, Seoul, Singapore, Miami
And London I’ve never been declined access!
Never again will I stay in The IC Barclay .
Poor attitude but sadly typical of NYC overall.

title: Nice Hotel...very expensive breakfast
text:
We stayed at this Hotel and were very satisfied with the hotel however when we decided to have breakfast for 5 adults It was approximately $500au.
The breakfast was a buffet style and had adequate choices of food but far too expensive.

title: Great place to stay in mid-town
text: We stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay for 1 night for a wedding in the city. As an Ambassador Member, we were treated wonderfully. We were given an upgrade to a Superior Room, Early Check in, 4PM Check out and $20 in free food plus 2 free beverages in the bar. The room was average for a room in NYC, but newly redone. The only complaint would be that the walls are quite thin and you can hear your neighbors. Other than that our stay was wonderful and I would highly recommend you staying their if you are looking to stay at a old 1920's styled hotel in Midtown!

title: IHG Barclay’s Refresh...
text:
My wife and I recently had a lovely stay at the IHG Barclay on East 48th Street in NYC. Hadn’t been there in years and the recent renovations are beautiful. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. The staff in every function and department is pleasant and most helpful. The room service staff are some of the best I’ve experienced in years. 
Bar menu for the evening and breakfast buffet were delicious. And guest services were very responsive as well. 
We will definitely go back there in the future. Especially due to the quality service, terrific location and courteous folks.

title: Thin walls, disappointing staff
text:
My biggest complaint about this hotel is the walls were so thin I could hear every word of my neighbors' conversations and became very familiar with their bathroom habits. It kept me awake and woke me up early every morning, I couldn't wait to check out. I've stayed at other comparable hotels in this area of NYC and haven't had that issue.

What also left a sour taste in my mouth was the attitude of staff. I noticed one night that the plaster on my ceiling was bubbling, as if there was a water leak above my bed. I called downstairs (using my cell - the room phone didn't work) and the staff was unconcerned and unapologetic. When it had been half an hour, they actually gave me attitude for checking in to see if anyone was coming. The engineers (who were lovely) finally showed up 45 min-1 hour after I called, there was no actual leak - just falling ceiling plaster - but no one ever apologized for the inconvenience or seemed to care that I was an hour late for my plans that night because I had to wait for these guys to show up. It was really a bad experience, something I wouldn't expect at an Intercontinental.

I would not stay here again and would not recommend the property to anyone else.

title: Amazing hotel, amenities and guest service!
text:
Everything for our stay at the Barclay was perfect!
I can’t wait to return for another special stay! From the moment we entered the hotel, I felt the high caliber service of every employee and I am so thrilled by my experience upgrading to the Barclay’s club level which included a fantastic breakfast fit for a king/queen, afternoon snacks/drinks, comfortable sitting areas with a lovely collection of books to read and an evening service of heavenly appetizers, wine, champagne...cappuccino maker available throughout the day! I would highly recommend this upgrade!
The hotel is a short walk to Rockefeller Center:)

title: Perfect EVERY time
text:
I try to stay here whenever I am in NY. I consider myself extremely lucky that this is a company approved hotel for me!

The staff is very attentive and always appreciative of the business. The rooms are not large but for the location relatively spacious.

The club lounge is wonderful. Breakfast, Afternoon Tea and Canapes and hors d'oeuvres...all fresh and high quality.

Is it expensive, yes, are you a stones throw from the UN and right in some of the most expensive real estate in the world, yes, yes you are...

title: Personnel indigne du standing de l'hôtel
text: J'ai séjourné dans cet hôtel en famille le contact avec le personnel est horrible principalement au niveau de la réception (on dirait des robots sans aucune marge de manoeuvre). Personnes incompétentes pas du tout qualifiées froides ne dégageant aucun signe de bienvenue ou autre. Quant au service de chambre, plusieurs habilles ont disparu et mo époux me la fait remarquer mais moi je ne voulais pas y croire (je me disais que ça ne peut pas arriver dans un hôtel de ce standing). La veille de notre départ nous avons laisser exprès traîner un paquet avec des casquettes et des chaussettes achetées au marché sur broadway.  Nous avons découvert à notre retour que des articles manquent à l'appel.  Nous n'avons pas préféré porter plainte car on voulait éviter d'avoir affaire à la froideur et à la lenteur de la réception et nous avons opté le silence et ne plus y mettre le pied franchement personnel indigne d'un intercontinental

title: Schwierige Entscheidung
text:
Wir hatten für vier Nächte inkl. Frühstück reserviert und vorab bezahlt, waren bei unserer Ankunft an einem Freitagabend allerdings geschockt, als uns mitgeteilt wurde, dass keine Reservierung vorliegen würde. Wir durften nach einer kurzen Diskussion trotzdem wie gebucht in ein Executive Zimmer im 7. Stock einchecken. Die Lage des Hotels in Midtown ist perfekt. Das Zimmer ist ausreichend dimensioniert, sehr geschmackvoll dekoriert und war top sauber. Es ist mit allem ausgestattet was man braucht und sogar die Fenster können einen Spalt breit geöffnet werden. Leider war bei unserer Ankunft noch die Kaffeekapsel des Vorängers in der Keurig. Aus dem Nebenzimmer hörten wir nichts. Das eher etwas kleine Bad verfügt über eine begehbare, verglaste Dusche und ist somit State of Art. Das Housekeeping vergass aber nach der ersten Nacht das Auffüllen der Kosmetikartikel und auch in der Folge gerne mal was.
Das King Bed weist das Standardmass auf und ist über alle Massen bequem....das gilt auch für die Kopfkissen. Der Fernseher ist etwas unterdimensioniert, was bei vor allem Sportsendungen negativ zum Tragen kommt. Das Frühstückbüffet ist von der Auswahl und vom Geschmack her ausgezeichnet. Die älteren Herren im Service legen allerdings wenig Engagement an den Tag, so  mussten wir  jedesmal um mehr Kaffee bitten  (in den USA eigentlich ein No Go). Zudem wurden wir nicht informiert, dass wir auch ein Continental Breakfast hätten ordern können. Wir haben dann am Montag unser Reisebüro kontaktiert; dort erhielten wir die Auskunft, dass alles ordnungsgemäß gebucht wurde, aber in der Kommunikation zwischen dem Veranstalter und dem Hotel scheinbar ein Missverständnis aufgetreten war. Zurück an der Rezeption wurde uns dann mitgeteilt, dass wir die Übernachtungskosten nicht zu übernehmen bräuchten, jedoch das Frühstück trotz Vorkasse nochmals bezahlen müssen. Am Abreisetag bekamen wir daher eine Rechung für das Frühstück, die jedoch anstatt der vier tatsächlich eingenommenen Mahlzeiten  fünf Posten aufwies? Zudem stimmten die Beträge nur ein einziges Mal mit den von uns unterschriebenen Belegen überein. Wir waren es aber leid, noch dazu hatten wir bereits die Zusage vom Reisebüro, dass uns die Kosten nach der Rückkehr erstattet werden. Wenigstens zeigte man sich bei der Berechnung der Resort Fee, die einen täglichen "Gutschein in Höhe von 25 $ beinhaltet, entgegenkommend und beglich damit unsere Kosten der Hotelbar. Insgesamt war es also trotz des wirklich schönen Hotels eine ambivalente Erfahrung. Ich glaube, andere hätten wahrscheinlich nur einen Punkt vergeben.

title: Would NEVER Return
text:
Spire Ambassador, highest level of IHG loyalty program.  After having stayed at two of the other IHG properties in NYC, thought I try the Barclay following their renovation.  BIG mistake.

Problems started from the moment I arrived.  Because I'd used points for the first night and was paying for the others, I had to book separately.  After multiple calls and emails up to the day of arrival, was assured everything had been taken care of and I could stay in the same room seamlessly.

Shocker.  When I arrive, front desk has no idea what I'm talking about and am told my key may or may not work after the first day.  Great.  Get the room and the bed has a disgusting red/orange stain (see picture).  Call down to front desk, no one seems concerned.  Do I want the sheets changed?  Are you an idiot?  

Eventually sheets are changed by a maid with attitude-- "I just changed this bed"-- and manager gives me some points to placate me.  Okay fine, reset.

Next night, get home after long day, none of the water that I pay extra for has been stocked.  Again, because this also happened the day I checked in.  Call down again.  More attitude.

Order dinner.  Front desk gives me attitude again when I call to let them know delivery will be arriving-- "why didn't you let security know?"  Maybe because I'm not the one who works here?  Do your job jfc.  Front desk refuses to let delivery person up and makes them leave food on a table in the middle of the lobby unattended.  Call for manager again when I go down.  Attitude attitude attitude.

You can renovate your tiny, still-dirty rooms all you want but nothing will make up for the attitude of the trash staff at this hotel.

Will never return and advise you do the same.

See my review of the other Intercontinental for an actual quality hotel.  The Conrad is also fantastic.

title: Good Location
text:
Stayed for 6 nights. The location was great.
Room , though small was comfortable but very expensive for the price paid.
It is a busy hotel which seemed to be due to a large conference. Impressive lobby and interior architecture.
Breakfast very expensive and and on first glimpse looked amazing with lots of choice but quality of food mediocre. Most of the waitstaff have attitude and I object to being called doll . Doesn't suit the standard of hotel.
Best staff member was concierge Norman who was very helpful with information and bookings.

title: Amazing hotel and staff
text:
I have been back several times. The club lounge is superb. I especially appreciate Sylvia and Paulette. Both of them are always there to help me with reservations and more. I would not stay anywhere else.
Dr. Erick J. Mann, Professor of History and Fulbright Scholar.

title: Can'r fault this hotel - good service provided
text:
We stayed here for two reasons, we had stayed before and enjoyed it and we are IHG Spire Members.

This hotel is expensive, but it is very good and we didn't really encounter problems here. I would suggest that if you want to eat breakfast here, you pre-book it in your room rate or it can be expensive over $100 per day, which soon mounts up. 

You can't fault the service here and we would stay here again, due to the good service.

title: Excellent Stay in Midtown!
text: I had a wonderful stay at the Intercontinental Barclay - I checked in at the Ambassador desk and the agent was very friendly - The hotel was rather busy as I was visiting while the UN was in session.  I'm an Intercontinental Ambassador and was informed that they no longer offer the welcome amenity - The instead offer a $20.00 food and beverage credit (I much prefer the credit over a random amenity).  I was also given two drink vouchers to the lobby bar.  The hotel has a central location in Midtown close to Grand Central Station, the Empire State Building, and the UN Building.  The room was average sized and in perfect condition.  I did order room service and the attendant was  prompt and friendly.  My only complaint was that the doormen often seemed to be very inattentive - They were often busy talking to each other rather than attending to guests - It's a minor complaint - But still something that I wish they would improve on.

title: Outstanding
text: Stayed on two occasions on this trip  found the hotel really good . Nothing was too much trouble and a special thank you to Peter at reception who went  out of his way to make our stay very comfortable. As we travel the world for work and spend a lot of time in hotels it was a pleasure to have such good service in all areas of the hotel. Congratulations you got it right we will be back .

title: Amazing!
text: Myself and my cousin travelled here for her 50th birthday. What an amazing experience. The hotel was fantastic. The staff were friendly and so helpful. We were upgraded when we arrived thanks to the fabulous Christa the assistant front desk manager. We will definitely be back. Fantastic location in a beautiful area of Manhattan. We couldn't have asked for better. I'm planning my next trip already. I will be staying longer than 4 days next time. 5 star service 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

title: Favorite Spot, but Check In was underwhelming
text: I’ve been a fan of Intercontinental Hotels for over 20 years so much in the last 5 years I’ve purchased the annual Ambassador Membership to enhance my stay and experience.  Intercontinental New York Barclay has been one my favorite hotels in their grande portfolio and this recent stay leaves no exception to quality and the standards of the chain.  However our check in was bit bumpy as the Ambassador check in reception refused to allow me to apply my membership to my reservation as I reserved my room through third-party hotel site booking.com.  I suspected this wasn’t true as I did it before bout I was still denied. I checked with the Ambassador service this morning and it was reconfirmed to me I was right.  I missed my guaranteed room upgrade for my entire stay plus all the club benefits.  It’s shameful for the ambassador check in reception totally got this wrong and was not trained to the quality I have come to depend on at Intercontinental.  As I’m checking out today I was able to rectify the error through another more well-informed staff.  For this experience I can only provide a a mediocre average rating.

title: Intercontinental NY Barclay: a bad surprise...
text:
We spent few days in U.S., visiting Cape Cod and Boston, and decided to end up our trip with two days in NY.
As I am a frequent guest of the Intercontinental hotels, I thought to have my family benefitting of the Intercontinental special treats also in NY.
Unfortunately, the Intercontinental NY Barclay was a big deception: we arrived at 2,30 pm and the hall was a mess, as many people were checking in or still waiting for their room; the staff that was checking us was always complaining and too tired and confused for being helpful; she forgot to arrange for our luggage to be sent to our room and I had to deal directly with the porter (who was, in fact, the only nice person).
The room were very little, but what bothers me the most was the total absence of sympathy from the staff...exactly the opposite of what it happened in the Intercontinental Boston where everybody was smiling and trying to be helpful.

title: 28th Anniversary Weekend
text: Our favorite hotel in NYC is the InterContinental NY Barclay. This time around we had tkts to see Hamilton and decided to make a weekend out of it! I cant emphasize enough how wonderful our experience was! The staff goes above and beyond to make certain everything is just right and to make us feel welcome. This is true from the General Manager, to the Front Desk Staff, to the staff in Club Intercontinental, and to housekeeping! We're looking forward to our next visit. This was the first time we experienced Club Intercontinental and we absolutely LOVED it!

title: Loud Rooms and Lying Staff
text: Rooms were so noisy, bottom line don’t plan on sleeping.   Planned an anniversary trip with the husband and was placed next to a loud group of guys coming and going.  When asked to change room was told firmly (and rudely) there was nothing that could be done because they were fully booked.   I decided to check, and there were rooms available to book online.   Very disappointed.

title: Long NY weekend trip...
text:
The best part of our stay was Ms. Nedesha!  The check-in experience started at the bellman greeting us at the taxi, to the warm welcome that Nedesha provided at check-in.  The upgrade for our room, to the random "walk-by's" whenever she saw us in the lobby and checking to make sure our stay was enjoyable.  She really was the face of the hotel for our long weekend.  

Brucha in the Conceirge office was also very helpful.  Her suggestion for great bagles near the hotel proved to be spot on...to the point the line was over 40 min long.  We chose to go somewhere else for bagels.  

We didn't like the lack of flexibility of the refrigerator in the room.  The fact that we couldn't remove the items in the fridge to accommodate leftovers and such was a big bummer.  The bar staff could've been friendlier.  Smiles seemed to be lacking.

The room upgrade gave us more room and made for a very comfortable stay.  I would definitely revisit...if the price is right!

title: opulent hotel!
text: I love intercontinental hotels! But this one may be my favorite so far! We were impressed from the moment we arrived. First walking through the revolving door shaped like a beautiful birdcage into the equally beautiful lobby! The bedding is a dream. Great location.

title: Not a positive balance
text:
The room is good, with a comfortable bed, good quality linens, ok towels. Air conditioning is not that easy to get to desired temperature (if it's too cold and you want to increase temperature, systems keep sending cold air - so you have to turn it off). But there were enough negative points on a one-night stay that make the experience not worth it: 
- Destination Fee "until midnight": you pay $30/day of "destination fee" (this annoying trend on NY hotels) but it seems you get something in exchange - for example a $25 food/beverage credit per day. The small print says "it must be used by midnight". And for them, midnight means midnight of your checkin day. So if you want to use the credit for breakfast... forget about it. Why do this? The rate of a hotel is always from 3pm or so until 11am or noon. Why create a destination fee whose benefit does not match this usual period of a hotel room? This seems one of those things created to mislead guests. During checkout I complained about that at the same time that another guest by my side was complaining. They ended up giving the $25 credit. But the whole experience is annoying. Why can't they just follow the same standard for both the per night rate and destination fee? Why try to confuse guests? 

- I left an article in the (very small) "personal space" in the fridge (the rest of the fridge has articles that, if moved, are immediately charged to your room). In the next morning... the fridge was locked. We called reception, they tried to unlock it remotely, it didn't work. We had to wait 30min or so for someone to come and unlock the fridge (and that delayed our checkout). The person was very nice, apologized, but... our departure was delayed in 30min. 

- I forgot a charger in the room. Called the hotel to ask about it, left a message. They called me back saying they didn't find it. I know those things may happen, maybe the next guest in the room took the charger, it's hard to say. But it's the first time that I forget something in a hotel room and they are not able to find it. 

Let's say I had better experiences overall in other hotels in NY.

title: Location is perfect
text: If you want a perfect midtown location this is it. You can walk to just about every desirable restaurant shopping and tourist site.  We had a standard room which was remarkably clean. Room was beautifully appointed.  Very comfortable and upscale but homey.

title: Stayed for a night, felt like royalty
text: Booked a room in this hotel via Priceline for an overnight stay to see a Met exhibition and watch a show.  Was a little nervous as it was listed as a standard room that could sleep up to two people, but I was not sure what that meant.  We were warmly greeted with a smile, and were upgraded to an Executive King.  I am not sure if that was because my husband has an IHG loyalty number, or just because, but we were incredibly appreciative.  Our room was a cool, quiet haven in the midst of the noise and stimulation of the city. Comfortable bed, and clean, roomy shower.Also, the hotel was a short (15-20 minute) walk to the Eugene O Neill  theater from the hotel. Overall, a stellar overnight stay!

title: Buena ubicación
text:
Me gustó... El cuarto un poco pequeño, pero la cama ufff deliciosa... Descansamos muy bien. El desayuno está rico pero sentí que muy caro para lo que fue.

Si lo recomiendo. Solo desayunaría en otro lugar.

title: Mostly Good After we Finally Got Our Room
text:
We arrived about 11:30 am. The lady at the Reception desk sent us around the corner to the Ambassador desk.  No one was there, but there was a sign on the desk stating that someone was away and would return “soon”.  After more than15 minutes, still no one so another staff member directed us back to Reception desk.  She said our room was clean but had to be inspected first so we were taken to the Club Lounge to wait.  I thought it would be a quick wait. It was over an hour as we sat with our luggage in the Club Lounge.  Finally, after I made a small scene and stated the obvious, a room was available about 5 minutes later. The Ambassador person brought over the keys and acted as if everything was normal.  It wasn’t the same room since it was on the 12th floor whereas the one that had to be inspected was on the 9th.   I am a Spire Ambassador with IHG.  As a Spire, check-in is as early as 10 am if a room is ready.  I was understanding that one wasn’t ready by noon, but after such a long wait, I found that someone dropped the ball so to speak!  After we got our room, most everything else went well for the following 2 days!
Our room was basically a standard room with Club Access, which I booked.  We may have received a one level upgrade from Superior to Deluxe, but this is the norm at most Intercontinentals with Lounges.   The rooms are most always very clean, well maintained, and have top quality furnishings and decorations.  Our view of an office building was not that great and required us to close the curtains at all times. We avoided the mini bar since it was probably motion-activated.  Given the prices of the drinks in the main bar, those in the mini bar were probably even higher!  We had a good king-sized bed, but to be honest, the one we had an IHG Express location near LaGuardia the night before was more comfortable (it was one of the best beds ever).  The one at the Barclay was not as firm nor were the pillows, and the duvet wasn’t as silky soft; however, I slept better at the Barclay since there wasn’t a noise issue, but my back was sore after 2 nights for my flight home.  This was the first time, I believe, that I’ve had a room at an Intercontinental without a tub.  There was a nice shower with a regular shower head plus a handheld device for easier rinsing.  The amenities (Agraria) provided were what used to be the standard ones at all Intercontinentals, but recently, I’ve noticed specialty brands at many such as in Paris, London, and Bucharest.  There was a closet with a safe although we really didn’t have too much to secure.  The TV was good and received enough channels to entertain when in the room, but we spent most of our awake time either in the city (eating out, walking, one matinée, etc.) or in the Club Lounge.  The Club Lounge is open from 6;30 am until 8 pm.  Again, for those Intercontinentals with lounges, I’ve never known one to close before 10 pm, but I understood because there was never a crowd in the lounge so there was no demand.  Unlike in Europe, we weren’t given an option to have breakfast in the main restaurant (unless, of course, we paid full price) so we ate in the Club each morning.  They had scrambled eggs plus either scrambled egg whites or egg white squares, plus meats, both turkey and pork, plus some pastry but not a lot, breads, juices, fruits, yogurts, and more.  I was disappointed that there was no omelet station since we were there over the weekend, and both American Intercontinental lounges that I’ve visited (Atlanta and Boston) have omelet stations on Saturday and Sunday.  I was still able to have a decent breakfast so not a huge issue.  In the evening from 5pm until 8 pm, they have beer, wine, and Prosecco.  I shouldn’t write this, but I think the Prosecco in the lounge (and maybe at the bar where it’s not cheap) is the same kind I get at my local German-based Aldi discount grocery store for under $10 a bottle!  We were able to partake of a few afternoon refreshments the first day but were out at the matinée on the second day and had to leave before that time on the last day.  They were ok with fancy teatime sandwiches and flavored breads such as banana nut, but we wanted a hardier lunch so we ate at a Chinese restaurant nearby after leaving our bags in the room.  On Friday evening, it was Sushi night in the lounge with many, many variations and varieties on the back table.  The front table had cheeses and sliced meats as well plus egg rolls and other bite size munchies.  Saturday evening didn’t have anything special and just included the table with hors d’oeuvres.  I never saw any chocolate-type pastries in the afternoon or evening, but there were some eclairs on Sunday morning.  Overall, we were happy with the lounge but would have enjoyed a later closing, more pastries, and an omelet station.
Check-out time is normally at 11 am, but as an Ambassador, I am supposed to receive one as late as 4 pm.  I requested a noon check out since our shuttle pick-up was scheduled for just after 12:15 pm but was told there would be no late check-outs for anyone since the UN General Assembly was starting on Monday with many people arriving on Sunday and even before.  I was given many points (or a choice of a restaurant/bar credit) because of such and understood so no problem this time.  We officially checked out in the Club Lounge about 10:40 and were allowed to wait there until our shuttle pick-up.  I received an email a few days before my arrival informing me of the UN issues and the probable extra security, but we were lucky since the street didn’t close until Sunday night and we faced no extra security in the lobby.  I think this may have been part of the check-in issue since everyone seemed to be “walking on pins and needles” to use an old cliché.  It will probably be better if we return on a less hectic weekend!
I do want to mention one employee who went above and beyond.  Paulette was there from early Friday afternoon when we returned from lunch until closing and was there for all 13.5 hours on Saturday although we didn’t go to breakfast until after 8.  She was the best.  She listened to my travel stories, changed the TV to college football on Saturday afternoon, and just was welcoming and professional.  Nothing was too much for her as she asked often if we needed anything.  As I said earlier, we had the lounge mostly to ourselves plus maybe a half dozen others at times.  I don’t understand why more people don’t use the lounge, especially when/if they have access?  When I booked this reservation with my weekend Ambassador certificate, I lucked out because I noticed how difficult it is to find a weekend here that is available for such.   Not too long after I booked, it appeared that there were no more weekend certificate slots available the rest of 2019!  I hope to be back here on a future visit to New York and expect a smoother check-in and please no UN meetings!

title: Good hotel..
text: Large hotel with a beautiful lobby. Check-in was done quickly and efficiently, no details were given regarding the 'destination fee' charge. Room was large and clean, found the buffet breakfast very expensive and hardly any choice of items to substantiate this cost... location is good

title: Horrible customer service with regard to billing issues
text:
I only stayed at the InterContinental Barclay for about twelve hours, but it took a week to deal with the fallout of my short stay.  

First of all, the hotel itself was just fine - the room was modestly sized and nice, though a little antiquated.  

However, upon checkout on the morning of Sunday 9/14/2019, I was told that the hotel's computer systems were down, and so I couldn't actually check out (or review a copy of my bill before doing so).  Instead, the desk agent wrote down my name and information and promised that he'd check me out when the systems were back up and send me a copy of my bill to review before I was charged.  I advised him of one minor billing error that I'd seen on my room service bill, which he promised to rectify before sending me my statement.  I went on my way.  

Two days later, my credit card had been charged, but I still hadn't seen a copy of my bill.  I called the hotel and requested a copy, which I shortly received.  Not only had the first billing error not been corrected, but there was now a second one.  

I responded to this e-mail per its closing line of "Should you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us at any time at (212) 755-5900 or via email at icbarclaybilling@ihg.com."  This e-mail was ignored.  I tried again.  I was ignored again.  I called the number and asked if my e-mail could be responded to.  The phone agent said I'd need to call back during business hours to request a response (despite the note above that I could contact them at any time).  I asked if she might simply leave a note that my e-mail should be responded to.  She hung up on me.  

I tweeted at IHG customer service, which said they'd ask the hotel to respond to my e-mail within 48 hours.  I didn't hear from the hotel.  I called the hotel again (despite having already sent two e-mails regarding my two billing issues) and started from scratch, explaining my two billing issues.  The phone agent originally said that she couldn't help me, but then said she'd correct the two billing issues and send me an updated invoice.  The updated invoice that I received only corrected one of the two billing issues.  I had to tweet at IHG customer service again and e-mail the hotel again to get the second billing issue, finally, redressed more than a week after checking out.  

It shouldn't take this much work just to be accurately billed for a hotel stay.

title: Super service in a regal hotel!
text:
This is my 2nd stay at the Barclay since it's been renovated and each experience gets better and better. It's truly a beautiful hotel and the service is excellent. Close enough to everything without being in the heart of the craziness. Love the location. 
Special call outs to Chris George, Gabriel Nogueira and Isaac Anderson who truly exemplified outstanding service during my stay. 
Can't go wrong staying here!

title: A good spot in Midtown East
text: A good base for a Manhattan holiday.  Hotel is elegant, and the lobby bar is lively and serves great cocktails. Handy to a lot of Manhattan highlights -  close to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, and lots more.  Pricey, but everything in Manhattan is.

title: Luxury hotel offers care you can't buy
text:
At a certain point, luxury hotels share the same features: great location, bedding, design/decor and service. Intercontinental Barclay makes itself stand out for making you feel cared for as a person, despite the sea of people moving outside the hotel and even in the lobby. 

I was distracted when I checked in, but Annmara surprised me with a bag of water after I had asked where I could find a convenience store to buy some. All of a sudden she appeared by my side and had put some chocolates in the bag too. It was a very moving and kind gesture at the end of a difficult day. I'm sure these lines don't do the interaction justice.

How do you put a price on being cared for by someone you don't know? 

The lobby is big. I asked another staff person and was escorted to the elevator bank.

This place really gets the power of people and presence.

title: Worst possible hotel in NYC
text:
I was a guest at the Intercontinental Barclay from Sep 15 to Sep 19. The experience was a disaster. The staff is the worst, and absolutely not helpful.

I arrived at the hotel, and the room was freezing (15 degrees Celsius). The heating wasn't working. I called front desk to ask for support. They said they would send someone to take a look. I left for work, came back 6-7 hours later, and the problem was the same. So I had to call front desk again, when they finally send someone (who only managed to improve the situation partially).

On my last night, I tried to call front desk around 11pm. No one answered. Then I had to go down to the lobby myself, where the agent told me that after a certain hour all calls are redirected to a central. The problem is that the central never answers. 

It seems a bit obvious to me that hotels are a 24 hour service. I can't be redirected to a central line that never answers after a certain time.

title: Club Lounge
text:
Having stayed at many 5 star hotels and experiencing their lounges, I have to say this lounge is beautifully kept, great service from the attendants in particular Paulette Hope and Josefina and great quality food and beverages from the friendly chefs.

I’ll definitely be visiting you again, thank you 😊

title: High Class, Low Hospitality
text: First, I will say that the property is beautiful and worthy of real high level hospitality and it unfortunately does not deliver. The front desk agent who checked me in was barely smiling nor engaging or friendly, rather just sort of there. The Bartender as well was similarly unengaging and had his back turned to us for an extended period of time when we were trying to pay...this is New York people got places to go! Look at us at least for crissakes! Then, one of us came in late and there was no overnight bellman outside to assist them which I thought must've just been short staffing which I could even understand in these economic times. However, a couple of other things also irked me about this property and compounded the situation and compelled me to leave this lousy review. The minibar- no prices and just a note saying that if you move anything for 60 seconds you will be charged. Wait...what?! How do you know if I remove something for 60 seconds?! I was looking through the minibar before I got to the note to look for prices(which aren't there!!) And now I just got this creepy "somebody is watching me" feeling which is the LAST thing you want to feel in a hotel room! Whoever wrote that should be fired honestly. As if all that wasn't enough, as I mentioned earlier one of us got in late so we were all up late and we needed to sleep straight through, but housekeeping came knocking on our door at 9am waking me out of my sleep and utterly ruining my day for me as I could not fall back asleep afterwards. I am sorry but that's just too early for housekeeping. When I informed the Front Office Manager I was told that the UN was coming in and they need my rooms and was given a measly 30 minutes compensation. I honestly don't care what your bookings are like for the next day, I don't care if the Queen of England is coming, it does not entitle you to ruin my stay. Thankfully, I will never stay here again as this place is rife with weird hidden fees and general ineptness. This city has so many options why bother?

title: From the moment you walk into the lobby you get the feeling of an ordered, well run and friendly hotel.
text:
We were recommended this hotel by a friend, it is an excellent hotel.  When we arrived at the check-in desk late at night we were greeted with a very cheerful “Happy Anniversary”; it was our 40th wedding anniversary the following day, it was a very thoughtful touch.  Our room was spacious, airy and spotlessly clean and every day when we returned to our room it was as though it was the first time we had been in there. The staff cleaning the room were excellent in carrying out their work.
After we had put our cases in our room, we decided that it was time for a beer as we had been travelling for many a long hour, when we went to the bar the barman assured us that we had come to the right place for a refreshing beer and he wasn’t wrong.  This was typical of the staff throughout our stay, they were pleasant, professional and approachable. Our sons had requested a bottle of champagne and a box of chocolates be delivered to our room, these were very nicely presented with a card written in beautiful handwriting.  Again a very pleasant touch.
I would definitely stay again in this hotel for a visit to New York and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Great Hotel Room
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at the Barclay. Excellent check-in experience and room was very nicely furnished, decent sized and reasonably quiet considering the hotel’s location. 
The Amenity Fee is annoying but at least it is possible to get some value from it with the $25 a day credit for food/beverages. 
I normally really look forward to breakfast at Intercontinental properties. On this occasion, breakfast was OK, but not worth the amount charged. The person on the table next to me had her table cleared whilst she was at the buffet which put me off returning to the buffet myself. Fortunately, there are lots of other options nearby.

title: New charge for packages
text:
New charge for received packages,: $30.
Thievery ! Will not stay in this chain again
