In other respects the hotel is good to very good. Well located, good bed and bathroom. 

But the un announce charge in this amount is ridiculous.

title: Management is AMAZING - Thank you Artem!
text: Our family is traveling for the first time to NYC and the management got wind of this. Not only is the hotel impeccable and the rooms, better than there photographs, the manager Artem treated our family like his family. Kind, courteous and wonderful at his job. If you get the chance to stay here - do! After a day out in the city, there’s nothing better than coming home to a place like this.

title: Could Be Much Better
text:
Decent hotel but let down by the staff attitude and non-existent customer service. 
I emailed this hotel prior to arriving and requested connecting rooms, I received a reply saying that they have put a note on my booking of my request.  When we arrived the lady at check in was not hospitable, didn’t welcome us at all. I mentioned to her that I have emailed and we had requested connecting room, she didn’t even look at me but said they didn’t have any notes on my booking and they do not have any connecting rooms available.  I realise this is never guaranteed but the fact that they didn’t have this noted on my booking in the first place and the attitude of her immediately raised my doubts about this hotel and we hadn’t even been there for 10 minutes.  
Room 1 - Bed base was broken, mould in the shower, poor lighting, room was very dark and our view was awful.
Room 2 (526) –Was right next to the elevator - Missing furniture, there was no desk or chair to sit on. Lamp shades were tatty and ripped, they needed replacing and the carpet was fraying.  
Overall I would say the hotel has a nice in the lobby, thats all. The rooms need more care and attention….and they need to work on the hospitality.... they're not friendly at all. 
Not good value for money.

title: Daughters 21st shopping trip
text: Had an amazing time at this beautiful hotel, our time started perfectly as we were warmly welcomed and checked in by Sharon who was so kind and helpful, what a lovely lady, she made us feel very special, thank you.  The hotel is in the perfect location it is elegantly decorated and the rooms ( we had a deluxe double 1409) which had a view of the front street and was perfect.  The beds were so comfortable and the rooms and whole hotel looked very fresh and tastefully decorated throughout.  After a busy day it was so nice to step into the elegant charm and tranquility of the hotel.  There is a great deli Ashley’s Fine Foods on the corner which seems to be open 24/7 which offers self serve hot drinks, breakfasts, lunch and dinners which were reasonable and delicious and can be taken back to the hotel or eaten there.  It is easy to get to all parts of the city, the doormen will hail you cabs or it is short walk to the metro, Times Square, Central Park, 5th ave, Empire State, grand central, Rockefeller, Radio City, Bryant Park are all a walkable distance too.  I love hotels and this is one of my favourites, there was even an issue with noisy guests in the room next door and this was dealt with very sensitively and efficiently.  I highly recommend a stay here it really is fabulous.

title: Fantastic experience
text: This is my second time at the Barclay and I am having trouble finding any reason to not go back every time I am in New York City. The staff continues to impress with their charming, kind nature, attention to detail, and quick response time. The atmosphere in the Barclay is like none other and I am currently looking for an excuse to come back here as soon as possible. Would recommend to all!

title: Average hotel, good location, but a lovely welcome
text: We recently visited the Intercontinental. Good decent hotel in a good location. Our visit was definately heightened by the  friendliness of one particular member of the staff, Ms Annmara. Her kindness, friendliness, and open way of talking made us feel we were her friends, not hotel guests. That's the way all hotels should be, home away from home, with real people who welcome you like family.

title: Delightful
text: We stayed here 6 nights in August during the New York Now show and loved it. We usually stay on the west side for easy access to theater and Javits Center, but we learned how much nicer it is to stay on the east side on a real luxury hotel. The rooms was comfortable and big for New York. The bathroom was big and well appointed. The linens were high quality, the towels were plush. Truly delightful!

title: Disappointed
text:
There is no denying the hotel is very well located and extremely splendid to look at but for such an expensive and well rated hotel it has let us down. 

My experience of check in was a fairly unwelcoming event. I went back down to reception in the morning to check on the room for my elderly mother and sister who were arriving that day and reception staff remained fairly miserable and to the point. When my family arrived they found an equally unwelcoming reception staff. They were only 40 minutes off check in time. I asked if, given my mothers age and the distance they had flown, they could find a room so they could check in straight away. That was not possible apparently. 

They later checked in and found their room to have a flooded toilet. They asked to move rooms but were told the hotel was fully booked so they had to wait for maintenance to come up and mend the toilet and for someone to come and mop the floor. They also had no robes and no hangers so those also had to be requested. They then took a shower and the seal on the shower was missing so the floor flooded again. This is not what I expected for such a hotel or for 2 people including a 78 year old lady who had flown from UK to US that day. We are still here and await with interest how the rest of the days unfold!!

title: Superb!
text:
Everything about this place is on point. Don’t skip breakfast, ever.
Rooms are clean, huge, bathrooms are beautiful with lota of clean towels. Room service is classy, and offers nice selection of wines and food. Stuff is helpful. Location is great, Bryant park is just couple of minutes away.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Staff
text: We spent 7 nights at the intercontinental Barclay and had an absolutely fabulous stay.   Upon arrival we were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who booked us in quickly.   The room was situated on the 15th floor and had amazing views of the New York street line.    Everyone we spoke to in the hotel could not have been more helpful.   The cleaning staff in the morning always gave time to say good morning and with a SMILE.   I would highly recommend this hotel.  Rooms were very clean and looked after.    I did not experience any negativity.    Brilliant...

title: 立地のいいホテル
text: インターコンチネンタルバークレーを利用しました。タイムズスクエアにも歩いていけて、買い物に便利です。また、周りに、レストランもあるし、24時間やっているファーストフード的な店もあるし、食事にも便利です。プールがあれば、言うこと無しなんですが、残念ですね。

title: Perfect, if you don't need to be right in Times Square.
text: What a nice surprise this hotel was. Just off of 48th and Lexington, the Barclay has renovated an older building and turned it into a beautiful hotel. The rooms are certainly on the smaller size, but they are furnished with nice little accents and I loved the wall mural. The beds and bedding were nice, but I found the pillows too big to be comfortable.  The staff was very helpful with the bags, and provided recommendations to restaurants near by. There is a small restaurant and bar in the hotel. We took advantage of their breakfast each morning which was well attended too. If you need some extra supplies there is a little Deli across the street, and a little french bakery around the corner. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here.

title: Lovely short stay
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights with my daughter and had a wonderful stay. Room was spacious and bed was super comfortable, perfect for a good nights sleep after long days out!
Location was just right and able to walk to many locations within a short time, no problem.
All staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful, thank you!
Actually can't think of any faults and would stay here again should we visit.

title: Una garanzia
text:
Camera spaziosa e pulita. gentilezza dei barman/bar/woman.
Tutto molto curato.  Tipico albergo di midtown ma di gran eleganza e comfort
E' stato il secondo anno consecutivo e quindi  garanza assoluta.
ci torneremo .....

title: Loved it
text:
Special hotel with lovely rooms and common spaces. Best hotel I’ve been in when visiting New York.
Requested a high room and nothing was too much trouble, the whole team were faultless, friendly and professional.
Didn’t use facilities much but central locale made Manhattan easily assessable.
Highly recommend if you want something a bit special in NYC.

title: Perfect!
text: Stayed here for 6 days recently. Check in staff were helpful and chatty, and very speedy. We were in our room within 10 mins of arrival. Our room on the 8th floor was a deluxe double double, which was perfect for our party of two adults and a thirteen year old. It was a very good size, extremely clean and had obviously been recently decorated. The lighting was good and the facilities were great: coffee machine, robes and slippers, plenty of toiletries, plenty of sockets to charge devices etc. Good wardrobe size for hanging clothes plus lots of drawer space. We had three suitcases of clothes and shoes and unpacked everything. Housekeeping was superb. Shower was powerful and nice and hot at all times. The staff in the bar area and the concierge were great - always helpful and smiling. The gin parlour was a great spot to people watch in the lobby - lots of choice for drinks. Can’t fault this hotel in any way. We’d stay here in a heartbeat and it was hands down the best hotel we’ve ever stayed in NY. Thank you to everyone!

title: Quality accommodation, pricey
text:
Stayed here for four nights in a standard twin room on the 3rd floor, while on vacation in New York. The hotel is ideally located in midtown Manhattan, near enough to the action but without being anywhere too busy, and only around 5-10 minutes walk along Lexington Avenue to the nearest subway & Grand Central.

As you’d expect public areas are very grand and impressive. Our room was a good size for Manhattan with a desk and two comfortable chairs, quality furnishings, nice marble flooring in the entrance hall and all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay. Being only third floor there was quite a bit of traffic noise although this did tail off at night and we weren’t disturbed by any other noise outside. Internet was included in the price and worked consistently and with a good speed.

Although the massive $30 per night “resort fee” was expected, I felt that the $25 daily credit towards spending in the hotel was just a cynical way to get guests to spend extra money in the hotel. As it turned out, there were very few menu items under $25 as all were incredibly overpriced in the first place, and of course even more so once you’ve added service charges and tips. Does anyone actually fall for this anymore? There are plenty of better places nearby to eat for a fraction of the cost.

Overall a good experience provided you treat the hotel as a great place to stay and don’t fork out for any extras, unless of course you value the convenience that highly.

title: Lovely stay in NY
text: Stayed here for three nights - lovely hotel - helpful staff - extremely well placed for most attractions! Occasionally noisy in the corridors at night but that’s not the fault of the hotel - it was the US Open at the time so very busy! Would definitely recommend.

title: Love this place!
text: It's easy to get to most locations in mid-town, it's very close to the train station (GCT), it's clean, the service is wonderful.  I love it and this will be my new go-to when I'm here for business or pleasure.  The gym is a little small so if they could make that a little larger, that would be great.  Not enough weights or space for more than one person to work out in front of the mirror.  That would be my only complaint.  I can't wait to stay here again soon!

title: Not sure about basic cleanliness
text: I usually stay here for business as close proximity to most of my meetings. Never really a long stay, but my most recent trip was a bit longer at 5 nights. Which is when I realised that the sheets and pillow cases and things are not switched out even if you put that 'pls change my bed clothes' card on the bed. I noticed some small smudges on the sheets, pillows cases and duvet cover and despite leaving the card on the bed every morning, these were never changed. Bed was nicely made to be fair, wrinkles smoothed out and all. Makes me shudder a little to think they may not be changing bed clothing between guests.

title: The Perfect Getaway
text: We stayed here for two family birthdays in August. The hotel went over and above in making our stay (we were travelling with our Autistic nephew) as comfortable as possible.In addition to the incredibly stylish decor,the rooms are spacious giving you space to just chill and read. What makes this place special is the staff who go out of their way to help. The door team (thank you Richard and David) make sure you get to your destination and help in anyway they get. The hotel also offers lots of little perks and the room service provides the best tea in New York ( I road tested a lot of places) the restaurant is also worth a visit with a lot of vegetarian options.

title: Loved our visit here
text:
Have stayed at intercontinental hotels before, and this is an example of why we continue to choose them.

Lovely hotel, clean and very comfy beds, cool, modern decor.  The location was fantastic for us.

I’d stay here again. W

title: Not a single complaint
text: Everything was wonderful.  The rooms were of decent size (for NYC), the bar/lounge awesome.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The staff was awesome, the location can't be beat, and (an odd thing to be excited about) the snack mix in the bar was something we still talk about.

title: Good Location and Well Managed
text:
We were here for a long weekend in August 2019.  It was a great base to get around the city.  My teenage daughter was with us part of the time, so we opted for a 1BR King Suite.  My daughter could have privacy sleeping on the couch in the living room, which was very comfortable.  The whole setup was well-designed and very spacious for NYC.

We also booked at a rate that gave us access to the Club InterContinental Lounge, which is on the ground floor at this property.  It is expensive, but that's Manhattan, I suppose.  The lounge offerings at breakfast were terrific and they also had a good assortment of snacks, drinks, and appetizers at different times throughout the day.  Silvia was particularly charming and efficient as the lounge attendant.  She and her colleagues did a great job of running the place smoothly.

title: Nice hotel, but...
text: If this is the area that you want to stay in, this is one of the nicer hotels.  For New York, it has a nice, large lobby.  The staff that I encountered was very professional and friendly.  My room was very nice, a good size (especially for NY) and was very clean.  So first impressions were very good. My problem with the room came later on, when the people next door to me came back to their room and I realized that I could hear everything that they were saying. They weren’t yelling or being crazy, but I could hear them until 2 AM. Eventually, I could even hear someone snoring. So while the hotel was nice, my stay there was not enjoyable.  Also, as an IHG Platinum member, I was surprised to not get any kind of welcome amenity.  No breakfast, no drink at the bar, no points to my account, not even a bottle of water. I’m also Hilton Diamond and they take very good care of their guests at their top properties.

title: Class NYC stay
text: After doing a Transatlantic crossing on QM2 we had four fabulous nights in this great hotel. Ideally situated and a magnificent building. The Staff were very pleasant and attentive. I can highly recommend the Club option which is great value for money. We will return!

title: Destination Fee Confusion
text:
Stayed at the Barclay one night using an IHG credit card free night certificate. Room was fine. I appreciated the classic decor rather than the minimalist rooms I typically encounter. Room was quiet except for some early morning screaming from other guests in the hallway. 

Taking off three stars due to the destination fee and the miscommunication about its inclusion for award stays. I called the front desk from my room and was told by a very stern woman that ALL reservations, award or not, are assessed the resort fee. I hurried down to the lobby lounge to make a $25+ purchase, in this case an overpriced $28 gin martini. Bartender explained that he had to place the order before midnight for the credit to post. Seems bogus that the credit may not be used toward breakfast the next day. Lesson learned. 

At checkout I found out that in fact the destination fee does not apply to award stays. If I had known that I wouldn’t have purchased the martini. 

I was also denied my IHG Platinum benefit of 2 PM checkout. 

If subway proximity matters then skip this property. Fairly long walk from Grand Central and winding down to the subway lines in that place takes time.

title: Güzel Konumu ve Konforlu odaları memnun edici düzeyde
text: Konum olarak 5.caddeye yakın olması güzeldi, Odaları Newyork'ta kalabileceğiniz dünyaca ünlü otel markalarına karşı bile kıyasladığınızda çok iyi ve tuvaletleri çok temiz, Amerika da birçok yerde klozetlerin de mevcut olmayan su giderleri bu otelde mevcut, odamızdaki klima ile ilgili bir sorun yaşadık telefon açıp bildirdiğimde gecenin bir yarısı olmasına rağmen bile hemen geldiler ve arızayı giderdiler, sizinle ilgileniyorlar hizmetleri güzel...

title: Good Hotel, Fabulous Service!
text:
I've stayed at the Barclay three times in the past month, and each time I have found my comfortable and clean. But what has really made me a loyal customer is the outstanding customer service I've experienced at this property.

On a recent trip, I lost my Apple Pencil during a business meeting in the bar. I discovered this before I left, searched the area, but could not find it. Neither could the wait staff. Before I checked out, I asked the front desk clerk Chou if anyone had turned it in to lost and found. No one had, but she promised to keep an eye out for it.

I did not expect she actually would, so I was surprised when my phone rang with a call from the InterContinental while my plane was taxiing at JFK. The flight attendant gave me a dirty look, so I didn't take it, but when I landed back at SFO there was a message waiting from Chou. She informed me that she had found my stylus and left instructions about how to contact her manager, Ruchi, to arrange for it to be returned.

 I called that Moday and learned that Ruchi would be out until Wednesday. I was in the process of asking if someone else could help me when I got a text from the concierge in my building informing me that a FedEx had just arrived for me. Since I was not expecting anything, I assumed it was my Apple Pencil. It was!

That is the sort of service that one used to count on from premium hotels, but it has become a rare exception these days. I'm happy to say that you can still count on it at the InterContinental New York Barclay!

title: Made it right!
text: After a long day of traveling with two young kids, all we wanted to do was settle into our hotel room. Unfortunately the room was not ready at the promised check-in time. After a couple hours, I was definitely losing my patience, however the staff maintained constant communication and understanding. They went above and beyond to try to make everything better. Between Jose's amazing sangria, Jessy's undivided attention, and kurchi's efforts to do everything she could, they all made our stay enjoyable and better! The hotel is beautiful and all the details are spectacular, it's a perfect location to so many attractions. We would def stay here again.

title: A polished turd of faux luxury
text: The only fancy things about this hotel are the prices - the rest is artifice. They charge a "Daily Destination Fee" of $34.43 that "allows our guests to enjoy $25 Food & Beverage Credit per day, $15 Laundry/Dry Cleaning Credit per day". That $15 - and I'm not making this up - is the cost of washing and folding one single shirt, which I'm sure involves exploiting workers that don't even see $1 of that money. The $25 in dining credit will not cover the cost of a bowl of meatless spaghetti in red sauce - that rings in at $26 in their lobby restaurant.  They want to be the Waldorf very badly but slapping premium prices on substandard goods and services is not luxury.

title: Business Trip at InterContinental Barlcay
text:
I stayed at the InterContintenal Barclay for business trip, I arrived at 10:30 pm on Sunday and every person was at every point. The doorman was nice and helpful, the receptionist made check in very smooth, the restaurant was closing but there is a late night menu and the waiter had no trouble in bringing a plate full of french fries. The lobby is quiet, nice, and smells good. The room, bathroom and bed are exactly what you expect and need, but the room was too cold when I arrived (I think is a cultural thing). Good thing is there is an extra blanket and pillows, complimentary coffee for every morning, and it does have a great location. 
One little detail was when I ask the lady in reception could not lend me some scissors to open my luggage because "she hadn't any", when I said it was to open my luggage she said I could bring it down - walking around the hotel at 12:00 am on Sunday when you have to get up really early the next day is the least you want! 
Unfortunately I would definitely not recommend this hotel to host an event - it is really expensive for what they offer. I work in this industry and I was shocked. Everything has an extra charge, service is poor, food ain't that awesome and when I mean is EXPENSIVE is above expensive.

title: Exceptional service
text:
I’m in NYC to celebrating my mom’s birthday . My mom choose this hotel and it was an excellent choice! I travel a lot and often stay in hotels I’ve stayed in several intercontinental hotels around the world and I found this one the best . 
The whole staff has been extremely friendly and helped make my mom’s birthday unforgettable .I’d like to especially note Silvia who greeted us in the club room when we arrived helped us out .On her
Birthday we were surprised by her as she arranged a wonderful surprise after breakfast Silvia had the kitchen arrange delicious birthday desert. We were all so excited and the personal touch made all the difference. Because our stay was so good we decided to stay an extra 3 nights. 
I highly recommend the hotel in addition to this the location is great all the little details are as should be and with a lot of chic .

title: Favourite
text: This is my favourite hotel anywhere in the world, I loved the large and beautiful room, the service, the breakfast buffet and the staff, plus the location is perfect in central Manhattan.  I will definitely go back again.

title: Superb location
text:
This is a great hotel.  It’s in a fantastic location near to a lot of places you would like to visit.  
The entrance is lovely.  It looks grand and actually has life as the bar area is in there too.  Bell guys were really helpful and the concierge is very knowledge for attractions. 
The rooms are great. We had two double beds for a family of four. Room was every well appointed.  All in all a great hotel.  If breakfast included would have been 5.  In all reality though there is so much to eat in New York it’s ridiculous.

title: Very Good Location
text: This is an older hotel located in Midtown. My room was on the smaller side, although it was clean and well appointed. The public areas are nice. The best feature is the location, in a very convenient spot in Midtown East.

title: the most appalling Intercontinental we have ever stayed in
text:
We use the Intercontinental Brand a lot around the world, this has been the most disappointing hotel under that brand that we have ever stayed in. Absolutely no customer service, the staff were rude, and if you happen to try and get room service outside of business hours... don't... you end up in a external phone loop with a call center, it took me an hour to actually talk to someone who could complete the order, and that was after having to go down stair (before 7am) to the bell hops.
the Room was ok, and the bed comfy, but this hotel advertises itself as 5**, I would rate it 3**, and it is totally not environmentally friendly.. with only paper cups in the room.
The cleaning of rooms was ok... but the cleaning staff didn't clear used dishes, and if you left these out in the hall, they would stay on the floor for 2 days or more... really unhygienic.
Too many taxes, and the daily charge certainly wasn't appreciated... a great way to force us to spend money in a hotel we could wait to leave

title: 신용카드를 멋대로 도용하는 곳
text: 고객 카드가 직원 부주의로 도용되어 레스토랑에서 사용되었는데 사과조차 안하는 저급한 동네 모텔. 듀티매니저부터 프론트직원까지. 하나같이 태도는 불친절에 심지어 얼굴까지 굳어있는 최악의 경험을 선사한 곳.

title: Muy bueno todo
text:
El hotel en gral esta muy bien, limpio, la ubicacion es excelente.
La atencion por parte de los conserjes no es del todo buena, la verdad que la llegada y recepcion fue bastante descortes. LLame informando quien haria el check in y cuando llegue no habian tomado nota de ello y no me permitieron ingresar hasta que no llego el huesped bajo el cual estaba hecha la reserva.....
El desayuno, excelente, muy completo.
Volveria a elegirlo

title: Surprise Charges
text:
We stayed from 7 Aug to 13 Aug 2019.  Before making our reservation via hotels.com, we make a call to the hotel and was informed by the concierge that we could stored our packages with them (as we intend to make some purchases on line)  and they will keep it for us until we arrived.  However, we were not informed that there are charges to these.  On one of the morning, when we were at the reception we asked for the bill to be printed.  We were shocked and surprised to see charges of $100 for the 10 packages which were delivered to the hotel for us.  We did not manage to speak to the manager as he was not around and the supervisor at the counter after a long conversation agreed to waive off $50.  If we were being informed earlier that there are charges to these storage, we would not order our stuffs on line and would go to the store and pick up these items instead. We had previously stayed with other hotels in NYC before but was never charged. The hotel should have make known to us in our email exchanges and also subsequent call to the concierge if there are charges to it.  We were very upset and unhappy over how this was being handled.
Although we enjoyed our stay with the hotel and was impressed with the room size and services rendered, we would not make this our first choice when we next visit New York.  We hope that the hotel could be more transparent moving forward and inform guest if there are charges to their services.

title: Awesome Ny hotel
text: What a great place to stay. It had great vintage NY style while being updated at the same time. The bed was very comfortable. The service was excellent. The location was perfect. I highly recommend this place for people who want an actual NY experience, rather than a generic hotel that could be anywhere. Beautiful and comfortable and clean and fantastic.

title: Convenient location and nice rooms
text: Stayed here on business as we had meetings in midtown. Pleasantly surprised as this is an older hotel - rooms were very quiet and well maintained. Comfortable bed - got a great night of sleep. Nice lobby and bar area.

title: Tasas
text: Ir preparados cada día unos 35 dólares de tasas no mováis nada del mini bar va con sensores y cuenta como si lo hubierais consumido nada más llegar te quitan de la visa 300 dólares de fianza que al finalizar de hay te cobran las tasas si te sobra algo en teoría te lo vuelven a ingresar ya os lo diré ahun sigo en Nueva York.El wifi bueno la habitación muy limpia.

title: Lovely restored hotel  - front desk needs customer service lessons
text: My wife and I love to try older hotels that have been restored.  This one has been wonderfully restored with rooms that are reasonably sized by NYC standards.  There are a number of nice little touches (unusually comfortable chairs to sit in), great bedding, and the overall ambiance when you walk in is elegant.  Yes, the prices of everything are expensive, but one comes to expect that in this city.  What one does not expect is bad customer service.  This trip was a special one for the two of us, so I called ahead the day before to make sure that our type of requested room was available, and would be ready on time (we actually had requested an early check-in).  I got the brush-off over the phone.  When we arrived at the front desk, we did have a room set aside for us, but rather than check us in early, we were told check-in for our room would be well after the official 3:00 check-in time.  Tony at the front desk did offer an immediately available room on a less desirable floor (we like high up floors), and we were willing to take it so long as we were located away from the elevator (a key request for us).  He told us the room was indeed away from the elevator.  Shockingly, when we arrived at the room, it was right next to the elevator.  When I went down to express disbelief, I was told a) he did not say it was away from the elevator (gee - could two people mis-hear him?) and b) what he did say was that he did not know where on the floor the room was located.  That was the topper - what front desk person does not know where rooms on the floors are located???  Lying to customers is just unacceptable.   We live in a world in which customer service is paramount.  This fell far short.  No restoration can overcome this kind of treatment.

title: Style and location!
text: We stayed 4 nights in this mid-town hotel and whilst overall a bit on the pricy side, the Barclay offers great style and comfort in the midst of busy Manhattan, free Wi-Fi, good-sized rooms and most importantly, ease of accessibility to all major sites. It's its location that sells this hotel, with the Empire State, the Chrysler, Rockefeller, Times Square and Central Park all just 10-15 minutes away on foot. East elsewhere as the food is pricy inside the hotel - plenty of eateries around and Starbucks is just opposite for your morning coffee fuel. Would stay here again for my next NYC trip:-)

title: Just wondeful
text:
We spent a night at the Barclay to celebrate a special personal event.

What a superb experience, we couldn’t imagine that the rooms would have become so gorgeous after the recent renovations. 

It had been years since we stayed there, and the difference is astounding. People are friendly and we even got to meet the General Manager who was absolutely lovely.

A lasting memory for sure,

title: Fantastic
text:
Good location, nice rooms and nice staff, good all round hotel for NYC ... 5  mins walk to grand central station where you can jump on the subway to wherever you want to go. 

Great bar and great bar staff, awesome 5 days in the big apple

title: Decent quality but needs modernising
text:
Overall - Nice quality hotel overall but in need of modernising and more atmosphere.
Location - quiet and convenient mid town which was nice.
Staff - generally very good. Check in and check out was easy although the front desk could be more cheerful.
Concierge - very helpful.
Bar staff and cleaners - very good
Gym - average
Atmosphere - not much atmosphere, very low key and reserved. No riffs rafts. Could do with a bit more atmosphere.
Decor - quite an old setting but clean, could do with modernising in my own personal view and personal taste.

title: A beautiful hotel
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August. 
The hotel when we entered was beautiful and we headed for reception to check in, which was a long wait, but sometimes this can’t be helped. 
We were informed about the “destination tax” which was $30 per night and that we received from this a $25 credit on food/drink, dry cleaning or high speed WiFi. 
We were also informed which I didn’t know anything about was that a payment of $100 per day would be deducted from my card for incidentals room charges, but this would be return if all was in order with the room with the amount being returned at check out. However I have been back home now for 5 days and it has yet to be returned. I have contacted the hotel via email and they have said this will take between 5-7 business to be returned, which is very naughty as I was not told this.
On the up side our room of a deluxe double double was just lovely with the beds being of an amazing standard. Our room overlooked the busy road which did become very loud at times through the night and woke us, it was a good job I brought my earplugs.
A 20 minute walk to Times Square, good transport systems around and plenty of coffee shops/bakeries and restaurants within a very short walk from the hotel.

title: Family holiday
text:
We booked a family six night holiday staying at this hotel booking a club king room. In summary, the stay at the hotel was great, the staff there were brilliant, not cheap but well located. 

The club room is actually just a standard room with access to the club lounge on the ground floor. It's not cheap but we found the lounge to be a great haven to recuperate after a day out at attractions and the breakfasts were fabulous.

Every contact we had with the wider IHG group was terrible though. We requested three times to have two rooms next to each other but it took the intervention of a manager on arrival to make this happen. We also found that somehow we had been reserved four rooms instead of two and charged accordingly then when we tried to cancel two rooms we ended up with only one. I still seem to have unexplained additional charges pending in my bank account. Simple stuff that the IHG group should be able to get sorted.

We would stay again at this hotel thanks to the staff especially in the club lounge.

title: With lounge access it's a 5/5
text: I chose this hotel first and foremost for the lounge access and secondly for location. My wife and I love to stay at the Fairmont Gold level for this exact reason. To have a full hot breakfast, snacks in the afternoon and tasty appetizers in the evening is an absolute luxury that I am having trouble doing without. It truly takes much off of your mind in terms of food and beverage. The Fairmont always meets our needs however Pauline and Silvia at the Barclay with the excellent food selection have surpassed my expectations. The food is plentiful, different selection every day, full beverage service including alcohol choices, fantastic. This lounge service adds a full star to this hotel's review. The hotel itself is quite nice, on par with a Fairmont, the staff are very friendly and helpful. There are a couple of down aspects though: $30 per day "resort fee" and very high room service fees. The resort fee is presented as a mandatory fee but you can "spend" $25 of that in house on anything you wish. This is a terrible way of making sure each guest spends more in the hotel per night. We found ourselves trying to find something to spend our $25 on and ended up spending even more because there were two of us. The second aspect, delivery fees, we ordered room service on the first night and one salad and one order of fries ended up being over $50, ridiculous! We quickly learned that room service was definitely a bad idea. The best way is to go down to the lobby restaurant and eat there since there are no additional fees. Watch out for the automatic gratuity of 15%, this is added to everything. Twice I almost added a tip when it was already there. Once you figure this out you can somewhat mitigate the added expense. That all being said, my wife and I would stay here again based mostly on our lounge experience.

title: Asleep at the Wheel -management can go home. No need to bother.
text: Nice historic property. Great location. Better than Intercontinental Times Square. Mixed crowd of business people, tourists, and hoodlums. Bar staff rigid and just short of helpful or classy. They turned down 4 people wanting to order dinner 1 Minute after last call. I had not eaten since I left the hotel in the morning. Worked very long day. I counted on my city refuge( hotel) to feed me. They let me and many others down without a slight effort to help.

title: Décevant !!!
text: Nous logeons à cet hôtel depuis plusieurs jours (Chambre 923) et nous le quittons demain matin, mais sommes très déçu ! Pas certain que nous revenions ici la prochaine fois. Personnel de l’hôtel sympa et très accueillant, mais cela fait 3 jours que nous avons droit à des bruits incessants depuis les chambres voisines et le couloir. Malgré nos appels à la réception et les plaintes a l’accueil, rien ne change. Le personnel est également très bruyant dans le couloir (ouverture et fermeture des portes très fortes et régulières). Nous n’avons pas l’habitude de nous plaindre, mais les bruits forts provenant de la chambre voisine sont très désagréable. Nous avions choisi cet hôtel pour être tranquille et se reposer. Très déçu et assez mécontent de notre séjour à cet hôtel. Il est incompréhensible de se trouver dans une telle situation pour un hôtel de ce standing. Inacceptable même ! Je ne recommanderai pas cet hôtel. Ce mécontentement vient gâcher les prestations de l’hôtel qui sont très bonnes: Chambre spacieuse, vue très chouette depuis la chambre, salle de bain très agréable. Petit déjeuner très copieux et très bon !

title: Great location, comfortable. Helpful staff.
text: Great experience here. Would definitely recommend and would return on next visit to NYC. The location was central, rooms were pristine clean. Have been to NYC a few times and this hotel choice was up there with the best.

title: Absolutely not up to par
text: We booked the Intercontinental Barclay as we are very impressed with both IC hotels in London and the one we stayed in in Dublin and Boston...however we were deeply disappointed by what we found at the IC Barclay. The hotel itself is old, which is fine, but it is woefully inadequate as a luxury hotel. The only place to eat is the lobby bar (the Gin Parlour), there is no real restaurant at the hotel. The Exec Lounge is a dark and windowless space squeezed in behind the bar - when the bar has live music you can clearly hear it in the lounge which is playing its own music leading to a cacophony of noise rather than an oasis of calm!  Food and drink offerings in the Exec Lounge are adequate but not special - alcoholic drink selection in the evening is very limited. Our room (1541) was an Exec King - apparently the best grade of room short of a suite. there is very little "Exec" about the room. It is dark, has mismatched furniture, smells vaguely of damp (due to the aircon I think) and the bathroom has a shower only. We asked to be moved to a room with a bath and a shower and were told that the only rooms in the hotel with baths are twin rooms. So you can have a king bed or a bath, but not both - go figure! The attitude of the Ambassador Guest Relations attendant was offhand and had no interest in addressing any of our concerns, the concierge gave us a local map from the Doubletree hotel, which had all the Hilton hotels in the city marked, but not the one we were staying at and in fact the only member of staff who treated us as valued guests was our housekeeper Katrina who was absolutely lovely, kind, efficient and very welcoming.Would we recommend this hotel?- not a chance!

title: Family break
text: Excellent hotel. Staff couldn’t do enough for you. Rooms cleaned daily. Clean towels day & night. Beds folded down in the evening. Awesome stay. Would definitely stay here again. Good location to many things.

title: Fantastisch hotel in hartje New York
text: Een echte aanrader voor iedereen die een 'home away from home' zoekt in New York City. Ik verbleef hier met mijn familie en we hebben een fantastische tijd gehad. Van de check-in tot de kamer was alles perfect. De bedden waren hemels en de service was uitmuntend. Ze waren erg attent met mijn moeder's 50e verjaardag. Kortom, het was onze home away from home en we kunnen het personeel niet genoeg bedanken om deze trip fantastisch te maken. We zullen zeker terug komen!!

title: Great location and fabulous room
text:
We stayed for a night at the hotel. Location is great if you like being close to 5th avenue where most shops are located, Rockfeller centre . Central park is not too far.

The rooms are big for New York standards and they are finished out nicely with good amenities.

Overall very happy with our stay. I got a great deal on Hotwire.Also they gave me a later checkout on my request.

They give you some credit on inhouse dining but if you are thinking of using it please remember the service charge and taxes are quite a bit so you you may end up paying more than what your expected.

title: Great location & finish ruined by staff
text:
Brilliant location - a stone’s throw to Grand Central and Fifth avenue. Only 15 min walk to Central Park. And truly gorgeous interiors - everything is so polished.
The big issues which mean I’ve only marked this a 3 is the truly shocking and rude customer service from the front desk. Not what you’d expect given how much you pay.

title: A pleasant surprise ❤️
text:
We have never stayed at The InterContinental Barclay, so when hearing there had been recent renovations, we decided to book our stay.  We love New York and wanted to stay somewhere central and the InterContinental Barclay ticked that box. Easy walking distance to everything.  
The Hotel is beautiful and from the moment we arrived the staff were beyond helpful. Nothing was too much for them. Efficient, courteous and knowledgeable.  Our room was so comfortable.  Bed and pillows so comfy which is always a plus for us as we travel so much. Clean and good wardrobe space ( always a plus ! )
Loved the Gin Bar. Fabulous service, great cocktails and nibbles with a wonderful ambience.  Breakfast and Room Service brilliant.  The Apiary on the RoofTop where the InterContinental Barclay make their own honey with the help of their bees ! Adore. 
Everything about this hotel is class yet homely. We will definitely stay again and in fact can’t wait to return.  Oh, also need to mention the very knowledgeable Concierge staff and great Gym too even though we should have gone more than the once !
Adore this new gem in our lives.

title: Onvergetelijk
text: Een fantastische locatie in hartje New York! Het was een onvergetelijke eerste kennismaking in een super hotel! Iedereen is er even vriendelijk, behulpzaam en het management was top! Een aanrader, voor herhaling vatbaar!!! Leuke attentie voor mijn 50ste verjaardag op de kamer! Nancy

title: Quite remarkable service!
text: I checked out of the Intercontinental Barclay on Tuesday morning and stored my bags with Jorge, the Bell Captain and set off to a couple of meetings before my evening flight. Realizing I needed to iron and change into a clean shirt for the trip, I made a request of Jorge who, without hesitation, found Sofia Vandaele, the general manager, who arranged for me to use of the room I had stayed in. The room had already been made up for the next guest and would need slight attending to by the maid. When I offered her a tip, she refused my offer with a grin and said she hoped I'd return to the Barclay hotel soon!

title: Still a gem
text: I have been staying here for over a decade and still think it is one of the nicest hotels in town.  The updates they did a few years ago maintained the old NY splendor fo the hotel.  The staff is always friendly and helpful, rooms are comfortable and clean, and the location can't be beat.

title: Amazing !.
text:
Dit hotel is top !
Geweldige locatie met alles erop en eraan.
De crew is er heel vriendelijk en erg behulpzaam.
Ook wil ik Sofia (general manager) bedanken voor de 
geweldige ontvangst.
Voor ons een onvergetelijke eerste ervaring in NYC!

Thanks Bob

title: First Trip to NYC
text:
Just had 5 nights at the Barclay and loved every minute of it. As with many New York hotels the rooms are compact but more than ample for 2 people and were decorated to a high standard with very comfortable beds!

We had a Club Level room that gave us access to the Club Lounge. This included breakfast, soft drinks, snacks, canapes and wine depending on the time of day. Well worth it considering the cost of food and drink in the city. All the Club staff were lovely especially Paulette who was a class above.

Like most NYC hotels they charge a destination fee ($30 plus taxes) but that includes WI-FI and allowance for food, drink and laundry service amongst other things - so make sure you use it get your moneys worth, but choose wisely so as not to overspend!

title: Disappointing in several aspects for tourists
text:
We wish we hadn’t booked this hotel for our first family holiday to New York. It soured the happy memories we wished to have from our vacation. One aspect that upset us was the Hotel’s focus on how they could take as much money from guests as they could. We know, from our stays in London, how city hotels can be expensive, but the Intercontinental Barclay take the biscuit. Their ‘Resort Fee’, charged on arrival, is in our opinion one of those examples. The fee is $34 (incl tax) per day per room and as we had two twin rooms for 6 nights meant our check in surprise was over $400. We were clearly informed that if the daily allowance was not used it was forfeited to the hotel. The fee, we were told, included a Laundry allowance and a food and beverages allowance, telephone calls and free Wi-fi (even though the hotel Wi-fi was free). Laundry was to be handed in before 10am and would be returned by 6pm the following day (2 days!) with the allowance just enough to clean one blouse or two pairs of socks. Worse was the daily food and beverage allowance which was just enough to buy one glass of wine once tax and 15% service charge was added on. The extortionate charges continued with the mini-bar but to rub salt into the wound they added 20% on to the price of anything taken as an ‘administration charge’. An example would be a small pack of Pringles was $11 plus 20% (around £11). Beware, anything moved/taken from the mini-bar to look at and not returned within one minute is automatically charged to your room, as we found out.
Another aspect is the attitude of the staff. I’d describe it as ‘functional’ for the most part. There were just a few individuals who were friendly/human, but the vast majority made us feel invisible or unwelcome. One or two were just plain rude. It is as though the management have little control over them, they run the show.
I could go on about the bedrooms/bathrooms but would just point the management towards Premier Inns (yes, Premier inns!) when it comes to user friendly practical layout.
Good aspects of the hotel, location.

title: Great hotel and location
text: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms were very comfortable.  We were upgraded to a suite with an adjoining room for our daughter and were pleased with all of the space.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Great mid-town location.

title: Very Stylish
text: Family of 4 spent a week here in 2 rooms. Service was excellent and the location was ideal. The rooms were very nice and well cared for. We pretty much only used the hotel as a base so we cant comment on many of it's facilities.

title: Ottimo hotel
text: Hotel vicino a Times Square raggiungibile a piedi in 10 minuti e stessa distanza per Central Park. Posizione ottima. Posto piu vicino per mangiare qualcosa veloce e decente per gli italiani Uncle's Paul. Camere belle e pulite.

title: 1st time in New York
text: We have just spent a wonderful week in this hotel. The staff throughout the hotel are extremely friendly and professional. The rooms are very well equipped and have comfortable beds. It's located near grand central station, 5th Avenue, St Patrick's Cathedral, Time Square.

title: All-around excellence
text: I really can't say enough about this hotel.  The staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating.  They truly made us feel like they cared about our stay.  The room was spotless and updated, yet elegant.  There were charging ports throughout the room, and the beds were very comfortable.  The food at hotel restaurant was delicious-we started out there for breakfast every morning.  The hotel was ideally located for us- close enough to walk to Times Square, the theater district, Grand Central and the sights, yet far enough removed for peaceful sleeping.  Getting cabs out front was always easy as well.  This is an extremely well-run hotel with an attention to detail.  We will be back, hopefully soon.

title: Great hotel! Perfect location
text: Loved this hotel! Very clean and super friendly staff. They were very welcoming whenever we entered and exited the hotel. I also enjoyed chatting with the maintenance staff on our floor each morning. Location is perfect distance between downtown and uptown - everything is just a quick subway ride away.

title: Five stars for appearance
text:
This hotel is in a great central location for seeing the sights of manhattan. The hotel has a beautiful foyer area. The rooms are small but well decorated, clean with comfortable beds. We are a family of 4 and I don’t think we ever got the correct amount of towels from day 1. Took until day 4 to get a shower mat, then they took the wash cloths and didn’t replace them.  Safe in room didn’t work, reported to reception and no one fixed it during our stay. 
The resort tax is a joke! It’s so expensive to get a drink you can’t get even get a gin and tonic from the mini bar for the allowance. Our mini bar was never stocked with the full menu and I never had tonic through my stay at all. Then they add tax on anything you take over and above the allowance! 
We didn’t use the bar or restaurant but it’s $50 per adult for breakfast, this explains why the breakfast area was always so quiet. The dry cleaning allowance will maybe get your underwear clean, again expensive and again didn’t use as we didn’t need to. 
The staff on the door are friendly but the reception staff are like robots. No personality, doing their job with no feeling. You walk past and they don’t acknowledge you. 
All in all the hotel was ok but not a 5star service

title: One of my favorites, this time they got everything right!
text:
We have stayed here many times for various little NYC staycations and this is one of my favorite properties in NYC.  Usually, though, there are little glitches.  This time my hubby and I spent two nights of Memorial Day weekend here and for the first time booked a room that included access to the Club International Lounge.  And this time they got everything right!

As I've said before, this hotel managed to renovate this hotel in keeping with it's elegant old New York style but also make it comfortable for modern travelers.  There are lots of colors of mauve, white, and gold with occasional pops of vibrant colors in fresh flowers or a chair here and there.  HVAC works well, the bed is comfy, lighting is good, and there is enough storage in the room.  This time, for the first time, they even remembered to supply wash cloths along with the towels!  Everything was clean.

The staff are always a real asset to this place and they manage to strike a nice balance between friendly service and proper formality.  We really enjoyed the access to the Club International Lounge.  Unlike other hotel's "executive" lounges, this one was always attended to and freshly stocked and they weren't putting away items before it was time to close.  There were many snacks and beverages, plus nice places to sit and relax or catch up on TV.  Breakfast was served and it was actually good!  I always need sparkling water and loved that I could pop in here to grab a bottle often.  It was a nice oasis to come "home" to!

There are a lot of hotels in Manhattan and we have stayed at a decent number of them and it has been my experience that most of the time a hotel is fine but misses the mark in some aspect or another (for ex., a room might be pretty but not practical, or a room is comfortable but the staff are disaffected, etc.).  However, this place usually gets most things right and got everything right this time!  I often suggest this place to out-of-town friends and look forward to returning myself.

title: Incredible service
text: Stayed for a few days at the Intercontinental Barclay and would like to congratulate the staff on their service. The room was always well appointed, and they really paid attention, because the room was always made during breakfast. The club lounge is excellent, and the food is incredible, always being welcomed with a smile.Loved the location and definitely would come back to stay at the property.

title: За весь свой опыт это,пожалуй,лучший отель
text:
Ну имя говорит само за себя!Бронировали на пару дней,пока останавливались в NY.Цена была какой то с огромной скидкой,поэтому взял не думая.В итоге мгновенное  заселение..
Отель в самом центре Манхеттена.Очеь удобное расположение.Недалеко Центральный парк,Централ Вокзал и Times Square.Номер как номер,но очень чистый,постель свежайше белая.Звукоизоляция на высоте.Очень вкусный завтрак.Кровать огромная(как и во всей Америке).В общем отель класса люкс.После такого ехать в другой не хочется

title: All the quick service lines going straight to voicemail
text:
Check in and out: Front desk experience has always been consistently good at this hotel. Even though there might be some wait, they deliver a good smile and take time with each person. What’s not so great is the concierge line, and every other phone line in this hotel. It’s impossible to call anyone as the line is always busy and going straight to “voicemail.” Voicemails are not very familiar with overseas guests and you simply don’t know how long it takes to fulfill a request. How long to wait around for. Housekeeping also is a bit inconsistent, for a few days straight I didn’t get any water set up, and trash still clearly lying around. 

It’s a busy hotel, and they show it by making you feel like they are too busy for you sometimes. The location is not bad with decent coffee shops and places you can walk to. For a good rate, I’d stay again and still recommend to others. 

A few points of improvements are: 
1. Water pressure in the shower 
2. Housekeeping quality and supplies 
3. Availability of the different lines

title: Nice hotel with a few issues
text: We have stayed in this hotel three times and we always have a suite. The rooms are exceptionally clean and we generally enjoy our stay. A few issues...this last visit we had some very strange pilllows which were quite frankly horrible - a bit like sleeping with your head on an inflatable (we like down and feather pillows). Absolutely hated them and couldn’t sleep properly and ended up waking up with a stiff neck and for that reason we are trying another hotel next time we come to New York. The other thing is the lobby area is kept very cold by the AC. This may not seem a huge deal except the only restaurant is located to the rear of lobby so one has to have breakfast in an unpleasantly cold area so you have to wrap up to eat even if it’s really warm outside. This wasn’t just me. I heard several people discussing it. In fact I saw a family of Aussies sitting with their coats on. You would think the sight of them would have prompted staff to adjust the AC but no! In addition the waiting staff are sometimes rather slow and aloof. On one occasion my husband and I went down for breakfast and were asked if we wanted to share a table with other people. I couldn’t believe that as there were several empty tables available. We declined as we enjoy each other’s company and call me antisocial but we don’t particularly want to eat breakfast with some complete strangers. My only other issue is there Is no real room in the bathroom to put one’s toiletries. They could do with installing a couple of shelves. It’s fine for a business traveller who stays overnight but for a couple who are staying three or four nights there just isn’t enough room and for a suite you expect more room. Generally (apart from the cold lobby) the hotel has a lovely ambience, and I loved the paper mache ‘bust’ in the room.

title: Business trip
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for a business trip. 
We live on Long Island and visit NYC all the time but first time staying at this hotel. The rooms were pretty nice and a good size for city hotels.  Clean hotel, friendly staff, great location, I would come back again.

title: City Break
text: Can’t fault the cleanliness of the hotel or it’s location which is short distance from subway and attractions such as Times Square, Fifth Avenue and Central Park.  Only disappointing thing was being charged £110 on my credit card for destination fee which had already been paid as part of my package, after showing 2 members of staff the proof of payment.  This was returned to my account after I phoned to complain, however phone call cost £15 to have this mistake rectified.

title: InterContinental New York Barclay - great.
text: Stayed at the InterContinental New York Barclay for three nights, had an executive room on the 9th floor overlooking the front. Absolutely fabulous facilities in the room, very comfortable bed, checking in & out was seamless. This hotel is very well located for sightseeing in NY, an easy walk to all the attractions. Looking forward to a re-visit.

title: Incrível
text: Começo elogiando o atendimento de AnnMara, super simpática e atenciosa. O hotel possui uma ótima localização em Manhathan, próximo à Grand Central. Os quartos são amplos, limpos, espaços e super confortáveis. O Club Loung oferece um café da manhã e Happy Hour incrível, com  variadas opções de pratos quentes, frios, pães, doces, frutas e bebidas, acompanhado é claro, de muita simpatia e atenção das funcionárias Josefina, Paulette e Blanca. Só elogios.

title: Some good bits
text:
I have just returned from a stay at the Barclay Intercontinental in New York. I think it is unfortunate that the best part of the hotel is the Club Lounge. The staff in the club lounge are polite and nice. Paulette was lovely and extremely helpful. The food choices are good and it serves different snack options throughout the day until 8pm. 
But the rest of the hotel does not match. On arrival at reception after a long day of travelling I was informed abruptly that there were no twin rooms left after requesting this in January.  So ok I was told they have a suite which I could have for an extra $100 a night. That was a swift NO. He went off again and said we can have a Kingsize bed to share. NO we said in unison as I was staying with my teenage son. The reception chap then said we can have a roll out bed for $50 a night. I said I am not paying extra. So he looks at me as if he is doing me a big favour and says oh you know what I will just give this to you. Wow thanks we got a roll out bed for free. We then had to discuss the fact I had booked a club room with club lounge access which is clearly stated on my paperwork.  He proceeds to blame British Airways and said no I do not. But they do a $25 a day voucher towards food and drink each day. He said the roll out bed will be there in 20 minutes. It took over 2 hours to arrive in the room. I spent £60 phoning British Airways and a nice chap called James called the hotel and sorted out the club lounge access which I had already paid for when i booked the hotel. The attitude at reception has completely put me off this hotel. There was no understanding that people have been travelling all day and just want to get into their nice room. I felt everything was a fight and it should not be like that. I am used to travelling and have stayed in hotels across America and this should have been a really nice stay but we were badly let down in the first few minutes of arriving.  
I also found bar staff a bit rude and unfriendly.  
Great location 
Good club lounge. 
Won't be back.

title: Very nice hotel in a great location
text: Stayed for 3 nights at the Barclay Intercontinental Hotel. Very easy process with booking and very affordable considering it is a 5* hotel. Service was excellent at the front desk. We had an issue with some noise from guests next door during night 2 of our 3 night stay and therefore asked to be moved rooms, the lady at Guest Relations could not have done enough for us. Our cases were moved for us and everything looked after. The rooms were super luxurious and clean, as well as being extremely spacious for New York. We did get complimentary water at other hotels included with the Resort fee which would have been nice here too. The location was great, a short walk to midtown but out of the busyness of Times Square. Slippers, robes and added extra toiletries etc were a nice touch. We would stay again.

title: Won't be back
text:
My wife and I booked a weekend to celebrate my 71 birthday. We are both Platinum Intercontinental Ambassador members.  The Ambassador greeting and check-in was wonderful and when they learned it was my birthday, they sent a bottle of Prosecco and strawberries dipped in chocolate to our room as a surprise. The concierge was outstanding, and made a great recommendation to a Jazz club.

On our last night, we went to the bar at 11:00 for a night cap. I ordered a very nice scotch but unfortunately it was presented on the rocks.  It should have been served neat so I requested a correction. My server took it back to the bartender, but immediately returned with the same drink. She gave me the "Sorry, but we just ran out" excuse and offered to remove the ice or get me something else.  I decided to keep it.

The next morning, breakfast was served at the same place so I was able to see the bottles at the bar. I was shocked to see a half full bottle of the scotch I ordered just eight hours earlier prominently displayed. I asked to see the bottle, and sure enough it was about half full.  They purposely lied to my face in the hopes I wouldn't notice, and they wouldn't have to discard a $22 drink.  This was quite the insult, and I decided to write a letter detailing my experience to the Hotel Manager. I mailed it and 6 days later the manager's  assistant sent me a boiler plate  email response "sorry to hear about your negative experience...this doesn't reflect how we usually do things...hope to see you again soon". 

The Intercontinental Boston and the Intercontinental Willard in Washington are fantastic places to stay.  We have stayed at both many times. We won't return to the Barclay, too many better properties in this area of NYC.

title: Right location
text:
Very good hotel in the right location, not too far to walk to Time Square, Central Park etc, grand central station is a 5 minute walk. 
The rooms are spacious and very well thought out decor, beds are OK, a little bouncy, but passable, The only downfall was tea/coffee it was from a coffee machine, it was the worst tea/coffee I have ever tasted, took the plaque and some of the enamel off my teeth.
Food was very pricey, so I didn’t eat there, choosing to go over the road, which was cheaper.
Overall very good apart from a few minor issues

title: Excellent hotel but book Club access too
text: My wife and I stayed here for a week while visiting our son who now lives in NY.The hotel is very well appointed.Luckily I booked the Club option.This provides a quiet area to have Breakfast Lunch from 2-5 and food and wine from 5-8.Will Stay again for next visit

title: Best high end hotel in nyc
text: This is the best high end hotel in NYC. Everything in my stay was perfect. The room is super spacious, quiet, comfortable and clean. The bed was amazing. The shower was great. The room service is the best you can get in NY. And their club lounge is nothing but perfect. The employee AnnMara did a great job in the check in - she is professional and quick and gave us all the tips we needed. Not to mention her warm welcome. The women in the club lounge are also amazing: Paulette, Blanca and Josie. I will certainly stay again. Highly recommend.

title: Comfortable Accommodation at Historic Hotel
text: We stayed at this exquisite hotel for our honeymoon and had an unforgettable time. Its location is so convenient to explore most of the sights of midtown and downtown Manhattan. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Our room was clean, spacious and tidy. It was furnished with the most comfortable bed we’ve ever slept on. The atmosphere was classy and relaxing. We felt like aristocrats.

title: Would stay again
text:
This was our 7th time visiting NYC and we try and stay at a different hotel each visit . 

We booked this last minute and received a good deal . 

Hotel was easy to find from coming off the subway and is served from a few different lines . 

Check in was smooth and efficient and as we booked through British Airways the resort fee’s was already included . 

The lobby was stunning as was the bar next to it although it was expensive for drinks. 

Room was on the small side but most NYC hotels are , the bathroom was lovely and the shower was very powerful . 

Maid service was excellent and all hotel staff acknowledged you when passing. 

Overall would i book again ? 

Yes definitely but only if it was on offer

title: Lovely Mid Town Gem
text: The Barclay has been in NYC since the 20's and as a child my family visited many many times.  My last adult stay, I purchased through a consolidator and I received a very tiny room for the one night I needed.   This time, I booked directly through the hotel and ended up in a beautiful king renovated room with a fabulous comfortable bed and club access.  The club lounge puts out quite a spread for breakfast, their smoked bacon is TO DIE FOR.....perfectly crispy and not greasy......so I at far too much and loved every bite.  The location of this hotel is walking distance to many many shops and restaurants and highlights of NYC.  I have read many reviews and I can only say that what you pay for is what you get....some of the rooms at the lowest base prices are tiny small......however when you pay a little extra the space becomes plentiful and relaxing.  Our room was quiet, efficient with a super bright bathroom which helped me while shaving. There is a NYC Destination fee charged however it included free internet, $25 per day F&B credit and a laundry/dry cleaning allowance.   We had many drinks at the beautiful bar as they club did not serve Vodka, only beer and wine.  The bartenders Enver and Waiter Maurizio as well as the other Italian bartender (name forgotten....oops) took great care of us.  Between the Room, Services and Club Lounge, this hotel was a 5* winner for us.  Consider booking a larger room though.....Safe Travels!!!  NYC

title: An alright hotel...
text:
The overall experience of this hotel was positive, it’s a clean and bright hotel with several amenities. However we had booked a double room (a good 3 months ahead) but when we arrived they told us there was no double rooms available, so we had to share a king bed:/ But the food and drinks were of a good standard.

Another thing I found unusual, was that on the website it is made to seem like there is a rooftop bar, but when we got there i found out that you can only have access if you have booked the penthouse, so a bit of false advertisement happening there.

But overall my experience was good and the location of the hotel is perfect as it’s close to all the key locations but out of the way enough that you aren’t woken up by the noise of the roads at night.

title: Expected a different experience
text:
I specifically requested a room with double beds for myself and sister.  It was extremely important for our comfort. The reservation for two beds was made in 2018 for the 5-8 July 2019 family wedding event. Instead we were upgraded to a suite upon arrival despite our protest.  Some would have loved the upgrade, because there was this one king size bed in the bedroom and a sitting area with a sofa bed.  One of us ended up on the sofa bed mattress that was uncomfortable and not like the king bed, thereby causing stress and strife. To make matters worse, the suite was a handicap accessible one, and we were not able to hang up our dresses, because of very low closet rods for people in wheelchairs. The shower was tiny, had a large folded up seat inside, and a flimsy short shower curtain that let water leak and spray over the bathroom floor. I was very disappointed especially given that the reservation was made months ago, and I had called a week before arrival specifically to confirm we would get two beds. 
The hotel staff offered an apology and said occupants of double bed rooms decided to extend their stay prior to our arrival.   On other issues, the hotel location is fantastic. In our room, the bed linens were very white, spotless and fresh.  Towels were clean and fluffy, bathrobes and slippers great.  However, the floor, sofa, and rug needs a scrubbing.  We were offered a room with double beds the second night, but by then we were too tired to move and were occupied with preparing and dressing for the family wedding and celebration.

title: Excellent place to stay.
text: Conveniently located near the centre of midtown this hotel offers everything you need at a reasonable cost. Staff are exceptional but I must mention the IT representative who went out of his way to sort out an issue with their Wi-fi and in the process gave me a tour of the IT facilities. It’s how people handle an issue that started them apart from the crowd. I just wish I had gotten his name.

title: ニューヨーク出張で利用しました。
text: 2019年6月のニューヨーク出張で利用しました。ニューヨークの便利なところにあるので、ニューヨークでの出張には便利だと思います。部屋も広いですし、アメニティなども充実していますので、ニューヨークの出張を快適にしてくれると思います。

title: High standards
text: The Barclay provides high quality large rooms. That is what one is  paying for. We stayed the weekend in a club room. Our room was on the 10th floor and we had access to the club at the lobby level. The club provided enough food to keep us going the whole day. Breakfast provided more than what we needed. The wine and beer selections in the evening were generous. The afternoon tea sweets and sandwiches reminded me of London. Highly recommend the Club especially if you enjoy the convenience of not going out and about every time you need a nibble or a sip. Our only unpleasant experience was at the bar late evening. The bartender we encountered had a dreadful attitude. I would avoid if possible. Highly recommend a stay here sans the gin bar.

title: Great Location & great service.
text: The location is excellent and the rooms are of excellent proportions, with the bathroom being a great size. We like to have breakfast at the hotel and this was a good experience here. I did think it was a bit sharp to charge $45 for breakfast & allow only one specialty drink, ie Latte or cappuccino. The bar was nice with an amazing selection of Gins! We would recommend Ian, the manager at Breakfast, excellent.

title: Luxury NYC Hotel
text: We stayed at the Barclay over the weekend of July 5th. It is not a cheap stay but you get what you pay for! I would characterize this hotel as luxury. It is very clean, modern and well-appointed but accessible and not uptight in any way. I didn’t even request it but we were upgraded to a beautiful, large suite which was perfect for my fiancée and I and my daughter. She enjoyed having her own bedroom with large, comfortable pull out bed, desk and TV with lots of channels. It was lovely! The bed was extremely comfortable, plenty of space in the suite for bags, etc. The shower is great, perfect water pressure and the bathroom amenities are luxurious! We were given toothbrushes and toothpaste, cotton balls, Q tips, combs, mouthwash, etc. There were puffy white robes and slippers in the closet. There is a gin bar in the lobby where you can get a gorgeous cocktail (for $25) and some delicious little spiced nuts. There was a breakfast offered there but we didn’t eat there. The only downsides: there are many taxes, fees and charges that are added on to the room rate which total quite a bit; and they probably could use more assistance at the check in/out and bell desks. Overall, a great little getaway in NYC.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We booked a standard twin room only. The staff at reception were very welcoming and friendly. Check in was easy and fast. The room a little larger than what you would normally find in NY. The hotel has been reformed to a retro style. The reception area is beautiful and retains all its original character. The whole hotel was clean. If I have anything negative to say it would be that the beds were small. We were two adults and 10 year old child sharing one of the Queen beds it’s normally not a problem but was a smaller bed than a standard Quuen. Location is perfect with restaurants near by across the road is a large deli open 24hrs that serve food to suit all. We found a diner for breakfast called Comfort diner (look on google maps) which had great breakfast. We definitely recommend this hotel and would love to return on day.

title: Great stay
text: We had a lovely time here for five nights. Room was spacious for a NY hotel. It was really clean and housekeeping and front desk staff were great. Only problem we had was that laundry wasn’t picked up on a couple of days, so it’s worth letting front desk know you’ve left something out to be collected. Would definitely stay again. Great location.

title: Return stay with family at Intercontinental New York Barclay
text: I had stayed at this hotel on business before and enjoyed it so decided to bring the whole family since there was a family wedding at a nearby hotel.  We had a room with two queen beds and since my daughter has two little ones,  they added an extra cot in the same size room. Other daughter had a standard room with king bed. The rooms are all clean and well taken care of by the excellent housekeeping staff. Each room had two pairs of slippers and two  bathrobes along with a small fridge and coffee maker, which we did not use.  The lobby area is gorgeous, and since we were all dressed up in our formal attire one night (tuxes and long dresses), our family photos looked very dramatic! Thank you to the Intercontinental for the lovely backdrop! We enjoyed the breakfast buffet one morning as well as tea and drinks in the lobby bar one evening. Guests must use key cards to go up on the elevator to their  floors, adding to security.

title: Exquisite Hotel in NYC !
text: Myself and my husband recently visited New York for a special celebration and what a fantastic hotel we chose ! The Barclay is a wonderful historic hotel which oozes sophistication and charm.Set in Midtown and convenient for all landmarks and attractions NYC has to offer.We would like to give a special thanks to Sofia and Ruchi for our beautiful room and special treats on arrival , so thoughtful and much appreciated.The stunning interiors and furnishings in our room and throughout the hotel are superior to any other hotels we have visited. From initial booking, communications by Ruchi were first class and welcoming , smooth check - in by friendly and professional front of house staff , service staff and concierge staff second to none. It was a privilege to stay in the Barclay and we highly recommend to all people considering hotel accomodation in NYC , make this your hotel of choice. We shall return very soon ! Kind regards Mr & Mrs Duffy

title: Great Location and Comfortable Accommodation
text: Being loyal IHG members, we tend to stay in an IHG hotel.  We expect great experience with InterCon as it is considered a higher end, however we were a little bit disappointed with the fact that toilet flush malfunctioned three times.  We are also not happy with the daily destination fee that can be used as a credit for food and beverages and other services on a daily basis as we only used it once for drinks. We stayed for 5 nights and we met with friends for various activities and thus, we didn't have the chance to drink and eat at the hotel. This amount added to the hotel rate seems to be a way to tie up the clients to use the hotel's own bar and restaurants.  We are contemplating of joining the InterContinental Ambassador, however we are now having second thoughts because of our recent experience.

title: Part of a British Airways Package.
text:
We have just returned from five nights here and have to say we had a brilliant stay. Part of a BA package bought in the January sale and gave us very good value for money. 

The lady who checked us in was friendly, efficient and professional. She explained very clearly about the destination tax and how it worked, and in fairness our BA had it printed on the bottom. 
The room  was very clean and very spacious - a deluxe king on the eighth floor. The bed was very comfortable - with luxurious sheets! Housekeeping were very good indeed - there was just one day we came back around 5pm and they were still on our floor working and hadn’t been to us - they were next door. We chose not to bother with the service but she insisted, in a nice way, we have some clean towels and coffee making supplies - she was really lovely. Other guests have spoken about noise, one night we did hear loud voices in the corridor from some other guests but were never woken up at all - we found it very quiet for a large hotel. 
Location is great especially being a tourist and wanting to visit the main directions both up and down town! We had room only, having coffee making supplies is a real bonus, so you have a quick drink before you go out and get breakfast. There is an Ole and Steen on one corner and Grand Central station five minutes away with lots of choice of food outlets and the subway. 
The door team and bell boys were brilliant, no issues storing our cases or getting us a cab. 
The lobby is very grand and we had a drink there a couple of nights in the bar to use the room credit from the tax! The service and quality of the drinks was ok but probably didn’t match the rest of the hotel standards amd experience. 
The photos are pre room servicing and have our stuff in them and in fairness probably don’t show the room to the standard it was. The bathroom was very clean and the walk in show very good indeed. We really enjoyed this quality traditional hotel. Thank you for making our trip very memorable.

title: “Nice”
text:
I stayed here with my husband for 5 days , location very good, quiet part of manhattan , nice Indian restaurant close by, the room is good , with all amenities , staff and conceierge very nice esp the guy at the entrance who helps u hail a taxi and also 
Offers change any moment .
The breakfast was quite monotonous, same everyday so got boring .
Otherwise nice experience

title: Hotel com ótima localização e serviço impecável
text:
O atendimento da Silvia que trabalha na área do club do hotel foi nota 10, super atenciosa e prestativa. Happy Hour a partir das 16h no club do hotel, vale muito a pena, bebidas de primeira e comidas deliciosas :) 

Super recomendo!! Todos os funcionários são uns fofossssssss

title: Maravilhoso
