text: Excelente hotel!! Fomos muito bem acomodados, as suítes são confortáveis e aconchegantes, e o serviço é impecável. O atendimento por parte da equipe do hotel é brilhante! Realmente de altíssimo nível! Recomendo!

title: Delightful surprise
text: I found myself unexpectedly staying overnight in NYC after a long workday and horrendous flight cancelations due to weather. Arriving at the InterContinental weary and withered, I couldn't have asked for a warmer welcome from Gregory. He was the consummate host, even noticing that the following day was my birthday. His care and attention to detail turned my entire day around, and I look forward to staying at this hotel  again on my next trip.

title: Excellent visit
text: Friendly and helpful front desk at check in . Nicely sized ,clean room with very comfortable bed. Great location to walk to many attractions as well as broadway shows. Pleasant lobby . Housekeeping staff were very friendly as well . We will return

title: An old hotel that stands out in modern time
text:
Had a wonderful stay in this excellent hotel - i loved everything about this hotel.  From its location just a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal, to the friendly staff and comfortable room.

Being an ambassador member, I was accorded early check in at 10am.  The room was clean and classic looking but certainly not old nor dated.  We had a very nice and comfortable king bed.  The bathroom was well stocked with amenities.  Although well shielded from the street noise, the soundproofing internally was unfortunately bad.  The main reason why 1 star was deducted is the noise issue from neighboring room which can be very significant! (otherwise I would have given this hotel 5 star).  

Centrally located in Manhattan, you can easily walk to Grand Central Terminal (for food and subway) or to Time Square and Broadway for theater.

Unlike most hotel where the club lounge is located at the top floor, Club Intercontinental is at the ground floor, hidden just behind the bar.  It was spacious with comfortable lounge and dining seating and what stood out was the good breakfast selection (although afternoon tea and evening cocktail's selection was not as great).  The one issue with the lounge beverage is the hot chocolate machine occasionally gives out very diluted chocolate though.

I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel and to stay here again.  Not sure if something can be done with regards to the poor soundproofing of the rooms.

title: Veio na Hora certa...
text: Por um erro da companhia nas nossas reservas, acabamos caindo aqui. Foi a melhor coisa. Show de Hotel!! Tudo 100% !! Quarto excelente, perto da Times Square!! Não precisa de mais nada. Podem reservar !!!

title: Loved this place
text: Check in was fast and easy in the luxurious lobby. We only stayed one night but, enjoyed it and it was worth it...lol. Our room was great with a great comfortable bed and plenty of towels.... I would stay here again.

title: Will stay again
text: Stayed here with group of friends and loved it. The rooms are beautiful and great location. It’s worth to pay for the lounge and we used it as our meeting point and the staff in the lounge are very helpful and friendly. The check-in check-out counter can be a bit busy but very efficient. Will come back here again.

title: Great location ..
text:
We stayed for four nights here as part of our two week holiday. We opted for a premier room with Club Lounge access - this was a big plus!! The food in the Club Lounge was really good and, unlike many Club Lounges in North America, there was wine and beer available between 5:30 and 8pm. 

We have to say a big thank you to Paulette in the Club Lounge who was really helpful, good at her job and pleasant! 

The room we had was very good - nice to have a walk-in shower. The staff were all helpful and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great location and hotel let down by just awful service
text: Staying here for 6 days. Great location and the hotel itself is very nice. Nice rooms and good decor etx. But what really lets this place down is the simply awful service across most parts of the hotel. Such a long list of problems; lack of warmth from staff; lack of follow through on requests (took them 90 minutes to print a doc for me); lost my laundry for a day and a half; mini bar not replenished 3 days in a row; coffee pods not replenished; waiting ages for them to answer calls to reception; a very average but very expensive breakfast (52 bucks with a coffee). The list of issues is so long I haven’t listed them all. Others include 1.5 hrs to call me back to answer a query. Having to ring them three days in row to ask them to replenish the water in my room etc etc. I travel a huge amount and this is about the worst hotel service I think I have ever experienced. The staff don’t make eye contact with you and are pretty dismissive. And when I’ve raised some problems they are just not engaged in wanting to fix it.  Not once did anyone just say “sorry for that” when I raised an issue. The one staff member that I’ve found very pleasant and helpful is the door man. Always greets you with a smile and happy to give directions. As an Intercontinental Ambassador I was really looking forward to staying her. The service is so surprisingly poor I won’t come back again.  You’d like to think this review would be a bit of a wake up call for hotel management; I suspect it won’t be though based on my experiences. You’ll see from my other reviews I rarely note the negatives. But this experience has been so poor it is almost comical.

title: Nice Location
text:
This hotel is in a nice location, most of the staff were very friendly, all of them were helpful.
Nice rooms with comfortable beds.
Just a couple of gripes.
There was quite a lot of noise on the one night during our stay from midnight on until about four in the morning coming from the builders loading lorries with rubbish from the Waldorf Astoria which is just across the road and is currently being refurbished.
I also asked if it was possible to have a newspaper delivered to my room, I was told it was and it would be there first thing in the morning, on opening my door, No paper.
I rang down and asked if I could have a paper the following morning, told them this mornings paper hadn’t materialised, I was given an apology and assured that there would be a paper outside my room in the morning.
Again no Paper was delivered.
This is a nice hotel but the attention to detail is somewhat lacking at times, we stayed in the Intercontinental in Singapore a few years ago and I have to say the standard of service and club room food/drinks were head and shoulders above the Barclay.

title: Good hotel, bad fees
text:
Stayed here on a four day trip from the UK, an overall enjoyable stay as the rooms were stylish, clean and the hotel is in a great location to explore New York City.

Our main gripe with the hotel was the $30 dollar a day “Destination fee” that we had to pay at checkout which is completely unjustified and basically money for nothing. The fee is compulsory and includes free high speed internet (that was actually low speed internet that hardly worked), a $15 dollar credit for laundry service (which staying for 4 night we were obviously never going to use) and a $25 a day food and drink credit which when we used in the bar didn’t cover the cost of two drinks. 

A shame as this put a dampener on an otherwise enjoyable stay at the hotel and we will be looking for a different hotel in the same area on our next trip to New York.

title: Birthday treat
text: This is a top hotel expensive  but top notch the bed was huge and really  comfortable  great location  and friendly staff  did not eat here so much choice  nearby  so cannot  comment on the food had a great stay here

title: Fitz’s Anniversary New York Trip
text: Stayed at the IHG Barclay for our 40th anniversary, checking in was fantastic, the hotel receptionist made us feel so welcome, as we had travelled from London, and it was just after midnight  we just wanted to get to our room and settle.  Whilst there the maids, doorman were smiling always greeting us on passing.  The room was adequate for our needs we were there to see New York and did not spend too much time in the room.  Unfortunately on  check out, one colleague made our experience glad we were leaving.  On our approach to the desk she was rude we said we were checking out she asked our room number and said we owed $137.68, we were aware we had to pay a departure tax but had estimated $120, when we asked what is it for she replied it is what it is! I then went to giveher a card for payment and she said it was taken from the card given at check in-is it really difficult to have taken payment from our ‘holiday’ payment card.  When checking in we were asked for a credit card which is why we gave that card and not our preloaded card, but she said it is automatically deducted.  There was no discussion her vocabulary seemed to be no.  I checked the internet to find what the tax is for and I saw that someone wrote we could have drinks off set on it but this was never explained.  It just seems a shame that one persons attitude changed our opinion on our stay, the time you put into ensuring your staff are courteous to guests wasted as one person showed there is really no customer care.

title: Barclay Hotel - How To Not Justify $30 “Destination Fee”
text:
I stay at the Barclay Hotel three or four times per year on business.  It’s expensive at $500 per night, including a $30 “destination fee”, but in a convenient mid-town Manhattan location.  At this price range, I expect the Barclay to do the little things well.  
On the morning of check-out around 9 am, I went to the Concierge desk in the lobby with a simple request.  No one was in line, and the Concierge appeared annoyed when I approached her.  I asked whether the hotel still provided stationary with hotel letter head and envelopes.  My daughter is away at a camp for the summer, she loves New York, and I thought she would appreciate receiving an old fashioned letter in the US mail from the Barclay.  The Concierge had a pained expression on her face in response to my request, advised that room service would need to bring letter head and envelop to my room and requested my room number which she wrote down.  I thanked her and advised I would be checking out that morning, to which I received no acknowledgement.  I returned to my room, finished getting ready for my business meetings and needed to depart the hotel around 10:30 am.  I never received the stationary and envelop which was a disappointment, and also raised the question of for what purpose was I paying the $30 destination fee?  While perhaps a minor experience, it was a disappointment and precluded my opportunity to send my daughter a special note from the Barclay in New York City.

title: Disappointing
text:
I have stayed here each time I come to New York and have always enjoyed it. However, this time I was disappointed. The hotel itself is still lovely, however, there were some issues this time which were not.
1) in the past year they have introduced a $30 per night per room resort tax. Why???!! Yes you can have $25 of drinks etc per day to put against it but genuinely it just feels they are taking even more money from you on top of the high price you have already paid to stay here.
2) we were here for three nights. There is only one bar. As a paying resident I think it’s unacceptable for the bar to be closed for a private function. You could sit in the lobby and have a drink but quite frankly I didn’t really want to pay $20 for a glass of wine whilst sitting side by side on next to my friend on a sofa in the middle of the lobby NEXT to a bar we should have been allowed to sit in. Not acceptable for the price we were paying to stay in this 4* hotel.
3) this is a nice hotel, it’s not cheap, it has a good reputation. Both mattresses having rips in them (see photos) isn’t on.
4) £9 or $12 for a small packet of pringles is quite ridiculous 
5) one unisex toilet in the lobby again seems not the brightest idea considering the number of guests they have. (Always a queue).

It’s still a lovely hotel, the bedding and decor is great. However, this time it seemed to have lost its sparkle. Staff weren’t overly friendly either.

I’m an IHG member (which doesn’t appear to get you any benefits at all!) and stay in a lot of intercontinental hotels, unfortunately I doubt I’ll be returning to this one.

title: Ottimo Hotel Old Style
text:
Il Barclay è una vecchia costruzione degli anni '20 adiacente al Waldorf Astoria; nella zona sono tutte costruzioni tipiche dell'epoca. Hanno un loro fascino, ma essendo mediamente più basse dei nuovi grattacieli non hanno nessuna vista. Se cercate la vista dal 40esimo piano… andate altrove. L'area è comodissima, per le attrazioni (MoMa e Rockfeller center a 5 minuti), la metrò ed i mezzi di superficie sulle avenue. Personalmente la considero ideale per un soggiorno a NYC.
Veniamo alle strutture interne:
- CAMERE: di media dimensione (la Executive), ben arredate e dotate di tutti i comfort; bagno piuttosto piccolo. Meglio le camere che danno sulla 48th, sono sicuramente più tranquille
- SERVIZIO: nella norma; abbiamo avuto (più volte) un problema con l'aria condizionata e sono sempre intervenuti nel giro di 5 minuti
- COLAZIONE: nel bar nella hall di ingresso, molto bello e scenico, ma piuttosto scomodo per i tavolini molto piccoli ed un certo affollamento. Buffet ok (anche opzioni senza glutine) ma molto caro al di fuori di una tariffa B&B
- RAPPORTO QUALITA'/PREZZO: buono per NYC; anche a me non è piaciuto il bonus da 25$ a camera a notte.
Per concludere: un buon 5stelle, ma non al top.

title: Delightfully Elegant with Friendly Staff
text: We had a wonderful stay here and were very impressed with the beautifully upgraded facilities; which are very much 21st century but with absolute respect for the art deco heritage of the building.  The staff were very helpful and pleasant and we particularly enjoyed the bar in the lobby with the fantastic array of gins from around the World.  The location was good for mid town attractions, including Empire State, Grand Central and the Rockerfella Centre.  We also felt that the hotel was excellent value for money, particularly as part of a package.  A bit of a special treat

title: Excellent hotel.
text: Four nights at this recently renovated hotel.  It was a wonderful experience with great service and friendly staff.  Haven’t stayed here before but would recommend.  Used the gym which was good.  Will be back.

title: Stupendo
text: Hotel stupendo pulizia cortesia eleganza non abbiamo provato la colazione troppo cara nelle vicinanze si trova di tutto dolce salato etnico caro ma per sognare a new York ci vuole anche questo..consigliato anche per famiglie

title: Quality Hotel
text: First time in New York was made very special by this lovely hotel.We were warmly welcomed and a sweet treat left in our room for my husbands birthday. The room was very clean with everything you would expect in your room Housekeeping  on a daily basis was also very good. I liked the location near enough to all the main attractions but far enough away from the madness that  is Time square  I would certainly use this hotel again on any return visit to New York

title: Love this place
text: Made as feel at home, cozy, very comfy( bed, pillows, linens, AC, bathroom, minibar) warm welcome, club intercontinental is sure a very nice add! Will come back for sure! Location is superb! Breakfast very nicely presented and flavorful!

title: Beautiful, classic hotel in a fantastic location
text:
The hotel location is just a few blocks (and an easy walk) to multiple subway stations, just a stones throw to the beautiful Grand Central and short stroll to Rockefella plaza, as well as the likes of 5th Ave. The hotel and gorgeous lobby has a timeless elegance about it. 
We stayed in a Superior King on the 7th floor which was very spacious, nicely decorated, clean and quiet. The King sized bed was incredibly comfortable. The room was fully equipped including a hairdryer, small (and very well stocked) fridge, sweet and treats area and tea and coffee station.

title: Amazing Hotel in NY
text:
This is our 6th visit to the Hotel, and we always enjoy the excellent room, facilities, location, and above all the very friendly staff.  
The room , the bed, the amentias, the fitness center , the entire set of services is simply outstanding.

title: Elegance and a bit of wear
text:
Have been staying at this hotel for years and it is a great location and grand lobby
the last couple stays, however, the rooms are starting to show a bit of age
yet overally, the elegance is lovely 
and the service usually exceptional!!

title: Great Hotel, Location and Service
text: Our stay was fantastic. Great room, comfy bed, nice bathroom and ... great bar in the lobby. Friendly, genuine, polite and welcoming service. The location is convenient, close to but nicely set a couple of blocks away from the main hustle and bustle of the tourist sights, so you feel like you can slow down and decompress. I will stay again, next time I’m in New York.

title: Very Happy
text:
Found the location of the hotel to be fantastic in exploring all the sights of midtown and downtown Manhattan. Hotel room was clean, comfortable, tidy and the staff friendly. 

I had an issue on return where I found that $200 had been added to my credit card even though I was told there were no charges on check out. However, I emailed the hotel to demand to know what I was being charged for and I had an email response within 10 minutes. They explained this was an upfront security charge and would be removed from my card in the next few days. 

Admittedly they could have told me upfront they were charging this to my card, but in all fairness their response to my email was so quick it was unbelievable. All I can say is a big thank you to Ruchi, the Assistant Front Office Manager, who was polite courteous and extremely quick with a response. 

He also agreed that staff should make customers aware upfront of the security charge, and advised they would make staff swarmed they should do this. 

I found the hotel superb, the location of the hotel superb and New York superb. The fact the after service and communication was so good cements my five star review. I hope to stay with  Intercontinental The Barclay again very soon.

title: pleasant stay
text: The hotel has excellent location, clean and luxury, close to Grand Central Station and Rockefeller Center. The staff was helpful. The breakfast was good but I can't say was something speacial. As a guest of the hotel we had to pay 35 USA dollars per day destination tax which was a bit of a suprise as it wasn't explained  prior arrival (our fault as we never read the small prints). In overall we had a very pleasant stay.

title: Classic
text: Nice rooms. Nice everything. Really. Classy atmosphere that feels like you stepped into a time machine. Not worn. Just timeless. Service was top notch. Absolutely worth repeat visits. I’ve stayed at other properties in the area and this one ranks very highly in my opinion.

title: Exceptional hotel with great location!
text: We recently stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay for our honeymoon and had a FANTASTIC time thanks to Christa Indiviglio.  Christa really made the difference between a good and exceptional honeymoon for us!  She welcomed us warmly when we arrived and enthusiastically answered our questions.    We’ve stayed at hotels around the U.S. and abroad and Christa’s care and hard work set the tone for an amazingly special time!   We are grateful for her thoughtfulness and know that if not for Christa, our honeymoon would not have been what it was.  We would give Christa 10 stars if we could, she’s the best!!  The hotel was spotless and the staff were extremely attentive.  We can't wait to visit again!!

title: A classic!
text:
The location is obviously fantastic!  The lobby is very inviting!  The staff is very friendly and helpful!  The bellman and valet attendants are pure class!

I was disappointed in room service breakfast although that does not diminish the delightful stay at the Barclay!

title: Gorgeous hotel and great location.
text:
I bought a four night trip through BA and choose this hotel. I added on the shuttle bus which was Airlink which was about £70 for both of us there and return. The hotel has 15 floors. It has a reception area, bar and small restaurant. The hotel was just how I imagined for New York! It’s just like the photos! It’s very impressive with marble floors. I think this fit it with the idea of how New York should be after watching home alone 2! The reception were helpful and even printed off my vouchers for shuttle bus. There is an area for luggage for when your checking out but not flying till later. The bar was expensive but there was plenty of choice on the menu. However we did eat out because there’s that much nearby! There is a room tax of $34 I think it was? But you get $25 credit to spend in the hotel I.e mini bar. However we did take a beer one day and placed it on the ‘yours’ section of the mini bar and it was taken by the room service the next day?? You also get free WiFi and $15 of laundry in this. And free calls. So if you use this then you get your money back. However I think because I booked with BA we didn’t have to pay in the end as possibly paid before in the holiday price? The hotel also take a credit card from you when you arrive and took $200 off me for damages etc but returned the money to my card after we checked out. The room was a deluxe room and was lovely. I can’t imagine what the more expensive rooms are like as this was amazing! Hairdryer and towels included. Also sewing kit, shoe polish, safe and massive tv! 
Only thing I will say which wasn’t a fault with the hotel maybe BA but the shuttle bus wanted a paper voucher or wouldn’t take us! So print before you go as there was a lot of confusion at the airport when we landed!!

title: Great mid-town location.
text: I stayed here several days on business.  Very good location in mid-town.  The staff if wonderful— all friendly and warm.  Exercise room is good enough with variety of machines and free weights.  Never that crowded.  The lobby is a fabulous meeting place and the Gin Parlour lobby bar is impressive.

title: Always a good choice
text:
I have reviewed this hotel before, but thought I’d do so again. Because, a couple of stays later, they consistently get it right. Good rooms, very nice service, good value. 

Somehow wasn’t able to book a club room this time (is it gone?). 

One thing to work on: I heard a lot of noise in the morning—the housekeepers, other guests. Somehow the door didn’t block out much.

title: Disappointed
text: Used to really love this hotel and we were really looking forward to our stay. We had booked two rooms as we were moving my daughter to New York. If you have any IHG status, don't expect much! First, the Ambassador desk was closed at check in, which we understood since it was 9:30 PM, but the gentleman at the front desk who checked us in didn't acknowledge my husband's status at all, he's a spire ambassador. He said we upgraded you to a Barclay king and that was it. He told us there was a resort fee but it could only be used the last day of our stay since we had used an ambassador night? When we got to our room there was no bottled water, no fruit, no amenity, which is standard for ambassadors. We weren't offered a hotel credit. When I called they said they would send but I didn't get it so I stopped by the ambassador desk on the way out the next day and the very rude lady told me that they don't do that at their hotel. They give you a $20 credit on your hotel bill. Even though there was an ambassador card on her desk listing the perks of ambassadorship, fruit, water, etc, being two of them. Seeingthat a drink at the bar there is twenty dollars, a twenty dollar credit is a joke. Plus, a gentleman walked up to us at the bar and asked us if we wanted his ambassador free drink coupons that he wasn't going to use?? The inconsistencies were one right after another. We had to book my daughter an extra night and were told that we didn't get the twenty dollar credit for her room. Checkout was a disaster too. Had to wait 15 minutes to checkout, only to see that I didn't have the credit on my bill to which she explained it had to be used by midnight of the last night and we used it the morning before checkout! Who has ever heard of this? It certainly isn't written anywhere. I convinced her to take it off any way. This hotel staff, or management, or whoever is in charge of their loyalty program really doesn't care if you are a first time or have a million stays. We spent over three thousand dollars on a weekend there even with the ambassador free night and I can honestly say I wished I had chosen another brand. The inconsistencies amongst the IHG hotels have me seriously considering taking my business to a different hotel chain. Also, when a "do not disturb " sign is on the door, it means just that! My daughter was awoken by housekeeper 2 days in a row after just returning from Asia and being jetlagged

title: Nice but hidden costs
text: Upon arrival at the hotel the check in was swift and we got everything we required . The rooms were really nice and well equipped .the bar area is very nice and service is good however food is very expensive $42 for a breakfast around $12 for a drink of coffee . Buyer beware when you check out you are charged $30 per day plus taxes destination fee to which you are not made aware anytime in advance or at check in which is very bad and kind of takes the edge of a very good stay .All in all a nice hotel in a good location but the hidden charges spoil your stay at the end .

title: Great 5* hotel in Midtown
text:
Had a fantastic 4 night stay at the Intercon New York Barclay. The staff were really friendly and welcoming. The rooms were large and well appointed and they arranged them to be connecting as I was with family. 
As we booked with Bon Vivant we had access to the Club Lounge: a separate area serving breakfast, tea and coffee and evening drinks/ canapés. I would thoroughly recommend getting this extra perk - it was ideal when dealing with early evening theatre shows!!
Definitely will stay there again!

title: Great hotel, hidden costs
text: This historic hotel is grand and beautiful. Our room was very clean and Keurig coffee was provided in the room. The location was very good for shopping and public transportation. Rockefeller Plaza is within walking distance. The hotel adds $30 a day to your room fee whether you use it or not. Their bar and dining room are quite pricey but be aware that you might as well spend $30.00 each day because you’re going to be charged for that anyway. For example, we spent $75 one evening for coffees for a group and $30 of it was considered our ‘destination fee’. All in all a great experience but we would have done more in their dining room the other two nights of our stay if we had asked the right questions.

title: Beautiful, classic hotel
text: The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The hotel location is just a few blocks (and an easy walk) to multiple subway stations and Grand Central. The rooms are comfortable, even large by Manhattan standards, and well appointed.

title: Just as described
text: Just got back from 7 days here. Lovely hotel and ideally located for famous landmarks. We didn't dine in but food looked wonderful. All staff we interacted with were helpful and courteous. Room was cleaned and refreshed daily

title: Timeless elegance
text: Great location on the east side, gorgeous lobby, great service, beautiful guest suites that were clean, fully furnished, and quiet. We were upgraded due to status, and stayed in a corner suite on the 10th floor, with nice views, very comfortable bed.

title: Diabolical service
text:
The hotel is on the older side and a bit dated but the real problem here is the service. By far the worst room service I’ve encountered for about 10 years. They keep putting you on hold , and giving you attitude for no reason when ordering food. Once I asked for my laundry and they sent up a luggage rack.
I expected a whole lot more from the Intercon but instead got a 2 star retrograde hotel experience.

title: Disappointing
text: Such potential with such a great building and location but as others have commented, the service is appalling. Staff just don’t know what they’re doing or don’t care. One morning the fire alarm went off at 6am. Staff were nowhere to be found and left everyone milling around reception wondering what was going on. The hotel is extremely noisy as walls are very thin and if housekeeping hasn’t already woken you up by screaming and shouting in the corridors at 8am, including weekends, they’ll be harassing you for when you’re leaving your room. Then there is the BS resort fee that is “mandatory” but isn’t declared when you actually book and is dressed up as being helpful, but it’s just a con. Really really disappointed from such a great brand, would never stay here again nor recommend. Make sure you check your final bill - mine was full of mistakes.

title: Great hotel. Recommend it
text:
Stayed here for a work trip. Good room and very nice bathroom. Great bar area in the lobby. I never had a chance to try the breakfast there which is unfortunate because it smelled and looked amazing as I walked out each morning.

Liked the location. Stones throw to Grand Central Station. One block from Park Ave. 

Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would come back here in a heartbeat for work or with my family.

title: Be warned; not a true InterCon Brand Hotel
text: I have used the InterCon brand of hotels a lot both domestically and internationally. This hotel isn’t a typical InterCon. It must be a acquisition from formal Barclay. You can still see the Barclay brand items in the room etc. The service is also not up to par.

title: Très belle rénovation, management perfectible
text:
Très beau, invite à la détente dès l’entrée dans le lobby. Accueil rapide (il est 10pm), installation dans la chambre 5 minutes après.
Le destination fee, obligatoire, est peu utile mais vous l’utiliserez.

Chambre spacieuse, lit très confortable et décoration avec grand goût.

Silence et confort sont la clé de cet hôtel. Emplacement idéal proche de la 5e avenue.

Grand point négatif : le staff de réception... une seule personne à 11am pour le check-out alors qu’une queue se forme. Même pour les clients réguliers : Ambassador Squire, aucun effort et vous attendez 10 minutes... une honte.
Le directeur doit prendre des mesures immédiates et la chaîne Intercontinental faire respecter le service attendu dans ses établissements.

title: Great location but that’s all
text: The location on 48 th street is great and you can walk everywhere from the hotel. I am afraid that’s all. No other thrills. We did not try the breakfast as it is too expensive and within 5 min walk you can have breakfast with a third of the price. The rooms are rather small and the bathrooms rather dated or it may have been the 50s decor. The room was cleaned and serviced well. It is a quiet hotel but if you open the window there is a lot of noise from the cars and traffic. If you are after convenient location it is perfect but that’s as far as it goes. Rather avoid coffee as it was 10$ for a cappuccino which I thought was too much. Also bottled water in the room terribly expensive too, so buy it from outside.

title: Great breakfast, cute hotel and nice services
text: I have spent 2-night stay at InterContinental New York Barclay for 5/25 and 5/26.  The hotel is so cute, clean and nice.  All the staffs are really friendly and professional.  I love their breakfast.- so many delicious choices to enjoy in the morning.   Great services as well.   I definitely will stay there when I visit NYC next time.  Thank you.

title: Fabulous property, wish we could stay longer
text:
We used our IHG annual rewards night to book this hotel. At check-in (we were there hours early) we were recognized for our status, and told our room would be ready in the afternoon. Bags stored quickly in the bag room, and pick-up was easy. Check-in was the one part of the hotel that was not superior: every time I walked by there were at least 2-3 people in line with only one person working the desk.

Room was comfortable and extremely clean. Bed was fabulously comfortable. When we needed service items, they were brought to our room within 10 minutes. Loved the decor of the room as well. Shower had great pressure.

Hotel is located two blocks from 53rd/Lex 51st/Lex subway stops, so convenient access. Several locations around for breakfast, as we weren't up for a $40 hotel buffet.

Would love to return, the hotel met our high expectations!

title: Exceptional / Luxury at its best!
text: The Barclay was a perfect combination of luxury and convenience. An exceptional staff, great attention to detail, friendly front desk & housekeeping interactions during our stay. From the comfortable bed to the heated tile floor in the bathroom, this hotel was outstanding, clean, beautiful architecture and design is a top-notch choice for NYC.

title: IHG has redeemed itself with the Intercontinental NY Barclay
text:
I'd been getting disappointed with some IHG hotels I'd been booking lately but all is well again as I have found the Intercontinental New York Barclay.  The location is great for me as it was close enough to walk home from seeing shows on Broadway but far enough from the maddening crowd.  The rooms were a great size (we got two rooms),  had everything you needed,  and the bathrooms were beautiful and big.

I give this hotel top reviews because I paid the same price as rooms I got for my uncles in Citadines and their rooms were half the size and half the amenities.

title: Great stay in New York
text: We stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay recently during our holidays in the US. The hotel has a great location and from there all major attractions in Manhattan can easily be visited. It is not only the great location that makes this hotel recommendable for a stay in the Big Apple; the hotel offers great service and simply has good vibes. I would like to thank Sofia the GM and her team for making our stay so pleasant and memorable. We hope to return one day :).

title: Lovely hotel
text: The Barclay is a nice hotel recently renovated, very nice lobby with a wonderful bar area. Staff very friendly and professional. Our room was comfortable, comfy bed and beautiful decor as well as bathroom.

title: Beautiful hotel, service needs work
text: This was the first time I've stayed at the Barclay since the renovation a few years ago, and they did a great job maintaining the historic integrity of the building while incorporating some modern comforts.  I loved everything about the guest room.  The check-in experience was not great.  No smile, no greeting, no "how are you" or anything like that, just a brusk "what's your name" followed by the handing over of keys.  (She later apologized and said she was having a bad day).  The bell staff here will happily watch you struggle with your bags as you try to navigate the stairs at the main entrance, but I guess this is what you expect in New York.  I feel that level of service is unacceptable for a luxury brand like Intercontinental, but maybe I am wrong.

title: Very clean, nice room, great location
text:
We have booked this hotel through BA website as a pack including flights to NYC. 
the check-in very easy and quick ( they retain 500$ on your credit card to cover any missing items/ breaks, etc). 
we have booked 8 nights ( with no meals). we were located at the 6th floor,. 
The room we booked -  superior king size - looked very nice and clean, you had everything you need at your disposal: hair dryer, iron, iron board , etc..  The bed was very very comfy and the bathroom great. 
You have in the room coffee and tea for free. any other items like snakcsor other beverages from the mini bar are extra cost.
As well, they provide free WI FI - password is given at check in. 
overall we had a great stay at this hotel. the location is very good. we walked most of the times.. good bars and restaurants near by. 
i would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. 
p.s.: when you check out you have to pay the city tax which is 30$/ night / room.
( with added tax on the total value) ... we paid 275$ for 8 nights .

title: Hotel overbooked and we got unknowingly cancelled... be warned
text:
We booked a special break for my 40th birthday in May in October 2018 to ensure we got the hotel of choice in an area we wanted. So, after much research we actually booked the sister hotel - Intercontinental Barclay via British Airways holidays. 24 hours before we were flying out to New York I contacted the hotel to request they order us a taxi to take us to the hotel from the airport, at which point they emailed back and said our reservation had been cancelled. I told them that couldn’t be possible as I have the up to date reservation via British Airways holidays. British Airways were brilliant at getting to the bottom of what happened as they weren’t informed by the hotel either - it turned out a member of staff deleted our reservation ‘by mistake’ and that there was nothing they could do as they were now full. We know (and they know of course) we were bumped for a customer paying a better rate... 

British Airways promptly booked us into the sister hotel Intercontinental Times Square who initially promised an upgrade for the cock up on their part (that never materialised), upon arrival the reception didn’t even know anything about what had happened other than they were required to take payment from us again for the room. We then had to call British Airways again to step in to remind them that they had deleted their payment details and we had already paid. 

I accept that hotels make mistakes, we are all human, what I am so annoyed about is how this hotel handled it. No one even apologised, came to speak to us, or even fully explained what happened, we were just left to it and told we were lucky to get the replacement room! If I hadn’t emailed to book a taxi shortly before we arrived we would have been none the wiser. 

Thankfully they haven’t ruined my birthday (I wouldn’t allow them to do that) but we have been on the end of some appalling customer service. 

My advice? There are plenty of hotels around Times Square, don’t risk this one, if they lose your booking like they did ours, the customer service and support to put things right is shameful.

title: Comfortable
text:
Good location, rooms very basic (no bath tubs) but clean. As a no frills option it works. Best part of this hotel is the little bar which gives you a choice of over 90 G&T options!!!
Would I stay here again, Yes, especially for the proximity to 5th Ave & Central park. Is it an exciting hotel, No, but does what it says on the 'tin'

title: Lovely hotel with Comfortable beds.
text: Staff is amazing and most try to assist to their best ability. Check in was swift and had the Premier room with a great view. Bed was a god send. Super comfortable which is important when you want to have a good night sleep. Unfortunately gym was rather small and there was already a bit of a crowd when I went in at 7am. Totally recommend upgrading to Club. Great food served all day!

title: Le aspettative erano un po’ differenti
text: Splendido hotel, in pieno centro, location d’eccezione, stanze altrettanto, personale alla reception professionale, forse troppo, ma va bene. È che così non ti aspetti che, nel cambio degli asciugamani ti manchi più volte il tappetino della doccia, che la tazza del wc si muova e ti accorgi che c’era già stato un tentativo di riparazione...mal riuscito, che sei “obbligato” a fare una consumazione di 25$ al giorno perché comunque devi pagarli, tassa di soggiorno a parte. Dettagli? Si, ma che un po’ fanno la differenza. I letti però un sogno, dopo tutti i chilometri percorsi durante il giorno..!

title: Great family stay
text: We stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay for 5 nights with our son of 12 years old to see the city and were impressed! The hotel has a very convenient location to see all major attractions in Manhattan. And after being out and about the whole day it is a great place to come home too! Lovely service, just what you need. We have traveled quite a bit and can highly recommend this hotel.

title: staff in the mebers lounge in particular ms. paulette hope
text: this lady is excpetional service and customer care , she leaves nothing to chance she is amazing , high quality staff there is a freindlinessto her you raraly see the only comment i hav eis she is fanatastic

title: Fantastic mini break in midtown Manhattan.
text:
We had a wonderful stay in a magnificent one bedroom suite at the Barclay. My wife and I found the hotel absolutely wonderful and really enjoyed our time visiting. 

We are back home now with new lifelong memories and this hotel played a great part in that. We spent an evening in the Gin Parlour which had fantastic cocktails and a huge selection of gin. 

We also had access to the Club InterContinental lounge where we enjoyed a fantastic breakfast and wonderful snacks and drinks during the day. They even had a small selection of treats for kids and were very happy for us to take some Dum Dums and Twizzlers home for our kids! 

The service throughout the hotel was very attentive. I will most certainly be recommending the Intercontinental New York Barclay to my friends and colleagues when visiting New York. Thank you again.

title: Amazing
text: One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. We got the room for one night for my wife's marathon and we got the room for just shy of $300 on hotels.com. This was by far the best hotel, and best value hotel, I have ever had in NYC. Don't forget to use your "resort credit" for a drink at the bar or room service.

title: Excelente
text:
Localização excelente. Quarto confortável e muito limpo. Banheiro muito bom excelente atendimento. 
O bar no hall de entrada é bem agradável. O restaurante, assim como o café da manhã, não experimentamos.

title: A good way to celebrate in the city!
text: I went to Barclay Intercontinental for my sweet 16, and my experience was just so wonderful! The staff will make you feel so welcomed and with such great hospitality, the food was great and at top quality,they make sure that you feel very special, they even surprised me with a treat made especially for me, and it was delicious! I would most definitely come back again.

title: The most wonderful stay
text:
We have just returned from 4 fantastic nights at the Barclay. From the beautiful room to the excellent service, there was nothing to fault about our stay. 

On arrival, we were greeted by the lovely Ruchi, who is the Assistant Front of House Manager. I didn’t know at the time but my lovely boyfriend (fiancé!) had been in touch with Ruchi before our stay letting her know he would be proposing while we were in NY. Ruchi did everything she could to make our stay so very special from ensuring a smooth check-in experience to gifting us a lovely bottle of Prosecco and chocolate dipped strawberries the night of our engagement. Ruchi deserves only the highest praise. 

We did not spend much time in the room as we were so busy exploring the city but the hours we did spend there were wonderful. An exceptionally large and comfy bed and more space than we expected for a New York hotel room. Not to mention a lovely luxurious bathroom. 

If we were to return to NY we would have no hesitation in staying at the Barclay. Thank you again, Ruchi!

title: Lovely hotel
text: We have recently visited your hotel for the second time and were very impressed again. We had mentioned it was our 35th Anniversary, we were upgraded to a corner room, early check in and some lovely cakes for our celebration. Even though we moved rooms back to a regular room due to renovation work going on at The Waldorf hotel during the night that kept us awake all night due to no fault of The Barclay, we hope to return again on our next trip to New York. Highly recommend, hotel very clean, super comfy beds and great location.

title: Fantastic hotel, excellent staff
text: We had a great stay here at the Barclay, taking my elderly parents for a weeks break in New York. The staff were fantastic, and really made us feel welcome. A small issue with our room was quickly sorted and we were given a free breakfast in way of recompense. They also arranged for a birthday cake to be delivered to my step fathers room for his birthday, which was a nice touch and made him feel very special. The hotel rooms were spacious and clean, and the main bar and lobby areas were nice places to while away an hour or two with a few drinks. Can’t recommend this place enough, if we ever come back to New York we’ll definitely try to stay again.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Great location, friendly, helpful staff and comfortable rooms.

We spent 4 nights at the Barclay having booked a package through British Airways.  We arrived a little early but were checked in promptly and advised that we would be charged $200 as a security deposit which would be held on my credit card. On check out, as I checked our bill, the destination fee had automatically been charged to my credit card as well a charge of $30 for breakfast on one day, which we hadn’t ordered. I queried the charges and advised that I wanted to pay cash for the resort fees and that we had never ordered breakfast and although the breakfast charge was refunded as well as the destination charges, this will take up to 3 days to be returned to my credit card. I paid cash for the destination fee but had I been asked in the first place how I wanted to pay, rather than the receptionist assuming, I would not now be waiting for the refund.  

Our room, on the 5th floor, was spacious and clean and the bathroom was lovely, with a powerful shower and complimentary toiletries which were replenished daily. Oddly the duvet on the bed wasn’t in a duvet cover but had a plain sheet below and above it - this was fine when we first got into the bed but partway through the night they became tangled and separated so not an ideal set up in our view - we assume the duvet itself was changed each time new guests arrive as otherwise the hygiene implications are questionable. We received daily housekeeping and ensured we left a monetary tip each morning but the service sadly didn’t include the ‘flick of a duster’ and by our departure day the dust on the bedside cabinets was really quite thick! 

Everything said we had a great stay in a lovely hotel and would definitely return.

title: Great Hotel
text: Our stay was fabulous. Sharon who worked the front desk was top notch. She was courteous had a great smile and knew her stuff. People like her are what keeps us returning to this fabulous hotel We had stayed previously in 2017 and loved the great location and the decor is beautiful. A big plus is the safety of the hotel.

title: Luxury hotel
text: I have been there for one week for my holidays. It was a great luxury hotel exactly what I want. But the basic think I didn't see is the hospitality. When we arrived after 10 hours fly, we had problem with our reservation. We were waiting 30min in the reception and nobody asked if we need something. Furthermore 1 day after our arrival, I went to the reception. I asked them for ONE spoon. Mrs Isabella told me that if we give you the spoon to your room you have to pay room service . I asked her how much is the room service? And she answer me I don't know. I was downstairs maybe 10 min for the spoon. It was too much for the study serve us.

title: Very Average
text: Interon can certainly do much better than at Barclay. I have been to many Intercon but this one was barely adequate. Around 15 min waiting on the phone if I can get bottled water, as apparently, the staff was saying, is not complementary daily. Then I went to downstairs to ask for it, and was promised 'a quick delivery'/ Water came half an hour later. With the current prices we pay in NYC, i think Barclay is missing the mark big time.

title: Hidden costs in hotel and some rude staff!
text:
The hotel in itself is a nice place, we only encountered problems a couple days into our stay. To begin, they asked to take a card which they said would only be used if anything was taken from the mini bar etc, what they neglected to tell us was that they would be taking $100 PER NIGHT out automotically at the very beginning of the trip. When we went to complain a woman at reception told us to "take it up with Trump" and then ignored whatever else we had to say. They also do not inform you that they will be taking out a further $34 per night (on top of the room cost) as a 'destination fee' for no justified reason other than to make more money. If nothing is taken they will refund $66 per night (the $34 is lost forever), but take note we visited weeks ago and this refund is still on hold so do not expect it any time soon. 
Lastly, for two people the breakfast buffet comes to just under $100! I don't know of any breakfast buffet worth this and so would suggest finding somewhere else to go.

title: Great Location
text: Great location and well sized rooms for midtown NYC. Gym is good. I did think that the bar and restaurant area was pretty uninspiring but there are so many good places to go nearby that it hardly matters. And the staff are generally professional and courteous - particularly the bell hops. The one negative was at the reception itself. The same member of staff checked us in and out five days apart and was dismissive and rude on both occasions. I have never come across that at such an upmarket hotel and could not make sense of it given we were just asking basic questions about the hotel amenities and one item on the bill that was obviously a mistake.

title: Surpassed all expectations
text: As a teacher you always want to be able to say how something can be improved.... I have thought long and hard and I am stumped. The staff from the door to the room and back are exceptional in all they do. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was large and huge by NYC standards. The location was perfect for two first timers in the big apple. I was genuinely sad to leave. We are expecting our first child and as hope to visit in the near future the 3 of us.

title: Perfect hotel for relaxing and sightseeing.
text:
This was our first visit to New York celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We cannot speak highly of the service we received from beginning to end. The hotel upgraded us a fantastic room as they heard it was a special occasion for us, along with a lovely surprise of chocolates and cupcakes. 
The gin parlour is a perfect location to rest and relax after all the sightseeing and walking we did. 
A beautiful well decorated hotel, to service your every need and far enough away from the busy Times Square, yet not too far to walk. 
The staff are so friendly and attentive and we had such a fantastic time and cannot highly recommend this hotel, we are already thinking of visiting again and the Barclay will be our first choice. 
Thank you to all the staff who made us feel so welcome.

title: Amazing hotel
text: This is the 5th time back in New York and I only stay at this hotel. Exceptional staff, especially in the lounge....welcoming and always make you feel like you’re visiting family. Breakfast service is amazing too. I really like the rooms that have very comfortable beds. Never would stay anywhere else.

title: Luxurious
text:
From the doorman, through the check in, to the room it was an excellent first impression.
The foyer is very impressive, the lifts old school, beautiful plaque on the bedroom door.
Bed very comfortable, well appointed room, bathroom had a large shower.
The cupcakes and fancies were an added bonus 😃
The staff are very attentive and knowledgeable of the area.
Didn’t use any of the facilities so cannot comment on them.

title: Love, Love, Love this NYC Hotel!!!
text: I've been staying at the IC NY Barclay hotel for well over 10 years and it's my home away from home.  They did a spectacular job on renovating this hotel which reopened a few years ago after a multi-million dollar renovation.  They drastically improved the lobby and installed a showcase stairwell on the main floor.  The lobby is beautiful, warm and welcoming and the floral arrangements are always on point.  It's strategically located near Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center and for the shoppers, it's within walking distance to Fifth Avenue, Barney's, Bloomingdale's, Saks 5th Ave and Bergdorf Goodman and I visit all them all.  An excellent hotel isn't only based on its facilities but its staff.  The staff here is welcoming, warm and personable from the Front Desk, Bellmen to the Room Attendants.  They always recognize me as a returning/loyal guest and Ambassador member.  I'd like to recognize a few outstanding staff members:  Annmara, Gregory & Sharon at the Front Desk (the three of them alone can serve as instructors or mentors in how to provide excellent hospitality); Richard (longtime employee over 20+ years) and Miguel on the Bellman staff, and Norman of the Concierge staff.  There are others but I didn't get there names.  I love the artwork in the rooms and the carpeted and marble floors.  I brought a dear friend on this trip who is like a sister to me and it was her first experience with the Barclay hotel.  We had both recently lost dear/beloved family members so we needed a good trip.  I contacted Norman for his suggestion on a excellent florist because I wanted to surprise my friend with an orchid corsage to wear to Easter services in Brooklyn.  His recommendation came through and the florist provided an excellent/breathtaking corsage which made her day.  We also used the Laundry service and they did a superb job in steam pressing our Sunday attire.  When I asked my friend how she enjoyed her stay, she commented that it was a first class trip. Having tenured/excellent employees provides a business with consistency e.g., I met Gregory when I first started staying at the hotel well over 10 years ago. Excellence permeates every aspect of this hotel and that's why I love it and will continue to be a loyal customer!!!

title: Well Located
text:
Excellent Room and service. 1st class hotel, located 47th and Lexington Avenue.
Central location, able to walk to most areas. Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, MOMA.
Central Park. 5th Avenue etc
Prepare to tip for everything.

title: Thanks for your outstanding service Christa!
text: Christa has consistently gone above and beyond over the past year in arranging our executive team’s accommodation.  Despite numerous last-minute changes, she is always calm, courteous and professional.   Her thoughtfulness, responsiveness and attention to detail have been greatly appreciated.  Christa’s initiative and follow through make her highly effective in her role.

title: La parfaite halte pour un séjour a Manhattan
text:
En terme de prestations tout comme de services, l’Intercontinental Barclay s’impose comme un établissement de référence. Chambre spacieuse et très propre avec un personnel qualifié, à l’écoute et professionnel, un grand bravo à sa General Manager Sofia Vandaele. 
Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans ce superbe hôtel en plein cœur de Manhattan.

title: Lovely stay
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay. Excellent hotel, we booked with BA got in a great deal. The room was perfect and the beds the most comfortable I have ever slept in! All the staff are polite and helpful, nothing is too much trouble. We had a faulty safe which was dealt with immediately and the Concierge was happy to print some tickets for me which I had forgotten to do before I came.
Would highly reccomend this hotel for location and comfort.

title: Our Magnificent Home Away From Home...InterContinental New York Barclay
text:
My husband and I began a month long 50th anniversary celebration at the InterContinental New York Barclay, before embarking on an ocean and river cruise. Our stay was for 5 nights.

From the moment we walked into this incredible property, our warm welcome, attention to every detail and very fine service from the Doorman, to the Front Desk Staff, Restaurant Staff, Housekeeping Staff, and the entire Staff could not have been more attentive and perfect in every way!  The Barclay works hard, yet makes it appear effortless in making one's stay a wonderful, memorable experience.  We began a special celebration in the finest of ways.  We wish to thank EVERYONE who made us feel special and spoiled.  

We love the InterContinental New York Barclay and this is where we choose to return to year after year when planning a trip to NYC.  There are so many hotel choices in the City.  Nothing can compare to The Barclay.  Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!  Everyone shared in our celebration and we could not have asked for anything more!

title: Oasis in Mid town
text: A smart hotel with a real sense of calm when all around is buzzing - beds large and comfy, staff friendly and helpful, faciltiies good.  Drinks and food are expensive, but you are in Midtown.  Great location to explore from and BA holidays did a good deal.

title: Beautiful hotel in a convenient location
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in April 2019. On arrival our room was not ready (this was expected as we arrived at noon and check in wasn't until 4pm). We stored our luggage with the concierge and were told the hotel would call as soon as our room was ready. As promised by 2.30pm we were contacted to say our room was ready.

The room was very generous in size, especially by New York standards with a king sized bed and over looked the front of the hotel (room 441). The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was spotless with a large walk in shower. We loved the art deco feel of the room's decor.

The location was quieter than when I have previously stayed in times square. I preferred this as it helped us get a good night's sleep, without the constant sound of sirens and taxi's beeping. 

Only disappointing thing was the price of the minibar and snacks in the room. They were very expensive and as they were located opposite the bed it was quite hard to resist temptation to dive in!  

Overall the hotel was great, only a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and only steps away from Grand Central Station.

Staff were helpful - we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

title: the staff was amazing
text:
we arrive early in the morning, we reserved 2 rooms for 5 people, and Crista, one of the managers, did all she can to hurry the rooms for us and took care of some problems we had in the reservation. later we receive great service from Ruchi , another manager, she was very helpful and made us feel welcome.
the hotel is clean, the rooms are comfortable the Gym was very nice and the location is perfect! but the staff is the biggest asset of the hotel...

title: Nice and clean, convenient location!
text:
I stayed at the InterContinental for two nights in April 2019. 

The hotel is really clean and the rooms are a fair size. Not too small, but not huge. 

The service is good, but not great. 

Location wise, it’s pretty good.

title: Great base for your New York Adventure
text: Fantastic Hotel top quality everything. Check in was swift note there is a $35 dollar daily tax but they do give you $25 dollars to spend on bar, room service or mini bar so make use otherwise you'll miss out. The main bar has a very good choice bit pricey for cocktails but all other drinks comparable with surrounding area. We didn't eat but good choice on the menu. Check out is at 11AM so not being kicked out early and you can leave your cases securely with the door man. Rooms are excellent and the bed so comfy like sleeping in a huge marshmallow. there is no complementary water only the 750ml in the mini bar which is $12 so need to purchase before but could always use it in your allowed $25. Large walk in shower which has 2 heads and is a good flow and temp. We would recommend hotel as a good place to start your adventure only 15mins walk from Grand Central and Times Square.

title: Luxury without opulence
text:
This is a 5 star hotel without opulence. Big rooms, confortable beds, very clean and well decorated. Expensive but very good breakfast with high quality products. Location is just perfect and we would recommend it.

I would only say that, as it is a big hotel, it lacks some personal attention to detail. For instance: we asked for a late check out when we checked in, we confimed it on the day we were leaving and still got 2 calls asking us to leave the room and 2 cleaning staff visits to our room.

Also, our door got locked one day and it took them 30 minutes to send someone to fix the door (we were waiting outside).

I would still recommend this hotel but we paid a high price and we expected a better service.

title: Still love this place but there were a few small issues
text:
This has been, and still is, one of my favorite NYC hotels.  It is an old, elegant hotel building that has been beautifully and lovingly restored/renovated so that you still feel the elegance of the hotel's history but you also get modern functionality and comfort.  For a bit of history, note the display cases opposite the elevator bank that contain artifacts from the hotel's storied past.

My hubby is part of the IHG Ambassador program and booked online, but surprisingly there was a problem.  When he looked at his confirmation email a couple of days before our arrival, the confirmation was for the wrong Intercontinental NYC hotel (it was for the Times Square hotel).  It actually wasn't my hubby's error as the Times Square hotel was significantly more expensive for that date but the price on the confirmation was the Barclay's price.  So he had to call the Ambassador program to get it straightened out, which got done.

We booked a king bed room and when we checked in with the Ambassador desk, the staff member mentioned that she'd upgrade us from two standard queen beds to a king deluxe.  Once again, we felt this was a glitch as we had reserved a king room to begin with.  When we double-checked this upon check-out, she told us she upgraded us from a king premium room to a king deluxe room, but that doesn't account for her talking about two queen bed room.

Our room was beautiful, with mauve, platinum, white and gold colors.  There was a nice round table and two chairs where we enjoyed our morning coffee.  The bathroom was well-lit and well-appointed, but one of the other issues we experienced was that there were a number of stains on the paint of the wall opposite the toilet, which one wouldn't expect in this type of property.  And, just like our last visit here in September, inexplicably there were no wash cloths in the bathroom, which we didn't realize until the morning.  I don't get that.  

The bed and pillows were comfy and the HVAC worked.  Another not-so-pleasant thing was that even though we never set the alarm clock, it went off at 6 a.m.!!!  I wish the fridge wasn't one of those where they stock it and if you move something it gets charged (the tiny section where you allegedly could put your own beverages wouldn't fit anything).

The staff here are pretty much universally friendly and service-oriented.  Everyone says hello even if you just pass by.  The Gin Parlour just off of the lobby is a lovely bar/restaurant/lounge where we had some snacks and drinks (made with house-made tonic!).  Some of our food was a bit overdone (pretzels were too hard/crispy).

We were only here for one quick night but made sure to relate most of the issues we experienced to the Ambassador Desk staff member at check-out, and she was very apologetic (I showed her a photo of the stains on the wall in the bathroom) and seemed perplexed that the bathroom didn't have wash cloths, etc.  We also reiterated the booking problem (which wasn't the hotel's fault).  She offered us 10,000 rewards points which we accepted, and while we appreciated the gesture I just realized that those points would get us about 1/6 of the way to a free night.  Better than nothing, but not what I would call "generous" after experiencing so many glitches in for just one night at the hotel.

Nevertheless, in spite of these problems, we still felt very comfortable here and would definitely consider booking again, but this time we'd hope they will have fixed all of these very fixable problems.

title: Lovely hotel, friendly staff and a great location
text:
We (two couples) stayed at the Barclay for one night over the weekend and had two nice size identical rooms with a comfortable king bed. The rooms were quiet and clean, the bedding and towels were of a nice quality, everything in the room made us feel relaxed. The staff always gave us a friendly greeting with a smile from check in to check out. The waiters in the bar and the hostesses in the lounge were all very attentive making sure we were well taken care of. The staff is one of the main reasons we will be back to this lovely hotel.  The Barclay is near Rockefeller Center, the subway, restaurants, bars and shopping. 
We look forward to going back to the Barclay again and would highly recommend it.

title: Quiet Elegance
text: This hotel is very beautiful and elegant. Large grand chandeliers, great restaurant on property and exclusive lounge for your private pleasure. Staff was very friendly and the room was spacious and quiet.  Peaceful quarters to rest in.

title: Vackert hotell med bra läge
text:
Stort och fint rum, älskade badrummet. Trevlig lobby och bar. Sängen var fantastisk. 

Men hotellet levde inte upp till våra förväntningar. När vi checkade in var mannen i receptionen i det närmaste otrevlig, vi fick inte påfyllning av schampo etc. trots att det nästan var helt slut, papperskorgen var inte tömd efter städning. Vi fick olika besked om hur stor voucher vi hade att använda och vilka dagar de gällde, och när vi fick sluträkningen stämde inget av beskeden överens med hur det faktiskt blev. Trots stör ej-skylt på dörrhandtagen knackade personalen på. Vi fick också bara en badrock och ett par tofflor trots att vi var två stycken.

I grunden ett jättehärligt hotell men det finns en del detaljer att slipa på, sådant som borde sitta eftersom det inte direkt är billigt.

title: Central Location
text:
Hotel was a good base for me and my family on our 5 Night break in NYC! Although distances in NYC are much less than you think it’s going to be!
We booked through BA and on arrival the reception staff did suggest that we might want to upgrade our deluxe double to a suite as a family of 4. We didn’t and the room was fine if not a little cosy for the 4 of us... I had been expecting bigger than actual double beds but it was fine and they were comfortable.
The only issue with the hotel was that housekeeping only kept leaving enough towels for 2 people when clearly they room was being used by 4, so every day I had to ring down to reception for more towels to be brought up to our room.

Booking with BA the $25 destination fee per day per room had been included so it meant that we could spend up to $25 in the restaurant/ bar or from the mini bar and would have been silly to not as it was already paid for and if it hadn’t have been we would have had to pay it on check out - use it or loose it!
Hotel prices were extortionate but you are surrounded by coffee houses, restaurants and deli style places, a lot of people brought food in to their rooms.

title:
Great Place!
Great Service!
Great Staff!
text:
We stayed in this fantastic hotel during five nights and we enjoyed our stay very much. All staff, from arrival until departure, was very kind and helpful. 

Great beds!

We believe a strong team is managing this historical hotel, situated in a wonderful location.

We enjoyed our stay in NYC also thanks to this nice experience.

title: Lovely
text: We booked this with  BA deal and upgraded the deal to this mid-town hotel instead of the recommended one and what a great choice it was. The room was lovely, on the 15th floor, and whilst it doesn’t have the views of some of the other hotels, it was a great location to get to everything you need. If you’re interested in the very touristy and chaotic Times Square that’s just a short walk away, and thankfully not too near the madness. If like us you prefer the subway to get to the more authentic areas of NYC, Grand Central is a two minute walk away or Central Park is a 20 minute leisurely stroll away. Standards were great for cleanliness and service at the front desk and bar. All in all a great stay was had and I enjoyed this lovely renovated, classically styled hotel.

title: The room was comfortable and well appointed and excellent location.
text:
The reception was not the best of starts, upon our arrival they were very busy, slow and understaffed and barely spoke English.
Once you were through that, the rest was fine... until breakfast.
I consider it infra dig, when staying at a top hotel, paying US $100 for breakfast for two, and the waiter expects a gratuity, and not just any gratuity, a full 20 - 25%!   I think they've lost perspective.  I would not normally complain about the cost, but I thought that was very weak, this is something I would expect in a mid-range hotel, not here.

title: intercontinental
text: very nice hotel, rooms clean, hotel staff friendly.  Bed comfortable.  location excellent. No great views of city hotell wedged between larger buildings.  Breakfast buffet very pricey best if you eat elsewhere. Would recomend hotel.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: We stayed at the Barclay on our second visit to New York City having stayed in the Intercontinental Times Square previously. This hotel has been decorated to a very high standard. It feels luxurious as soon as you walk in. We had a standard room and the bed was so comfortable we are considering investing in a new one for home! Room was clean and housekeeping visited each day to keep everything perfect. The hotel also provides a safe which is free to use. Having stayed at both intercontinental hotels in New York City, the Barclay for me was a nicer room, with a larger space and decorated to a higher standard. If it's location and views you're after then Times Square is the better hotel, although the rooms are smaller, you are in a much more central location which makes it easier to explore New York City. The only downside to the Barclay was the price of the breakfast and drinks in the bar- 1 breakfast was $40 and although it was delicious, I don't think it was worth quite that much. A gin and tonic cost $20 which made for a very expensive round of drinks! I would definitely stay here again or in it's sister hotel if I visited New York City again- highly recommended.

title: Mother/Daughter weekend in NYC!
text: This hotel is just stunning.  From the moment we arrived and checked in the staff made us feel very welcome.  Our rooms were ready and our luggage was promptly delivered to our rooms.  The Club Lounge attendants greeted us and gave us a tour of the lounge and the offerings at different times of the day.  This lounge is very comfortable and the three offerings daily, breakfast, afternoon light snacks, pre-theatre hors d'oeuvres & cocktails were presented very well and quite tasty.  We were on the Club level and our rooms were quiet and the bed was very comfy.  The shower is another wonderful feature as it is large.  We felt were in a great location in the city and had no problem getting around either by walking or subway.  ***A note to the hotel- The Club Lounge attendants, Paulette Hope and her daytime counterpart that weekend were extremely friendly and quite helpful.  Thanks ladies!!  Also, Michael in the Concierge's desk was very instrumental in helping us with a subway map and directions when needed.  All in all we could not have been happier with our stay.  Thanks again, Suzelle Harrison

title: Fantastic hotel and location
text: Great hotel. Easy transfer from JFK via subway and well located to reach all points of interest. Number of cafes within a very short walk for breakfast ($40 each if stay in).  Watch out for mandatory destination charge $30 a night which came as a surprise. That aside, rooms and hotel spotless and great service.  Would recommend.

title: Doesn’t meet expectations
text: Seems like a small thing but this is the only hotel I’ve stayed at that consistently refuses to give guests a free bottle of water.  Only after practically begging for it will they provide.  I’ve stayed at many, many hotels in Midtown, including the Lexington, JW Marriott Essex House, East Side Marriott, Doubletree on 50th, Hyatt Grand Central, etc - they all give you at least one bottle of free water.  Even the InterContinental at Times Square gives me free water.  Not this place.  Only after going back down to check in, pointing out how out of line they were and that I am a Spire Elite did they finally give me two bottles.  Just really stupid.  Not a place I want to stay at.

title: Nice hotel - be aware of fees if on a budget!
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at Intercontinental New York Barclay for 4-nights in April as part of a short break in NYC.

This recently refurbished hotel has been completed to a really high standard. The décor is really classic New York. Rooms, bathrooms, furnishings and facilities all seemed to be great, our only gripe was that the walls were quite thin.

The staff were a little hit-and-miss, we sometimes got the impression that we weren't the usual sort of calibre of guest to stay at the hotel, but for the most part they were friendly and helpful.

For tourists I'd say the location is okay. You're only a few minutes from Grand Central and all the train links to elsewhere in the city, but it does feel a bit out the way of other tourist areas and landmarks.

We booked this stay through the British Airways Sale and got a really good price on the complete trip. I would, however, point out to any guests staying here on a budget, there is a mandatory $30 +Tax daily charge made to your room called a 'Destination Fee', which you are required to pay upon checking out.

We were not aware of this when booking and so it did push our hotel budget up unknowingly. This seems like a bit of an underhanded move used by hotels to keep their online booking prices low, only to squeeze a bit more out of you when you get there. I know it's common place in Vegas but also now seems to be creeping into NYC.

Anyway, this $30+Tax does go towards food/ drink and laundry credit so it's wise to utilise it each day. We used the credit to take a couple cans of Coke out the mini bar each day (around $10 each plus tax, plus an administration fee). This all seemed OK until, at check-out, we were told the mini-bar actually was not included in the fee, and that we faced a bill of almost $300 for 4 days of the fee plus a few cans of Coke! We did manage to plead our case in the end and the Cokes were eventually chalked off the bill much to our relief.  

For most people I’m sure this won’t be an issue, but I thought it best to inform anyone booking on a tight budget as we were.

title: Just what we were looking for
text:
My husband and I stay for the weekend as a getaway.  I was looking for an Old World New York hotel and this hotel fit the bill nicely.  The decor was classic and elegant.  The chandelier in the lobby took my breath away.  The staff was polite and helpful when needed.  The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was luxurious with the right touches of traditional elements.  The location was perfect, a quick walk to any of our destinations.  We found valet parking half a block away at MLP Parking.

However, I will note that we were not advised how the resort fee ($30/night) which was applied at the end of our stay, permitted us certain benefits while we were at the hotel.  I do feel like the resort fee should be an optional benefit and not applied to all rooms, especially since the benefits were not specified to us at check in.

title: Adequate
text:
Why does a superior double room only give you one bath robe and one set of slippers.
The only resturant was in the Gin bar ok but not a pleasurable experience .
Situation was great for uptown but the absence of eateries as you would get downtown needs consideration

title: Will be back!
text: The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to the buses and subways. Well designed and quiet rooms. if you do stay here make sure that you try the hotel restaurant for dinner. The sea bass was delicious and Maurizo our waiter recommended the gelato for desert. I would also recommend the gelato and the portion that is served is more than enough for two people.

title: Ticked the right boxes
text:
The Barclay is an old style NY hotel and it really suited our stay (2 Adults 2 Kids (10/12). We booked via a Virtuoso agent which gave us perks such as lounge access. This really suited us as a group with a good range of foods for each day at Breakfast, Afternoon Tea and Pre Theatre Drinks. This was excellent value for us. There is only a small selection of self serve alcoholic drinks but again was enough for us. 
We had 2 connecting rooms on the 15th floor and it would agree with other reviewers that the rooms can pick up a certain amount of noise from the neighbouring rooms and corridor. The bathrooms are functional and cosy and the plumbing is fairly noisy. 
The sound proofing from the outside noise was just ok but New York is such a noisy city that you would be had pushed to find rooms that block out all of the traffic and building works going on. 
Turn down service was hit and miss but all in all everything was clean and well done. 
Location is very good with plenty around to Eat, shop and sight see. 
Plenty of pros for the hotel and not many cons that we did not expect prior to our stay. We would stay here again.

title: Mooi, maar duur
text: Ik heb al heel wat Intercontinental hotels bezocht en qua look en feel is dit ook weer een top hotel. Alles ziet er keurig uit, de kamers zijn ruim en voorzien van alles wat je als zakenreiziger nodig hebt. Snacks en dergelijke heb ik laten staan want een zakje M&M’s voor 11 dollar ging me toch iets te ver. Normaliter zijn bij hotels één of meerdere flesjes water op je kamer aanwezig die wel gratis zijn, maar daar was hier ook geen sprake van. Gezien de kamer prijs zou dat er toch wel van af moeten kunnen.

title: Loved our stay
text:
The room was super clean, nice and comfortable bed. Staff was courteous and helpful at all times. 
They definitely made our family stay a very special one.
Close to restaurants in midtown NY.
I recommend this hotel at anytime.

title: Amazing Stay
text: What's not to love about The Barclay.  As soon as you walk in you appreciate the opulence of the lobby.  Our check in was fast and easy.  Our room was beautiful! We were celebrating a birthday, and when we arrived there was a very thoughtful amenity in our room which included a birthday cupcake.  This was my first visit to The Barclay, but it will not be my last.

title: Club Lounge the best benefit
text:
