As like others, slow to check in and being an IHG Royal Ambassador I didn't receive the guaranteed double upgrade, but notwithstanding this, the room was immaculate, comfortable and well set up as a city hotel.

The Club Lounge is the main benefit for us, using it for breakfast and pre-dinner drinks, the food was very good, surroundings comfortable and the wine great.

I was charged $100 as a holding deposit which I was not informed about, an annoyance but am waiting for the hold to be lifted.

All staff were courteous and polite.

title: "Luxury" hotel - inhospitable attitudes.
text:
Isn't your overall experience (and expectation of what that experience will be) a big part of why you stay in one type of hotel instead of another? 

I stay at all kinds of hotels - from "road trip" motels to 5 star luxury properties. I choose the hotel based on the kind of experience I need for that particular trip. Sometimes it's just a clean room off the highway when I'm taking a road trip. Sometimes it's a larger room where I can get work done. Other times, it's a special place for a special occasion. 

Our stay at this hotel was for the latter... a birthday celebration at a luxury hotel (and is part of hotel group with which we have pretty high status). Unfortunately, the experience and attitude at this hotel doesn't match their promise :  "with meticulous attention to detail, we welcome guests to a comfortable living space of idyllic pleasure". 

Hardly so. 

They have renovated this hotel, but neglected to improve the staff and the overall guest experience. It is a lovely hotel, with a surprisingly unattractive attitude toward guests. 

It starts upon arrival, where there is no one outside to help or offer any assistance of any kind. No help with bags, no direction to reservations desk, no help up the stairs or with the heavy doors, no one to get a car or a cab. You're on your own. Not once during our stay was there a doorman or a bell captain available for assistance. 

We had booked a Club Room, and the information given indicates that there is a separate check-in for those rooms, so we looked around for that area.  Found the club, but their "printer wasn't working. You can go to the other side and check in there". Found that area, were told that the room wasn't ready yet (that's fine- we were early) and they would call us when it was. 

Now, in most Intercontinental Hotels, when you are a Platinum or Royal Ambassador, they tend to treat you fairly well. We don't have unrealistic expectations of being upgraded to expansive suites, or anything like that. But usually, in a good property, they will give you the best room they can find for you as part of your "guaranteed upgrade" status. So, when we got to our room, which was wedged between the ice machine and the cleaning staff service room on a not very high floor, with a view of the lower level roof,  we were a bit surprised. We asked for a better room. We were shown the same room on a LOWER floor, which they *insisted* was an upgrade. And even more astonishing, said that we would be charged an additional $50.00 a night if we wanted it. We said "no, thank you" and stayed where we were. And then called for towels and a robe and another pillow, because the room was furnished with amenities for only one person, not two.
Did I mention that we had informed them that this was a special occasion?  

However, when I later checked my hotel charges, they had entered the "premium" room into our folio, and charged an additional $141.00 per night to our bill. When we asked for an explanation, they said "You said you wanted a premium room". The ensuing "discussion" with the manager was wholly and terribly unpleasant. I don't like being lied to. I don't like being treated like I am being too demanding and difficult when I am simply asking for a hotel to do what they are supposed to do. I don't like being treated with condescension, contempt, or a dismissive attitude. 

 There were other, smaller, issues as well.  For some inexplicable reason, they had a utility cart with open paint cans and brushes and tools right next to the food in the Club Lounge, and someone was repairing walls near the seating area during the evening pre-theatre snack service. 

Room service?  oh...  I laughed out loud when I saw that they charge about $30.00 for a "breakfast sandwich", then add a 22% service charge, a $6.50 delivery fee, and all kinds of  taxes, which results in paying more than $40.00 for what is the equivalent of  $3.50 McDonald Croissandwich. Now, anyone who travels with any frequency knows that room service  is always a bit expensive, but this is just cynical. 

Again, the renovation of the hotel is lovely. It is a very sophisticated and warm lobby, and there was a manager on duty on Saturday night who was quite kind. 

It is an adequate hotel, with clean rooms. 

But ultimately, it is a luxurious facade, with an austere attitude. There are much better places to stay in Midtown. 

(disclosure: I lived in NYC for many years. I stayed at this hotel before the renovation, and used to send friends there when they visited. I am not offended by the brusk, somewhat harsh New York attitude, nor am I put off by having to work to get what one wants when in Manhattan. Nothing is ever easy here, and it's always been  part of the NYC experience. The attitudes at this hotel are not typical of NYC -  no matter what they might say to the contrary. I'm sure that my review will be dismissed as that of a "difficult" guest. Because that's exactly how we were treated. The only "difficulty" we presented was that of a guest who asked for things to be fixed when they were wrong. That's not difficult. That's their job.)

title: Great but few details
text:
I just love this hotel and its location. The perfect place to stay. Rooms are big enough and service is mostly superb. But, housekeeping forgets too much at the beginning until they are told what is needed. Perhaps it is the policy that the guest needs to call to ask for extra bath robe as we were 2people in the room. Had to ask also some other things for two. I thought that reservation tells the housekeeper how many people coming to stay in the room.
Then I asked for water, it took over an hr to arrive. But these are minor things so no probs. But annoying after 9 hrs flight.
But the people are great and I believe in this hotel. I can overlook these as the hotel is 99,9% great! 
The gym works well and is very good. In overall, I strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I can’t say enough about this place. 
Prior to checking in, my mum had emailed the hotel advising them of my health issues (I have a brain tumour) and when we arrived Gabriel, the man whom she had been emailing, came to personally welcome us and had upgraded us from the standard room we had booked as part of a BA package to a deluxe larger room with a king size bed. Gabriel was so lovely and we really appreciated his kindness so much so we are returning to NY next year after he helped us so much. 
The staff at the Barclay are all so friendly and helpful, happy to offer assistance about restaurants, tourist queries, transport questions and any other random thing you may want to know. 
We only ate breakfast on the morning we checked out which was the only thing I found a little disappointing as it was lukewarm but other than that the Barclay is perfect. 
It’s close enough to Times Square and Rockefeller Center and all the other tourist attractions to be able to walk there but far enough away that you don’t hear any noise at night. 
There are plenty of restaurants nearby for all meals and a Duane Read around the corner for late night snacks etc should you want them.
Being in NY the day the tree was lit was magical and it was without doubt the best holiday I’ve ever had. 
I can’t wait to return to the Barclay again next year. I’d highly recommend it.

title: Classic, central hotel
text:
The Barclay is a classic, central hotel. The recent update remains fresh- i.e. hallways and rooms look great. The bell service from the curb is efficient. However, this isn’t a hotel where a staff member escorts the guest to the room and shows feature, etc.

Room is spacious and comfortable. So are beds and bedding. Extra pillows requested in advance were in the room.

There is one of those pesky, daily destination fees- $30/day. To max its value need to use the $25/dat F&B credit, which is deducted from the final folio bill. Of course, it may not get much more than a drink at $15-20 per... and the full breakfast buffet is $40 (more like ($50 with service and tax- it’s European style and pretty good). Can also use an additional $15/day laundry credit ( again, expect hotel prices so it’s more of an offset):-)

The lobby bar is staffed with very skilled mixologists- note i don’t say bartenders- ask and they’ll happily prepare wonderful craft cocktails from fresh ingredients.

All in all, this is a great four star place for business guests and tourists alike, and worthy of loyalty and repeat business.

title: Not bad!
text: Nice hotel and service is not bad.  Location wise, can’t really make an opinion because I took Uber everywhere.  I haven’t explored nearby places so can’t say much.  We only used the hotel to sleep in.  Didn’t dine here at all.  I forgot to take pictures of the room.  It’s nice and comfy but pillows are horrible.  Needs improvements!

title: Lovely hotel, great location.
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting New York. It's a lovely hotel - staff were pleasant, rooms were clean & nicely decorated, bed was huge and comfortable. Our room (7th floor) was surprisingly quiet for NYC. The air con wasn't brilliant - not so much of an issue in early April but imagine the rooms would get very hot in summer!

The location of the hotel is brilliant - a few blocks away from the madness of Times Square but in walking distance of most places (Grand Central, Central Park, Rockefeller, Times Square etc.) We didn't eat or drink at the hotel (very pricey) but could recommend Mama Jo's Food Cart (3 minute walk away) for breakfast - $5 for bagel, doughnut & coffee!

title: Horrible Service and Billing Problems
text:
My stay here was absolutely terrible.  The room was terrible with a broken shower door and shower heads didn't work properly.

Nobody answers the phone - I called about the shower issues, I called to order some room service.  I called to ask why I was overcharged $100 after I checked out and had a printed copy of my itinerary.  

Nobody answers the phone - I have spent hours trying to talk to someone with no success

That includes while I was at the hotel and then the over-billing issue afterwards.

Just awful in every way

title: Terrible Service
text: I have been a Platinum Ambassador at IHG for many years.  The check in , service and arrogance of the Barclay hotel staff is beyond disappointing.   I waited for over 30 minutes to check in.  The ambassador desk person was on “break for one hour.”  No explanation during that time.  Rooms here have paper thin walls.   Do yourself a favor and stay at the Times Square Intercontinental where they really care about their guests and go out of their way to accommodate you.  Even though the Barclay is within walking distance of my office, two words best describe how they treat guests—Never Again!

title: Home Away from Home!
text: The room was sufficient enough for us! The best part of our stay was visiting the Club Lounge every day not only for the great buffet featuring very light options for snacking, beverage bar with different coffees, wines, juices and so much more with enough to make you feel good for the rest of the day, but for the friendly staff that takes care of you whether you're enjoying the morning paper, watching sports, or sipping on a drink. Be sure to say hi to Sylvia and her staff.  Everyone is so friendly and accommodating.  By the end of our stay, we became family.  I even sent a box of goodies from Hawai'i! They sure showed me that the Aloha Spirit even exists in New York!  I truly hope to visit again! Mahalo!

title: Quiet Neighborhood Hotel
text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Rooms were clean, bed comfortable in a great neighborhood.  Enjoyed drinks at the relaxing atmosphere of the lobby bar with friends. We do live not far from NYC and frequently stay overnight.  For someone unfamiliar with the city’s East side, this is a great location.  Easy walk to restaurants uptown or down. No trouble recommending this hotel to anyone.

title: Misses the mark
text:
For at least six years when we visit NYC, my husband and I have been regular guests at the Intercontinental Times Square.  We decided to try the Intercontinental Barclay for a change of pace.  After our recent visit, we will not be back.

When we arrived on Friday afternoon and drove up the street to the hotel, there was no available parking space to pull up to the hotel.  After going around the block, we were able to pull up to the hotel.  When we exited the car, the doorman did come over to give us a ticket, but it was clear that no one was going to assist us with our luggage.  My husband removed our luggage from the trunk of the car and carried it into the lobby.  It did not feel very welcoming.

Upon check in, we were told that the Club Lounge, for which I paid extra, would not be available from 11:00-3:00, due to a private function.  I was not offered a refund of any type due to this. Paying extra for a luxury service and then not being able to access it is unacceptable.  

The hotel itself has a nice appearance.  The room was clean and nicely decorated.  There was sufficient drawer space.  The walk in closet was large, however, oddly, there was only one bathrobe.  The bathroom had adequate shelving for storing of toiletries.  The shower was fine, nothing exceptional. There was only one large bath towel and one hand towel per person.  Regardless of trying not to slam the door, the doors to the rooms close so loudly that several rooms down the doors could be heard and were loud enough to wake you up.  The thermostat in the room had no option between heat or air conditioning, just a temperature setting, and we were unable to attain a temperature that was comfortable enough for sleeping.

We had drinks at the Gin Parlour, which is the lobby bar.  The bartenders were personable and the cocktails were on point.  On our second night we again had cocktails and ate dinner at the bar.  Food was pricey for the quality.  Spaghetti bolognese and scallops. Nothing remarkable.

At departure, the doorman presented my husband with two different car keys and had him select the correct one, instead of having the car properly tagged as to which patron it belonged.  We handed him our ticket for the car and he stated that he needed our name and room number and admonished us for not having the ticket filled out with this information.  When we checked in two days prior, my husband presented the ticket to the person checking us in and we were told it was not needed at that time, and is only needed when we leave.  We were never instructed to complete the ticket.  

We will be in NYC in two weeks, and I have just booked at the Intercontinental Times Square.  I can be assured that the doorman will greet us with a smile, open my car door for me upon arrival, will unload our luggage, and will promptly deliver it to our room.  

Skip the Barclay and book the Times Square, it's only about 10 blocks away.

title: Love this hotel
text: Although the Barclay is a bit of a distance from the tourist area, it is definitely recommended.  Friendly, helpful staff and comfortable rooms.  Classical luxury which makes your stay a pleasure.  The breakfast is extremely underwhelming and I cannot recommend it.  We received an invitation to the restaurant for New Years Eve.  Something was lost in translation as nothing was complimentary. Would stay here again.

title: Great location, excellent hotel
text:
Perfect location near Grand Central, 3 blocks to 5th Avenue.
It was an easy walk to shopping, dining and especially to watch the St. Patrick’s Day parade.
There is a Duane Reed around the corner along with a liquor store (bleekers) and a grocery type store (Ashley’s) that has some surprisingly good quick service food. 
The hotel itself is very beautiful. The rooms are nicely furnished with a good use of space.  Dual head showers and as my husband called it a “butt sprayer” next to the toilet. 
We slept so well with the blackout curtains and very comfortable mattress and linens. 
All of the staff we came in contact with were very friendly. We would certainly stay here again.
The Gin Parlor is pretty pricey but the service is A plus!  It’s fancy but worth the splurge.

title: Magica New York
text: Hotel splendido situato al centro di Manhattan,  a pochi passi dal rockefeller center e central park, dotato di ogni confort,  stanze grandi, bagno grande e soprattutto pulizia impeccabile.  Alla reception ci sono addetti all'accoglienza che parlano italiano e sono disponibili per qualsiasi informazione.  Eccezionale veramente.....

title: Stayed here after hip surgery
text:
The hotel has been completely refurbished after being closed for 3 years . Everything

Beautiful hotel that has been completely refurbished ! The rooms are spacious and and the decor of the entire hotel is classic . I cannot really say enough about the Barclay other than I will definitely be staying here again when I go back to NY ! The pictures here on Trip Advisor do not do justice to how beautiful this hotel is . The hotel opened again in 2016 after a complete makeover that took 3 years to complete . I have stayed in several hotels in NY over the last several years and nothing compares as far as value for money .

title: Great location & value for money
text: I stayed in Intercontinental New York Barclay since it was very close to my business meetings in new york city. The hotel's location is excellent since its few steps from (around 1 block) from the 5th avenue and the grand central train station. Good breakfaat buffet and service

title: Beautiful classic hotel.
text: Well appointed rooms, excellent service, a grand old beautiful lobby, outstanding cocktails at the Gin Parlour, along with good rates and convenient access to subway and the Theater District.  What more could you want?

title: 4 Nights Sightseeing in New York
text:
This was our 1st trip to NY and decided on this hotel due to location - it did not disappoint. It’s located 5-10 mins walk from Central Park and Times Square and literally 2 mins from Grand Central Station.
The hotel bar is very expensive ($15-$20 each drink) but we never the tried food so can’t comment on that but Ashleys Food Market directly over the road is great value and does amazing breakfast! 
The rooms are really good; they have iron & board, hairdryer, shampoos/conditioners and safe all provided (we didn’t touch the mini bar as this was also very expensive!). The massive bed was very comfortable (best hotel bed ever!) and each bedside table had USB charging ports.
We were able to store luggage no problem until 3pm on day of departure meaning we could do any final sightseeing on our last day.
The hotel gym is also open 24 hours and has a good selection of free weights, cable and cardio equipment (it also has free water, fruit, towels and headphones supplied!) 
We thoroughly enjoyed our trip & have already booked again for 2020 👍🏽

title: Visiting The big Apple at it's best
text: The Barclay is a great hotel. It has been renovated. The rooms are a great size, very well decorated. The beds are super comfy, the linens first class. With its warm atmosphere, friendly staff and great amenities The Barclay is in my opinion one, of the best hotels you can stay at while visiting NYC.

title: Good Stay, Great Location
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights while visiting family in NYC.  Check in was a great experience, Leslie was extremely helpful and friendly with answering questions and making sure we had what we needed to start.  We did receive an "upgraded" room on the 14th floor due to my Spire Ambassador status.  The room was very nice and I have no complaints, I just would have liked to see our original room to compare because I'm not sure how it was upgraded.  This was our first stay with Intercontinental's since they made changes to the Ambassador benefits so I can't speak as to whether it is just this hotel or Intercontinental as a whole but I didn't feel the normal personalized service with the status.  We stayed at the Chicago Intercontinental in February and we received the in-room welcome gift and card from the manager and a phone call during our stay making sure we had everything we needed.  We did not receive any of that here.  

Housekeeping was great and we received turn down service on the nights we were out and not in our room.  We also did enjoy the 4pm late checkout because our flight didn't leave until 8pm on our last day.  The bar was usual crowded but the bartenders were friendly and the drinks were delicious.  

The location worked out extremely well for us, it is close to an entrance for Grand Central and not far from numerous other Subway stops making getting around quite easy.

One big complaint is the walls were very thin-  I was woken up in the middle of the night once and almost every morning at 5am by the man staying in the room next to us because I could clearly hear everything he was saying.  I did not notice the traffic noise at all.

Overall, it was a good stay.  I've seen complaints from other Ambassador members and we're spoiled by the exceptional service we always receive in Chicago as Spire Ambassadors but we definitely did not receive poor service here or experience any of the other complaints.  We did receive our benefits and we will definitely be staying here again when we're back in NYC.

title: Welcome back
text: This was a second visit to The Barclay in 14 months.  My familiarity with the property and the surrounding area made for an easy trip.  Although my requested early check-in wasn't available until 1:00 p.m., the stay was stress free and enjoyable.  It really is a great hotel.

title: Great Hotel, loved it!
text: The hotel was perfect for our three night stay, everything good quality and staff very welcoming and helpful.  The hotel was in a good position for visiting the places we wanted to, walking mostly in a nice area.  We only ate in the hotel one evening, having a bar meal and it was excellent, in fact one of the best salads I can remember!  Nice ambience and altogether a most pleasing trip, hope to visit again!

title: Lovely Decor - Nice Hotel
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights as a Spire Ambassador Member.  First off, I want to say that IHG have really downgraded the perks for being a top tier - t the extent that a I got a $20 off food and beverage - no note, nothing personal welcoming me to the hotel and no breakfast.  IHG have really lost the plot with this - the only reason I was staying here was because of a 241 voucher so they are losing business from me!

Anyway - the hotel itself is well decorated and harks back to a bygone era.  Check was friendly enough - and my benefit was explained... I had been upgraded by one category.  I also paid for Club Lounge access (another bug bear for a top tier - but it was $80 per room per night).

My double room was a good size, the bed was huge and very comfy and had a really luxurious feel.  The bathroom was gorgeous although a little small for 2 people really.  The shower was not the strongest but it was perfectly fine.

I didn’t have a view - but then I don’t think there is much of a view from many rooms in this hotel judging by the location.  The room was very quiet though for being in the middle of New York.

The Club lounge was fine - a bit dark but the evening snacks were better than a lot of hotels in the USA - and including wine and beer of a good quality.  Evening cocktails was 1700-2000 and there was other stuff through the day - for 2 people it would be good value - for me it was marginal I thought.

There is a limited choice of places to eat or drink in the hotel - in fact there is only 1 - the Gin Parlour but it did good cocktails.  It was very busy in the evening and was typical New York prices!

I got a late check out and check out itself was seem less.  The location is a quick 10 min walk to the subway that will take you back to the airport.  Think carefully, as a tourist, about what you want to see as I thought this hotel was in the quieter part of town - although everything is easy to get to.

Overall I thought the hotel was of a very good standard - certainly up to Intercontinental standards albeit my issues are primarily with the loyalty chain.

title: Good hotel in a good location
text: 8 day stay for both business and pleasure. Easy walk to midtown attractions such as Rockefeller centre, Empire State Building, MOMA, Times Square, Theatres etc. $20 USD taxi fare max to basically everywhere else. Some good food options nearby. Breakfast in hotel is expensive.

title: Club lounge
text:
Wonderful club lounge,
Thank you Paulette Hope, a credit to a wonderful lounge, you made our stay memorable. 
Look forward to our next break in Manhattan & yes thanks to this hospitality our first choice will be the Barclay.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We stayed one night while we were visiting New York from Boston.  The hotel is in a pretty nice area, only a mile away from Times Square, stores and coffee shops.  

The hotel room was beautiful and we had a large window we could open and look at people passing by on the street.  We were across from the Marriott.  The hotel offers parking, but it’s about $80.00 and if you leave and re-enter you have to pay the $80.00 again.  There is metered parking on the street behind the hotel.  It’s 6 hour parking and Sunday is free.  We parked in the street and paid the meter till midnight the rest was free.  

We went to Felix Roasting co and had a croissant and hickory smoked s’mores latte.  They were both amazing.  

We also went to 5th ave and visited St. Patrick’s Cathedral and stopped in some stores.  

For the evening we had tickets to the Phantom of the opera which was well done.  We walked back since it was about a mile away. 

The hotel bar was open and had a late night menu that began at 11:00 PM.  The menu had some items like cheesecake, chicken tenders and fries, shrimp and salads.  

Classy and elegant hotel.  Our room had a table with two chairs, a big closet, tv and a beautiful bathroom. 

We would definitely stay again.

title: Stunning hotel in great location
text: Arrived late at night and we were swiftly checked in, staff incredibly friendly so welcoming! I had mentioned a birthday prior to arriving so we were left a lovely birthday cake and desert in the room with complimentary bottles of water. Hotel lobby and room beautifully presented, really comfortable bed and pillows, maids delivered an excellent service every day. Immaculate shower room with lovely toiletries, iron and ironing board and hairdryer. Perfect location within walking distance to most sights but quiet enough to get a good nights sleep! Could not fault our stay at all and will definitely stay again when we are next in New York. Stunning hotel.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
We have been to NYC on many occasions and this Hotel was the best yet.
The staff were always very Friendly and efficient and this included Reception,Doorman and Housekeeping .
Our De Luxe room on the 12th Floor was the largest we have ever had in NYC with bath and shower and well furnished with extremely comfortable twin beds and quiet.
We booked this hotel with a BA 4 day break which was excellent value and as mentioned by earlier comments we were not charged the resort fee on checking out after the receptionist checked with a manager.
We did not eat or drink in the Hotel so unable to comment on this aspect but their are numerous eateries nearby to suit all pockets.
The location is ideal for walking and nearby Subway entries give easy access to all routes including JFK which takes about an Hour or so and exactly as described on Hotel Website.
Would not hesitate in returning or recommending.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Just returned from a week's stay at the Intercontinental and enjoyed every minute. Very convenient location being so close to everything. Staff were so Friendly and helpful  always greeting you with a smile.  The room was comfortable with great beds. Housekeeping was excellent and our room was spotless. THIRD time at this hotel and will certainly return again.

title: Perfetto
text:
Tutto semplicemente perfetto.
Bello, pulito e di gran classe.
Camere comode con un ottimo letto.
La colazione è divina, ma ottenetela all’interno della vostra prenotazione perché altrimenti decisamente cara.

Non viene indicato al check-in (e questo è un errore), ma vi verranno addebitati 30$ al giorno che però comprendano servizi al minibar, telefonate, lavanderia. Approfittatene perché il bar è splendido, e ha in atmosfera molto particolare. 
Vale la pena!

title: インターコンチネンタル ザ バークレー ニューヨーク
text: ユニットタイプのバスタブがありましたが、日本に比べるとかなり浅いものだったのでシャワーだけ使いました。ハブラシや剃刀などのアメニティはありませんでした。クラブラウンジ付きのプランにしました。初日の朝食に間違えて有料レストランに入ってしまいました。2人で99ドルのレシートがテーブルに置かれて気づきました。翌日、有料レストランの奥にクラブラウンジがあることに気づきました。部屋に置かれていた手紙に日曜はクラブラウンジが込み合うので無料で有料レストランに案内することがあります、と書かれていました。日曜にはクラブラウンジから有料レストランに案内されましたが、チェックアウトの際にその日の朝食代もプラスされていました。無料じゃなかったようです。文句を言えるほどの英語力もないので、今後、海外では朝食付きプランを頼むのは辞めます。

title: Siempre mejorando
text: Es la tercera vez que voy al hotel y siempre esta mejorando, con la renovación de las habitaciones y de las áreas comunes se le dio una nueva vida al hotel, sin que perdiera el ambiente de su tradicional barra de licores en la entrada. las habitaciones son amplias y confortables, el baño mejoró en un 100%. tomamos el paquete club en el cual teníamos acceso al club Intercontinental donde daban pasa-bocas y bebidas todo el día, la atención en el club es lo máximo.

title: good but  not excellent
text:
stayed for 5 nights for business and pleasure with my son
we had a premium room with double beds the beds were comfortable with good linens and pillows.
the bathroom was very small and not convenient Ruth one small sink and a narrow bath that serves as a shower.
the room was clean but nothing luxury or very modern
we had breakfast and it was good selection and comfortable sitting
the location is not bad about 300 meters to 5th avenue, 1 km to times square

title: New York New York !! 🗽
text:
Travelled to New York in Feb and stayed at the intercontinental Barclay with my husband and daughter.

Hotel is in a great location we preferred it to Times Square. 

Our room had 2 double beds but it was a really tight squeeze would have been ok for 2 people but not 3. 
There is not enough storage space in the room, one tiny closet. Other than that the decor and cleanliness of the room was perfect.
Our room faced onto the Waldorf  Astoria which is currently being renovated the building work went on right throughout the night so it’s quite noisy cranes scaffolding banging (etc). With that and the time difference we hardly got any sleep. 
Went to reception but they seemed disinterested. 
Asked reception for a late checkout for our departure they said we could have the room until 1. We met some other guests who were on our flight and they let them keep there room until 4.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: This hotel does not disappoint , following an extensive refurbishment it is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are pristine with beds to die for and staff are friendly and informative. This is exactly the Hotel you need after a long weary day in NYC. We did not eat here as the restaurant is pricey but we did have an added bonus of no tourist tax at the end of our stay. We couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough and would like to say a personal thank you to Ruchi for our complimentary upgrade. Book this hotel now you won't be disappointed.

title: Another great stay
text:
Just been back to this hotel again, and after the initial issues on the first visit after the refurb, glad to say they are now (see review from Quovardis1 below) respecting Ambassador members.
Anyway, we were upgraded to a lovely room, and had a great stay. 
One of the comments about this hotel is that it's a bit impersonal, and the staff are a bit distant, which as probably true for most large hotels... so it would only be right to mention Silvia in the Club lounge, who was amazing, she helped sort out a problem with friendliness and expediency.  

The only thing I will flag up for future travellers is the "Destination Fee", which is a $30 per night charge they apply to your account, which gives you various perks - theres a $30 of food and beverages and $20 of laundry credit... but bear in mind that the F&B has to be used in your room, so mini-bar or room service, and as for the laundry credit .. a pair of boxers is $6 plus 50% for next day service, so basically you can do get 2 pairs of boxers laundered... should you want to!

Great hotel, we'll be back!! Not wishing to miss anyone out, Angel on the door is very good, and of course thanks to Kecia for the room!

title: Spire Ambassador check-in experinace not so Favorable!
text:
Well either I am just glutton for punishment or it’s just luck of the draw with this hotel!    This is probably my 4 or 5 th time at this hotel for both business and personal.  Whbe my husband and I were here last we did not have a great experinace if which was quietly handeled by hotel management.  Which we were very greatful for.  Back again and had really hoped the experinace would be better.  Mind you I’ve been a Intercontinental world traveler since 2002.  I’ve recently made it to their highest membership level and to boot pay every year either with cash or points for the Ambassador perks.  You would think with all of this the experinace would be AMAZING!  Yet, somehow thisbhotel has a very hard time maintaining this image that  the Intercontinental (IHG) prides it’s reputation on.

My husband and I just checked in, let’s talk about the little things that add up to the foul taste already placed in my mouth!

1. Sat at the Ambassador’s desk waiting to be waited on for 7 min before some young woman with blond hair and black glasses walks out in a sloth like manner to finally advise is tgat the person who normally Mans the Ambassador’s desk is gone for the day, mind youbit was 6:30 pm.  Mind you There was no sign or direction given at the Ambassador’s desk. So I walked out to the resceptionist desk to be checked in.  

2. While at the reception desk checking in, I was told that on my third night I will need to move room . I will need to pack my things and move my room for my third night. Because some large group had booked a suite of room on the floor so as a high end member I have to move.
I was advised a manager was going to be calling me in 10 min.  Been in my room for the past 30 min.  Still waiting for that call. Going down for a drink at this point !

3. When I had to remind the receptionist for my two drink vouchers.  She told me they didn’t have anymore to give out and I can check in with the Ambassadors desk tomorrow ??????  Or if I want I can just tell the bartender and he may be able to take off my bill????? 😕😕😕

4.  Then the best thing yet... wait for it.... I get to my room, and what do I see.  Someone’s left over food bowel and food by my door.  I had to look at my door number twice because I thought someone else was already in the room.
Check out the enclosed photos.  

What the heck !  Did I mention ,  I am a spire Ambassador, never since 2002 frequent and extremely loyal visitor to this hotel chain not just domestically but internationally!  Let’s just say my level of disappointment is on 10!  Last time I did not give a review on trip advisor and dealt with my serious issues but this time I can not , not say anything!

title: Fint renoverat
text: Första gången jag bor här efter renoveringen, var lite orolig att de gjort om framförallt lobbyn för mycket men inte, samma sköna NY stil med mörk bar etc. Rummet var helt perfekt, fräscht och underbara sängar. Läget är enligt mig fantastiskt med både shopping och bra restauranger runt hörnet. Ett tips om Ni vill ha frukost, boka det när Ni bokar rum. Kostar ca 45-50 dollar för en(1) buffé om man betalar på hotellet. Vid min nästa vistelse i NYC kommer jag till att sova gott på Barclay igen ! :)

title: Exceptional - Can't Wait to Come Back1
text:
My wife and i just finished a two night stay at the Barclay for her birthday. It was flawless. 

Details below with a tip for getting lower cost room. 

1. Service - They were kind, friendly and attentive. 

2. Lobby - It reminds you of a modernized 1920s hotel. It is beautiful!

3  Rooms - The rooms are immaculate. I tad small but wasn't an issue. There is a huge mural on one wall that is gorgeous. Great sitting area. 

4. Bathroom - Bathroom is beautiful. Small subway tile in stand up shower with tempered frameless glass doors, back lit mirror, lit makeup mirror. Very modern 1920s. 

5. Food - Food is expensive. Watch out for the mini bar in your room. They are very proud of the items. 

6. Bar -Drinks were great, glass of wine was $15-20 bucks but drinks and service were excellent. 

7. Location - INCREDIBLE location. 3 blocks from Saks 5th Avenue shopping, Rockfeller Plaza, and 15 min walk to time square. 

TIPS:

1. Breakfast is expensive but directly across the street is Ashley Fine Food. It is a grocer/cafe. with great hot break break fast ( i had bacon, pancakes and wife had oatmeal and french toast). They also have great sandwhiches from lunch as well as affordable bottled water. Suggest you load up here for snakcs, bottle water, and breakfast/lunch. 

2. Soutwest Booking - I booked the Barclay through Southwest Hotels. I received 10,000 soutwest points fro the booking and ended up not having to pay the $35/nt resort fee. I expected to have to pay it but was told when ichecked in because of the way i booked i did not owe it. (Not sure if it was a mistake on their end but they insisted i did not owe it whom am i to argue). 

We can't wait to come back and stay again at the Barclay.

title: Another fabulous visit
text: The Intercontinental Barclay is well located on E48th Street, steps from Lexington Ave and about a 8 minute walk to grand central station.   The rooms are spacious, and luxurious with sumptuous robes, super comfy slippers and huge beds (the only very small niggle we had is that the bed was a bit too firm for us) the bathrooms are classy with citrus toiletries which are refreshed daily.  The public areas are fantastic and the extensive refurbishment has been done with amazing attention to detail.  Once again we found the check in/reception staff to be delightful, the check in process was slick and everyone we have encountered has been lovely.   Again the hotel delivers a lot, is really great value  and I can highly recommend a stay.

title: Perfect hotal at a great location
text:
I recently stay at the Intercon in NY for 3 nighst while on a businss trip.

This is the perfect hotel in a great location. The concierge and the reception were swift and helpful from the word go. The rooms are very nicely done up. Not the extra luxurious 5 star variety but just perfect when you need a room to really sleep in and bath. The bed was comfortable and the house keeping was great. The bathrooms were modern and adequate in all ways. 

The location of the hotel is awesome. Its right on park avenue so very helpful for a business stay. Yet, just a few blocks away from Times Square, Rockefeller and the Central Park. 

Definitely a recommend if this is the area you want to live in while in NY.

title: Bad experience
text: I am a IHG spire Elite member which is the hotel's highest level, yet when I checked into the hotel, I didn't even get a room with a bath tub.  Not only that, the shower had women's hair all over the floor.  The maid left a queen size mattress and vacuum outside my door for 2 days.  When the maids cleaned the rooms on my floor it was like grand central station with all the talking back and forth, very loud and unprofessional.  There was extensive traffic noise from outside.  would not recommend for a relaxing stay.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights. Room was small but nicely fitted out. Bed was very comfortable and room keeping very good. No complimentary water in rooms, the towels they give you include 1 large snd 1 small each but the small one is not big enough, just s small hand towel. 
Gym is very good although compact but perfectly adequate. I would have rated 5 if they had just added a few more complimentary bits in the room, no cotton wool or buds either. 
Enjoyed the stay again and would come back as the location is just great.

title: Location, Cleanliness, Gym
text:
Other reviewers have mentioned poor behavior of the hotel staff.  I did not experience that.  This is not personalized service by any means, but they are average.  In other words, I didn’t get the impression they will go out of their way to help, but I didn’t find anyone to be intentionally rude as some other reviewers have mentioned.  We arrived in the afternoon to check in.  They accommodated our request for a room on a higher floor which was very much appreciated.  The hotel is only 9 stories so you aren’t going to get great views regardless of what room you are in.  That being said, the location is ideal for visitors.  It’s within walking distance to a lot of things to see in the city.  I visited the gym while I was there.  It has a good mix of free weights, machines, and cardio equipment.  I would rate this gym as above average for a NYC hotel.  We had access to the private lounge.  The lounge staff are not overly friendly.  We have lounge access at most of the hotels we stay, and commonly utilize the lounge.  The lounge staff are usually very friendly and accommodating to guests.  I found this to be a weakness of the hotel.  The staff just seemed to be passing the time until they could clock out.  The lobby is clean despite being busy most of the time.  The rooms are nice, but the only mirror is in the bathroom.  I’m not certain if this is only in the room we happened to be in, but it would be nice to at least have another mirror in the main room if someone else is getting ready in the bathroom.  

Pros: 
-	Location
-	Overall cleanliness
-	Gym
Cons:
-	Mediocre staff engagement
-	Lack of views from any room

title: Impressive Hotel - Impressive Stay
text:
This hotel did NOT disappoint - centrally located for everything (walking distance to Grand Central, Times Square and Central Park) and a good location if you need to use the subway.  Apart from a grumpy check-in assistant (I didn't get the man's name, but it was late at night), everyone else was very friendly, welcoming and professional - from the maid service, bellboy and Michael the Concierge.

The breakfast wasn't cheap at $40 each (I was prepared for this from other reviews), but it was well worth it one day as a treat - and you won't need lunch after filling up on their numerous breakfast options! There are also plenty of cafe's nearby.

We were on the 8th floor and there wasn't too much noise - you only heard the street noise in the morning once you had woken up.  And on the subject of sleeping - the beds are the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel.

A perfect stay - thank you!!

title: Sophisticated, timeless hotel
text: Stayed here with friends for a New York getaway and we were not let down! You truly felt pampered at this hotel by the staff as soon as you stepped on the sidewalk in front of the hotel. When you walk in, there is a classy bar/restaurant to the left and a nice check in area to the right. As you walk farther back, a beautiful marble staircase. The room.... was breathtaking! The artsy decor was unmatched to other hotels I have visited in New York. In roo. Coffee maker. Valet... well was expensive (like anywhere else in New York). There is another Intercontinental hotel in Timea Square, however, it felt like this hotel was hidden away from the hustle and bustle, such a gem!

title: Perfect hotel for NYC
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was everything we needed for a New York stay. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms spacious and in a perfect location for everything. Would definitely stay here again when I’m back.

title: Friendly, welcoming, clean and great location
text: We stayed for x4 nights in mid Feb. The lobby is great, quite a hub and the bar is busy with a nice atmosphere. We had a small suite on the 15th floor, which was kept immaculately clean and the room was quiet. The bed was one of the comfiest ever. Reception staff were warm, welcoming and helpful. It was a great stay in a great location - we would definitely return. It is handy for most attractions and the transport links to others are very accessible. Bar food is a bit on the expensive side and service there could a bit variable. Otherwise a great stay...

title: Long weekend in the big apple
text: Just back from a wonderful break in New York staying at The Barclay. This hotel is situated in a fantastic position close to 5th Avenue and all the shops. The rooms and amenities are superb, I highly recommend staying here.

title: Me gusta
text: Recientemente remodelado, este es un hotel con una excelente ubicación, buenos servicios y espacios amplios. Las habitaciones son mas grandes a lo que tipicamente uno encuentra en NY. El lobby bar es bastante agradable y los servicios son muy buenos. Definitivamente uno de mis preferidos en Manhattan.

title: Very nice hotel for midtown access
text: A return trip to the Barclay for leisure. Clean upscale hotel with nice lobby bar/restaurant. Food is expensive but excellent. Good value if you book at a non peak time. Very convenient to midtown activities.

title: Stand Out hotel in NYC
text:
It's hard to say enough about this hotel. I came for work and fun and I had to split my trip up and had The Intercontinental booked for the first part and was planning to stay at another hotel for the last part. Well, this hotel was so great I cancelled my other booking and am heading back for my last few days.
I've stayed in NYC alot and you never really know what u are going to get-location could be inconvenient,  walls can be thin and rooms noisy (I need a quiet room), room cleanliness can be questionable and staff can be rude. I had none of these issues. The room was elegantly decorated,  shower was fantastic and staff was so kind! I highly recommend it as your home away from home when you are traveling to the city!

title: Terrible five star hotel
text: We were really disappointed at this place as there was nothing five star  at this place. If I went there as a two or two and half star hotel I would have been very satisfied but this hotel is listed as five star so had higher expectations.The front desk lady was extremely rude. Customer service was terrible. There is no lobby to relax or sit. There was no mirror in the room. Beds were ok but nothing of five star status.To use mirror you have to use the one in bathroom which was very inconvenient.  They did not provide the folio to explain the charges. They charged me for the pantry when I did not use any thing from there. When called for the charges no one answered as only accounting can explain the charges  and they are never there.I tried several times calling them regarding the charges and accounting was never available.TV did not work . Location of this hotel is great.

title: always a New Yorker
text: Beautiful linens and bathroom Comfortable beds . High end feeling with lobby and staff . Great bar with fun people watching . Breakfast and light fare served  Well priced ,but very elegant . =Fabulous location to shopping and theater ..

title: Lovely hotel
text:
We just returned form 4 nights here, booked through BA. I must say I was a bit worried as some of the reviews on here are awful but we had a tremendous stay. We arrived late at night but check in was fine. The rooms are on the small side but they are well thought out, immaculate and very comfortable. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The bathroom was small but very well laid out, best make up mirror and lighting ever! We only had a shower which I understand is to be expected in all rooms with only one bed. One strange thing that everyone seems to comment on, there is only one bathrobe and one bath towel, but this was quickly rectified with a call to reception.

We didn't eat in the hotel because of the cost and we only had one drink at the bar, $40 for 2 G & T's. There are lots of options nearby to eat and drink. The location of the hotel is fantastic and we were able to walk pretty much everywhere.

One nice surprise was there was no resort fee (presumably because we booked through BA)

I have booked to go back again in the summer with my daughters. All in all I don't think that you could fine a better hotel for the money in such a good location.

title: New York Trip
text:
Fantastic hotel. 
Friendly staff with exceptional quality rooms. 
The hotels location is perfect. 
Just a short walk to Grand Central Station and within a leisurely walk of 10 to 20 minutes to most of the places to see on a trip to New York. 
Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Classy.  Historic. With outstanding service
text:
The Barclay remains one of the best hotel's for the rate in the Mid-Town area despite the newly introduced additional resort fee.  It really is so convenient whether for  Grand Central Station or 5th Avenue or even Broadway.  If you are on a whirlwind schedule and/or like to enjoy lots of refreshments and snacks during the day consider adding access to The Club. Not inexpensive but well worth it.  The selections of foods and beverages are terrific and the staff most helpful notably the wonderful, Silvia Guidos.  
Ask for Peter John to help check you in.  He a seasoned professional, knows the hotel inside out and will do everything within his purview to accommodate your needs.  Remember NYC is noisy so a high room on the inside will be quieter.  Rooms are always very nice and the bathrooms top draw.  I have stayed at the Barclay many times and will certainly return when back in new York City.  (BTW: I was in the Hotel business so am very particular!! )

title: Attitude Adjustment required
text:
Being in the Service industry, one would expect the hotel to be more welcoming to its guests, but some of the staff here might disagree. My flight landed at 04:30am. I arrived at the hotel by 05:30am. I know it was too early to check in and did not expect to get a room. The only thing I asked of the reception guy was - May I please use your restroom after a long flight? 
The answer was - you might find some in one of the Deli's across the street ... that was after he checked my ID and confirmed I have a prepaid reservation that would make me officially a guest of the hotel in few hours.

So I found myself roaming the frozen streets at 05:30am just looking for Restrooms and some comfort.
I returned to the Hotel at 07:30 after the shift has changed and the nice lady was much more welcoming and understanding. She made an effort to have my room ready by 12:00. allowed me to use the ground level restrooms if needed and overall was very professional.

I checked in at 12:30 - Room is nice, spacious enough and well equipped as you would expect. I didn't use any of the hotel amenities or facilities besides a shower and a decent sleep in my room. Yet at the check out you need to pay extra $34 (Per night) for a "Destination Fee" that is not very clear what you get in return and makes the entire package much less attractive. Pay attention and make sure you take  it into consideration.

Overall, as a veteran IHG member and guest, this was one of the less enjoyable hotels I stayed in. Felt like somebody is doing me a favor by letting me stay there.

title: Amazing weekend at the Barclay
text:
My 2-night-stay could not have been any better. Check-in was seamless and the welcome was very warm. The room was ready way before guaranteed check-in time. Housekeeping did an excellent job, as the room was spotless. 
I really enjoyed the welcome amenity, top fruit and cheese quality. 
The room service breakfast was a perfect and tasty start for a long day. It was delivered within minutes and the table was also promptly picked up afterwards. 
A big thank you goes to Gabriel from Guest Relations who went the extra-mile to make this stay so memorable.

title: New York
text: The Hotel infraestructure is awesome. As in any other intercontinental Hotel. Rooms are very nice. Staff is very kind. Except for one of it's "Service Directors" that lacks any service skills and too bad damages the whole experience. Not at all the spirit of Intercontinental which is always service, service, service. This person has no understanding of guest experience and has an excess of Pride. The complete opposite of service. For me is the first time I find somebody like that in an Intercontinental. The problem is that he holds a decision makers which makes it imposible to improve the experience. I have stayed in 14 different Intercontinental Hotels more that 20 times since 2016 when I join their program.

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental Barclay for a long weekend in the city. I thoroughly researched many options, and we were so happy with our choice in The Barclay. 

The service from all the staff was warm, friendly and professional without being stuffy. The lobby and common areas were beautiful and relaxing. The rooms were tastefully decorated and were a decent size for NYC. Location was fantastic as it was within walking distance to many sights but was in a quieter location removed from the Times Square madness. 

We highly recommend paying the extra money for a club room. We did and found it to be an amazing value! Not only do you get a very nice breakfast spread, but there is afternoon tea, coffee, and snacks. But the best of all was in the evening with a nice selection of wines as well as a substantial selection of appetizers. One evening we made it our dinner just because we didn’t want to rush before hitting the theater. Mind you it was not the same as a NYC restaurant but it was pretty impressive especially for a club lounge.

We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Also we recommend buying parking online from a normal parking garage in advance instead of paying the very high valet fee. We paid $25 per 24/hrs near grand central station, and it was very convenient walk to and from the hotel.

title: Magical trip
text:
The only word I can use to describe this amazing hotel is WOW! From the moment we arrived at the hotel it was 5* service we had read the reviews before we booked as we will traveling to New York for the first time for mine and my husbands 10 years anniversary. The hotel reception staff were so helpful they said if you have any questions on trips or anywhere you need to be just to ask a member or staff.

I did question whether a hotel could be this amazing and it blew me away on every level. We were walking for around from about 9am - 11:30pm for the 4 days whilst we were there and nothing was better than arriving back to the most comfortable bed ever! 

Location was perfect! Not to far from Times Square and there is so much to see and do on your way into Times Square. Also it’s very close to grand central station and the Empire State Building.

This hotel is everything I could of wished for and expected from a New York hotel ❤️

Thank you for looking after us guys I’m waiting on prices with BA to be released I’ll see you March next year! Sooooo excited

title: Stylish hotel
text: Stylish, relaxed, well located hotel, ideal for exploring Manhattan. Rooms are beautiful and peaceful, with all amenities required when travelling. Location was perfect for hitting 5th avenue, short walk to Broadway and Times Square. Staff are outstanding and truly understand customer service. Will recommend!

title: Great Hotel In A Great Location
text:
Had a family trip to New York with the family last May. After travelling from the UK, we arrived in our 'comfy' clothes after a long haul flight. We must of arrived on a night of a gala ball or something because a lot of guests were in ball gown's and suits, so we looked slightly out of place. However, we were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived. The lobby is plush and beautifully decorated with a lot of marble features. We were given our room card and entered into our room. The rooms are slightly small but it was fine for a family of 4. Had all tea/ coffee making facilities, good sized bathroom and we had a good view looking into the very tall buildings outside. We only has a couple of issues with the room. On our second night, we discovered a slight leak in the roof but this was quickly sorted out by a local engineer. 

We never ate at the on-site restaurant / bar due to the high prices but you would expect that from a 5 star hotel in Manhattan. However, there are plenty of restaurants in the surrounding area to satisfy all budgets.

In terms of location, this hotel is spot on. Subway station only a couple of blocks away and a lot of the major attractions are within walking distance e.g. Rockefeller Center, St Pauls Cathedral, Chrysler Building, Fifth Avenue etc. 

Overall, this is a great luxury hotel, in a brilliant location.

Would highly recommend.

title: An absolute delight: a class above
text:
I don't really leave reviews, but this was worth the effort.

Recently stayed at The Barclay for a business trip to NYC.  Lots of choice in the city, but I ventured to try something a bit new on a recommendation and in a new part of town-- delighted with my decision.  The Barclay was at first one of those grand edifices and polished interiors that instantly impressed, but it was the service that delighted the most.  Early check in request accommodated, no waiting at reception, a genuine politeness that wasn't too formal but respectful, and really welcoming introduction after a long flight.

Room was very clean, very spacious, wonderfully appointed, and quiet!  Bed was extraordinary and the water pressure was great for a wake up.

Early morning start and the buffet couldn't have been more fresh and full of variety.  Service again relaxed, accommodating, and efficient.  And my coffee cup was always filled!

One night even finished off in their lobby bar with a perfectly made gin martini.  Service again was superb and friendly (not robotic or too formal). And was pretty busy too!

Wow did they get this right!  That's it, new place to stay in NYC sorted.

title: Remodel still looks great
text: I typically alternate between two hotels in Midtown when on business, the Intercontinental being one.  The hotel rooms underwent a gut remodel a few years back and the remodel still looks great - there’s a cool wall covering in each room of old Manhattan, which is a great design feature.  I also particularly appreciate the shower does not have a tub, as it just makes for a better shower experience.

title: Amazing hotel and location
text: We came here for a 3 nights in December and had a superior room with Club room access. It was amazing. All the staff were so helpful and the club facilities excellent. The room was very clean with a large very comfortable bed. We will be staying here again on our next trip to New York.

title: Loved this hotel.   Luxurious
text:
Great staff. Nice rooms, small but not too small for NYC.  It was such a great experience that even though I’m not a IHG member with status (I’m platinum premier with Marriott), I’m sure I’ll stay at intercontinental hotels again and may even do a status match soon. My experience here was everything a luxury hotel should be. My only complaint is that the water in the spray bidet in the bathroom was colder than the water in my home fridge.  ICE COLD so unusable.  Only got even colder of let it run for a while.  It was very cold outside so maybe it’s fine when the weather isn’t so dramatically cold. 

High recommend but don’t expect a large room.

title: Barclay is Incredible!
text:
Thank You to the Barclay team for a fantastic stay!  Perfect Mid Town location & a truly gorgeous hotel. 
We were in town for the week for my birthday and the concierge team were so helpful & had excellent recommendations.
Additionally, Lauren & Aldrin assisted me with my detailed reservation and ensured we were blocked in a great room.

title: Great Location and Nice staff
text: The proximity to the Time Square was perfect and Edgar was so helpful with dinner recommendation we only wish we could have stayed longer. We will be back the next time we are in the States and hope to see everyone again.

title: Excellence in service and location
text:
I highly recommend the New York InterContinental Barclay hotel to anyone visiting NY for business or tourism. The candid truth is that the Barclay keeps upping their game. Elevating service, food, and comfort again and again. The hotel was updated a few years ago, and the rooms are large, well appointed, comfortable and elegant. The lobby and Gin Parlor are energetic while maintaining the old world classic New York City feel of a 5 star hotel. And, the location is a 10 out of 10. At 48th and Lex you are a short walk from Grand Central, 5th Avenue, and in the middle of the business district of midtown. 

I think the Barclay is setting a standard for an elegance in Midtown East. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

title: Winter Sun in NYC
text:
I spent 3 days at the Intercontinental New York Barclay, whilst recently visiting the city, I have to say from the moment I walked through the door It felt like home, the staff are so welcoming, they can not help enough. It might be a NY thing that staff go out their way to help but there was just something special about the team. I can't thank them enough. The view over the city is just incredible. I ordered breakfast to my room on the last day and just stared out the window, drifting away in thought. 
Hotel situation was perfect, walking distance to central park, Times Square and surrounded by loads of character you don't see on travel sites, take a walk round neighbouring streets and so much can be found. Oh and make sure you eat at the breakfast buffet, it's amazing and filled me up for the day.
I've included a few shots from my stay. 
A big big thank you to all the team at Intercontinental New York Barclay, you truly made my stay in the City.

title: Great location
text:
Very nice hotel, great location close to times square. Room was Ok, lobby is very nice to hang there or for a drink.
Rooms are not big but nice. Service was very good. Ansolutely recomended to other tripadvisor

title: MIXED REVIEW: detailed comments re: Ambassador, Rooms, Gin bar, resort / destination fee
text:
Located in Mid-town east, fairly convenient for Grand Central and the '6' subway, this Intercontinental hotel has a bright spacious lobby, renovated/modern rooms, and a historic feel.

Check-in: Two issues: 1) As a Platinum Ambassador, I was advised no room upgrade is available if you book a room with two beds as now nicer rooms with two beds exist int the property. Since the Ambassador program "Guarantees an upgrade to the next level up" there should be disclosures when booking a two bed room that NO UPGRADE CAN BE OFFERED if you book this room. 2) The $30 per day "Resort fee" / "Destination Fee" is insulting. I don't care if IHG thinks some hotels in NY are doing this - this is not a "Resort Hotel" and the amenities it provides are not valuable. The $25 food/beverage credit is hard to use as "IT MUST BE USED BY MIDNIGHT ON THE DAY YOU CHECK IN" - when you arrive at 10pm and have had dinner this is pointless. Why they don't allow you to use it for breakfast is beyond me.  The $15 Laundry credit is all pointless.... laundry must be picked up in the morning to get it back the same day, and overnight laundry (surcharged at 50%) must be picked up by 8pm or so... again late check in and you can benefit from this. On future days we turned in two pairs of socks just because (uses up the allowance) - until all guests start doing this, hotel management will keep adding this fee annoyance knowing people don't benefit from it. PLEASE IHG GET RID OF THIS FEE - IT'S INSULTING - YOU ARE NOT A RESORT. Just price rooms correctly. You also don't get a paper delivered to your room.

ROOM: Negatives: Two bed rooms are tiny double beds - not queens, inadequate amount of towels, no laundry bags/slips in room on arrival, only 1 wine glass on arrival, fruit provided as welcome amenity was old and wrinkled. Complimentary water for IHG Plat AMB not restocked daily. Positive: beds comfortable and windows can be opened for outside fresh air.

GIN BAR: The hotel prides itself on its 'gin bar' with a lot of (overpriced) gin choices, plus you pay extra for the tonic. Laughable is they service these 'uncommon' / boutique Gin & Tonics in glasses filled with ice chips. Come on - any good bar knows today that quality cocktails needs to be served over a single large ice cube (or at least large ice cubes). At ~$25 for 1 G&T why would I want it diluted to a watery mess quickly with small ice chips.

Will definitely have to explore other IHG properties for my next trip to NY or return to others I've used that don't have these issues.

title: Excellent presentation, clean, accessible and great facilities
text:
We booked a week over Christmas after a recommendation from a friend who stayed at the same time of year previously. We found the foyer impressive and beautifully decorated for Christmas. Later learnt that the location was also very convenient - its not right in the thick of it but close enough to all of the usual Manhattan attractions to walk to most.
The standard room we booked was clean and modern, albeit not large (what can you expect in New York?!)
The accommodation we found was great value for money (circa £1400 each for flights and accomdation over xmas, short notice for a week - booked through an agent)
Only major down-point which tainted it for us was the cost of eating in the hotel. Around $100 for 2 to have breakfast a day, xmas dinner was over $200 including drinks - this put us off eating in the hotel VERY early. We also ran up about $600 of costs on the minibar so it really isnt worth it no matter how tempting and well stocked it is! Ashley's Wholefood across the road was a saviour for our breakfasts, snacks and lunches.

title: Excellent hotel
text: This hotel was absolutely stunning! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the room was beautiful. Location is great for New York, not a long walk from Times Square and Broadway. Had a room service breakfast and that was absolutely delicious! Surprised my partner for his birthday by bringing up some delicious eclairs with a candle in!

title: Gold Standard
text:
Great location in mid town Manhattan. Lovely old world charm of this property make it a favorite destination. The staff is very welcoming and accommodating especially the club lounge attendants. The club lounge it self is one of the better ones in terms of amenities. Paulette and her colleague really enjoy providing good customer service.

Love the hotel lobby warm and comfortable.

title: Warmth & Professionalism
text: I love New York, and every time I have an opportunity I come to the Greatest City in the world. This time I was here for surgery. I alerted the Ms. Peggy Chang Executive Assistant to the General Manager before I arrived that my visit was for  medical reasons and requested a quiet room which she personally reserved for me. I was operated on yesterday, and today I had the pleasure to meet Ms. Chang. She told me that the Hotel Staff is aware of my situation. Yesterday, the General Manager of the Intercontinental Barclay  Ms. Sofia Vandaele  left me a voice message and personally wanted to check on my health status. The wonderful hotel staff as well as its its environment well-appointed rooms and spa-like bathroom will be conducive to my quick recovery. I can not wait  to be back at the Intercontinental Barclay on my next trip to NYC.

title: One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in
text: I was delighted by this elegant yet welcoming hotel. I stayed for one night in one of the smaller (least expensive) rooms and still was really impressed; the hotel combines the charm of a relatively historic building with the convenience and comfort of a beautifully updated hotel. For me it combined the best of both. The room was very attractive, and larger than I expected given the price point; the bed was very comfortable; the lights in the room were more than sufficient for reading, the TV channel selection impressive. The bathroom was beautiful, with a spacious and very well lit shower. The keyed elevator made me feel especially comfortable as a solo traveler, since you cannot get to a guest floor without first swiping your room key on the elevator pad. The lobby was beautiful. As someone who was born in New York City  and has lived within a fifty-mile radius almost my whole life, I rarely get to spend a night in a New York City hotel and experience the city as a tourist would. This was really a treat, and if I were a tourist or staying over in the city again I think the Barclay would be my first choice. (The proximity to Grand Central was a deciding factor for me when I booked the room since I was coming in by train.) I do not love Lexington Avenue, but the hotel itself is just off the avenue on a side street and as soon as you approach the steps everything seems quite serene, though not quite peaceful, given that Midtown Manhattan is rarely truly peaceful.
